text: My daughter and I went there for breakfast. Sean our waiter was the best. He special ordered chocolate chip pancakes for my daughter and was very accommodating. My corned beef hash was awesome too.
Sean had amazing customer service and the gold standard of customer care. Will come back based off of his service. Good food and good drinks!

We had a great breakfast here sitting outside on the strip. I had the three egg breakfast, and the over easy eggs were cooked perfectly. The potatoes were nice and crispy on the outside. 
My wife had the ham croissant. It included a lot of ham, a flaky croissant, and she added an egg (which she recommends). All of it was tasty. Would definitely come back.

Was walking down the strip looking for a breakfast joint and found this place and it was awesome. Had the chilaquiles and they where amazing. And our servers Sean and Steph where the best. Will be back when we visit Vegas again!

This  my second time here at Hexx. The first time I was here Traycee was our server. She is awesome, Funny and  made my first visit here great I had to return.  My second visit was today and Sean and Shannon were my servers. Both were very attentive and made my second visit also great. The French toast are amazing. I will return soon.

We came to brunch for my bachelorette party and had a great time. Food was great and the bottomless mimosas were even better. What stood out the most was our server Sean. He was absolutely amazing. He was extremely attentive and gave us the best service. Highly recommend!

Had dinner here. Great ambiance and a great view of the Bellagio fountains but it was hot (mid June) even when we sat inside. Food was a mixture of great and not so good.

Appetizer: crispy broccoli
This was delicious. Perfectly crispy, sauce was sweet and sour (like a sweet lemon sauce). It was really good! There was too much sauce though and it was sometimes overwhelming.

Main course: pepperoni pizza
Really good. The Arrabbiata sauce was amazing and the garlic slices were delicious. Had to ask for more garlic.

Main course: pappardelle with mushrooms
Terrible. Pasta was overcooked, not al dente at all. Not enough sauce so all the pasta stuck together in a huge clump and it was dry. The dish has big chunks of mushroom but it tasted bland. Not much of a mushroom flavor at all. Needs some salt. In the end we added some of the garlic from the pizza into the pasta and it was much better. Still not great though. Disappointing especially for the price.

Came here while on vacation with my husband and the food was good and they have plentiful portions. I had the chicken and waffles which had a different take as far as flavors but I found it to be pretty tasty. My husband had the meat omelet which was a nice size and served with huge potatoes. The location and the ambience was really nice. We had Sean as our sever and he did a great job!! Very friendly and kept checking on us and made sure we were happy with everything. All and all I would recommend this restaurant and will come back here again.

We came here for brunch during our Las Vegas trip. He patio is great and overlooks the strip. We had fun people watching as they walked on by. We ordered the chilaquiles and guava mimosas which were both great. They also had an option of bottomless mimosas for $20. 

Great view, great food, great drinks.

THE brunch spot of vegas. Hexx is our go to brunch/recovery restaurant we go to when we are in town. The service is amazing and the location is perfect. It's across the street from the belagio so I recommend the patio dining. And you have to try the carnitas hash.  A mixture of carnitas, home fries potatoes, and some over easy eggs. Delicioso!!!! Add some bottomless mimosas....perfection. 
Service is great. Stephanie was awesome. Second time she's served us and both times she was sweet and very attentive. 
Hexx is a must eat, drink, relaxed place to visit in LV!!!!!

We always make sure we grab lunch/dinner there every time we are in Vegas. 
You can see The Fountains of Bellagio and the strip from their outside/patio seating! Their food is very good and customer service is great! We got two small Hexx Chocolates after our dinner and they were delicious! :)

Had quite the variety of food the other night, from the smothered fries and crab cakes to that candied bacon!!  The food, service, and the people watching on the patio made for the total package!!  We will be back!

Huge proportions, and the quality of food was great! Taylor, our waitress, and her right hand man Chance were  unbelievably great all brunch long! If you're looking for good food and first class service, HEXX Kitchen is the place to be!

My husband, I & another couple ate lunch at HEXX for lunch on Feb. 15, 2016.  We were all starving and craving burgers.  The burgers were $18.00 (ya I know....it's Vegas).  We all ordered them. They were good, not great.....not $18.00.  Also, we asked for the burgers medium....they were well done. My friend did not hardly get any thousand island dressing for her burger.  They give you a ton of french fries.  The view is great & the service was friendly.
The food was delicious and the service was great. Sean was an awesome waiter! I would recommend this restaurant to any of my friends who visit Las Vegas!

4.7% CNF CHARGE ON ALL CHECKS in addition to tax. They can't even explain what it is for. 
Appetizer and entree was delicious. Banana cream pie was horrible. Graham cracker crust was hard and the pudding part was difficult to find.

2 words: bottomless mimosas. Tracee kept them coming!! We came here 2 days in a row because the service and food were so good. The view of the Bellagio fountain show doesn't  suck, either! The food portions and quality are worth the price, in my opinion. Had the lobster roll yesterday and steak and eggs today. Would absolutely recommend. We are staying at PH and Hexx is about 2 doors down.
This place is good every time we come to Vegas! Service was great, my mimosa was never empty! Sean and Alex we're great - highly recommend this restaurant !

This used to be Sugar Factory, and while they didn't have the same place with its strangely sexual candy shop, HEXX was nice enough. I actually didn't like my watermelon sour - way too sour - and was too polite to say anything. The bartender noticed and he took it off the tab, which was very nice. Mr. Harris ended up finishing it along with his Crown on the rocks. 

I loved the d√©cor, very edgy and sexy, with the bar off to the side, but still close to the entrance. I'd go back.

I recently went to Hexx kitchen and bar after doing some sight seeing we decided to stop here and have one more drink before going to our room the staff was outstanding. Our servers name was Jen and by far the best server I've had while dining on the strip. she was so educated on all the questions we had about the menu she told us to get the Hexx potion because it's great for sharing so we got the passion fruit margarita and ohemmgeee it was to die for!! I recommend it to everyone, it tasted delicious and so awesome to see the presentation on it as well. After getting our drink we ordered a quick snack. We got the crab cakes which were amazing as well we sat on the patio which overlooks the bellagio fountains even tho the fountains weren't running at the time it was still a great view to people watch. As we were finishing up Juan the manager stopped by and asked how our experience was going and gave us great ideas about sights to go see while in town he was so radiant and professional but making us feel like friends. I recommend this place to everyone! Thank you again Juan and Jen!

Open 24 hours though found they don't serve all dishes all day. They have some high tables, fyi in case your party has trouble with tall chairs. Gravy fries, pepperoni pizza, and sea bass were good. Pizza came with slices of garlic which was a nice touch. Sea bass smelled fishy when it came out, didn't taste fishy. After a few bites the smell was gone. Desserts sounded really good, will be back to try them. They charge a concessions fee, shows up as "cnf" on the bill, can ask to have it removed.

Great spot to eat on the strip. We ordered this salad that starts with the letter "P" lol I forgot the name but It was delicious worth the 17$ then we ordered the smothered fries and those were good too! But the mac and cheese-ugh! Better off saving your money. Kraft mac and cheese is was better than what they served us. But everything else was very good!
Very relaxing decor and friendly, helpful staff. Food  was tasty but no wow factor. Bit overpriced for what it was

Food was delicious. Has the chicken and waffles and a Caesar salad. We got bottomless mimosa which was well worth it. Our waitress Tracee was amazing. She was super friendly, funny and personable. Tracee was super quick at refilling our mimosas and very accommodating with our requests.

We just wondered in to this place while walking along the strip. The food was amazing. I had their signature burger which is certainly one of best burgers I've ever eaten. My girlfriend had the veggie pizza which was also very good and had some unique and interesting toppings. Sean was our waiter. He was very knowledgeable about the menu items which helped us make the right choices. He gets five stars for that and service. The reason I gave only 4 stars has to do with the hostess. The restaurant wasn't very busy at the time we arrived. There were so many empty seats that some employees seemed to have nothing to do. For some reason however, we were put on a 20 minute wait with plenty of empty and clean tables inside and out. No one could give a reasonable reason why. I would recommend this place, but next time I'm asking for the manager if they say there's a wait.

I will be dreaming about my meal for the next year! The location is amazing with a view and the food was impeccable , we had the lamb and the pizza and both exceeded expectations. Will definitely be back the next time I'm in vevas

I'd say this place is average at best. We went for breakfast and got the chilaquiles. they were rather spicy despite being told they only had a "kick". Also they charge a random concession fee on top of your order.  it's also rather expensive for what you get. I'd say there are probably better places to get food in vegas
Flora was the sweetest! Her and the manager Juan Sanchez went out of their way ! The service is outstanding, great ambiance and delicious food.

Absolute crap. Didn't get what I asked for, toast was wet and soggy, scrambled eggs tasted like whipped cream home fries looked like they had been used before when asked about eggs was curtly told I was wrong.

Just ate here with a Groupon and won't be back. The temp here in Vegas is in the 40's yet the front door was propped open to attract customers walking by. At first I felt sorry for the hostess who was wearing a winter coat. Then I felt bad for me as I was freezing my entire meal and I'm from Chicago! Apparently it's more important to entice new customers than take care of your current ones. Obviously the food, once served got cold really fast. 

I ordered the soup which was excellent and the smothered fries which is supposed to have pulled pork in it. I tore the fries apart and found one small bite size piece of meat. When I questioned our server about this, he could have cared less. But that didn't surprise me as he could have cared less about anything. I requested salt and pepper when our food was delivered. I ended up having to get up and get it from a table by us because he just disappeared. Meanwhile don't forget, the dining room is freezing and my soup is getting colder by the minute.  People next to us ordered coffee, got it, but didn't have spoons. They requested spoons several times and again the waiter just disappears. I'm sure their coffee got cold while waiting for something to stir it with. The garlic bread I ordered was burned. We had to laugh and said it was just like home. But seriously what kind of chef burns bread and then sends it out of the kitchen? What wait staff professional would serve it??

So, in a nutshell, service was bad, restaurant was freezing, my food was ill prepared and no one cared. The manager came to our table to swipe my Groupon and couldn't be bothered to ask about our dining experience. The high prices here will deter most people. Having been to Vegas dozens and dozens of times I still get shocked when a glass of pop at your table is $4.95. It's truly highway robbery. 

I HIGHLY recommend any other of the many dining options close by. Mon Ami Gabi right next door is 1000x better for about the same price.

THE spot for #Brunch & bottomless mimosas!  Natalie was our server and was absolutely amazing! Our bottomless mimosas were never empty! Man up and wait out the line as they can sms you when your table is ready while you mill about. You won't be disappointed for views of the Bellagio fountain, service, and satisfaction!
Sean & Alec made our bachelorette party brunch the best!! So attentive & courteous. Shout out to Tracy for keeping the party going!

HEXX was a solid spot to have some great Bloody Marys and awesome breakfast. Great views and great service. Sean and Bobby were a dynamic duo and were super friendly and helpful. Also the price wasn't outrageous (for the strip). Totally recommend this place for brunch and starting your day.

When we arrived (with reservations in hand), there was a long line there awaiting us. After navigating that (went quickly), we had to wait about thirty minutes. 

Upon being seated, we were greeted with a fun view of the strip and the fountains. 

The food: it was ok. Nothing amazing. Nothing great. Average to good, in my opinion. 

The service: a little slow for my taste (except the guy in charge of filling my water...he was constantly filling it). 

I wouldn't go through the hassle of this restaurant (parking, waiting, etc) to come back here. It was one of those "oh hey let's check out that restaurant right on the strip" type of places that you do once and never again.
The food is fantastic and the brunch is served all day. Sean and Alec were delightful, friendly, and very attentive.
We ate here for breakfast twice in three days. The food was good, and we were able to get patio seating with no waiting. Chilequiles were super yummy, and I would highly recommend it.

Overall food was good - the waiters were terrible! Had a wrong bill all the way up & didn't accept our tip and they were beging for more money.. didn't let us go until we gave higher tip - worst restaurant ever, will never go again! shame

This place was amazing.Taylor are waiter was the bomb she took very good care of us. She smile and joked with us. She made sure everyone's Bottomless mimosas stayed full. The food was also amazing will return when in Vegas.

Fantastic food, fantastic beverages (bottomless mimosa ), but most of all, our waiter Sean was AWESOME! Breakfast was phenomenal and just the little things made our meal so great and his warming and courteous manner is an asset to Hexx! Keep it up!
Food was Great and so was the Service and do not forget to try the brocolini !!!
Great food and tasty. Sit outside for people watching and to take on the scenery. The French toast was very good.

Great brunch place.  Trendy atmosphere.  Comfortable seating.  Nice view of the strip. Hash browns baked and fried  crisp to perfection.  French toast delicious.  Large portions.  Servers super friendly.  Shout out to Shanon and Natalie.  They were so pleasant.

meh nothing to brag about same old over priced food you can find anywhere on the strip.  The reason why I gave 2 stars is they charge you CNF fee (google it )  which is a charge that no one is able to explain.  My bill was $154  and they  charged $6.37  for what?  Go figure

Good food, wonderful view and FANTASTIC service! they are open 24 hours and its really hard to find late night restaurant with patio seating but this is the one to go to! their food is good but i love their dessert! make sure to try their pitcher cocktails. Also, they have brunch available on saturdays and sundays! :)

Was in town last weekend and hit this spot up for breakfast and the selection was amazing and our server Sean was the best!! Best bloody Mary's in town and they have few to choose from and the other drinks looked amaze too! Will be back for sure!

I love this place. I've been here five times now for brunch, and I will continue to bring visitors because we always have so much fun. The $20 bottomless mimosa brunch is a great value, the waiters are always on top of refilling the glasses. The food is wonderful, the frittata and chicken and waffles are both top of the line. Tracee is THE BEST waitress, very attentive and extremely personable. Locals love this place and I suggest this place to anyone looking for a good, fun morning brunch!

Poor star for the front desk staff, they are lazy n a bit racist. They made us wait n not text us until we finally had to go back check with them.
Good thing the staff at the table was really good and 3stars for food.

Bought a dinner package with the Jersey Boys tickets, so dined here with my parents for the first night in Vegas. Not bad! The food was decent, the service was nice (our server Kevin was really welcoming and patient), and our overall experience was great.
We tried everything in the dinner package. My favorite was the grilled salmon. Oh and the soup was nice too! The burger had a great flavor but a little too salty. And the salad was plain.
Taylor is the BEST server ever!  Seriously.  Will be back soon.  She never let us go without our unlimited mimosas...and she did it all with one arm!
This place is incedible. Great food, awesome drinks and ask to sit in Tracee's section, shes the bomb. CHICKEN AND WAFFLES!!!!
Having breakfast with Melissa at Hexx Kitchen + Bar was the most pleasant experience I have had my whole time in Vegas! She's an all around wonderful server and lady ! Cheers to Vegas!
Taylor and Abraham were amazing. So much fun and the food was amazing!!! The Benedict was awesome and loved the mimosas.

I'm not really one for writing Yelp reviews, but after eating brunch at Hexx with my family, I had to. Not only was everyone's food delicious (I recommend the veggie omelet and definitely the bottomless mimosas for only $20!) but we had an exceptional time thanks to our server Tracee. She was incredible!! From excellent food suggestions to making my sister laugh to chasing down my grandfather when he forgot his jacket at the table, she really went above and beyond to make it a great meal. The manager Ari even stopped by to "dab" with my cousin. If anyone is visiting Vegas and looking for a fun place with excellent food and impeccable service, I highly recommend Hexx!!

We dined at Hexx last night and were blown away! Great staff from Parish, the host, who was so accommodating and polite  (and adorable with his bow tie) to our server Maria (knowledgeable, engaging, attentive) to the chefs who have outdone themselves with the menu....we tried a little bit of a LOT OF stuff and while everything was tasty and beautifully presented, a few things stood out: the broccolini. Really. It's an appetizer and we all thought, "huh?" because who wants to eat a plate of that stuff before a nice meal?! But it's delicious! I can't even describe it---some kind of marinade happened and then I think it's fried. ....what you get is the lightest, most delicious thing you never expected! Other standouts: the meatballs, the artichoke dip, the BACON! For entrees, the New York strip was melt in your mouth even better than the Filet. Chicken and waffles? An unlikely dinner option that turned out to be a great choice. The jumbalaya was generous with the shrimp and chicken and not too spicy, the burgers were excellent. We also had a sampling of desserts and my favorite was the French silk tart. Hexx seems to pride themselves on high quality local foods and it shows. 
Because of the size of our party (9), we were seated at a long table with upholstered booth on one side and chairs on the other. I was so pleasantly surprised by the throw pillows which were decorative and great back support!  Get the right spot and you can see the Bellagio fountains while you dine. Though the restaurant was busy, we never felt rushed AND we were lucky enough to get a tour of the chocolate making facility (bean to bar) after we finished our meal. Fascinating and I highly recommend if you get the chance. We have eaten our way through a lot of Vegas and Hexx is the place that stood out as best quality and most memorable. Thanks for the tremendous experience.
Us honeymooners from Chicago had brunch with Tracee.   Her service was top notch,  and Hexx has some of the best food at reasonable prices on the strip!  Wish we could give them 6 stars!

Had lunch here today to celebrate my boyfriends birthday and our first day in Vegas. Our server was Sean and he was one of the best waiters we have ever had! Very personable and always checked in on us to make sure we were happy. We would go back to this restaurant solely based on the service we received!
Was there with a large group and everyone of us felt that our steaks and sides had an excessive amount of salt, in fact most folks didn't finish their plates.

Visited Hex Tuesday Jun with my sister. I frequent vegas often but have never eaten here. Upon being seated for breakfast Sean, our waiter, was servicing another table right next to us. He came over and said he would be right with us while on his way to the kitchen. He came back only a few moments later and introduced himself.  He was attentative, efficient, and and great down to earth guy. Once the food came my sis asked for some extra dipping sauce and got it with no problem. He even brought me extra syrup that forgot to ask him for. It was like he was reading my mind. He had about 4 tables to serve at once and never missed a beat.I wouldnt have known he was new if he hadn't mentioned it. CHEERS TO SEAN! Great service, professionalism, friendliness, and efficiency were all of his qualities that made our experience great. We'll be back again!!!

-CARLOS
Bedt appy i ever had BACON. Great atmosphere... SupEr good service. Back to the appy... OMG.. Tasty as... Crispy bacon ... Who thinks of this stuff.. Very original

This was our second time dining here in the past year. We shared 3 appetizers, the overcooked bacon, shrimp, and smothered fries. Yum!!!! Steven was our server. He was very nice and provided great service. It was nice to sit on the patio and enjoy the Belagio fountain.

We just went for brunch for the first time here. It was highly rated and I can totally see why. Food and drinks were amazing, but even better was our server Tracee!! She has SUCH amazing energy that she spreads all throughout he restaurant. She's extremely attentive and super engaging and creates an atmosphere that makes everyone want to have a great time together! She's extremely kind and makes each guest feel so welcome and ensures everyone has a great experience. If you come here, ask to be sat in Tracee's section!

Sugar Factory was fading. Glad they tried something else. Got a small gelato and two cookies from what used to be the candy shop. Came up to 9.53. Looks like their focus is more chocolate now. Would like to come back to try the restaurant. The desserts were good, not phenomenal.

Honestly I never write reviews for yelp, but I had such a good time here that I would feel wrong for not doing so.

The bottomless mimosas are legit, and particular shout out to Jody and Mike for their excellent service, I had an absolutely wonderful time, and would definitely recommend Hexx to anyone who is coming to Vegas looking for an excellent brunch experience!
Tracee- We love u! Hexx is always great~ bottomless mimosas, amazing food and great environment! But Tracee, you made the day fun and happy! Thank you! We will be back and will look for you!
Terrific option at the Paris. Bright and clean space that opens to the Strip. Plates are slow but service is super friendly. Recommend the charcuterie plate. And a stop at the chocolate shop!

STATLER: Boo!
WALDORF: Boooo!
S: That was the worst thing I've ever heard!
W: It was terrible!
S: Horrendous!
W: Well it wasn't that bad.
S: Oh, yeah?
W: Well, there were parts of it I liked!
S: Well, I liked alot of it.
W: Yeah, it was GOOD actually.
S: It was great!
W: It was wonderful!
S: Yeah, bravo!
W: More!
S: More!
W: More!
S: More!

My wife and I were in the mood for a delicious brunch and discovers Hexx Kitchen while walking down the strip. We asked to be seated outside the 3-4 waiters outside failed to notice us and we didn't even get asked for a glass of water for 10 Minutes. This lead to us to change our seating arrangement and we moved inside WHERE WE HAD THE BEST WAITRESS EVER MISS MAGGIE!!!!!!! She made our experience wonderful after an unpleasant start. GREATEST WAITRESS IN VEGAS. Now about the food it was AMAZING! We had the chicken and waffles and steak and eggs they both were cooked to perfection and the Bottomless Mimosas were spot on. Definitely the best brunch spot in Las Vegas. If you get the chance stop by, ask for Maggie she will make your brunch even better with her amazing personality and great conversation.

Love this place. Came here 2 days in a row for brunch while visiting. $20 bottomless mimosas and the bartenders and staff were attentive and kept the glasses filled at all times. The first visit, my husband and I sat at the bar. Allison, the bartender was great! The second day, we had a bigger group of people so we sat at a table in the main dining area. The omelettes are delicious with huge portions of home fries. The frittata was also delicious but it was a small portion compared to the omelettes. I will definitely be back the next time I'm in Vegas.

Sean was the best server I could ask for. Not only did he make sure I had everything I needed, but also helped me choose a delicious dessert (milk chocolate cheese cake). He was very welcoming and friendly, had all the answers I needed for a picky water, dessert loving person as myself. 

As I was seated on the beautiful terrace overlooking the Bellagio fountains and it was about 100F outside (yet definitely cooler on the patio), he and Shannon always made sure I had plenty of water and I was extremely comfortable. 

Would definitely recommend the place and Sean is a superstar there.

I came here for lunch with my sister, had a great Bloody Mary and salad for lunch. Best part was the hospitality! Sean was our server, probably the best service I had throughout my stay in Vegas. Thanks again Sean!

Hexx is a brilliant spot for breakfast/brunch, the menu is varied so there's plenty to choose from and the food tastes great.  We are here twice for brunch and once for evening meal.  The spot is fantastic and the service and food top its next door neighbour (Mon Ami Gabi) in my opinion.  The brunch was definitely better than the evening meal in terms of value for money but the food and service were equally as good.

Sat at the bar for Saturday lunch. Service was incredibly slow. Waited 15 minutes to order. Ordered the roasted beet and grains salad. Waited 45 minutes for it to come and when it did it was full of capers which was not listed on the menu. I hate capers, but did not have time to complain after the long wait. The bartender was apologetic, but did nothing to help with my bill. Salad and ice tea was $27 after tip and I was still starving after. The salad was the only potentially larger vegan item on the menu (I switched out the dressing). Not impressed and annoyed that I went over my work lunch budget.

When deciding on where to celebrate our 2 year anniversary, we landed on @hexxlasvegas. A unique American eatery with magical signature drinks.

Pinky's Rating: * * * * * 
It's a great upscale restaurant yet still a fun atmosphere. The food was yummy and the drinks are not only aesthetically pleasing, but tasty as well.

Proppy's Rating: * * * * * 
This place screams the Las Vegas vibe! With drinks that pour smoke onto your table and a full in-house candy store, this is where to spend a fun date night or adventure with the family.

The server was very attentive and friendly, but i found the food to be quite bad.  I also didnt care for the fact that the menu isnt 100% accurate on the ingredients in the dish.  For example, my salad had olives and artichokes even though many other ingredients were listed on the menu.  Two foods i cant stand.

The bucatini sauce was mushy and just not to my taste.

I'd give it another try for brunch since most reviews rave about their brunch, but considering the 1000 other options...it wont be soon

I expect restaurants on the strip to be overpriced, but to generally have excellent food.  Hexx unfortunately did not have excellent food. 

I ordered "Grilled King Salmon.  manhattan clam chowder, arugula salad."  The 'clam chowder' consisted of several clams in open shells, and a little bit of liquid in the bottom of the plate, with small pieces of vegetable.  At first I thought it was just liquid from the salmon, which was in the middle of the plate.  The 'arugula salad' was really more of a garnish on top of the salmon.  The most disappointing part was that the salmon wasn't cooked through. The half that was cooked was good, the rest was orange/pink jello.  I declined the offer of another piece of salmon, since I was ready to leave by that point.  

My dinner companion ordered the New York steak, 10oz, which looked small for 10oz.  The blue cheese butter was specifically asked to be left off the steak, but it arrived with it anyway.  The second steak that came out, this time without the butter and about whenI finished the cooked part of my meal, apparently was good.

Cost, without tip, for both meals, one soda, and two glasses of water, was just over $80.

The service was OK, with several apologies, and the view of the fountain was nice, but I would not go back again.

Fantastic. All employees were nice and friendly. Ambiance is classy and sophisticated. Very good beverage selection. Reasonably priced. And the fried chicken is to die for. Keep up the good work HEXX.

Started off with bad seating experience we asked for inside and lead to an outside table in 100 plus degree heat. 
The girls at the front are completely indifferent and it took 15 minutes to get seated on a Tuesday night. 


Our meal was so salty filet mignon,  schnitzel,  mushrooms that we sent it all back and left without eating our dinner.

At over 20 minutes to get our main course it was inexcusable.  
Our waitress explained that the sides are pre salted downstairs and that there was little chance a second try was worth it.

My wife and I came into HEXX and had such an amazing experience . The food was out of this world , the service was impeccable (Shay being our server ) and the atmosphere was dynamic.  Juan the manager had given us a table on the patio which made my wife extremely happy. We were able to see the Bellagio water show which was electrifying .. Juan also at the end of our meal explained in detail and showed us how chocolate was made .. He went above and beyond what we expected . Working in the industry myself for ECOLAB  I plan on defiantly returing and notifying all my fellow Las Vegas contacts to visit this amazing establishments .  Thanks again for an unforgettable evening . Thanks again Shay and Juan ..

Very disappointing... came back to see our server, Shannon to find out she's no longer here. My husband said to give it a chance. We sat on the patio thinking the view would be worth it. Food was mediocre at best. Service was so-so. Managers look frantic and unorganized. Really thought we had found our new favorite place in Vegas. Unfortunately, our previous experience that we were so fond of, was a one time deal.

I can't give this 5 stars only because I need to more food lol. Other than that this place was phenomenal. The staff were very friendly and our waitress was awesome as well Maryfae! Great personality. We were sat down, served our drinks and were offered a special they had going on and I loved how passionate she sounded because it made my mouth water lol. We got our appetizer and ordered two delicious burgers. I haven't eaten good burgers like those in ages, and I eat a lot of burgers ( I love burgers). If you are in Vegas this place is open 24/7 give it a try.

Happened upon this place with open tables when Mon Ami had a 45 min wait for breakfast. So grateful they did as this was the best breakfast we had on our trip! Fantastic views from the patio, amazing service, & the unlimited mimosas just kept coming. Hopefully everyone else continues to go to Mon Ami so this place stays a best kept secret for our next visit. ;)

What's better than sitting on the patio eating supper watching the fountains at The Bellagio across the boulevard? The spinach artichoke dip was amazing, as was the jambalaya. Tom, our server, was amazing, always keeping our drink filled and informing us of the local attractions we needed to see. Make sure you stop next door at their chocolate shop! Yum!

We just finished brunch on a Sunday afternoon. Bottomless mimosas for $23 and the best Brioche French Toast. Found seating at the bar and were taken care of immediately, nice ambiance. This is a solid choice.
Great food..great service.. Our server was Tracee & she was awesome! Definitely going back there next time I come to Vegas.
Standard menu for breakfast. The breakfast pizza was good but nothing special. The service was excellent. The waitress was very patient and accommodating with our son's food allergies.

Great place! Music is off the hook and the ppl are hella dope! Our server Sean AKA the Rock lol was super dope. Nice guy! His service was on a million! He was always there when we needed him some how. I was like "man I wish I had some more Pepsi." And BOOM! There he was lol. Really really cool guy guy tho. Would most definitely come back if everybody is like this guy.

Came in for lunch with friends visiting from Toronto. 

First impressions of the restaurant was great, the interior decor was modern and clean. We sat at the high tops located right when you enter the dining area. 

Not 100% on the name of the pitcher we order for drinks but i believe it was on a special drinks menu and it involved dragonfruit (Kinky something) recommend by our waitress. It was delicious, only down side is it cannot be poured into separate glasses (says the waitress) because the presentation involves dry ice. 

For appetizers we ordered, Over cooked bacon, which is exactly what it sounds like haha, Crispy Broccolini, which were great (must try), and the spicy pork rinds which also what it sounds like. Figured there would be something more than just the obvious. 

We also ordered Chinese Chicken Salad (yum), Sausage flat bread (meh), and the spicy jambalaya (super spicy but the best entree we ordered out of everything).

Great for a one time meal, most likely won't be returning. Quality of food vs. price isn't worth it. Still a nice place to sit outside and enjoy the Bellagio fountains across the way.

I'm staying at Paris Las Vegas so my first thought was "it doesn't have great reviews but its convenient". The place is amazing, not too crowded. They have a heated patio during colder weather. Its a bit pricy if you are traveling on a budget, but each plate is big, enough for two. I've only tasted breakfast food so that's what I'm recommending it for.

Extremely disappointed! Being locals we wanted a night out just to watch the tourists, we heard this was a good place since they have outside seating so we came here. Well it took our server 20 mins to greet us. She then took an extra 15 mins to grab our drinks and forgot one of them. The food presentation was nice but the food did lack flavor. We got the salmon, cauliflower and the hexx salad. Any who the busser was very attentive he always cleared out our table and was the one who ended up getting the rest of our drink order. 

It definitely wasn't busy so there is no reason for this. 

Ps: it would have also been nice if they would have offered us a cocktAil or dessert menu.

We saw $20 bottomless mimosas on the street in front of the restaurant, so we decided to try it out. We came in 10 minutes after the breakfast and mimosa special had ended, but they let us order the mimosas anyway, which was great, but then it all went downhill. The restaurant appeared higher class, but looks can be deceiving. Our server did not get to us for 10 minutes, even though they weren't busy. We ordered the mimosas and food together since we had ample time to decide, and our server was very friendly, just extremely slow. Each mimosa took at least 15 minutes, and when the food came out, one dish was forgotten, and we had to wait an additional 20 minutes for my friend's order. The turkey club was good and a large serving, but the pasta dishes (pappardelle) were lacking flavor (hamburger helper has more). Aside from the food, I am a young woman with tattoos, but that doesn't make me a lower priority customer. The manager went around to every table except ours, for reasons why, I know not. Before ordering, I noticed they charged a 3.5% concession fee, which I had not encountered before. I asked our server, upon which she replied that she was new, so the manager would come over to explain. I had tried to flag him down before, but he seemed to avoid walking by our table. He finally came over, upon which I inquired about the fee (which was in small fine print in the menu, and on the receipt was labeled "cnf"). I wonder if only a few people had noticed this before, but when I asked, he responded that it was a fee associated as their position as a tenant in the casino as opposed to a free standing business.  I replied, "So, rent?" He curtly said "oh, um, yes," as he walked away. I wasn't allowed any follow up questions or comments before he fled, nor did he ask how our experience was at any point. Server was nice and new, so she was fine, I understand, I'm in the service industry, but the manager was incompetent, unprofessional, and completely lacked friendly people skills. Food was overpriced and bland. Will not return.

Simple salad.. 8 uncut pieces of butter lettuce with almost invisible cheese shreds and some chocolate shavings. The anti-pasto on the other hand for the same price was enough to split wi th 6 people as a generous side. I did not eat the simple salad - cheese was called snow white cheddar and it tasted like goat... ugh...  Service was strange. We had a party of 16 and 6 people's food came out over a half hour before the rest. Jambalaya, 27 bucks. The two ladies who ordered it could not eat more than a third due to the spice. Burger looked great but at 20 bucks you had to pay extra for fries. Marguerita Pizza ok. Wish it was fresh basil instead of pesto drizzle but I understand the twist.  I didn't care for it all in all. Service a bit funny - never had my water glass so well attended in my life to the point of annoyance.  Waiter brought out dessert forks for all so we thought there was comp dessert as it was a wedding reception and then he brought out one scoop of icecream and a brownie  then told the bride and groom they could pass it around the table... to 16 people... oy vey awkward. So overpriced.

I came all the way down the strip from the Luxor with my kids and sister because she came here before. She said the food and drinks were awesome. When we got there the restaurantp had changed since she last went there. I was expecting a candy type theme since it was right next door to a candy store. My sister had stated this also in the first place since this was the main reason we went. I have never been looked at so coldly from a hostess before we even exchanged words. She unwillingly greeted us and asked how many in our party. I had my two young kids with me, one in a stroller. They said they don't allow strollers in the restaurant. I could see if it was a big traveling bulky stroller that I had it would be a problem, but I didn't. It was a simple folding one. So I said it was fine and that I could hold my baby and fold up the stroller so that it would not be in the way. It could easily lie underneath the table. They said ok. Once we got seated to the table, I heard the hostess tell the server passing by that she had a table up but in a way that sounded like "ugh you got a table of 5, so sorry you have to serve these people with kids." Once we sat down, I thanked the hostess and she just looked at me with this half ass smile like "yeah your welcome, your lucky to be seated in here." Then just walked away. I was like ok that's it. I tried to look pass the rude glares from the hostesses and server. So I said let's leave. And we did. Will not recommend this place because of the condescending looks and attitude from the hostesses who think their sh** don't stink.
Great food and service!!! Our server Sean was awesome! Thanks again for everything Sean!

We stumbled upon this place when a neighboring restaurant has a ridicilous wait. There was no wait for our party of 13. The enviroment is great, clean and nicely decorated. Our waitress, Angela, flawlessly handled our large party and had a wonderful demeanor to boot. Even the gentleman filling our water glasses was pleasant and attentive! 

Food was great. I had the jambalaya. I was warned it was spicy, which it was. However it was delicious and would highly recommend if you enjoy spicy food.

We ate during the evening so it was a great view of the Bellagio fountain show. Enjoy!
I had the same experience as Debbie B.   Horrible service and way overpriced.   The only good thing about this place is that you can sit outside by the strip, but not worth it.   Never again!

Great experience at Hexx! The staff was super personable and really made sure that we were well taken care of. We sat on the outside patio and watched the night life walk by. It is a great location on the strip and provides great food and drinks while you sit and people watch:) Although Alexia wasn't our server, she really completed the experience by giving us great recommendations for the weekend and gave us her true opinions about the different clubs. Kyle was another person on the staff who gave us great info about the Vegas experience and was so kind and attentive to our table. We really enjoyed our time at Hexx and would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for good drinks and a fun time!

Big disappointment.
If you are looking for good food and nice view better go to Mon A mi Gabi. We came there (hexx) for an anniversary and won't came back again. My husband got burger - dry and salty. He had to ask for extra sauce (only one good thing about burger) to keep it a little moist . White fish (I think it was haddock) - dry. Thanks to the moist risotto i could eat it. 36$ fish meal should taste better. Punch - the only cool thing about the drink was the presentation -  fog over it. We would love to complain about the food at the dinner but saw server briefly 4 times 
- took drinks order,  we were not ready to make food order so he had to come back to take our food order
- stopped him to get extra sauce 
- dropped at out table sauce - fast
- asked us about desert holding already check for us. Pretty much when server gives you check and ask about desrt it's like "hey are you hungry yes or no well  I already have check for you so I'm done here".  
Spend more than 100$ for dinner but nothing special about this place. Not for celebrating anniversary or any other occasion  maybe just for a quick bite while u walking down the strip because service was fast . We were in and out of the restaurant. 

I went to the chocolate tasting next door - it was amazing! Chocolates are very Good! Cookies were great as well. That place deserves 5 star

Our waitress was so sweet and helpful and our appetizer, entrees, and dessert came out so quickly, which was nice since we had to make it to a show after our dinner reservation. Our Chilean sea bass was the best I've ever had and the overcooked maple bacon appetizer is great. If you order dessert, get the apple pie - my family devoured it in seconds!

The menu reads like an upscale trendy breakfast spot but beware from menu to kitchen to table there is a problem first our food came from the kitchen cold the eggs were under cooked then over cooked like burnt
On a positive note the eggs Benedict was great better if hot upon service
great service and I had the greatest time. the food was great and my server Daniel was so attentive and had a great personality! definitely coming back again

So I was VERY disappointed with this place. Now to their credit maybe it was bad because I went at 4 am for steak and eggs but if you can't make it then don't offer it. Maybe the chef who specializes in steaks wasn't there but man it was bad. I asked for it medium and it came out burned on the outside with a medium interior. Sent it back and they brought it back slightly less burned and STILL charged me for it!!!! I couldn't believe it! If this is the service over night then close your doors because it's not worth it to lose customers over it.

Had the Veggie omelette with fried potatoes and an English muffin and it was good. Veggies were fresh ~spinach, peppers, onions, mushrooms.. Seats are very uncomfortable though! While there is construction going on in the restaurant there is NO hot chocolate! So bummed! I would have gone to Serendipity across the street if I would have know before I was seated.

Nice atmosphere amid the hustle and bustle of the strip! Clean, smells good, and the Chinese chicken salad was amazingly fresh and delish...not to mention HUGE! The wait staff is friendly and helpful as well...shout out to Tracy!

Great Brunch vibe today at Hexx. The colossal bloody mary has crab legs, shrimp, sausage, cheese... We all enjoyed our meals on the best patio in Vegas! Chef CB checked on us which made the experience even better!

Stumbled upon HEXX kitchen + bar when looking for a nice brunch spot during my stay in Vegas that wasn't a buffet and Yelp led me here! Located off the strip across from the Bellagio fountains, HEXX focuses on fresh, quality, approachable American cuisine with extensive drink options OH, and it's attached to a candy store as well! What's not to like about that?

I loved the atmosphere; modern, cozy, home-y vibe that made you feel like you were in someone's house casually sitting down for a good meal. As we settled in we pursued the brunch menu and I actually had trouble picking what I wanted because everything looked so good to me. After some rounds of coffee I opted for the ham and cheese croissant which our server recommended and I was not displeased in my decision. It was a huge sandwich with aged gooey cheddar, a nice helping of black forest ham, and a nice soft and warm croissant bun served with a side of their home fries. Seemed like the perfect way to start my morning as  I was completely satisfied with what I ate and now was ready to get my day started. And although the candy kitchen seemed very tempting, I had to restrain myself since I was still basking in my brunch pleasure and it seemed too early for that, until next time!

Give this place a shot for great food, views, and atmosphere when you don't want to eat at a buffet.

Wonderful bottomless brunch spot. Great service, fantastic food, but the service by Sean was the best part. Very attentive, friendly, and great recommendations on the menu. Cannot recommend enough - ask for Sean!

I had the steak frites and regret it. 

The steak was indescribably bad the fries were stale. 

There are far better ways to spend $35 than paying for the opportunity to suffer through this food. 

Offering a shot at redemption, I returned a couple days later for brunch. And left regretting it too.

The Veggie Quiche was inconsistently cooked, and somehow, really greasy. The potatoes were served with substance that resembled a house speciality Ketchup but was actually a strawberry jam and butter puree. Because Vegas, right?

Food was good but service was very slow. In Vegas everything is expensive when it comes to food and drink. The quality of food is very good, especially the Yukon potatoes. We went there a couple of times and the wait for our food was very long.
Paid $18 for a salty oily personal pizza. Burger also burnt, salty, & expensive. The waiters are not to friendly either. Don't recommend this place.

Went here for breakfast.  Great service, food was sub par.  The homefries are just deepfried whole potatoes, not good at tall.  Breakfast sausage has way too much paprika.  The ham and cheese croissant was ok, same for the Belgian waffles.  A better option at Paris with a similar price tag is Mon Ami Gabi.
Hex is a Great place!!  It's a must try! Also loved the warm touch from the Manager Michael whom was very nice when he stopped by the table to make sure everything was great!!

Went to hexx for breakfest and was dissapointed.  The service was mediocre the table next to us received multiple menues with specials and so forth, while our waitress didnt offer anything.  I waiting for a grapefruit juice for a good 20 minutes before i asked where it was.  For the price i recommend the paris restaurant outside as it had better service and overall food.

Went to Hexx for breakfast because of the previous Yelp reviews! Went and it was amazing!!! Taylor our server was amazing!!! We had a big party for my brother in laws 50th and she didn't break a sweat!!! Love her! Request Taylor anytime you go...she's amazing!!!!!! Funny, friendly and great service!!!!

I tried to have the buttermilk pancakes at Hezx last Sunday in LV.  

The pancakes looked fine.. but once I cut into them I had batter all over the knife and fork.. the insides were not cooked through.

The waitress & Manager were very nice.. the waitress took the pancakes back.. she could see they weren't  cooked.  The Manager told my wife and I the pancakes were taken off the bill.. and another plate would be coming out.

I can't recall ever sending food back.. and definitely not pancakes.

The second plate wasn't much better.. this time I had one bite.. I needed to gulp some water to swallow the forkful.  The second plate was also under-cooked.

I wanted to head back into the kitchen, and make some pancakes myself.. can't most of us cook pancakes ???!

Phew... try Mon Ami Gabi !!

From a local's perspective: AWESOME!

Came here on a Tuesday evening during the week of the fight weekend so there was a decent crowd already in town.  Made an easy reservation on their website.  We were immediately seated on the patio along the strip as we requested.  The table offered stunning views of the strip looking directly at the Bellagio fountains as the canons went off every 15 minutes.

Tom was our server who was phenomenal. He was positive, quick, and knowledgeable of the menu.

We enjoyed a bottle of cab reasonably priced at $60, the meatballs ($15), the margarita pizza ($16), and the flourless brownie ($10).  Everything tasted great.  The pizza was a little cold but did have a lot of flavor and the brownie was very VERY rich, you'll only want a couple of bites.

All in all a great experience.  Will definitely be back.

P.S.  We entered in from the casino where there was no hostess at the stand so we had to walk through the restaurant to the other entrance just off the strip.
Taylor was such an amazing server. Great energy and always refilling our drinks. She was such a pleasure I'll definitely Come back !!

We were walking around the strip, and decided to give this place a shot, it was a long wait, so we assumed it would be really good. The food tastes bland and was over priced, service wasn't the best either, I wouldn't go back.

Doesn't get the credit it deserves. Hexx chefs wonderfully prepare feel good food with a modern twist. The chocolate is made from the bean right there in its little location so do the chocolate sampling ... You won't be disappointed . Eaten here on several trips but the food seems to be getting better and better . The covered fries are insanely delicious and if you want a LARGE portion of food this is where you want to go !

I had the spinach sausage pizza and my husband had the burger. It was just okay. His burger was $20 and my pizza was $19. We will not visit this place again. It was over priced and just tasted okay. 
Vegas has so much more to offer.
Amazing brunch experience and delicious bottomless mimosas!!! Ask for Sean - he was a fantastic server!

I want to give a shout out to Juan at Hexx. He turned our night from a 5 to a 10 every restaurant should have a manager like him, especially at night in Vegas. We had an issue with our order and he completely took care of it with no questions asked and a smile.

came here very late and it was busy and loud and had a very happy atmosphere! I got the hummus and it was phenomenal, I especially liked the blue oil on top, perhaps I may have questioned it more if I had been sober. the people who were working there were very very sweet. our waitress was nice and efficient and the boy I stopped for coffee was super sweet tea but I think he may have had a crush on me, I was looking pretty cute that night. the coffee was very strong so I recommend it for those of you who love that.

After reading all the positive reviews I decided to check this place out my last morning in vegas and I was not disappointed.  For a casual restaurant the ambience is definitely upscale.  I got the meat omelette and parfait.  The highlight of the meal was the home fries... so good.  The omelette was ok, just too much meat for me and maybe a little over cooked.  But that's just my personal taste, a meat lover would probably love it.  I'd probably try one of the other ones next time.  The yogurt parfait was delish with fresh berries, as was the jam.  Portion sizes are huge and I couldn't even finish my plate.  And the staff is friendly too.
Great brunch place for Vegas!! Waiters Sean & Julio were AMAZING!! The carrot cake pancakes were to die for!!

We went to look for a nice place for brunch and ended up here. Didn't have to wait for a patio seating. Had a pretty view of the bellagio fountain. Ordered the rib eye steak and egg. Scrumptious! We would love to come eat here again!

Came here to have an excellent anniversary brunch but sadly, was disappointed. We ordered the Brioche  French Toast, overcooked bacon and the Frittata. The French toast and bacon came out cold. The Frittata was all egg. Where was the chorizo and potato? Oh, according to the waiter it was in there. Where, we asked again? Finely chopped, those little dots he said as hubby combs through all the egg with his fork. We look at each other and shrugged. When the waiter left we said hmmm maybe finely ground like pepper?! Lol, wth?
To top it off, no refills on our water... Not one...I know there's a water shortage, but c'mon. With all the great restaurants in Vegas this one seriously needs to step their game up. 
1 star for the adorable patio. Awesome views of the Las Vegas strip and the Bellagio Fountains!
The service at HEXX was amazing!! Cece was a great server and kept the food and mimosas coming. This is a must for any visit/brunch in Vegas. Request Cece if you can!

First time at Hex... Was definitely blown away by the service Steven provided us. He was very informative and friendly. The food was absolutely delicious, artichoke dip and short rib dinner, amazing! Oh yes how could I forget the Aztec cake was to die for! Will definitely have to come back for other amazing dishes.

Favorite place in Vegas wonderful atmosphere right in front of the bellagio fountains they have an outdoor seating as well. We got the bottomless mimosas which is unlimited for $20 can't beat that. Food was amazing tasty as well I will definitely be back

We came here on Monday morning for breakfast before our long drive home to San Francisco. Tracee was our server and was training another server who helped us as well. She was very outgoing, personable, and friendly. Great recommendations, we enjoyed everything we ate. Out of our whole Vegas trip Tracee was by far the most impressive in service, I appreciate the genuineness and I would go back just based on the service we received. As a retail business manager myself I know it's hard to find talent as good as hers, great job! thanks again for the experience!

There's literally a thousand plus places to eat at within a 5 mile radius. My husband and I wanted to try something different to celebrate the new year. Sadly, we chose Hexx. We ordered the Hex burger, marguerites pizza, and Mac and cheese. Our waitress, Denise, never asked us how our food was. We wish she would have because the burger was so over-cooked and bone dry. The pizza was sub par and soggy. The only positives- the bacon on the burger was delicious and my drinks were never empty. Everything else was a let down. There's easily 999+ places we would have rather eaten at. Patrons, avoid The Hexx- you can do much better in Vegas, the Mecca of great food!!

Sat there for 20 min and didn't even get a menu. Manager came up asking if we were going to order something, then said he will get us menus. Never came back. Never got a menu. Never got a waitress. Terrible service.

Came in today with my husband and had bottomless mimosas, and the smothered fries. Best service ever thanks for making it a greatexperience great Julio. We will be back and will definitely ask for you

Came in here for breakfast on a Monday morning as other places in the hotel were a bit busy. Went in through the casino and it was pretty quiet and empty. A bit worried it wasn't actually open. Made it the front and saw someone at the bar and asked if it was ok to eat here. She said of course and started chatting with me. 

Ordered a latte first. It was alright and wouldn't recommend getting one. 

Asked for some suggestions which included the steak and eggs and the ham and cheese croissant. However, I had my eye on the chicken and waffle meal. She said it was great and a big portion. 

When it arrived it was the waffle with two strips and two wings fried to a golden brown. Crispy on the outside and nice and hot on the inside. The wings were ok, but not enough meat. 

The waffle was good, but wasn't blown away. It could have been a bit crispier.

Came with spicy pickles which were pretty tasty. 

Didn't eat it all, but came close. 

I thought the service was great as was the chicken. Came at the right time and sat at the right spot to get that personal attention. I'd probably order the same meal again and sit there at the bar. Next time I'll get the Bloody Mary instead of the latte.
Ate here and had the most amazing waitress. Tracy was so attentive and fun I had to write a review. The food and atmosphere was great! Definitely stop by here for a meal!!

This place is horrible! I'm sitting at the restaurant as I'm writing this review. The waiter is the biggest ass- condescendingly tells my Korean-American parents that Jambalaya is a dish they may not be familiar with and tries to argue with them about the dish. First he says it's impossible for them to make it without the spice. Then, I tell him that my dad never asked for it without spice, and he backtracks to saying he doesn't understand. He made a snide comment about my parents not listening to him when he was talking about the specials. I asked for a different waiter and he scoffed and left. The service here is horrible and the blatant condescending manner toward non-English speaking customers is unacceptable.

This restaurant is a great choice! It's on the strip with open air seating, you can choose outside seating or inside and still watch the folks as they pass by on the sidewalk. The atmosphere is great and the staff is friendly! I had the salmon and clam chowder with fresh clams.... oh my goodness, delicious to the last drop!

Midnight munchies on Friday night! 6 of us shared and split a few menu items. Hot mess was pretty great and the gumbo was yummy as well! I got a bloody mary which was tasty! Used a myVegas cocktail reward very smoothly! We were seated on outside porch which got a little chilly but we had a great time and got to people watch all the late night overindulged patrons of Paris. Waitress was quick and nice, answered all our questions. A good experience and I would go back!

Expected the sugar factory, ended up at Hexx. Everything about this place feels rushed without any sort of thought in to its concept. They tout chocolate and candy but the front desk is surrounded by wines. All the furniture looks portable as if it's a popup restaurant. The chocolate they gave us as a taster after eating was horrid - I'd rather eat semisweet bakers chocolate. I ever write reviews, and in fact I made an account just to write this. Something about this place spurred me to do so. Take it as you will. 

If you are looking for sugar factory, move on - this is not a replacement.

We would strongly recommend Hexx. Great environment with amazing service. Sean and Patrick were a great duo who made our experience one to remember. Great birthday brunch all around. 

P.s. Carrot cake pancakes were amazing

9/25/15. Great looking eatery! The 2 hostess at entry were fantastic. The food is mediocre. I ordered the Chilaquiles and well.. ugg. The service was fair. 
I would not go back here until they earn 4 stars
On Yelp

Looking thru social media, it was the potion drink made me want to try it! What the heck, let's try it! Ahh excuse me?? I'd like to order the Potion drink? So the waitress handed me the drinks menu. Oh boy!! $38 for that one pitcher plus tax.. I pretended I don't have problem with  the price as it was my mission to try it lol!!! Overall, the drink was good just for the experience only. It would have been better if it was on a  $20 range only. The four cheese pizza was also good. Just 3 stars because of the price of their potion drink!

Hexx is a great new restaurant situated in front of the Paris Hotel & Casino, directly on the Las Vegas Strip. It's a beautiful space with an even better patio. I highly recommend enjoying the outdoor seating as it provides for some amazing people watching and a beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains. 

The menu is delicious, approachable, while still being creative. Everyone from the hostess to the management was great too. The General Manager stopped by our table; he was extremely nice and hospitable. Our server was super knowledgeable and attentive without being intrusive. She was eager to answer all of our questions and recommended some tasty cocktails. The Potions are fantastic and the wine list is extensive. 

We can't wait to return for more cocktails and to try their "bean to bar"chocolate. Thanks again to Michael and the Hexx staff!

It's hard to find a decent place to eat on the strip - I struggle to find a place that's proportionately priced to the quality. You mostly pay exorbitant prices for average food in a fancy setting or exorbitant prices for average food in an average setting. Either way, tastebuds and wallet are not in sync. Except for Hexx!!

I saw Hexx from across the strip and suggested we check it out for lunch instead of one of the mainstream (and not very good) chain restaurants we were passing. Checked out the menu and were able to grab seats at the bar in time for happy hour pricing on food and drinks - it was great! We split the spinach artichoke dip (very tasty) and I got the tomato and burrata bruschetta. I don't see the bruschetta listed on their menu online, so I hope it's still available - it was delicious! And both appetizers were especially generous in portion, for pretty reasonable prices (and not just Vegas-reasonable, I mean actual reasonable). It was a really perfect lunch (kind of lunch turned linner) stop for us, and I highly recommend it. I was so impressed with the quality, quantity, and price point of the food I actually sought out the manager and complimented/thanked him for running such a great find - and right on the strip!

Some would say it was by chance we landed here, others might say fate...my friend was obsessed with going to the "candy restaurant, where they serve candy for dinner!" (which we all immediately shut down) but, as it turns out, that very same restaurant is Hexx. They have an attached candy shop and apparently went through a revamp a year or so ago - so the rumor of a candy restaurant had been true (or at least as true as rumors tend to be) but we all also enjoyed a great meal.

OMG! This place is amazing! Our waiters, Tolu and Bobby were wonderful! They got us what we wanted and even brought us free chocolate samples! Their food was spectacular and everything was nicely plated! I can't wait to go again!

Fantastic service - Sean was great. This is our third time to Vegas in a year and a half and honestly this has been the best service we have gotten throughout our visits. Food was fantastic and drinks were endless... We could barely keep up! I would definitely recommend and also request Sean for your waiter!!

The local is awesome and the food is great.  So the reason why i gave this spot 3 stars had nothing to do with quality of food.  There a mid price when it comes to eating in vegas but it's tasty.  

The 3 stars are due to the horrible service provided by the waiter.   He gave a sense that he didn't really care about taking care of my table.  He only checked in on us ones for drink and the for food.  My brother had asked him for a water and it never came.  20 mins later i asked another server for water and it finally came.   The other waiters where doing a way better job than the one assigned to our table.   I think the restaurant manager should be more involved in the quality of service being provided by the waiters.

Was in Vegas last weekend and no weekend in Vegas is complete without a brunch. This was a fun place! The decor is very California hip. Lots of white and natural finishes. Fun music was playing and everyone was kind of grooving in their seats to the music. We opted to sit indoors rather than outdoors which had a lovely view of the fountains and great people watching but it was 105 the day we were there. 

Our server, Tracee, was wonderful. Very fun and high energy and fast. Her station was full and she had a smile on her face the whole time.

Hubby had french toast and I had the chicken and waffles. Both were very delicious. My chicken and waffle was a huge portion. We could have split it. In fact, I gave hubby a big piece of my chicken since I had more than enough and he needed some protein. The fried chicken was excellent!

The mimosas were also good. The pre mix the oj and the bubbly into pitchers so they can refill glasses quickly. I would have preferred not having them pre-mixed just because too much acidity in the oj can bother me. However it wasn't a deal breaker.

Will definitely return on our next trip!

Food was great for everyone in our party, portions aren't ridiculously big either so I could actually eat all mine (still left me full though). Our server was very friendly and accommodating and our water glasses were never allowed to get empty. A little pricy but I'd say worth it.

Total CRAP!! 
Service was the worst... never got my food, and left. Guy next to me ordered a berger, and it was raw and old meet. We both spoke to management and they didn't care. Would not send my dog there. Be carefull of places like this.....

Best brunch in Vegas. Perfect location on the strip. Bottomless mimosas are a plus! Taylor and Josh were attentive and kept the drinks coming! Wish we could have sat outside for an amazing view of the Bellagio but the inside was super cute and AC was wonderful. Will def make this a dining destination next time in Vegas.

We had THEE best dinner!!! Chelsea, thank you for such a great experience!!!  Dinner was delicious... Everything tasted D-LICIOUS!!!!  We enjoyed our bottle of Syrah!!! And the best part, we were able to leave a "love note" on our bottle!!! We will definitely be back!!!!!

I am so disappointed in this place! 

The presentation of this restaurant makes you think it's a great place to have brunch at. It's across the street from the Bellagio fountains, outside dining and for some reason it's packed. 

I waited 45 minutes for a table to be so disappointed! I ordered the ham& cheese  croissant and the carnitas hash. What a mistake! 

First the croissant was deli lunch meat ham with cheese put on a croissant. The carnitas hash was potatoes.. No joke! Like no flavor in anything. Only good thing about this place is location and their potatoes! 

Service is slow too! I would NOT come here again.
I wish I took pictures of my food. Great food great people and great view. Lisa was serving us and she was awesome. Definitely we are coming back for breakfast.

Tracee was our server at Hexx. The service was outstanding. She gave us great suggestions, was extremely friendly, and showed an interest in us as a group as we were celebrating a
35 year retirement. Hillary, the manager congratulated us on the event we were celebrating as well. The chicken BLT and lobster sandwiches were excellent. The table was in a perfect location outside with a view of the Bellagio Fountains.  Thank you for making our dining experience so memorable and fun. We will definitely be back in the near future.

I've been a huge fan of Chef Carlos for years. From Vegas to Austin, TX and back.  When I found out he was at Hexx, I couldn't get there fast enough.  He never disappoints. The brunch menu is stellar and if you like a good Bloody Mary, you'll be glad you came. Great food, great drinks, great view, just bring good company and you can't possibly go wrong!
Really yummy sandwiches.  Service was pretty good. Our food came before our drinks but getting food fast is not the worst thing in the world!

While it's a great location, the atmosphere is lousy. While paying $39 for a steak, I don't need to have "Down with OPP" blaring in the background. Other people were complaining too. The music kills the atmosphere. Wait staff are nice though and if you sit outside, you can see the fountains... Still, suggest Mon Amie Gabi next door instead.

Came to Las Vegas for a visit with my daughter and she suggested coming here for dinner. Jan was able to sit us at an amazing table with a view and the service was divine. The wine selection was incredible and the tomato salad (my personal favorite) and roasted salmon were to die for! I am planning to return here upon my next visit and will never hesitate to suggest it to my friends. Wonderful place.

Very disappointed in the courtesy of staff. I can't comment on the food as I never had the opportunity to make it that far. I put my name in with my whole group and was told I would receive a text and must arrive within 10 minutes. The staff was already very curt demanding to count off the members of my party before I could put my name in. I received a text at 12:44 and arrived at the restaurant front desk at 12:53 with my party just behind me. The hostess, who's name I wish I got but was an older woman with dark hair, barely acknowledged me and when I inquired about my reservation stayed I would have to go to the bottom of the list for not arriving in 10 minutes, after showing her my phone that documented I received the text 9 minutes ago, she stated that she was sure she sent it 15 minutes ago. This is the equivalent of making up a rule that you can only drive 5 mph on a road and then pulling someone over for going 4 mph. If you are going to have your own insane rules at least follow them. I understand it is on a busy location in Vegas but maybe stop and think about what you are trying to do (i.e. Providing and experience for people) as opposed to trying to churn people through your restaurant.

Best. Meal. In. Vegas.... EVERRRRR!!!!  From the ambiance, to the service, to the food/drinks to the incredibly talented Chef Piekarski... everything was beyond amazing!  I could not ask for a better experience!  I was celebrating my birthday and decided on this restaurant since I knew we could sit on the patio & have a wonderful view of the Bellagio water show as we ate.  I'm so happy we went here.  From the moment my party & I walked into Hexx - we were treated like we were the only ones in the restaurant - who wouldn't luv that kind of service?!?!
Our table ordered the Overcooked Bacon & Hummus Bruscetta for aps - both were perfect on the palette!  Not so heavy of an ap that it ruins your appetite for dinner either.  They were spot on for taste & portions!
For dinner, we ordered the Rib Eye, Chicken & Waffles, Sea Bass & Chicken Schnitzel entrees.  All 4 dinners were mouthwatering!  The Ribby (my fav cut of steak) - so juicy, perfect char, and cooked to my exact liking - medium.  It came with this dollop of garlic butter on the rib eye - that took the already delicious steak to a whole new level of deliciousness!  The Chicken & Waffles - Even better than we anticipated.  The chicken wasn't at all dry & had a perfect crunch to it.  The waffles - not your ordinary waffles.  What a wonderful suprise of flavor!  I could eat those all day!  The Roasted Sea Bass was absolute perfection!  Respectively seasoned, juicy & had a little crunch to it cause of the perfectly cooked skin.  That too, had a flavorful char on it (I do luv me some char - lol).  But the best dish of the night was the Chicken Schnitzel.  OMG!!!   As my sis would say "Their Schnitzel is the Shitzel".  We really didn't know what to expect from this dish but from the moment I tasted it... there was a very savory party going on in my mouth!  My taste buds were definitely doing the happy dance!
We were so impressed by the food that we just had to thank the Chef in person.  I asked our fabulous server, Vanessa, if we could speak to the Chef & without missing a beat, she told us she'd go get him.  A few mins later, the accomplished Chef Piekarski came out and chatted with us for appx 10mins.  He gave us a little Hexx history & a little backstory about himself.  Super friendly & super gracious!!  He never once made us feel rushed to speak to him & he happily posed for pictures with us.  Meeting him and being able to show our gratitude was the cherry on top of everything.... Or so I thought.  Next thing we know, we're getting served a heavenly array of desserts sent from the Chef himself!  The Creme Brulee... absolutely divine!
I was in Vegas for 5 days, did all sorts of fun things, ate all kinds of different foods & saw a concert.  Hands down, the highlight of my entire trip was my experience at Hexx.  I can't thank Vanessa & Chef Piekarski enough for making my bday dinner such a memorable evening!
We're heading back to Vegas next wkend - I already know we'll be stopping here to try out their breakfast.  Chilaquiles or Carnitas Hash.... Here I come!!!
Never had a bad meal here. Our sever Steven was absolutely amazing!! Worth every penny for food and service.

We came for brunch on a Friday morning around 1030. We made reservations just in case, and we got there a few minutes late and were seated in about 15 minutes on the patio, which is first come first serve.

We did bottomless mimosas which were strong, a great price, and were filled almost immediately after taking a sip. We each got different meals and were all impressed! I got the veggie omelette which was one of the best omelettes I've had. 

There is no time limit for sitting and enjoying your mimosas so we sat for some time after we finished our meal and enjoyed our $25 bottomless drinks. I would definitely recommend this place for a reasonably priced meal on the strip!

What an enjoyable place to have brunch on the Strip... While a bit pricey, it is easy to get your money's worth from their Bottomless Mimosas and there Chicken and Waffles were perfect - especially their in-house bourbon syrup! Though the giant line can be intimidating, they are very good about offering - and honoring - reservations, no matter how far in advance you make them. We made a reservation 10 minutes before arriving, found out the wait was over an hour for non-reservation holders, and were seated less than 5 minutes after arriving. Not bad!!

After some shopping, we stopped in for lunch.  The girls in the front were very friendly and sweet. We got seated fairly quickly.  Our server was amazing and knowledgeable of the menu.  She was also very patient with our toddler, who had a lot of energy at the time.  The pizza was delicious and the mac and cheese was yummy!  Definitely toddler approved!  The dessert menu was unbelievable... we had a difficult time deciding... With some advice from the awesome manager and our server we narrowed it down to the brownie and cheesecake.  OMDeliciousness!  Thank you to all the Hexx staff for being so wonderful!  We will definitely be coming back!!

Mediocre food and expensive for what you got.  Service was ok, but she was pretty overwhelmed.  Beware of the appetizers... they are small and not terribly filling.  I dont feel you should do this unless you have no other options... it was pricey and sub chilis grade food.

The food: 
we ordered salmon and chicken on waffels. The salmon was to tried-out. The mussels in the soup from the salmon, na what should I say Not the best part. The chicken on the waffels, the most parts of the chicken was bones.

Trinks
We orderd a red and white wine, both was good but nothing special.

Service:
The service was friendly and we seated immediately.

Went for a late lunch. I was by myself and sat outside to people watch. My server was Andrea. Andrea you got a dollar tip because you ignored this senior citizen the whole time I sat there. My ice tea was gone for 25 minutes, you kept looking my way but never came over. You had three tables outside and were not very busy. Pizza, waited 30 minutes for the food, you never came over. The pizza had dripping grease and was horrible.
This senior citizen would have left you a large tip if you had been attentive, but alas you were not.  Not impressed with the food or the server.

I send people in hexx to dine in and experince the view over looking bellagio 

Lets begin with food, we order salmon, bolo pasta, newyork, and prime rib 

All all of the proteins were overcook their interpretation of midrare is well done the meat was so tough we had to send it back 

Then our server had the audacity to come back on our table to tells us one of the protien was properly.cook 

Pasta was ok! Needs more seasoning 

Service 

I ask for water it took them 4 times me asking nicley to get 4 glasses of water 

My sister in law and my wife already finished their meal before a medium newyork, and midrare prime rib came out, my sides dish are already cold before we get to enjoy a ok meal 

Will i go back? No
Will i recommend? No
Will i send clients to have meals at hexx? No 

Dispointment!

Let me start by saying the only reason i gave it 2 stars  was because of the outside view! First they said it would be 20 min to seat us. After 30 min i went to the front and they said they had no record of me.  Then they sat us, nice view of the foutains at the belagio!  The bloody marys were 13.00 each and tasted like there was no alcohol!  Me and my wife ordered the carnitas hash, HORRIBLE!!! IT WAS LIKE A STEW!  my wife didn't even eat hers. Service was poor and food horrible. For the price i expected MUCH MORE.  skip this place!

First time coming here and I must say that this is an upscale place! It's very modern and classy.
