Our waiter was very very nice, I believe his name was Jay. Our food came out quick me and my date ordered the Spicy Jambalaya dish! Ahhmazzinggg! I thought it was a bit overpriced but overall it tasted excellent! 

The vibes are great here! Definitely a MUST if you're near Paris on the strip!

Hexx was a tasteful delight at the wee hours of the night. The bake sale sundae was amazing; three scoops of ice cream adorned with cookies, brownies and rice Krispy treats yum! Daniel our server was by far my favorite part of our experience. His enthusiasm and hospitality set the bar high for all servers out there.

My husband and I had dinner here last Saturday. Food and drinks were delicious. Service was wonderful. We could not have asked for a better server than Jessica A. Attentive, funny and had great suggestions! We had a great time!

Sean was our waiter and he is truly the best! Really good with recommendations if you are ever stuck between a dish, and just cares about how you are doing! You can feel how genuine he is when it comes to making your experience the best! If you come here ask for Sean lol!!
This place is top of the line! The chefs put their hearts into the food and the servers are amazing ! 10 starts for hexx!!!!

Only reason I gave 1-star is because you can't give less. We sat at the bar for 10 minutes with an empty glass with 2 bartenders walking by multiple times, looking away each time. I would strongly recommend you spend your money somewhere else on the strip. No with the time.

Hexx is hands down my favorite restaurant on the Las Vegas strip. I frequently visit and always have to make stop here. The food is some of the best you'll find on the strip and the bottomless mimosas are just an added BONUS! 

Although I've been here a handful of times what made this pass experience even more memorable was our awesome server Sean and Mark. He never let our mimosas go empty and had great knowledge about the menu. He made our experience that much more enjoyable.  

Definitely recommend!

Horrible establishment! Couldn't get service. I had seen an interesting advertisement outside by their doors showcasing what looked like sangria pitchers with what looked like dry ice making fog rise from the pitchers. I thought it would be interesting to try so I came back with my wife to experience that. Since we were not going to eat the hostess sent us to the bar. We sat there for literally no joke about ten minutes and no one acknowledged us at all. We weren't complaining because we aren't jerks or assholes we understand that the staff might be busy with other guests but it was about 3pm and there was five people scattered throughout the bar and there was three bartenders. It wasn't until one of them needed to use the register that was next to where we were sitting that I had the opportunity to ask for service asm he replied that he needed to take care of the two ladies sitting three stools away. Horrible service. Horrible service. Maybe he was being racist? Maybe he was being discriminate? Maybe he doesn't belong in the service industry? The reason I bring up the race card? My wife and I are Hispanic. The rest of the patrons were anglos. That was my observation. Why bring up the discrimination? Maybe because he saw that we were Hispanic, he assumed we were going to be rude or maybe even be bad tippers? I work in services as well, my bonuses are directly from client feedback through what my company calls net promotor score. If I meet my metrics I get a bonus. If a server or bartender gives good service or even great service they should assume a great tip. I tip 20% regardless because I understand the service industry. This person, with grayish short hair wearing a blue striped long sleeve shirt didn't even give us the opportunity to pay for a good from this establishment much Lee's tip him. He seemed like he had more authority than the bartenders so he might be a manager or whatever maybe he felt like he can choose his patrons. Been in Vegas before to many establishments and this was the worst ever. Couldn't even comment on their product or food cause I couldn't even try it...

I usually don't write reviews but everything from service, cold and salty food was totally disappointing.  It is also so loud that you can't have a conversation..... The management should really take a good look of how things are being ran.

There are so many other places in Vegas to ever return here!

Great food and excellent service. It's our first time here and we did a birthday brunch for our friend; we had the BEST waiter name Sean! Super attentive, extremely kind, and really made us feel welcomed. We're definitely coming back :)
I used to love this place, view is still good, service is also, but I need fondue.. used to drive from green valley for it, but no reason anymore.

This place is amazing original made a reservation for sugar factory and was thankful for the change..!!! Hands down great service, great food..!!! And beautiful view def suggest go around 7 so your whole dinner you get to see the water show at the mirage..!!! Omg..!!! I came with a party of 11 and was shocked how well we were taking care of.. And there birthday Sunday was soooo cute..!!! So please u want a great beginning to the evening start at the Hexx it was awesome get a steak and a glass of wine (fab selection by the way) and enjoy..!!! I will definitely make it a stop every Vegas trip..!!!
Great food and good service ! The atmosphere was lovely and we had a seat right next to the window to watch the Bellagio fountain!
This was awesome. Went here for brunch. Make a reservation.  Our bottomless mimosas were on point. And our server Taylor made the experience.

I had Vanessa as my server and she was so amazing. Vanessa was very attentive and fun. The food was great... I came in for dessert and ordered the Aztec chocolate cake which was delicious! Compliments to the chef

These were probably the best eggs Benedict I've ever had. I wasn't sure I would like them over scalloped potatoes but they were a nice touch. Very nicely presented and delicious. Also enjoyed some bottomless mimosas. I don't normally get dessert with breakfast, but decided to try the hazelnut pudding and it was amazing. I can't wait until I'm next in Vegas so I can come back here. My waitress was very nice as well and helped make my dining experience even more enjoyable.

Were craving pizza and staying at the Paris..Hexx is here so we stopped in before heading out. Omg! Fabulous!. Teddy our server was amazing. Great salad and hummus appetizer. Fennel sausage pizza was the bomb. Can't wait to come back.

Stayed at Paris for a work related convention, and needed breakfast to get off to a good start.  This restaurant is situated right in front, and just to the left of the hotel.  My friends and I decided to give it a try.   There are several options on the menu.   Something for everyone.   I had the Farm Fresh Eggs with bacon, toast, and home fries.    The potatoes are out of this world! They are small size new potatoes that are crisp on the outside, and tender inside.   Very well seasoned, and just delicious!   The strawberry jam for the toast is made from scratch, and is just delicious! The service was great, and the atmosphere is wonderful!  I definitely recommend this restaurant as a breakfast option.
All around good meal....lots of options....we ordered a variety from pasta carbonara to steak and burgers. All were delicious and not overly priced. Service really needs some work though!

Ummm I love this place! A must go to for brunch every time I'm in Vegas. I have never had dinner here but I love their brunch menu. When I went, we ordered a variety of different foods and they were all so good! Don't even think about it, just go! And their 20-somehting dollar bottomless mimosa well surely help start your day off right! If you're looking to meet your friends or family for breakfast after a night of partying or just for brunch, this is your spot! Just do it. Love this place!
Juan and Cherry were great. Amazing food and awesome drinks. Definitely worth it. Everyone was super friendly and the food was delicious.
The food here was so good! But the best part of eating here was probably are incredible server marife, she was funny and personable, and took very good care of us!

My husband and I came to this restaurant after visiting the Eiffel Tower Experience at the Paris Hotel. The food was just ok. I ordered the filet mignon because I wanted a smaller steak. I told the waiter I wanted it well done. He seemed really confused as to why I wanted it well done so I had to explain to him that I'm pregnant and have to have all my meats cooked thoroughly. He then asked if they could butterfly it (when I'm at restaurants and they ask me this it gives me the inclination that they do not have an experienced chef in the kitchen so I usually skip it). But ok, butterfly it. He then tried to convince me to get it with some pink, no! The food took over 30 mins to come out and it was just ok. The roasted asparagus tasted like they picked it fresh out of the ground and slapped in on the plate. The steak was butterflied, but still CHARRED on the edges, yuck. I ate in the center of the steak where it was cooked thoroughly but not burnt. My husband had the chicken and waffles, which he said was good. This is the only reason they got two stars. My advice: use a groupon or go somewhere else.

Hexx's menu looked appetizing   We were blown away with how good the food and service was.  We started our night with crispy brocollini.  My wife had the roasted tomato bisque a side of mushroom and a glass of Etude pinot noir by Carneros.  I had the 10 Oz NY steak with roasted asparagus and mashed potatoes.  Everything was cooked to perfection.  The bisque was full of flavor and just perfect on this brisk evening.   Mushroom were very tasty a great compliment to the bisque.   My NY Steak was full of flavor and just melted in my mouth.   Asparagus was great.  Mashed potatoes were light fluffy and delicious.   Desert was the perfect ending to the meal.  I had the signature carrot cake (Rafael suggestion) and my wife had the Aztec sundae. Carrot cake was moist cream cheese frosting fresh pineapple topping and a scoop of vanilla to add that creamy goodness to this decadent dish.   Aztec Cake is Venezuelan chocolate cake with white and spicy dark chocolate syrup   I only wish I had taken pictures.  Trust me come here and you won't be disappointed
The setting is perfect , food is outstanding and the staff always keeps a smile, and they make their own chocolate can't beat that. Can't wait to go back.

Hexx has the most magical atmosphere on the strip with patio seating facing the Bellagio water show. It's a little pricey, but the food is above average. The bacon appetizers and cinnamon waffle are my favorite. Sean was our server-- hands down, the best server we've ever had. He was personable, attentive, prompt, and kind. He made good recommendations and kept the ice tea refills coming. I would give Sean 5 stars. I gave Hexx only 4 stars because while the food is good, it isn't outstanding. I asked for my fries well done, and they were floppy, and my cranberry turkey sandwich was a tad dry, but still tasty. I look forward to our next visit. I do wish their? Groupon was still available- such a good deal!

Overpriced food, not very good quality.  Got 3 stars b/c service was great.  I had spaghetti carbonara.  Spaghetti was about 2 minutes from being al dente.  A little under cooked.  Should have been angel hair or thin spaghetti w/ carbonara.  It was the thick spaghetti.  Sauce was too thick.. should have been creamier.  Flavor was ok.  Not worth $26.  Husband got burger.  Fries were cold, server, Dominque (who might be the hottest girl on the planet lol) was very kind and brought us hot fries immediately.  Burger was good just not worth $23.  I can cook better dishes at home.

Well.... We came for the view of the Bellagio fountains, heard the food was ok but not spectacular for the price. I had the ceviche and a side of mushroom risotto. Both were delicious. Domaine Ott rose is not common in a restaurant so that was most enjoyable while watching the fountains dance! He had the surf and turf sliders. Interesting, but not recommended. What did detract though was the live band at the Alexas bar right next door competing with the music and the ambience at Hexx! No bueno! I'd suggest sitting outside on the patio when the weather is good and watching The Fountains having an appetizer and a glass of wine and calling it a day.

Excellent dining experience. Wait staff was great - thanks Johnny. 
Flavours were wonderfully complex and presentation of the food was very pleasing to the eye. 
We will be back.

This was our first night in Vegas and the first restaurant we had dinner at. It set the bar high!  We had six and were seated in less than 10 minutes. We had the kids with one of them being picky. They accommodated us easily. The service was very good and the food was excellent. I got the lobster gnocchi and it was delicious. All the dishes looked great. The dessert was awesome, a peanut butter and chocolate mouse with wine jelly and candies peanuts on top!  It was a lot and it was great. The kids got 15% off at the candy store (attached) with our receipt.  

The prices were good for the quality. I didn't think much about it then. It as we continue to eat out in Las Vegas it was actually a good value for good quality. 

Would definitely go again and even my 13 said he would go often.
Decent food but quality doesn't match pricing. Good service & atmosphere - quiet, comfortable, outdoor seating & view of Bellagio fountain show (if you're into that). Limit menu given food quality.

This is hands down my favorite spot for brunch in Las Vegas. We came here today and Sean was amazing! Attentive, friendly and expeditious with our food and drink orders. The bottomless mimosas are fantastic and the location in front of the Bellagio fountains can't be beat.

This place has a great location, AMAZING service and even better food. Our server, Alexia, was not only a hospitible and personable server but a great representative of Las Vegas. I had the Hexx burger and it was delicious; very flavorful! I will be coming back before the end of my trip and highly reccommend this place to everyone else looking for excellent service and food!

This place was very nice but the food taste freezer food, you can taste and smells the refrigerator form the food specially hamburgers. I recommend do not order foods, there are many more restaurants in vegas to go.

Such a great place for brunch! Had to wait a while for a table but we had a large group and it was a Sunday.  The food was quality and very tasty, definitely worth the wait! Our server Tracee was the best! So enthusiastic and attentive!  Overall can't go wrong with this place!
Went here for dessert got red velvet and peanut butter cheesecake all delicious but still overpriced

Great restaurant! Had the best service and a great brunch.  Sean and Patrick were so attentive to our party.  Most definitely would recommend Hexx Resturant for the food and service.  The french toast along with the chicken and waffle went perfectly with the bourbon syrup.  The restaurant had plenty of seating and our wait with reservation took no time.

Review is for dessert only. We had a good solid French dinner at Mon Ami Gabi next door and wanted to have dessert here because of all of the single origin chocolate hype. We ordered the Ecuadorian Brownie with Coffee ice cream and Chocolate silk pie. 

Brownie - texture was crumbly and not the melt-in-your mouth texture we were hoping for. Coffee ice cream texture was fine but it needed more coffee flavor.

Chocolate silk pie - it was a tarte with a thin layer of chocolate mousse in a thick graham cracker crust and a large mound of whipped cream on top. The chocolate mousse lacked strong chocolate flavor and once diluted with the whipped cream, was not strong enough to stand up against the strong graham cracker taste from the thick crust. 

Disappointing considering this restaurant was supposed to specialize in chocolate.

Wow!!! My husband and I arrived right on time for our reservation and seated immediately on a busy Saturday afternoon! So excited! Great vibe! Pictures don't do it justice! We had Rafael on the patio and he treated my husband like the King that he is. We went for brunch and even when we had only a sip of our bottomless mimosas finished, Rafael would top us off. He brought us 2 cake pops with a candle for my husband's birthday. And, great food btw!
just went there on Sunday 11- 27-16. our waitress Tracee was awesome. My wife Debbie tried the Johnny Cakes and they were amazing. We will defiantly be going back.

We went are there for breakfast on our last day in Las Vegas.  The atmosphere was nice, food was ok, nothing super spectacular. I liked the bottomless mimosas for $24 as that is a steal if you have two or more glasses;
 in Las Vegas as all drinks are $12-$20 per cocktail! Our breakfast for two with one bottomless mimosa and one Bloody Mary came to $90! You are definitely paying more

My wife and I are back in Vegas for one night, and we couldn't leave without stoping by our favorite place in Vegas Hexx kitchen + bar. We both ordered our favorite dishes and of course it tasted like haven. Our waiter Rafael was very gracious and kind, and they were nice enough to give us a complementary gifts when they found out we drove from Orange County CA. I recommend this place to everyone to try.

it is in a great location right on the street across from the Bellagio fountains, they've really improved their cuisine over the last couple of years since the opening.  tremendous food in one of the most prime spots in the country, killer wine list and cocktail program..  in addition to having a really deep, interesting menu, they happen to have my favorite dark chocolate in the entire country at the candy shop next door.  they make the amazing single origin chocolate right there from scratch!

Came to Hexx with a large party for brunch. Not only were we discriminated against for being a younger crowd, but the "bottomless" mimosas only afforded everyone 4 drinks. Really? After ordering food and drinks, is that the best service you can offer for the biggest group (most expensive check) at the time?  As Vegas locals, we thought we should check out a renowned Strip location but it was clearly a mistake. If you're looking for a fun brunch experience do not come to this restaurant. Someone rated this as, "Bottomless will keep your glasses full." It was more like our glasses were empty for 80% of our stay. 
LUCKILY, the manager (Hillary) assured that our party is just as important as all the other customers and became more attentive to our table.

Great food with a great outdoor atmosphere. Our waiter Rafael was on point from start to finish. Definitely worth at least going once for the great service and fun drinks. However, just like everything else in Vegas be ready to pay for it. 
Overall not as expensive as other not so yummy places tho. One order of chilaquiles, brioche French toast, reg pancakes, chicken and waffles, French dip sandwich and a pepperoni pizza came to almost $200.00. Yes that also includes two root beers, a chocolate "hexx" drink and one of their $36.00 drinks with a dry ice show.

I like the calm and serene decoration at 3am. But we did not get a server for a few minutes. Not even to offer water. Not even to say a quick hello and be back to serve us. When we finally decided to leave, as we pass the host counter, they bid us a good night. We simple said 'we did not get served' in response.  And the host said 'oh, shit!'
Traycee and Ceecee were INCREDIBLE. They made the experience amazing and I can't wait to come back here the next time I'm in Vegas!!! Impeccable service!!!
If you're in Vegas you have to get Brunch at Hexx!Be sure to ask for Sean and Patrick. They are the absolute best in town. I will definitely be back and  for them. They are the best in Vegas!

I enjoyed the experience and the food of this place except the very end. We got our ticket and there was a CNF charge next to our bill and we asked the waiter what it was and she said it was a charge for being on the strip and immediately called over the manager to explain. We found this behavior really odd. Once the manager came to our table he said he would discount one of our food items. Our question Was what was CNF charge? We didn't expect a discount BUT we realized they charged us a fee for something that was not disclosed anywhere on the menu or advertised as such. Everything was great except the sketchiness of this charge. Weird business going on here.

This was our first time visiting this restaurant. We sat on the patio and even though it was a hot summer day, the misters made it comfortable. Sean and his assistant Stephanie were a great team! They were very attentive and provided great service! Would definitely come back again.

We were staying in the Paris hotel, where HEXX is located, but we didn't go just because of conveniece - we went for the amazing reviews we had heard. We had brunch and the food was delicious! Amazing service, too. Sean was our server and was so great and so nice! Would definitely recommend if you find yourself hungry and on the strip! They have the best outdoor seating - you're right on the strip but still get that classy atmosphere that HEXX offers. Alternatively, later into the night, they have greats bands playing too!

NOTE: This place used to be called the Sugar factory and the waiter said the owner changed the name and interior design in February.  The menu looked different too, but they still have the candy shop.  

Sat here for 6 hours Saturday morning with a huge group of hung over friends.  We probably wouldn't have stayed so long, but they put us on a couch type booth with pillows and it was SO comfortable.  

Portions are HUGE.  Like to big for one person.  

The all you can drink Mimosa's are great.  

Service was little bit slow, but then again we were there for six hours.....all in all.  I would come here again.

The staff here is amazing ! I always get great service.  Kristal is awesome ! She is one of the reasons why ill keep going back !

She made me feel at home! i recommend her!

This restaurant sits right on the strip. When I first walk in the people were nice and accommodating. I went a night and wanted to sit outside so I could people watch and watch the fountains at Bellagio. The food, drinks, service and atmosphere was first class. The prices are a lil high but hey its vegas. I definitely recommend. The desserts looked great but I didn't have any room left to try them.

I really wanna give this place 1 or 2 stars but they may not actually deserve it... but we bought two steaks, their most expensive ones, and they were terrible. Really bad in every way a premium steakhouse can be. Everything else was perfect, service, cocktails, sides... perfect. But all that is supposed to set up the main attraction, right? Over cooked, tasteless, and dry steaks, both the NY Strip and the Filet Mignon. If pressed, go with the Filet, but these are not quality cuts, properly aged, properly seasoned, or properly cooked. Why ask for a temperature if it's not coming out that way. Sure, they offered to replace it, but that sets the timing off for the meal. Maybe it's my fault as their are more expensive steakhouses in this property and all the adjacent ones, but $40 should still buy a decent steak, even in Vegas. The cocktails were great, both the Desert Smash and the custom Gin and Tonic. Also, the spinach dip, House made pita they substituted at our request, the mashed potatoes and roasted cauliflower were awesome and better than expected. Just don't get the steak.
Very good lobster roll n smothered fries were delicious!! Andrea was a very good server!!

Good food, sat at the outdoor table and enjoyed the views.
We had the spinach dip, plain salad and Salmon.

The food , ambiance and service is too notch . Mike our server , from Wisconsin is amazingly very attentive and give us guide to a good portions . The options are very generous . Finding a good breakfast place in Las Vegas strip is almost close to impossible . Will definitely comeback and beside this is my second time here and never failed us

This place is amazing. The service JJ provided was excellent. I spent a great time with my family here I recommend it if you haven't been here before. The French toast is amazing for anyone who has a sweet tooth. And bottomless is a must here in Sin City (:
Mediocre pizza and bland customer service even though this place is open all night it is not working going to!!!

Ambiance is great facing the dancing fountain at Bellagio hotel. We ordered medium rare steak but they serve us the well done and the beef was hard and chewy. The good thing was they have offered us another one and this time it's perfect. Thanks to our server Teddy!!

Food at brunch is awesome . Our waitress is AMAZING! When you come ask to be seated in Melissa section. She is absolutely the best. She is very professionally and has the best customer service. Bottomless mimosas at brunch!  Very worthwhile for the price!

I came here for my birthday brunch and had a great experience! They've completely renovated the space, it doesn't look anything like the restaurant that was there before. Great food, happy and kind employees and a really great atmosphere. They accommodated my group of 15 and checked up on us consistently, not to mention their prices are fair. The location of the restaurant is great as well-there's an open patio that you can look out on to see the Strip. Will definitely be returning.

The food service took a very long time, but the waiter and manager gave such great service and were very apologetic. The food and atmosphere is amazing. (We were there Christmas Eve so it's possible the kitchen was too slammed) although we waited a long time I would still recommend this restaurant to anyone.
Didn't wait long to be seated. The food was great mimosas were strong. Service could have been better hence the 4 stars. Sat outside and got front row seats to the strip entertainment.

Atmosphere: a fun, young, and hip (does that negate everything I just said?) vibe. 

Breakfast: I am not a fan of potatoes, but these roasted and pan-seared fingerlings were done well- crisp, buttery, and sprinkled with sea salt. The omelet was good. Want a hearty start? I loved the multigrain porridge, loaded with barley, farro, oats, and a variety of dried fruits and nuts. 

Sweets: the candy shop offers free chocolate tastings at the bar that faces the chocolate-making room. You can try 6 darks or 6 milks. Everyone is so friendly and well-trained that I bet they would gladly offer all of the samples. Same with the ice cream! Ahhh, heaven. They use their own chocolate in the different chocolate ice creams offered. Feeling like going all in? Make it an ice cream sandwich, which can be make vegan with the sorbet or gluten-free with the GF chocolate chip cookies.

We had a wonderful experience! Great spot for brunch and people watching. Food was fantastic. We ordered the French dip which was amazing. Bottomless mimosa was a great addition. Our server Brittany was fantastic. We will be back next time in Vegas!

Probably the fanciest place i went to during my weekend stay for edc. I was craving some chicken and waffles and some southern food. The dining area was huge and they accommodate for outside and inside seating. The food was great and service was top notch. I recommend the chicken and waffles and the jambalaya soooo goood

Tracee! Wth shes amazing! This place was my best experience in Vegas dining. Brunch. So fun! 
I trust this company hiring and letting employees express and be who they are. We are multi-cultural,  and felt so comfortable and ready for a fun day after eating here. Thanks Hexx !

Saw the reviews of this place and decided to try it for breakfast. We had reservations and we were seated right away. They are part of Caesar's and if you are Platinum or above you can get priority seating. The place was pretty crowded and we sat inside but close to the windows. My wife ordered the corn beef hash which was scratch made but didn't really taste that great. We always like trying everyone's corn beef hash but this one was just ok. I had the French toast with fruit. It looked great but the taste was just like that of Ihop. Oh well we probably won't come here again . Since there are so many choices for breakfast in Vegas we will be going some where else. The food wasn't anything to write home about. Don't get me wrong it was ok but we are foodies and want somewhere that is yummy.

Had the halibut over risotto. It was delicious! Wife and I shared the Bloody Mary that ended up being an appetizer that filled us. We took most of dinner back to room for a late night snack. Wait staff was helpful and with it being 100F out we sat inside.
Typical Las Vegas: overpriced and pretentious, yet mediocre. AND THEY CHARGE A CNF FEE OF 4.6%. Breakfast for 2 $50.00.
Food and atmosphere was great! Only thing I wished was that they went lighter on the salad dressing. Overpowered the dish. Otherwise great and speedy service.

First time here!!! The hostess are stuck up and feel entitles. They didn't greet us when we walked in and they were rude! Ordered a potion drink Purple Haze!!! Soooo good!!!! For food I ordered the chilaquiles!! First time eating them and they were delish!!!!!!  Our waitress, Claire was amazing and very friendly! All other employees were very friendly. Minus the stuck up hostesses!! They would get 5 starts if they weren't so damn rude!
Cece definitely came through with the service. Our lunch with bottomless mimosas was awesome
Great service, great food and absolutely stunning view if you get a chance to sit out on the patio. Great for family or romantic brunch dates as well.
Great View of the fountains at the Bellagio! Affordable and delicious.
Everything here is great - you can't go wrong with anything you order. Melissa is the best - Try to get seated in her section!. I hope they open a Hexx in LA soon...

This is the place to go for a nice dinner, with fabulous service, on the strip. Our server was Kevin, aka Chocolate Thunder!!! I have never had such an attentive, personable server at any restaurant before!!! When my friend and I were deciding what to get to drink, he immediately recommended the favorite HEXX Potion. It was definitely a favorite. Upon being seated, he also immediately noticed that I had an injured arm and tried to make light of my unfortunate situation, which was so appreciated after a week of, "I'm so sorry" or "that sucks". He was great. We ordered the calamari as an appetizer. UH-MAZING. He immediately noticed from a distance I was struggling using my left hand (I'm right handed). He strolled right over and assisted in putting a portion of the calamari on my small plate. When I thought he couldn't get any better... I ordered the rib eye, not thinking about having to cut the steak.... he sees that the food was brought to the table and immediately walks over and begins to cut my streak for me!!! Talk about service. I was so impressed, I will only come back to be put in his section!!! Thank you, Kevin, for the best dinner!!!!!

I really loved this place! Super convenient location in the middle of the strip. They were pretty busy and said if we want a table it's a 25 minute wait but if we were on with the tables at the bar we could sit right away. 

Their menu had a nice variety. I ordered their nachos and their Cesar salad which were both phenomenal. The service was good just a little slow because of how busy it was. 

Overall if you're looking for something light and refreshing to eat this is the place! Will definitely come back when I'm in town.

I came here around 2pm for a really late lunch. My party and I decided to come here because the lines at Bacchanal and Le Village were like 

Out of desperation, a long drive, and disappointing lines we came here. I liked the ambiance as well as the interior of the restaurant. Well trained servers and great service. 

The food was very average. We ordered a meat omelette, a margarita pizza, and a hex burger. Very original tasting and very average. Portions weren't bad but I wasn't full. Nothing special. Kind of disappointed. I think I would come here again but would be my last choice.

We used to love this place... before hostess, the blonde one, called my husband an "ASSHOLE"... Brought parents here for dinner and asked for table outside. Waited for 15 minutes to be seated while there were plenty of tables. When my spouse asked , how long more to wait, she didn't find anything to tell, but "CHILL OUT"... Absolutely inappropriate behavior. Never again!

This space is so decidedly more tasteful and mature than the former sugar factory in that spot. I had the lobster roll and my dad had the French dip, I believe. The server was polite and expedient. I enjoyed the chocolate tasting next door and especially liked the Peet's coffee bar (as a former Bay Area resident). Their chai is delightful.

Very impressed with both food and service!

My date and I were at Hexx for an event, and were able to sample a beautiful assortment of small tastes and cocktails.

Honestly, there wasn't a thing that I didn't love.
Real standouts were 

Wagyu Beef "Burger"
Shrimp Ceviche
& Braised Short Rib.

I don't know if the Tempura Shrimp that we were served is on the regular menu; but dear God, I could live on that. I don't know how they did it, but it has spoiled me for all other tempura. I will return to eat a trough full of it soon. 

The staff knocked it out of the park!
Serving a very large group of picky people can be a nightmare, I'm sure. But each server that I 
encountered was fun, friendly, and seemed honestly happy to be there (and trust me, this is not always the case on The Strip). 

I'm sure you'll be made welcome in whatever you happen to be wearing (mostly) - but the atmosphere is nice-casual - leaning more toward the 'nice' at night. Street clothes are fine during the day, but you'll fit in wearing sharp goin-out duds at dinner time. Make Las Vegas Classy Again.

Congratulations, All -- Well Done!
I look forward to returning for a sit-down experience with my Trough-O-Shrimp soon.
Hands down one of the best places to have an awesome late breakfast. Our servers Julia and Taylor have been great and made it an excellent experience. Will come later for drinks and food.

What a pleasant experience here.

From the hip, clean, and 'natural' interior design to the quick wait staff and absolutely delicious food- I'll definitely be coming back!

My wife, who's gluten intolerant, got the Hexx Benedict which was just scrumptious! The typical poached eggs and sauce were placed on top of a bed of stacked cut potatoes. (It was so delicious we're going to try and recreate it at home!) I got the eggs and bacon- which is typically a simple plate, but they managed to make it both complex in flavor and presence.

Also, I can imagine this place gets pretty packed so I'd recommend either going early in the AM or making a reservation- they also have bottomless mimosas for $23, so in theory you could spend hours here!

Sean 007 really bumped my experience at Hexx from a 4 to a 5 star experience. The endless mimosas and poutine fries were worth the visit, but Sean really went above and beyond to make us comfortable and happy in our 7-person group! Thanks to Hexx and Sean!

Amazing place! Our server David was wonderful! I love the management and the food was excellent! Must stop for families, date night, and any other time!!!! Love love love love love this place! 100% recommend!

Love it here!! It was awesome, great food. Bottomless mimosas and a great view of the strip and the fountains at the Bellagio. But best of all was our server, Tracee she was so awesome, my mimosa was never empty! :) thanks Tracee we will definitely be back!!
Live jazz band on the weekends is such an awesome touch to the experience here. The ribeye was really good for the price.
Sean are waiter is on point with the bottomless mimosa's. Ask for Sean if you eat here!!

Sugar Factory vs HEXX
Spinning lollipops vs Chocolate 

Locals and avid Vegas tourists understand what I'm saying. No lies, I loved the Sugar Factory. Everything from the ambiance, the food and the service. The concept of having a candy shop attached was cool. The spinning lollipops were fun but now very 3 years ago.

Now for Hexx, I really love their concept and the changes they made by opening up one side. Enjoying some sun, people watching and enjoying the Bellagio fountains is just part of The Strip. We were seated on the patio, so we could enjoy all three sports on the Strip.

We ordered the bacon and it was super crispyn. thought it good, but I'm not a fan of overcooked anything, so I guess it's a matter of taste. For my meal, I ordered the chicken and waffles. The waffle was great but I found the chicken to be bland and dry. Chicken breast can dry pretty fast and that's what happened. I don't think I will order it again.

After brunch, my daughter and I shared the hot chocolate and wow it was good. I'm big on hot chocolate... Angelina's in Paris... Max Brenner... I like it a lot. HEXX has amazing hot chocolate, very rich and a good consistently. 

The service was amazing. We weren't rushed and they were all very friendly.

When done, head next door to pick up some chocolates. Don't expect it to be the packaged cheap stuff you pick up at a grocery store. They serve chocolate here, it's the real deal. 

I love the chocolate here. I was never big on the spinning lollipops anyhow. :)

Tracee was amazing!! Such a fun environment and kept all 8 of the bottomless mimosas full for the whole two hours we were there! She made our friends birthday brunch so much fun and her energy never stopped. The food was excellent, I definitely recommend the carrot cake pancakes!!

An awesome location should not allow a restaurant to offer such mediocrity in its food and drinks.  The sangria was over-sugared and under-boozed. The crispy broccolini was drenched in a syrupy sweet citrus glaze like orange chicken at a bad Chinese restaurant and the florets were not just crispy, they were fried into sand-textured oblivion.  The sausage pizza was okay, but for the price I would expect higher-quality sausage.  We also shared a short rib for an entree, and it was overcooked and uninspired.  We wanted a bottle of wine to wash down our disappointment, and the waiter kindly brought us tastes of three reds also served by the glass.  None was quaffable.  Do yourself a favor and choose another restaurant.
Tracee & Patrick are the most amazing pair of servers we HAVE EVER had!!!  So much props to them for making our brunch extra special!!!!!

IT'S NOT THE SUGAR FACTORY ANYMORE!!! 
This place is horrible. Overpriced food and horrible customer service. This place just opened, but it's so not worth the money. It's a wannabe 5 star restaurant. Just trying to warn you guys to save your money. Unless you wanna pay $50 for a hamburger.

We stopped in around 2:30 pm for Sangrias. Pitchers were on special so we ordered one and an appetizer of Spinach Dip. All was delicious! We sat at the bar and Jeff took great care of us. He was kind, quick and full of useful information. The dinner menu looked great!

This restaurant is in front of the Paris Casino and has a great ambiance.  It is very updated and is very open.  They have outdoor and indoor seating, but the way they have the restaurant set up it has the feel of covered outdoor seating.

The wait staff were cordial but very busy and therefore we had to wait a long time for everything (like coffee refills :-\ ).

We had the corned beef hash (a very small portion), the Farm Fresh Eggs with a side of bacon, and coffee.  Although the portion was small the corned beef was good, and so were the farm fresh eggs and bacon.  I think the coffee was the best part of the meal, but like I said we had to wait for it. 

 If you do not want to wait, they do take reservations, which we recommend.  Overall, although this wasn't our best experience we would still recommend it for those that are already close by.
Great view. Service was good. Awesome spot for a date night and you can head to the beer garden after for drinks. We had to seafood tower as well and a salad and a side of fries and we where stuffed!

Great service and cool location right outside Paris Casino... which you will pay for!  We'd just gotten out of a show nearby and restaurants start closing in droves after 10:30 pm even in Sin City.  HEXX is one of those places that run 24/7 and isn't your usual drab, out-dated caf√©.  

The staff are young, good-looking and smile even when you don't know what you're talking about.  My friend decided to order two shots, but since he's diabetic and rarely drinks he didn't know much about them.  The bartender was left to guess and what we got wasn't what he expected and wasn't drinkable.  They didn't charge for them, but I still felt bad.  The Hypnotizing Strawberry was awesome if kind of weak in the booze department and it cost $15.  That's high for any bar!  The cool looking Hexx potions (I actually think they must be pitchers to share) that they decorate with dry ice effects were over $30 each!

We ordered a Margherita Pizza and Spaghetti with Meatballs.  I thought the pizza was okay but I've had better.  The pasta, on the other hand, was great!  Three juicy, flavorful meatballs and a big pile of al dente spaghetti soaked in a wonderful tomato sauce coated with Parmesan and dried garlic.  Was it worth over $22?  Jury is still out on that one, but chances are we wouldn't return here even for that dish unless we were close by and thin on choices like this last time.  Service, ambience and food are pretty on point but just so very very pricey!  I'd gladly pay more for steak or seafood, but for pasta and a vegetarian pizza?  There are plenty of other places demanding high prices for food for now so we'll keep looking for that perfect place...

Fun fun place,  the potion drinks are the best !! Great for social media pics and they taste great. The Hexx Benedict tasted perfect with scalloped potatoes instead of the traditional English muffin,  great twist and now that's my favorite style for Benedict!

Literally everything we ordered was very flavorful. Their menu may not have exotic options but I was very satisfied with the quality of each plate. On top of that, service was phenomenal. Our waitress would come and check up on us and she would switch out our plates as well in between entrees. Very unexpected considering this wasn't a white tablecloth restaurant.

Beautiful place to sit and have brunch! Love the secure of this place. I noticed on the way to the restroom they have little private booths around the Corner from the bar area.  If you love to eat and people watch this was the place for it! 

Food was good and portions were pretty large. 
Service was a little slow that morning which she apologized for since we were on a time frame.

Nice ambience and outdoor seating right on the strip just outside of Paris and across from Bellagio. The food was good. Service was ok. Server got the burger wrong for my 10 year old and left him sitting there for at least 15 - 20 minutes watching us eat our meal. They could've at least left him the fries to munch on while they make the right burger. We ended up cancelling the burger they were still making and going somewhere else to grab him something quick to eat since he was starving. We only had the salmon, short rib, and a glass of wine and the bill came out to almost $90. We left still hungry. It's never good when you leave a nice restaurant still hungry after paying a Benjamin for it.

Came here for breakfast on a Monday and it is seriously one of the BEST BREAKFASTS I've ever had. The food looked and tasted great. We will definitely be coming back when we're in Vegas. The server was also super nice. The only downside is it's somewhat pricey, but it's worth a try.

The wait staff was quick and very attentive. The food portions were huge! The drinks were tasty and amazing! My party of 4 sat outside and watched the Bellagio fountain show a few times. I also used a Groupon, this was an amazing meal and restaurant! I would go again without hesitation!
We had a great meal but the service was the highlight. Tracee was our person. Exceptional service with a smile

This was a fun spot for our late night dinner upon arriving at the Paris Hotel. There was no wait and we were able to sit outside. Great view of the Bellagio fountains. The food was good, though we both just got burgers because we were so tired from travel. We shared one of the big cocktails with dry ice, which was fun and very easy to drink. Our waitress was lovely! Excellent service.

Disappointed that my friend and I had to send our broccolini back because it tasted like a salt lick. Our replacement was tasty and fresh. The pizza was awesome and our "bake sale" sundae was a feast for our eyes and stomach.
The service left a lot to be desired though as our waitress all but ignored us until it was time to bring the bill. For the price of the meal, service was a disappointment and i would never eat here again.
Note: Ask what the significance of the monkey paintings are but do it BEFORE you order. Lol

Fun Tracee - that's all you need to know! We had an exceptional time and ordered the pancakes and breakfast croissant. The food was great, but the service was amazing! She was attentive, sweet, & of course a ton of fun. My fianc√© and I will definitely be back!

This is our second time this week to come to hexx because it's so dang good; again we love tracee but didn't have her as a waitress (heart broke a little) but she still made sure to come by and see us as well as made sure we are okay! Hexx should be named tracee's but it's all good. Best food, best drinks, best everything #tracee

Pros: People watching patio, good service
Cons: A little bit over priced menu items. Not all that impressive. 
Maybe it's because of the amount of people who was around, it was a bit difficult to get seated.  Kudos to the servers tho.. they are all nice and hot :)

Came here without a reservation and was able to get sat right away in the patio, which was amazing. Ordered one of their portions, which are a bit pricey at $36 but are meant to share and is worth the hype. Got the spinach dip as an app and the jambalaya for dinner. The jambalaya was spicy (server warned me), but oh so good!! They also gave us a piece of chocolate after our meal from their store next store. This made us go next door and do the chocolate tasting and I bought a few bars. So good!! I am still dreaming about that chocolate...

Would love to go back for breakfast or brunch.

I miss sugar factory. But Hexx has similar items. I wasn't keen on it at first but it definitely has grown on me. 
The waiters we have had we're really great!  Very on top of everything with drinks and food.  The food is really good. We did brunch and dinner. Brunch is by far my favorite. Not a huge menu but it's great. Bottomless mimosas. Can't go wrong. They kept them coming!!  
You can make reservations if you'd like but it's not as crazy busy during the cooler months. And you can still choose to sit outside if you'd like with patio heaters out there. 
Definitely worth checking it out. 
We always make a stop every trip.

The manager should aware of the unprofessional hospitality caused by its waters. I got extremely annoyed by my two waiters, who constantly talked while we are eating. Don't put your hand on the shoulder of your client!

We showed up at 6:30.. no hostess in sight, so we sat ourselves on one of the many empty tables on the patio. We were approached that we did not check in, so a manager came and asked if we could check in and sit down.  There wasn't anyone waiting so I'm not sure why they actually asked us to go check in to go sit down where we were so we left. Assumably this is the reason why it's half empty where everywhere else in the vicinity with a patio is full.

This place was great! The food was delicious, and the Bloody Mary really hit the spot. They serve them in small pitchers. The best part of our visit was the service. We were told we had to wait, which is expected on a morning in Vegas but the wait ended up being much shorter than anticipated. Our server (I wish I remembered his name!) was AWESOME! Seriously! He was fun, suggested food for us, and just took great care of us. He saw me scraping sauce off of my sandwich and insisted they make a new one, which I declined. Well he insisted, and the sandwich came out in record time. He even took some money off of our bill. He was a tall and bulky African American man. If you are a manager reading this, that guy is the best! I'll definitely be back when I'm in Vegas again later this year.
Tracee killing the mimosa game. Great food and greater service. Will definitely come back

Had HEXX during a road trip and it was sub par. Had the 'smothered fries' which had a fair taste. It's fine for what it is, but way over priced. 

My friend and I sat overlooking the street which was fun. If you like people watching, that's probably where you want to sit!
jessica a is the bomb and this restaurant rocks!!!!!! great food great drinks great views
We went for my birthday brunch. It was "so-so" and the drinks were okay. I truly think some places off the strip are better !
Amazing food! Amazing Service!! Jessica was absolutely great!! Loved the overlooked bacon and the desserts are to die for!!!

Had an awesome server. Thanks, Brandon! If you're dining out late when it isn't too hot, sit outside. The people watching opportunities are great.  And you have a pretty sweet view of the street and lights.
Rachel is the best! She took care of us from the second we sat down. I'll be back every weekend to see her.

This place is awesome in terms of location-- it's located right along the strip with a full on view of the Bellagio Fountain. However, that's pretty much the extent of it for me. The prices, as expected, were high, and it blew my mind that the burgers and steaks didn't come with sides. I ordered the New York steak, but was handed a prime rib instead. I didn't feel like complaining, so I just accepted it with a smile. However, the first bite was RIDICULOUSLY salty. Like, 5-days-worth-of-sodium-in-that-single-bite salty. My manager and I (who also ordered a steak) both sent our steaks back because this girl had size zero slacks to fit into the next day, and I couldn't afford any unnecessary bloating.

Our steaks came back *much* better in terms of seasoning. Definitely more edible, which is good! Unfortunately, the steak was very fatty (don't necessarily blame the restaurant for this, as I know most prime ribs are), and extremely greasy. I wish I could have dabbed it with a napkin but I didn't want my coworkers to judge me! The small side of balsamic glazed onions were extremely greasy as well; I'm sure they drench their food in oil while cooking. Some people love that, but I, however, am not a fan.

We also ordered a dessert platter, and while good, it wasn't super memorable. Service was good, as our waiter was very personable and our food came our within a reasonable amount of time.

If I were to come back to Vegas, I don't think I'd visit this place again. However, it is conveniently located on the strip, and is a good place if you don't mind a high price tag with slightly above average food.
Super awesome food and a great patio! Went here for brunch before the race and it was a great way to start the day!

BEWARE OF THE CNF CHARGE!!! This is a totally bogus charge the put on your bill and they say it's because of a law that states all restaurants that are opened 24 hours are required to have. That is completely not true and it's just an okay place anyways. Go to Giada's or Bouchon down the street for much better food.

Nice on the porch. Food was very well prepared. The colossal bloody Mary is one to share. Chick full of food and a good Spivey Mary. The chicken and waffles enough to share and the chicken was very moist. Got a breast and a thigh split. The farm fresh b-fast has the best potatoes and the eggs were done to perfection. Highly recommend. Keep in mind portions are such to be totally shareable. This will help with the$$.

It has been a while since the prior review. For some reason it did not post then (2017). This visit was again 3/2018) good.

While walking the strip we came upon this place by a promoter who recommended it for the happy hour. They had a two for one on selected specialty drinks $14, the watermelon mule was a refreshing beverage! The food was all so tasty and cooked to perfection. Its a great size restaurant and modern furniture. The bar is pretty big and dimly light, the main dinning area has a clear view of the strip and right across from the Bellagio Fountains. It's a nice spot for a dinner date with cheap prices for quality Vegas dinning. There are private hole in the wall spots with cushions. We love it and will definitely come back during our next visit.

Our waiter was super attentive and polite. The food was great! Everything that Brunch with the girls should be! Bottomless Mimosas and amazing food what more do you want! A definitely stop when in Vegas.

Friend had chicken and I had the pizza. Both were delicious, as one would hope of a restaurant prominently located on the strip. 

However, service was extremely slow at a time when server to diner ratio was very favorable. Seems they forgot us a couple times and kitchen must have been half asleep.

Also, server forgot that my drink was ordered on the rocks. Server said he would correct it and left. I slowly sipped my drink while he was gone, wondering what he was up to. When I was halfway through my drink, he finally came back with some ice which he then poured into my drink... what?

Anyways, food was great and prices were not bad for its location. I will give them the benefit of the doubt and that fourth star despite the slowness and questionable service.

Restaurant is better for brunch, which takes place 7 days a week, vs dinner. Dinner menu is over priced (pizzas are $20+), limited in variety and lacks cohesion. From what we sampled it was good but once again over priced. The short rib entree ($38) was the size of a Tomahawk steak with bone just as large. Although enough for two people they could serve a smaller portion and lower the price. Mac and cheese ($13) was bland and tasted like Kraft white cheddar straight from the box. Even the server agreed. White bean hummus ($10) was great but they give you so little pita bread youre stuck with half the jar remaining and no pita bread.  

One sticking point that will not see me returning or sending any of my friends is the fact you cant use the 20% off business card they give out and Opentable giftcard at the same time. One is to be treated like cash and the other is a discount offered by the restaurant. We could have split the check and created a hassle but its not worth it. Manager came by and snidely said 'you can use this 20% off next time.' They want your business but not bad enough to honor their own discounts.

Let me first say that back in the day The Sugar Factory was my favorite restaurant of all time, and this is a pleasant substitute. 

The vibe is casual, and the wait staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. The weird thing we noticed was we had a wait to be seated, and upon being seated we walked through a whole empty dining area. I dunno, but it worked out because we sat on the patio and the weather was beautiful. 

We ordered the garlic bread appetizer and I got The Hexx specialty drink. I'm a bit weeny when it comes to alcohol and asked if the bartender could make it so I wouldn't really taste the alcohol. They accommodated me very nicely and The Hexx tasted amazing. They offer many different drinks and wines, and like The Sugar Factory they had "Potions", which takes place of the Goblets. 

I ordered the chicken and it was delicious, the eggplant was also cooked perfectly and tasted sweet. I did order the French fries, and this is where they lost a star for me. We paid $10 for a basket of fries and they were stale and cold. I only ate about 5 of them, that was a disappointment but the other items we ordered were perfect. I'll let this slide, and who knows what the circumstance was. 

I definitely recommend this place, it is quite expensive but we had a pretty view and had a great dining experience.

My husband and I purchased a Groupon here just to try it out on our most recent trip to Vegas, LDW.

We got the gravy potatoes, which were amazing the guacamole, which were meh, and the spicy jambalaya, which were amazing! Overall, we will return as its 24/7, plus we got to sit outside for a nice view of the Bellagio fountains and ppl watch. If it weren't for our Groupon, I feel it is a little pricey for some of the items, but the items are big enough to share for at least 2 to 3 ppl, just something to consider, for the ones on a budget eating. 

I wanted to try their chicken & waffles, but decided we will be back and give that a try. I hear it's one of the popular items! Our server was also great and attentive, so A+ for the service.

Great place for breakfast, lunch, and late eats.

The service was too amazing! We were seated shortly after arriving, they expanded the bottomless mimosa for an extra hour. Our drinks were never less than half empty. Sean and Patrick are the best! If you go ask for them they'll treat you like royalty, at least that's how our group and I felt. Spinach dip was on point, hexx Benedict were absolutely amazing, Sean even recommended a croissant or muffin along with it. Fresh berries and their French toast were great. All around awesome place must check it out. But thanks to Sean and Patrick your amazing service warmed our hearts they were extremely accommodating!

We went for brunch and bottomless mimosas. We had a wonderful experience and were seated immediately due to our reservation. We got a table outside. The entire experience was beautiful and the food was delicious. Our waitress Natalie was wonderful- if you go I'd definitely recommend requesting her if possible. She was very kind and attentive and even helped give us recommendations on where to go while in town! Overall wonderful experience, thanks Natalie!!

They have bottomless mimosas here for $23. I found a new spot for day drinking if you're not going to the clubs. Food was great and service was even better. Thank you Tracee for being so attentive! Ask to sit in her section! #CancerPower

The perfect example of Las Vegas fine dining. Right on the strip with a GORGEOUS view of the world renown Bellagio fountain!

To top it all off, Chef Shay came to my table to see how everything was, which all I could do was look in her eyes with a lustful desire as I chowed down on my amazingly elaborate seafood platter.

The steaks are TO DIE FOR. No teeth? No problem. They fall apart in your mouth. I don't know what they did but I ate a piece of heaven that night.

Their desserts rival the artwork of Michelangelo and taste like a flavor bomb exploded in your mouth.

I can't recommend this place enough. If you have the desire to eat at the best all around experience in Las Vegas, go no further and good luck at getting a reservation!

As a Vegas local I was excited to try this place. Love the new decor and brand, absolutely amazing. The broccolini was on point and I had the chicken and waffles that were out of this world!  Chef Piekarski gave us a tour of the chocolate kitchen and what a great concept ... Bean to bar single origin chocolate. We had a chocolate tasting to end the night and needless to say, we found a new favorite strip spot!
Absolute amazing  food. best nrekky ive had in vegas a must visit restaurant. good vibes friendly staff and super nice food!

Food was seriously the most flavorless food I've ever eaten. I had to check to make sure I was even eating and i was eating eggs Benedict. Breakfast croissant had no egg, nor cheese. Just a sky high pile of ham.

Avoid at all cost.

Who knows maybe the dinner is better. AVOID THE BRUNCH.

Great bottomless Mimosa brunch on Sunday.  The food quality was fantastic, there were 6 of us and we all enjoyed our meals. Tracee, our waitress, made the meal even better with her prompt service and fun attitude.  It's our new, favorite breakfast spot in Vegas! Thanks Tracee.

We came here for my girlfriend's birthday lunch this afternoon and the food was amazing, the drinks were great! The service we got from our server Stephanie C. was fantastic can't wait to come back! 
Oh and we weren't going to order dessert until she mentioned the bourbon caramel drizzle on the 
panna cotta which was a great way to finish off the delicious meal!

My husband and I wanted somewhere to eat right on the Vegas strip that would be good quality. We stopped at the place and it didn't disappoint. We had a WONDERFUL waitress. I hate I can't remember name but she has curly hair. She made our experience great. It was like she was reading our kids. The food was really good. The chicken I added in my pasta was a little bland but over all the dish was great. We ordered white bean hummus as our appetizer and it was the best hummus I've ever had. For our dinner plates I ordered a pasta dish and added chicken and my husband ordered the other pasta dish that had bacon and he added shrimp. Our wonderful waitress put together a fantastic wine concoction for me after hearing what I liked and it was great! I had 2 glasses. We would definitely recommend and go back when we're in Vegas.

A  little pricey but great breakfast. I had the protein omelet. Full of flavor. Best breakfast I have had in Vegas. Sat outside and loved it. Would have rated 5 stars but they could not get the patio heaters to work.
Came here for Saturday Brunch love views of Bellagio across the street. Portions were big and this place went beyond my expectations. Luckily I had reservations and didn't have to wait.

Took a trip down to Las Vegas about 2 weeks ago and came across this place as we were looking for a breakfast/brunch spot. 

The atmosphere of this restaurant was extremely cleanly and nice. We were seated as soon as we walked in because the restaurant space is pretty large. 

The menu was very straight forward and there was quite a few delicious looking items. 

There were 4 of us and we tried the following items:

1. Corned Beef Hash 
- Portion was pretty small, however the dish itself was very flavorful. 

2. Gravlax Benedict 
- Wasn't the biggest fan of the English muffin because when it was brought out it was pretty soggy so it didn't have the right taste to it, however when removing the muffin, the rest of the ingredients were very fresh and tasty. 

3 . Chilaquiles
- Expected to get some crispy nachos, however there was a slight problem to food coming out soggy. So it seemed as if the nachos stood out for awhile and by the time they got to the table, they were no longer crispy. 

4. Candied Bacon 
- This was probably my favorite thing that I tried. Although the candied bacon wasn't extra crispy, the flavor was superb. Each bite was mouthwatering. 

5. Venezuelan Milk Chocolate Cheesecake 
- Definitely a very delicious cheesecake and the portion was HUGE! The caramel popcorn on the sides was the perfect touch! 

Overall a decent place to dine and another plus side to it is that it's open 24/7!!

Very Surprised how FANTASTIC the burger was!!!!
    
   I stopped in HEXX, to wait for my husband who was @ the UNLV vs Duke basketball game ~ had some time to kill, was hungry had seen picks in Paris of their burger, to cold to wait outside @ Beer Park, saw an open table in the bar and the rest is history!!!

   I kinda consider myself a burger addict or affecianado!!! Don't eat fast food burgers and consider Bachi Burger the burger to me measured against!!!! And the Hexx Burger stands up very solidly to Bachi. (In my opinion) 

    Not only does the burger look good ~ it's DEEEELISSSH. I don't know if it's the fully melted American cheese, the well done bacon or the chocolate bun.... YEAH! I know that sounds weird but it's different and not what you expect ~ but go Order, Look & EAT a HEXX burger you'll be very happy you did!!!

Raphael you were the best server! Thank you so much for serving us and being so entertaining, it made our Vegas experience that much better. The mimosas were 10/10 and the food was amazinggg! Definitely recommend HEXX and the philly cheese steak sandwich with their signature fries!

My wife and I dined at Hexx while we were visiting Las Vegas. We are so glad we did. We were greeted promptly by two very pleasant employees as soon as we walked through the door. 

We were shown to our table and very quickly our server, Sal, came to take our drink order. When he returned with our drinks he took our food order. We had the fried pork rinds as an appetizer. The were very delicious, especially with the Fresno peppers and the lime flavored oil. My wife and I both ordered hamburgers and we were both very pleased. We like our hamburgers rare and very often they are too overcooked for our tastes. These burgers were cooked to perfection. 

Hexx has great food, great service, and great ambience. Do yourself a favor and visit Hexx when you are in Las Vegas. You won't be disappointed.
Place is awesome. Food was great. Service top notch. I'm a little inebriated to comment further. Will continue later.

Everything was absolutely excellent. Kevin our server did a wonderful job. Even though he was extremely busy. We had the beet appetizer and it was delicious. I had thw king salmon and my husband had the fillet with mac and cheese and everything was perfect.

So we visited Hexx twice last weekend in Las Vegas.  Once for dinner and once for brunch.  It was excellent both times!  First, let's talk about the service.  Our servers both times were super friendly, attentive but not intrusive.  They both made the dining experience pleasurable.  For dinner we had the shrimp cocktail, filet, Mac and Cheese, and sangria.  The shrimp cocktail was not served like the classic dish.  It was presented on slate with carefully placed complimentary cocktail sauce.  The filet was cooked perfectly.  It had a nicely season crust on the outside which was a wonderful surprise.  The sangria was refreshing.  The Mac and Cheese was good but not great.  For brunch I had the yogurt and granola parfait.  Holy Cow!  It was huge and you did not need the honey that comes with it.  Eating it was pure heaven. They have bottomless mimosas and huge pitchers of Bloody Mary's too! The hash browns were awesome!  They were not shredded but small potatoes that were first seasoned and cooked in the oven, smashed to split them open, and then finished off in the deep fryer!  I've never had hash browns that were so good. Hexx was fabulous!  I highly recommend it.  Double bonus!!!  You have a perfect view of the fountain show at the Bellagio as well.  Enjoy!

Lobster salad for $19 and it is 3 spoonful of salad, this is a joke, also manager is a joke, he said lobster is expensive, I should have known, really??  Oh by the way, it is served without chips, which was on the menu.

Had lunch here and it was disappointing. Overpriced for what you get. Pepperoni pizza was too greasy and the classic burger did not come with any toppings (pickles, lettuce). For ~$20, I'd expect a really good pizza/burger. The entire family was not impressed. Will not be coming back.
Tracee was a wonderful server. She has a beautiful demeanor that brightened up our morning. The food was delicious!

This was our first visit to Hexx. The wait time to be seated was minimal. The food quality and taste was out of this world awesome. We enjoyed breakfast selections and as locals can't wait to return.
Thanks to the hostess Angie who was great and our server Fallyn was super.

HEXX is conveniently located in the Paris hotel with additional access to the strip. 

Went in for brunch and was not impressed by the food. I got the HEXX Benedict, without bacon, and I would not recommend it for those looking for a traditional Benedict fan. Instead of poached eggs on top of an English muffin, they are served over scalloped potatoes; making the overall texture of the dish soft. I ordered an extra side of toast to add some crunch to the texture and was happy I did. The rest of my party was content with their food, but not impressed with their dishes. 

Aside from the average food, the attentiveness if the servers is great. Also, it was my friend's birthday and they brought out complimentary cake pops which was very thoughtful of them. 

Overall, wouldn't return for brunch, but would give the restaurant another chance for dinner.

Very decent food. Ate a burger and fries. The burger doesn't come with lettuce or anything else. Just meat and bun for $20. Very under staffed. Took 30 minutes to get my check. I stood at the station for 20 minutes trying to pay. The server was doing his best; he was slammed. Granted it was about 3pm. I was going to try it for dinner but I'll find somewhere else.

My boyfriend took me here for my 24th birthday dinner. Sit outside! You'll have a great seat under the heat lamps to view the Bellagio fountain show. The food was great! We got the cheesy garlic bread, halibut and risotto, and the pasta carbonara. For the garlic bread, it wasn't suuuper garlic-y, but the cheesiness was so good! My boyfriend wouldn't stop raving about the risotto that came with the halibut. My pasta was delicious and filling. The crispy egg that came on top was unique and really added to the dish. They ended up bringing out cake pops for my dessert! We ordered the red velvet, but it didn't really taste like anything. Little strange, but it was very moist.
Ask for Tracee!! Great server and lots of fun! She is real tentitive and always kept he glasses full. Great food Also bottomless mimosas for $20 is a huge plus...

Adding to my review - the chive waffles with lox and creme fraiche was about as good as it gets for brunch! I had the best lunch at HEXX today! My only regret is that I was so hungry I forgot to take photos before I started eating!
The broccolini is always delicious - I want that recipe! But, today's salad, chips and dip and mushroom flatbread took it over the top.
I give Hexx a 5 Star on the amazing food and exceptional service of the fabulous woman with the blue hair! She invited me in and made me feel extremely welcome!

Beautiful view, excellent location, bellagio fountain on the hour. 
Mediocre food. Pizza was bad (soggy on the bottom). Ate half a slice and gave up. Service was nice though.

Went there last night and so pleasantly surprised. It used to be the Sugar Factory which was dreadful in every way. The service and food at HEXX was perfect. Had the steak tartare my favorite and the mashed potatoes were to die for! Plus they are open 24 hours and have patio seating to sit and people watch on the strip.
Stopped in today since it was newer. The place was nearly empty, but we were told it was a 10 minute wait. Ridiculous! Walked to one of the many nearby places to eat. No wait.

Was really excited about this place. The entrees were seasoned well. We got the HEXX Benedict, Chicken & Waffles and the Sticky Bun. Getting seated was a typical 25 minute wait. The employees were nice. The Benedict seems like a small entree but it's very filling and delicious. The chicken and waffles were fairly good. I was really looking forward to the sticky bun and it looked amazing BUT was extremely tough :( overall it was average and the view of the strip on the patio was a highlight. Will go back for chocolate at the store next door before I dine in to give it another try.

Thank you Tracee! Our waitress was a sweetheart with great suggestions for our brunch options! I had chilaquiles and mimosa. Wait time was not existent, we were lucky! The food and service was great and glad we came! She was so fun and had a great attitude!

This is the first place we went to when we got to Vegas. We were starving for breakfast and decided to them out. My husband and I shared the surf n turf sliders. They were short rib with lobster and slaw. I tried to fish out the lobster out of one  because I really didn't like it. My hubby at the rest. He said it was ok but not worth the $28 price tag. I left hungry and dissatisfied. I would not recommend this place.

Kevin is amazing and has an infectious laugh . Good food we are all full and heading over to the Bellagio for the water show before we escort the in laws back to the hotel.
Prime rib was huge ! 
Scallops were filling !
Halibut was tasty! 
Rib bone was really good melted in your mouth .
Kevin enjoys life ! Great guy!

Location is the best in Vegas. Right across the street from the Bellagio fountain, so you have a great view to the fountain show. 
Their food was okay. I think they have changed their menu recently and it seems to have less options. 
Staff is friendly.

Sean was our waiter and he was absolutely amazing. Our bottomless mimosas were never empty, and he always checked to make sure everything was okay. He is a super nice guy and told us some fun things to do in Vegas! The food was great too, but the customer service made it better! I highly recommend this restaurant and I would definitely ask for Sean! You will get the best service possible with him!

Service, food and drink is a solid 4. Being open 24 hours is an additional star. Its nice to sit and chill after a long day/night in Vegas. We had a party of 5 and showed up close to 12am. We were seated quickly and our server came around soon after. We ordered a couple of pizzas, other shared snacks and drinks. Out of the pizza the  Margherita was the best. We also ordered the jungle juice which is served in the pitcher. A bit pricey but it was fun to have.

After traveling that day into Vegas with a group of 6, we were eager to find something to eat but had no idea what we really wanted. We were staying at Planet Hollywood and decided to venture onto the strip to find something to eat. Paris was right next door, and I had read that Hexx was a great place to check out. After viewing the menu outside, we thought we'd give it a try.

Our waitress was awesome. She answered any questions we had with menu items and thoroughly went through the drink menu - as we were thirsty! She recommended a few items and let us take our time to order; this was around 5:15 pm on a Monday.

I ordered the chicken and waffles, opting to try something different at our first place to eat for the few days we were in Vegas. My husband got the Filet Mignon. Both were excellent. Others in our party got another meat, a couple pastas and the crab cakes. Everyone said that their meal was very good. One of our party ordered one of the pitcher drinks that had smoke when another drink was poured into it. I cannot remember the name, but it was cool to watch and was a good drink.

Overall, it was a great place to eat on our first night in Vegas. The service was great and the food was even better. They gave you chocolates with a little fortune when you receive the check. It was a dark chocolate, and although I prefer milk chocolate... it was still nice to try.

Got a Groupon for Hexx. Was excited to try it. Ordered the chicken blt. The chicken was the worst I've ever had. Took one bite and that's all I could stomach. It was a hard consistency and did not taste like chicken at all. The only reason I gave it two stars is because the service was good. The food was horrible!  Save your time and money.   Plenty of other good places to eat.

Amazing meals! Took the whole family, and everyone loved it! My kids went crazy for their chocolates!! Absolutely incredible! If you're in The Paris Hotel and Casino, definitely stop here and treat yourself!!!

Came here for brunch on Saturday at 1030a. Not too crowded; we sat on the patio which was wonderful. We got the sticky bun for an appetizer. It was ok; the bun itself had not a lot of flavor but with the toppings on top it was better. Chilaquiles breakfast was good but could've used more toppings and less chips. The quiche meal was delish, it was crustless which is something to note. Also the brioche French toast was yummy although a bit dry because it seemed a. It dry and overcooked. We all got the endless mimosas and our waitress kept it filled the whole time so that was awesome. Overall, great view of the street on the patio, decent food, slightly overpriced in my opinion.
Great breakfast selection, giant portions, we couldn't finish the delish chicken & waffles between us!

I've been wanting to go to this restaurant for a while and I'm glad I finally got to try it. This appetizers are delicious especially the spinach dip with the bagel chips. The mimosas are delicious! Our server was Sean and he took great care of us- us was very attentive, funny, and knowledgeable about the menu. Great job!

Great breakfast option on the strip and reasonably priced. I had the braised pork and hash that was accompanied with some very flavorful pico. Yum Yum!
Choose the bottomless mimosas for $20 and that was a great choice. The waitress kept them coming.

The patio view was nice.

Just "OK", I wasn't very impressed with the $20 burger, it was so so, definitely (in my book) overrated.  Wait Staff were pleasant, but slow.  Don't know about it, maybe my expectations were high, but left feeling disappointed.

We waited to be able to sit outside and I'm so glad we did! The fountain and people watching was great. As for the food - it was very unusually presented in some cases but it was *absolutely* delicious. The burrata tomato salad was unique and really good. It came in like a cracker pie crust looking thing (but was not sweet). It tied everything together really well. We both got the filet mignon and it was cooked to perfection. With this we shared a side (which was plenty) and the broccoli was crispy and tasty. The service was also great.

After visiting for happy hour, dessert, and brunch, I can confidently say that the food at Hexx is better than it needs to be for a Strip location with patio seating and an attached dessert/gift shop. Apparently the chef from Due Forni (a local gem) recently took over the kitchen and is responsible for many of the improvements.

For HH (20% off apps plus drink discounts), the Surf & Turf sliders and Flatbread Carpaccio were both solid flavor-wise but neither was quite what we expected. Menu makes no mention of the barbecue component of the short rib-lobster pairing but it somehow worked. Shout out to the amazing housemade kettle chips on the side. The flatbread flavors needed the mustard sauce to harmonize and seemed to be closer to a tartare than a carpaccio, but it got devoured, too.

 Brunch featured a swath of dishes from all over the menu, with the Prime Rib French Dip falling flat while others like the Hexx Benedict (featuring a base made of scalloped potatoes!), Chicken & Waffles (elevated by housemade pickles and bourbon-maple syrup),  and Carrot Cake Pancakes (a well-balanced sweet and savory combo) stood out as reasons to come back. The Twisted Sticky Bun was a little too sweet and a little too doughy for my personal preference but makes a great share dish, particularly if you don't opt for other sweets.
