Dessert is really where they shine, though! The S'Mores Semifreddo is a creative presentation  that combines all the classic flavors with an emphasis on the toasted marshmallow. The safe-sounding Peanut Butter Cheesecake also gets you a photogenic treat with spun sugar and candied peanuts, and tasted both super creamy and nicely nutty. 

Service varied on my visits, from our super-friendly brunch host to an absent-when-needed bartender. Reservation and seating policies seem inconsistent, with one hostess militantly insisting she couldn't seat my party til all were present while another graciously rushed us to our table five minutes after appointment time regardless that one guy was still stuck in the parking garage. Luckily the great food made up for the lackluster introduction for others in our group who had no previous experience here... but it should still be addressed.

Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day, and therefore I am ultra-critical when it comes to reviewing places that serve breakfast. 
Breakfast is easy, but that doesn't mean it's always good.
For some reason, finding good breakfast places on the strip (aside from buffets) is pretty difficult. Perhaps it's because people aren't typically awake in time?...
This was one of five places we found we wanted to try, and ended up being one of three places we actually enjoyed.
The service was great; our server was personable and easy-going, not too loud or pushy. He checked in frequently to ensure we were enjoying our meals.
I ordered the banana bread French toast, and let me just say that it is THE most delicious French toast I have ever had. The toast had the consistency of banana bread, but wasn't as dry. The flavors were SPECTACULAR. Caramel drizzle...and fresh berries! Wow, seriously the best.
My one issue with it was my own fault...I added the syrup they provided in a small bowl, and it definitely became inedible towards the end because of how sweet it was.
Whatever you do, don't use the syrup on this dish! It's perfect and sweet enough without it.

Great breakfast.  I had the eggs Benedict and it was amazing.   Very hip crowd and very open and bright.   Steven our server was especially nice and accommodating.   Chatted with us without rushing us like most servers too.  Super good energy Steven has.  My friends had the eggs and bacon and loved his English Muffin too.

The food at this place is ABSOLUTELY the best ever! We ordered the filet mignon (w/ peppercorn sauce), halibut, and two sides (the cauliflower and mashed potatoes). Everything was PERFECT!! It was all SO fresh and light and I would have put away two more servings if I could have (happily stuffed with the more than sufficient portion sizes). I'm still even dreaming about that cauliflower and the SAUCE... mmMM! So of course, after reading my rant over the divine food, you might be wondering to yourself "then why four stars?" WELL! Unfortunately, the front of the restaurant needs to get their shit together. With a reservation for two, we waited 25 minutes for indoor seating after being told 5 minutes by the hostess. One small party of three had been waiting 45 minutes (YES. 4. 5.) for indoor seating after ALSO being told the wait time was 5 minutes. When we were finally seated, we looked around the restaurant and it was half empty. It didn't make sense that they could not seat the small groups that were waiting. It was kind of frustrating actually, and the four hostesses appeared apathetic and fresh out of fucks. Just pushing everyone to the side and saying "it will be 5 minutes" and collecting us all for like 20-40 instead. WHO KNOWS! But seriously, despite the shit customer service at the hostess stand, the overall experience was worth it because of the food and serving staff (shout-out to Teddy who was an absolute hero of the night and HILARIOUS). Serving staff and the food made it AT LEAST four star worthy. So if you can get over the four 18 year old girls at the front who forget how to count or whatever was the issue, you won't be disappointed!! Make this a must stop, but don't take any shit from those girls at the front. SAY SOMETHING IF YOU'VE BEEN WAITIN They will forget you.

To the manager response: 
Hi!! We had a reservation for two at 9 on May 29, 2018. I appreciate your response!!
Food is terrible and overpriced McDonald's is much better than this place. The chicken was like rubber and flavorless and the service was not impressive.
Thy change a 4.7 % fee just to eat there. They call it a franchise fee. Be aware and just say no!

Went here for brunch with some friends during Memorial Day weekend and needless to say, it did not disappoint! We ordered several dishes and desserts which were all delicious! I will def be back here next time I'm in Vegas

Great place for late night eats after midnight in the area.  Food 24 hours.  Ordered cheeses, salami, big pretzel, skillet potatoes, pizza.  Everything was delicious.  Lots of food (leftovers). Will definitely eat there again.

The food and atmosphere was so good! Plus at a bachelorette party bottomless mimosas don't hurt. BUT MVP OF ALL TIME was Tracee. Not only did she make our experience super fun she took care of everything we could have needed. Aces all round!

Visited for lunch. The staff were very attentive and the food was great. I had the prime beef dip and it was excellent. It was a hot and humid day but the patio was open and you could still get fresh air. This is probably not environmentally friendly but the effect was nice. I was so tired of being cold every time we went into a building! The temperature was great here.

Dinner was such a great experience last night we came back for brunch! Server Krista was amazing and the GM Michael Main is a sweetheart and reserved us an amazing table strip side for our brunch this morning. Will definitely be going back!

I came here with a groupon on hand and it's a good thing too because restaurants on the strip can be pricey.  I made a reservation and requested to be outdoors facing the the strip and that is exactly what I got.  It's a perfect location because you can view the Bellagio fountains across the street and just people watch.
Our wait staff was fabulous and attentive.  I ordered the chicken and waffles and a midori sour, both were excellent.  We also tried their famed Hexx pitcher which was neat and worth trying atleast once but I would not get again because the price is a bit ridiculous for me.
On your way out you can view where they mix and make their chocolates.  Overall this place was a very nice place for any meal.
Staff was very friendly and the service was great. I ordered the rib eye and I swear it was enough to feel two people.

The Cinnaroll waffle is out of this world, decadent and filling! Now, I'm not crazy about waffles, but this is a must try! Everything about this waffle is just great, texture, flavor, and it exceeded all expectations. Vanessa, our hostess was attentive and on cue for our every request. Great experience!

I came here for dinner from a Groupon deal and now that I'm looking at reviews , I think coming for breakfast/brunch is a better option.
The setting is nice and open. Perfect for summer. They keep it cool or if you want to sit outside they have a good amount of misters.
Service is excellent. They're very attentive. Every time you use a utensil they immediately bring a new one. I thought this was interesting because I haven't seen that anywhere else! I always have to ask lol
For an appetizer we had spinach dip, a meat and cheese deli type plate, and shrimp cocktail. The only one worth mentioning is the spinach dip. Very delicious and I loved that it was served with bread AND chips.
For the main dish I had short rib which is one of their signature items. It is served with mash potatoes and brussel sprouts. The short rib itself was delicious, however the dish was ruined by the horse radish mashed potatoes. The other member of my family who ordered the same dish had a similar hate for those. The horseradish completely ruined the taste of perfectly good mashed potatoes and it was inedible for everyone at the table. If only they put garlic or something else, because the taste was so overbearing . Other members of the group ordered different steaks which were all cooked to their liking . The only complaint was that you had to pay for a side dish. Otherwise you just get a steak with a tiny topping of peppers or some other small assortment. But definitely two bites at most. Not enough for a side dish and not enough to fill anybody up.
For dessert we had a brownie sundae, cookie sundae, and some sort of flan. The flan was overly soft and couldn't be picked up by a fork. It was pretty liquidy. The brownie was very rich but not very good. The only good part was the ice cream with toffee in it. The cookie sundae was hug but I was disappointed to find that the taste and texture were more like a muffin than a cookie. I kept retasting it to see what was so weird about it,you but I didn't enjoy it. None of the desserts we tried were worth it.
Overall it was a good deal for what we paid but I definitely wouldn't come back.

If you come to Vegas looking for the Sugar Factory's dry ice drinks, you will find that they no longer have it (miracle mile banned dry ice). That's what I did, and the closest thing I could find was hexx. The drinks are tasty and pretty strong, although they make them with fruit instead of candy (so they are not as sweet). The portions are HUMONGOUS. It will look like the bartender's bringing you a huge smoky mug of potion, and you're ready to cast a spell in that joint. #hocuspocus!

Love this place.  Open terrace seating that's covered with cooling misters makes it even better.  Great brunch options, and items for any time of the day.  Girlfriend and I shared the Margherita pizza and the crispy broccolini.   Margherita pizza was very good (12"), worth the ~$13, but the crispy broccolini - OMG - delicious!  Lemony zest to compliment the lightly salted crispy broccolini.   Service was a bit slow, but the atmosphere and food made up for it. 

Tip: VIP access (SPG) card gets you a table very quickly.  If you are a platinum SPG member, be sure to get this card at Caesar's so you can take advantage of serious line cuts and discounts at all Total Rewards venues.

With all the good restaurants in Las Vegas, skip this one and don't think twice about it. 

The service was the best part of this place. The food, at $20 for a sandwich/salad/burger, was below average. By a large margin. I should have known to pass Hexx up by the fact that from the street I could see that most of the tables were empty. 

My fianc√©e had the panzenella salad. Lots of "white" lettuce, head lettuce, barely any avocado, barely any other good stuff at all. Her comment of "my salad in the airport was so much better!" Summed it up perfectly. 

I had the turkey club. A big sandwich, but the ingredients were not great, the fries we worse than McDonalds, and it just wasn't a $20 sandwich. I'm not opposed to the prices, but I'm from Chicago. I know good food. I'll pay $20 for a turkey club in Chi and it will be a memorable experience. The only thing memorable about Hexx is how sub par it was. 

Go someplace else. That's all there is to it.

Their cheese and meat platter was very tasty! It paired nicely with the bubbly, too!

I was a bit disappointed with the size of their appetizers, but it didn't disappoint my tastebuds! 

Their servers seemed to be a bit frazzled from the dinner rush, but overall it was a good dining experience. 

Great place for a date night!

Love this place.. Actually we love Angie which is why we come here! She is such a hoot and always takes good care of us. Rafael was our server, and he too is the bomb. Highly recommend the chilaquiles. Thanks Ari for the blue sweetener!

Amazing. Amazing. Amazing.  I love every bit of this restaurant from the location, to the food.  What I didn't love was the prices, which aren't disclosed until you're seated.  But we were prepared, so I suggest you be.  This restaurant has beautiful decor, trendy chic vibe, an open patio that faces the strip so you can watch the fountain show at the Bellagio, and the staff was super friendly.  We had a party of 18, reservations on a Saturday at 6pm, & were seated as soon as we arrived.  I ordered the 16 oz prime rib, with the bacon wrapped asparagus (a la carte) of course.  He had the rib eye & lobster cream corn.  Everything was absolutely deeeeelish! Only negative was my steak was the last out, & the waitress didn't bring me au jus... we celebrated a birthday and the manager on duty was sweet enough to send over cake pops & red velvet cake at the end of the meal.  Makes the $175 dinner worth it, I would definitely go back.  Thanks Hexx!
I asked for medium rare on my steak --- They gave me a well done piece of chewy New York piece of charred shit... If not for the decor and service, I would have rated this place less than one star.

We went on a packed Sunday afternoon for late brunch.
The service was a little slow however our waiter Sean did the best he could.  He was very polite and apologized for the wait and took his time to explain/suggest everything.  He kept running back and forth to check in on us.  I appreciate that because even though I understand you are busy, standards should be met.  I could see he was working hard.  He and Abram took good care of us under the circumstances.

The food was great too.  I ordered the chilaquiles and my husband ordered the steak and eggs.  We both enjoyed our meals very much.  Portion was good as well.

Overall this place was great.  I don't really love the price but...it's Vegas, it's expected.  :)
Tracee and Patrick were the best! They were so kind and attentive! They made our experience here at Hexx!! Thanks so much!!!

I think this place is great for the views. There was no wait for outdoor patio seating (compared to typically 1-2 hours at next door's mon ami gabi) during dinner. 
As for the food, i honestly thought it would've been great if it wasn't for the kilo of salt they dumped into every dish. The flavor of the food was great, but the amount of salt on top of the flavor made my taste buds feel like they were burning off??? This was literally the saltiest meal of my life i'm not joking and i live off of sugar and salt ok
For dessert we got the tiramisu, which comes "deconstructed" meaning that the cake is plain by itself in the center, the cream / cocoa shit comes on the sides surrounding the cake, and the waiter pours the tiramisu alcohol mixture on top of the cake. I think the concept was interesting but the ingredients ratio was off, like there was too little cake to soak up the alcohol mixture + other ingredients.
 
I gave 4 stars bc they tried. they really did. A for effort. I would come back for the views and next time i'll just ask them to give me the salt shaker myself lol

Great place, great food, great view. The restaurant is located in the middle of the strip right in front of the Bellagio fountain. They have excellent food and their cocktails and fresh, unique, and tasteful.

Loved this place when it was sugar factory. Love it even more now. The Bloody Mary is still the best in the entire world and the food was actually super good. Our waiter Sean S. was brilliant. Super friendly from the very beginning and gave us pretty incredible service for how crowded it was. Everything came exactly as we ordered it. It was a birthday brunch and it was perfect. So thanks Sean and Hexx!

Let me start off with saying that the food is fantastic! Had dinner here last night and wow. I would definitely return. I had the chicken Cesar salad, I was speechless! The most biggest, delicious salad ever! Had some dessert, which I forgot the name of, but it's somewhat new. Extremely tasty! The waiter was super nice and hilarious! Super friendly staff, great environment!! Definitely recommend coming here!

Great service. Food is decent price. Food isn't the best but definitely good enough. Really good location right across from Bellagio fountain. For the price and atmosphere, I'll definitely come again.

Had a great experience. It was my parents first time in Vegas and Hexx food was good. My mom enjoyed the mimosa and Sean kept her glass full!! Sean was an excellent server and very attentive. Will certainly come back & ask for him..

My friends and I came here for happy hour which was 20% off appetizers, snacks, and pizzas. The happy hour tables were first come first serve and all of them were taken so we asked the hostess if we could sit somewhere else to get the happy hour. She spoke with the manager and we were able to get our own private booth! We ordered 2 hexx potion drinks... The magick dragon and the voodoo tea. The voo doo tea was extremely sour so we asked them to switch it out for another magick dragon which they were happy to do. The presentation of the hex potions were really neat because they poured the drink over liquid nitrogen which made the drinks really look like a potion!

We order a pepperoni pizza, a margarita pizza, grilled asparagus, and a chicken Caesar salad. Everything was delicious, especially the Chicken Caesar salad. 

Overall, the presentation, food, and service was great.

Some of the best corned beef and hash I've ever had! The eggs Benedict was amazing as well! Got a great view of the strip for optimum people watching.   Our server was excellent. Kept the drinks coming and recommended a bunch of places for is to check out as well.  The only downfall is the bottomless mimosas cut off at 2 but brunch service doesn't end until 4, do if you have a 1pm reservation its annoying. Overall great experience!

Loving the atmosphere here at Hexx! 
Really loved the menu- so many great options
And of course the food was great!  

We showed up at lunch time on a Saturday and the place was packed.  It really is in a great spot in the strip.  Directly across from the fountains at the Bellagio.  Sitting outside is a huge added bonus!  When we arrived there was going to be a 30 minute wait for our table, so we snuck into the bar and snagged a table.  They were so busy we went unnoticed for a little bit.  But once the manager saw that we were at the table with no water or menus she came over and handled everything.  She was amazing, took our order, got the flatware and waters out to us and recommended some great dishes.  She didn't just see us once and get us help-  she stayed on top of our service for our entire meal.  Christina definitely is a top notch manager-  digging in with team.  What great service!!

Brunching here with Yelp friends is always a good idea.  Thanks to Stefany, we had a group of 6 enjoy a weekend spread of brunch items.  

Friends that share - care! This is why I like to dine with this group.  We decided to share several menu items, Carrot Cake Pancakes, Hexx Benedict and Chilaquiles.  The Hexx Benedict was definitely the star of the show.  Instead of being on an english muffin, a layer of scalloped potatoes are nestled beneath the canadian bacon, poached eggs and hollandaise.  Several spears of asparagus top off the lovely dish.  

The Carrot Cake was no slouch either.  The spicy batter comes out in full flavor with the dollop of cream cheese frosting. It's generously fill with walnuts to complete the ingredients.  With all of that sweetness you really don't need to add the syrup.  

The Chilaquiles lacked comparing to the other two previously mentioned items.  It was good but not great.  This is dish is good for sharing since you can just grab a few chips with toppings.

Our service during this busy time was decent.  The gentleman had a fun and friendly table side manner.  The assistants helping refill drinks were very consistent in checking on our table and keeping us hydrated.  They certainly were attentive and made our visit enjoyable!

Welcome to an evening of food Bliss!  Stopped in at Hexx the other night with my son.  What a treat we had!  Jessica was our server and please when you go, Request Jessica!  She is top works by far!  Her recommendations were perfect!  We started out with "Smothered Fries", okay, you can almost make this one a meal by itself - OMG - The Cheese Curds, excuse my drool, all of this cheese with the right amount of pulled pork (LOTS) and this fab gravy toping it all off! In between we had "Maryland Crab Cakes", just the right amount of everything in them! By far my FAVORITE of them would be the "Crispy Broccolini" OUTSTANDING! The balsamic dressing they are tossed with To Die For! 
    We had time to enjoy the fountains between our courses, we were sitting on the patio!  We then had a visit from Michael the GM! What a personal touch this made!  The night is Incredible! Our entr√©e's arrived in perfect timing.  We both had steaks tonight, I had the 7oz Filet, OMG, this steak was EXQUISITE, and boy do I LOVE red meat, cooked to perfection this was! My son had the 14oz Rib-Eye which was just as enjoyable as mine! They were served with grilled asparagus, the only way to eat it in my opinion! 
    Dessert was so fun! We were treated to an ice-cream cone tasting Extravaganza!  We had 8 different flavors, my favorite was the pistachio!  Not to be let down by the Chef, we were toured in the Chocolate Factory, and learned quite a bit about Chocolate, where it is grown, and how they prepare it! We also had the opportunity to try each of the chocolates they offer as well.  How Amazing this night was! They should be a must on any trip to Vegas!

I really enjoyed this restaurant! I took my grandma and came for an early 5pm dinner prior to a show. The restaurant is modern, trendy, and decorated in light colors with green and brown accents. Very "California" beach vibe. There are both patio and indoor seating so you can overlook the Bellagio Fountains. There are misters all around the patio to keep you cool as well. 

The menu has a nice selection of American food. For our appetizer we had the calamari in buffalo sauce and ranch, a twist on the typical calamari dish. We also had a large crab cake with chili aioli. For our entrees I had the filet with mashed potatoes and my grandma had the veal with mushroom risotto. Both were fantastic. The portions are very large here as well. 

The absolute best part of my night was the dessert!! I cannot rave enough about the hazelnut chocolate pudding. OMG SO GOOD. Our server, Denise was very kind, friendly, and checked on us multiple times throughout the meal. 

I will be recommending this more often for dinner.

This place has a nice airy feel. Huge glass sliding glass doors that open the restaurant up onto the patios. I love music but it was really loud and head banger music in a classy place like this.... was making my head hurt and I found myself wanting to leave because of it. I couldn't relax and enjoy my meal.
I had the Benedict. It was presented beautifully. My first egg was perfectly poached. The temperature of the meal was warm. The hollandaise sauce was bland. 
It was nice to find this as a gluten free option. Hopefully next time the eggs with be the same and the entire meal would be a bit hotter.
Our server was very kind and knowledgeable. I must say that I would hope this was just an off day for them. I would give it another chance. 
I saw many beautiful plates of food passing me by.

Amazing brunch, should be your first recovery stop in Vegas! The pizza, eggs, potatoes, salad, coffee: it was all good. If you go there, be sure to ask for Tracee. She is a top notch server, and we never even had to ask for a refill on our bottomless mimosas. Couldn't imagine a better welcome to Sin City, Tracee was perfect!
I had brunch with my girlfriends and everything was great. The food was fantastic, the service was wonderful. Sean was the best server you could possibly get (:

Bad start showing us the absolute worst table on the outdoor patio.  In a corner next to the server station with no view at all. How about showing us the second table first?

Our server Natalie was very pleasant but the food was very mediocre.  My Caesar Salad was pretty tasteless and the specks of what looked like freeze dried bacon detracted from an already so-so dish.  My wife said her Chicken BLT Sandwich was good.  

I guess if they didn't try to screw us over with the poor table I might have given a 3, or maybe not.  I really did not like my dish.
Food is great. Unlimited Mimosa, combined with great service, and outside seating,  makes this a great place for breakfast/brunch.

I'm so mad the sugar factory is gone. But I came here for brunch it was very tasty. I had the veggie omelette. The breakfast potatoes were delish. The whole thing was actually very good. The food came out in no time. Hot and fresh just how I like it. We sat outside mid morning so it was beginning to heat up. They eventually turned on the misters to cool the area off a little
First time trying the breakfast here n it was delicious! Very filling gourmet food! Our waitress Taylor was so friendly!

So, when you go out for a meal there are two things you look for...great food and great service. This place has both. We went for brunch the first time and was blown away by the food and service. Our servers the first time were Taylor and Abram. Taylor was amazing as her attention to us was beyond expectations.
We went back a second time and not only were we NOT disappointed, we were even more impressed. We requested Taylor again and she was assisted by Patrick and Steven. Seriously, Taylor should classes on how servers should be. Go here. Ask for Taylor. Get the bottomless mimosas and enjoy!

We had drinks and dessert after a show.   No waiting, a great table on the patio to enjoy Bellagio fountains at night!    Milkshake with a side of the "over cooked bacon" for hubby, and a crepe choc raspberry dessert so wonderful it  made me forget its name.   Really.  Good.   I forgot hubby's name too.  
Would have loved to had more time to try dinner too, the things being delivered to neighboring tables looked and smelled wonderful.

My husband and I went to Vegas for our honeymoon last month.  We went to the Circus 1903 show at Paris (which was awesome!) and then went to HEXX for a romantic dinner.  We got a table on the outside patio, so we were able to people watch and view the Bellagio fountains.  We ordered the Hanger steak (medium) and the Shrimp cocktail, both were delicious!  However, I must say, the Hanger steak was one of the best tasting steaks that I have ever had!!!!  Service was also great.
Look on Groupon, the usually have a great deal for HEXX

Saw this place across the strip from the Bellagio and what a find it was! Tracee and Luis were extremely accommodating. We started with a party of 3 and our friends came to join us. They quickly helped us turn the table from 3 to 5. The food was delicious! All of us had great meals and added the bottomless mimosas for good measure. Thank you for a great time!
Tables are small but the food was amazing! Bottomless mimos, black forest ham croissant and the best twisted sticky buns! Found our new "breakfast" place in Vegas

It was a busy Saturday morning, President's weekend.   We had hoped with the warm weather to sit outside and people watch while having breakfast, but they were hopping and we opted for a seat at the bar.   Very attentive staff.   I ordered a simple eggs over easy, with the usual english muffin etc along with a very well made Irish Coffee.  It was vacation afterall! 
My friend ordered the croissant ham and cheese sandwich which she added eggs to (recommendation of the bartender).    Croissant was well made,  crispy outside and perfect inside, along with a large portion of ham, cheese, avocado and perfect eggs.  Portions in both case were fairly large.  Everything came out quickly despite the crowds.  
Highly recommend if you are looking for a great breakfast on the strip.

Came here for Friday brunch and we were seated in 15 minutes. Their brunch selection is great, and I couldn't choose between the delicious looking stacks of carrot cake pancakes, cinnamon roll waffle, or chicken and waffles. I ultimately got the chicken and waffles, and it came with two generous pieces of chicken thighs and breast. The chicken was juicy and paired well with the cheddar waffle and syrup. So delicious!

Service was a little slow, but the manager was great about visiting our table to apologize for a hair in my friend's cappuccino. I definitely will be coming back the next time I'm in Vegas!

Omg! A prime rib the size of my head! AND it was soft and delicious!!! I am actually craving that prime rib now that I'm writing this review. Have to come back!!

Prime rib- did I say it was delicious?!?! Suggesting you share this one with someone. I couldn't finish it. 

Dry aged rib eye- packed with flavor! Every single bite! I love it when steaks are seasoned just right. It shows care in the process of making the food. 

Customer service- what an informative young lady! We had questions about a few things and she knew all the answers! She was prompt and filled out glasses often. We were never down from our high after one bite of the meat because she also kept us going. I do want to mention that the young host was lacking in friendliness. It felt like he looked down on us and responded with the hoity toity attitude. Dropped our menus on the table and left. Luckily, we had a stellar server and an even more amazing meal!!!

The location and view were outstanding especially if you sit outside.  The service was good but there was very little flexibility on making some minor changes to the menu items such as the type of cheese and side item with the Hexx Burger.  The hamburger was mediocre even with the overrated and overpriced white chocolate bun.  Other dishes such as the spinach artichoke dip and chicken & waffles were average - nothing out of the ordinary.  

The main complaint I have with Hexx (other than being over-priced and offering mediocre food) is the surprise CNF (Concession & Franchise Fee) that is tacked onto your bill and leaves you no choice but to pay at the conclusion of your meal.  I have since learned that a few other Strip restaurants charge this concession fee and it's far worse than a resort fee because you get nothing whatsoever for it.  It's just a money grab fee tacked onto your bill that is kept by the restaurant owners and ranges from 3-5%.

My recommendation is to find out if the establishment imposes this fee before you are seated and if so, exit the premises.  Hexx does in fact charge this fee and as a result, I will not return.

Went here for a later dinner recently and we ate on the patio which was great for watching the Bellagio fountains and for people watching. 
I ordered a steak and received a recommendation to order the broccoli. The broccoli was meant to share for the table but everyone should order their own because it is amazing!  
Like everything in Vegas, is his dinner was also pretty expensive.

As much as I've passed this place when I go down the strip, I've been intrigued in visiting Hexx, the ice creamery & candy place, not the restaurant. . So here was my opportunity...
Right away it is split between the candy/ice cram shoppe and the restaurant. I just ate a good sized lunch so I thought of treating myself to a sweet something. The candy area resembles any other candy place here in Vegas, with a mixture of Mickey Mouse, Hello Kitty and Star Wars items like purses, glasses, cups, wallets, etc. i steer my way to the ice cream bar where they also service roof beer floats, teas and coffees drinks. This is where my disappointment begins...
I ordered a scoop of Horchata ice cream in a waffle cone and an ice hibiscus iced tea cooler. First my order was wrong and the gentleman gave me black ice tea from Peet's.  First the ice cream was ok...good but not like "WOW" and pricey over $6/scoop with tax. Now to the ice tea...the cashier noticed it was the wrong tea and I was given a simple ice black tea. He asked the other gentleman to re-do the kind of iced tea I wanted and how to do it. So, not only the taste was very bitter unsweetened, but not enough ice for an typical ice tea in 106 degree weather. I had to add 4 packets for Splenda to get thru finishing my drink and trying not to feel I wasted my money...which I eventually felt anyways. 
Honestly, the iced passion tea at Starbucks would've been more satisfying than here. I paid for the name really, and probably won't go back. Sorry!
I ordered salmon with mushroom and quinoa.  I have to say that I am more impressed with the flavor of quinoa than the main character, salmon.

We visit vegas monthly and love trying different spots every time we are in town.  First time at the Hexx, we went for brunch. It's a great location and a beautiful restaurant, I honestly expected the food to be the same. But I was disappointed, sadly. I couldn't decide on what to order, but I kept seeing the prime rib French dip being served at multiple tables and it looked delicious so I went with it. After waiting 20 mins to be seated (mind you, the restaurant was half empty) and another 25 mins to finally get my food, I immediately regretted my food after 1 bite. It was SOOOOOO bland. Like no flavor at all! I shared it with friends at the table because I didn't want to waste it. The customer service was friendly but so slow. After we asked for our check it took our server 10 mins to bring it to us and another 15 to bring it back, what a mess. Probably won't be returning.

We had bottomless mimosas on our first day in Vegas for my friends birthday! They have bottomless DAILY! If you're lucky enough to get Melissa as your server, you will be taken care of like you're the only party in the restaurant! The food was so so to me (I got a protein omelet) but the bottomless and service from Melissa makes it 5 stars!

We went for brunch and had the best experience. Shout out to our server, Adam, for being on it with the bottomless mimosas and for being concerned about my bacon (I ate it so fast when it came out that when he came to check about two minutes later he was worried I didn't get my order- I definitely did). Our food met our expectations and beyond. I ordered the Brioche French toast and my sister ordered the protein omelet. We split our meal together so we could each experience it. I highly recommend it as a solid brunch spot. Everything was so great that I'm hoping to make it back to try their other items.

Formally The Sugar Factory at Paris Hotel. The was good then and it's still very good now. Portions are good and comparable to the prices. Menu is simple but a good variety to choose from. The gift shop has been changed to restaurant and bar with live music at night. We were lucky to have been seated in the new section since it only opened on New Year's Eve. The only negative was the tables. The tables are bar tables which is fine for a bar but for eating? Nope. 4 plates with 2 waters put the table st full capacity. No room for anything else. There are larger tables for bigger groups. Check this place out. You will enjoy your visit.
Amazing!!! Great service!! Melissa was awesome - best service you can get! She was great and so nice, she deserves an award!

There breakfast menu was amazing. I had the eggs Benedict and it was amazing. Our waitress Clare went above and beyond. She helped us with everything from choosing drinks to food. I would definitely come back! Thanks to Clare!
The food was super yummy. We had a lovely brunch with bottomless mimosas. The atmosphere was great. And our server Tracee was THE best!

Awesome food!! 
We had a wonderful experience here.. be sure to get a potion my husband and I love these!

We reserved for 9 + a high chair for lunch indoors. We got there on time and figured that they had given our table to someone else. They tried to seat us on a high table where we couldn't have the child sit at the table or said they'd seat us out doors. When we declined to take the high table and refused to sit outside in the hot Vegas sun with a 2 year old; they asked to wait and was not able let us know how soon they could give us a lower table indoor. The girl at the front unapologetically stated that reservations are not a guarantee for a table instead of apologizing and trying to arrange a table. We decided to take our business elsewhere. Extremely pathetic service.
Not impressed at all the food is a 1 the service was good but the food was just barely average with mon ami gabi right there I would have to go there every time
We had a fabulous brunch here with Tracee our awesome server. The food was delicious but the atmosphere and Tracee's friendly fun service was even better.
We did the chocolate tasting and  education  at HEXX . It took about 30 mins. We tasted / samples 6 milk chocolate and 7 dark chocolate samples. Lots of fun!!

Julio was the best server! Very attentive and quick to respond when needed.  Food was delicious and it was great sightseeing from the patio.  Bottomless mimosas for $20 on weekends.  Totally worth it!

Every time that I came here with my girlfriend is awesome! The food is delicious!!! Great drinks, nice price. Today we saw the sunset, was beautiful!! And we want to give a 5 Stars to Mark our attendant today, he was great!!!!

Trendy spot right across the road from the Bellagio fountains. We made a reservation and were seated outside immediately at 8pm, right when the show started. Great flavors, smaller portions, higher prices. We used the $50 for $35 Groupon, but our bill came out to be around $90 before the discount. 
Two people: 1 cocktail, 1 soda, 1 app (spinach dip), 2 entrees (10" pepperoni pizza and gnocchi dish). Vegetarian options available. Service was great!

We heard about the bottomless mimosas and came running. They were fantastic, and the waitstaff was quick to refill.

Aside from the mimosas, we tried some other items. The maple bacon was amazing. Life changing, really. The fruit was incredibly fresh and there was a great variety of more exotic types of fruit than your standard grapes, blueberries, strawberries and melon. My husband, who doesn't usually eat fruit couldn't keep from stealing bites from my plate. The potatoes were indescribably good. A perfect crunch when you bite into it, with a smooth texture on the inside. They were seasoned quite well. The servers and hosts are attentive, warm and welcoming. Our favorite place on the strip. 

If you stop here, you can't go wrong.

Hexx wins major points for its location: catacorner from Planet Hollywood, on top of  Paris and with perfect view of the one enduring cultural artifact Vegas may have to offer - the dancing fountains at Bellagio. (I say "may" because fountains synchronized to opera say little about the ilk of tourists drunkenly shuffling up the strip). 

Anyhow, set a plate of Southern food before me, deconstructed or faithfully artery-clogging, and I will savor it.  I ordered a "re-imagined" shrimp and grits entree, which sounds like a violation of a sacred art form but was in fact utter melt-in-your-mouth fabulosity; spicy prawns over a pillow of polenta with gruyere bechamel and sauteed spinach. The drinks, on the other hand, were an overpriced bummer. I should have stuck with my usual sauvignon blanc or pinot grigio, but a fruitier drink sounded better at the time.
I went to a business breakfast this morning. All I can say is "CARROT CAKE PANCAKES" amazing! amazing! amazing! It even comes with frosting!!! Whhhhaaaaattttt!!!!!! Yes frosting!!!!

The best chicken and waffles my husband and I have ever had!  I wish I ordered them instead of him because I kept sneaking bites of his food :P  The waffles have pieces of bacon in the batter and the syrup has bourbon.  Bacon and bourbon...how could you go wrong?!  If I ever go back to Vegas this will be my first stop for breakfast.  
I ordered the steak and eggs which was really good too.  The only reason I didn't give this restaurant 5 stars is because I ordered my steak medium rare and it wasn't pink at all.  I never send food back but for the price of the steak I want it cooked properly.  When our waiter brought out my second steak is was much better.  Also the breakfast potatoes were perfectly crisp and my eggs were perfectly poached.   This restaurant just opened last week so there are minor quirks but I suggest you give it a chance.  Don't forget to order the amazing chicken and waffles :)

I came here during my Presidents' Day weekend stay. I wanted to originally try burgr, which was located near by but only because the wait was over an hour, I decided to walk next door and try something with less of a wait so my son did not have to wait any longer for dinner.

Well I read reviews on Yelp, and I originally only saw two stars. I was worried but I gave it a shot. Unfortunately, to my dismay , the Yelp reviews were rather accurate. I ordered the margarita pizza, and it was just horrible! I had to return it to get a plain Cesar salad, only because I was scared to try anything else. 

My boyfriend ordered the short rib dish. You would think that this would be amazing. We have tried this dish on various occasions at different restaurants, being that it's on of my boyfriends favorites! Unfortunately this location did not nail the dish.  it was possibly the horse radish that was included in the Brussels sprouts that turned him away from giving this dish any good review. 

My son probably ordered the most normal and decent dish. The hamburger. Plain and simple and you cannot mess it up right ? Yet , my 6 year old didn't really pick on the fries . What 6year old doesn't like French fries? Well mine does on a regular basis , although this place had the coldest and grossest French fries I ever had . 

Last disappointment ? CNF fee added at the end of your receipt. Other yelpers have discussed this in their review. And it's true folks ! It exists and it's annoying !  never again will I come back here.

Came here a few Saturday's ago with a group of friends visiting from Denver and Texas.  We saw the Lionel Richie show and needed some dessert and drinks after.  We were immediately seated and given dessert menus.  Our server, a young man with light hair (can't remember his name) was phenomenal with recommendations and putting up with all the questions from a group of 8.  Wow do they have a variety of desserts and drinks.  After much contemplation I settled on the chocolate cake and couldn't have been happier.  It was unlike any cake I've ever had.  So light and airy and not in a tall slice form.  This cake looked like spun cotton spread out with cinnamon cream cheese frosting and chocolate ganache on the side.  Sprinkled over the top was toasted almonds.  The carrot cake and banana cream pie also got 2 thumbs up from the group.  Needless to say my carb count was ruined for the week but what a way to fall off the diet wagon!

I've eaten here several times in the past couple months, food & staff are great but my recent visit...FOOD POISONING!! After eating there my significant & I are both running to the bathroom which caused us to miss our flight home. We ate the cheese plate, N.Y. steak with mashed potatoes.

Love this place. Having lunch out front with Bellagio fountains in the background. The people watching is fantastic. Great meal and really enjoyed the cocktails. Our server, Tolu, was amazing. Made great recommendations and really made our experience memorable.

I really enjoyed the atmosphere here.  Wait staff was great and they had bottomless mimosas for $20.  I had the eggs benedict.  I was a tad disappointed they had potatoes instead of the usual English muffin but the potatoes were actually good in the dish.  I also had a choice of toast or english muffin on the side so it wasnt a huge deal either.  I also prefer my hollandaise to be less thick and a little more salty but it was still very good regardless.  I will definitely try this place again.  Maybe for lunch or dinner.  I would definitely recommend.  I preferred things differently but, I still loved my dish.
This Bloody Mary was amazing!  We also had the chicken BLT and the hexx salad with the shrimp.  It was amazing!
We ate here on a Saturday at about 1:00. It was extremely crowded but we were seated quickly. The service and food are good quality and we would come back.

Excellent.  Service top notch.  Wife had rib eye, while not the best she has ever had, very good,  tasty and tender.  I had spare ribs, a hit!  Shared brussel sprout, delicious.  Mac & cheese, good not great.  Overall superb.  Highly recommended.

First off, our server CeCe was the shit!!! (meaning GREAT)... The restaurant itself is sheek with an open layout. Food is amazing as well! I had the short rib sandwich along with a healthy serving of bottomless mimosas. 

Check it Out...

Being a local and trying all of the offerings Las Vegas has, my party of three decided to give "HEXX" a try. It was worth it!

From the time we were taken on a tour of Hexx  Chocolate & Confexxions by "Gianni" and seated at our table by "Parish" the service and the food were great. We went with the suggestions of our server "Steven" from the appetizer to our desert and his suggestions were spot on. We had two server assistants "Phillip" and "David" making sure our glasses were always full. 

A special thank-you to "Juan Sanchez" and "Katelyn Ix" the two managers for the desert suggestions and the BEST chocolate martini called "The Hexx" my wife has ever had!

We group highly recommends "HEXX" and will be back for dinner, desert or trip to the bar, and yes they do have a Happy Hour!
We had breakfast there and then came back later that night and had carrot cake!! Wow! Best carrot cake in Las Vegas. and I feel to be an expert ;)

Spectacular view of the strip, food and service! Definitely will be coming back on my next trip. Brunch was amazing, my favorite is the sausage, egg and bacon pizza. Our servers, Sean and Erik, were outstanding.

Cute little patio makes you feel like you are in a European cafe. I decided to sit on the patio and have some brunch along with their delicious sangria. The view looks directly onto the Vegas strip so the people watching is plentiful! Also, you can see the Bellagio Fountains from here as well. If you're looking for a place with an awesome atmosphere and delicious food then this is the place for you, whether you are visiting or not.

We wanted to celebrate a special occasion with my daughter and her family. And we wanted to try a place that none of us had eaten previously. Hexx Kitchen for brunch on a pleasant June morning seemed to fit the bill.
Ambiance: We got a table on the patio with a good view of the Bellagio fountains and for people watching. A good start for the meal. They did have misters going to help with the heat but they were spraying out so it did little to cool down those of us sitting on the patio.
Service: Our server came by a few minutes after we sat down. She was very warm and welcoming. She then disappeared for about 10 minutes. No problem - we needed time to work out menu options. When she returned, she took our order and disappeared again. No problem - family time and we liked the chance to talk. The food runners eventually did bring our food, but getting water or coffee refills required tripping a busboy for another table to get attention. Yes, the servers are spread thin. And working hard. But that shouldn't be my problem. And not an excuse for poor service. They should have more servers working Sunday brunch. 
Food: My wife and I shared the brioche French toast and the meat omelet. Each was brought out room temperature. The French toast was about the same quality you can get at IHOP or Denny's. That's not a serious criticism about the flavor - eat on the Strip and you pay Strip prices for a meal. The omelet was tasty, not great but good. It came with potatoes that probably were good when they were hot. Being generous, I could see giving the food a 3 star rating.
Value: Eating on a patio on the Strip should be worth something, even if the food and service are disappointing. But the final "straw" for me was on the bill. They added a 4% surcharge item labeled "cnf." When I asked about it, I was told it is an added fee because the restaurant has to pay the hotel for the location attached to the Paris. GIVE ME A BREAK! Charge more for the food on the menu if you need to cover your overhead. But don't slip it in on the bill and hope that no one notices.  I won't be back.

Just had a fantastic breakfast! Food was fresh and tasty.  Started with a fresh bowl of berries and some OJ. Followed that up with the vegetable omelette.   We did see amazing stacks of pancakes and waffles go by us as well as the breakfast parfait.. so we'll be back to try some of the other treats!  The wait staff was attentive but not too much. Sean is the person to ask for, sit in his station you will not be disappointed!

This was my very first place where I bought alcohol with my ID on my 21st birthday :D I've been a fan of this place ever since (it used to be called sugar factory). It's actually been rebranded to HEXX and I think it's a positive change. This is a very trendy, clean place and a great place to people watch.

Food: I would definitely recommend their pizzaaaa. Yummm
Drinks: Okay this is why I make a point to stop by on every vegas trip. You need to have "The HEXX" I think used to be called a chocolate martini. Best drink EVER. No seriously, you dont believe me try it for yourself! Also if you're in the mood for drinking more then the dried ice drinks are an experience I haven't had anywhere else. They prepare the drinks in front of you and because they put dried ice int he drinks, when they pour water over the drink there's so much fog that comes out. 

It's conveniently located in the middle of the strip right in front of the bellagio fountains so you can sit outside, sip on your drink and watch the fountain show.
Great service from Sean! Wonderful food with a twist on common favorites...corn beef hash was great
Great drinks!  Good ice cream next door(although it's a bit warm and soft).

We settled on this place because it was close to our hotel & the menu looked appetizing. It was even better than anticipated. We didn't have a reservation but were seated immediately. The waiter was great - very friendly and helpful. The food was great, too. My date was even able to substitute out one of his sides, which some restaurants are sometimes strict about not letting you do. We sat inside because it was a super hot day, but the outdoor seating has a great view of the Bellagio fountains across the street.

Fantastic location across the street from the Bellagio fountain. The fountain is visible from much of the seating. The place has a modern and fun vibe. The food and service were both excellent. The prices are high which I expect is a result of the location.

Food was good but a bit pricey. Good service but a better view of the fountain. If you're looking for something fun and light, a good place for dinner. Food is served la carte  so it can run you some extra money.  Not including the burger, fries were included.

This place was phenomenal great great great!!
Highly recommend. The crab cake was very good

My husband met the manager Michael Main while in the candy shop next door and he talked up the restaurant so much we had to take our family here and we were so glad we did!
The ambiance of the restaurant was airy, open and inviting. We had the opportunity to dine outside and enjoy the nice Vegas weather. Our service was impeccable, Tracee with to e's, was incredible, she was funny and attentive, a perfect way to start our day!
There were eight of us at breakfast and we all ordered something different! Everything was delicious, with the exception of the Carnitas Hash! Which was described as runny and soggy.
We started the meal off with a fruit plate which was not your ordinary fruit plate, it had all kinds of interesting flavors like Dragon Fruit and Japanese Apple. We also ordered sides of the aged bacon, also a delicious choice. The protein omelette with avocado mousse was delicious and the breakfast potato's were some of the best I have ever had in my life! The ham and cheese croissant with an egg was a popular choice, we saw it on a guests table and two members of our group decided that that was what they had to have. They said it did not disappoint. I had the Cinnamon Apple pancakes with oat crumble and brown sugar butter! The brown sugar butter was candy delicious!
This establishment offered unlimited mimosas and when in Vegas, you have to partake!
This was hands down one of the best breakfasts of my life, a fabulous find in Vegas! I wish we lived closer, I would be a frequent visitor!
Great food, great food and great service. The manager Olivia came by to check to see how everything was. They went above and beyond. Will be back for sure

Chilaquiles were really good! I tried their fruit salad as a starter and it was much more than I expected. It came with delicious muffins on top! Next time I would love to try the carrot cake pancakes.

Came in this morning without a reservation, not expecting it to be busy. The hostess was very nice, and we were quoted a 25 min. wait time, which wasn't bad for how busy everywhere seemed. We decided to go to the bar to grab mimosas while we waited, but ended up finding seats at the bar to eat. The bartender dropped off menus and then ignored us. We didn't get asked about drinks (or even given a water) for 10 minutes. Waited another 15 min at least to get asked about food. The food did come out quickly, which was a plus because we were hungry. We ordered an eggs Benedict, chicken Caesar salad, and a typical eggs and bacon breakfast plate. The food was for the most part good, except for my Caesar salad, which aside from it having a long hair in it, was dry with not enough dressing. Of course, I couldn't get more dressing for it because the bartender didn't even ask how our food was until we were all done with our meals. Literally didn't speak to us until taking our plates away when she asked, "was everything okay?". Don't get me wrong, she was really sweet when she did talk to us, but really poor service on her part. I understand she might've been busy and I don't need small talk, but there are certain things you do no matter what that take one second. A) drop waters off. B) ask how the food is!!! Won't be coming back.

Pancakes and their cream is  BOMB! Literally no wait, perfect place to have a nice meal while people watching. The chicken and waffles looked great
Too.
Servers were awesome. Will definitely be back.

Loved it! Our server was so nice even though her manager was super annoying :) 
The food was good, and we actually had a nice meal despite that it was 1:00 am
The food was delicious and Amanda was great she kept our mimosas full and anticipated our split bill.

We went to Hexx kitchen + bar for brunch and had excellent food and even better service. Our server Sean was friendly, polite and attentive. I will definitely come back to this restaurant the next time I'm

Wir haben durch Zufall erst das Caf√© und dann sp√§ter das Restaurant auf dem Strip gefunden. Nach dem kaffeetrinken haben uns gleich entschlossen dort sich abends zu essen. Wir haben beide Male auf einem Balkon gesessen, genau gegen√ºber vom Bellagio. Somit k√∂nnten wir jedes Wasserspiel mitverfolgen. Einfach toll. Cappuccino war ein Traum. Endlich mal ein richtig guter Kaffee. Das Abendessen war absolut spitze. Ich hatte Steak, das genauso war wie ich es bestellt hatte ( Medium Rear). Bedienung super kompetent und freundlich. Immer wieder gerne. Preis - Leistung stimmte!!

We came for Saturday brunch, had a reservation and were seated right away. The decor is fresh and light. The bottomless mimosas were on point not too heavy on the OJ. The staff are friendly and fast. The food is priced well and everything we had was great, I would highly recommend trying this place.

Ok nothing special, bartenders should really know what an old fashioned should taste. Went to a of Chang's and the bartender know a lot more about the drink then The hex bar staff knew, like serving it an a large ice cube. Worst drink I have had served.

Went there for breakfast, seriously worst Chiliquillas I've ever had. The description in the menu said it came with avocados. When it came to our table, it had a couple squirts of a green sauce that looked nothing like it even had avocado in it. I asked if I could get avocado on mine because that's what it said in the menu. They put avocado slices on a plate and charged me an extra $3.00.

I just had a fabulous brunch at Hexx.  I had the streak and eggs which was cooked to perfection!  My bartender Shena was A+. Very attentive and cared that I had a great time!  Bravo Hexx. Can't want to come back!!!!

We visited due to having a Groupon. I wouldn't go back due to the service my husband and I received. The food was nothing special and our server never asked us if we were enjoying our meal and never asked if we wanted a refill of our iced tea, soda or water. I was surprised and annoyed because we were there on a Monday morning and it wasn't that busy. I would never pay full price to eat here. The only positive is that they have an exceptional view of the Bellagio fountains. There were other waiters that were much more attentive to the tables they were waiting on. The guys who brought out our food were more friendly and attentive.

The restaurant was empty inside when we arrived, very full on the patio.  The wait was 50 minutes outside but 25 minutes inside.  We said inside was fine.  They pointed us to the bar area.  We could sit anywhere and hang out.  They had nifty little private alcoves.  The restaurant is beautiful.  

The menus are not grammatically correct.  Normally neither am I!  I went up to the bar to get a drink.  I asked for the Desert Smash without rosemary agave and asked if I could get it with regular agave.  Pretty sure I asked nicely, but the bartender bit my head off and told me it wasn't rosemary agave.  It was rosemary AND agave in the drink.  Oh okay - the menu was missing a comma.  Maybe they were really understaffed.  Maybe she was having a bad day.  Maybe she has to answer queries about rosemary agave all day everyday... She never warmed up to me.  Maybe my Vegas hair was too big for her liking.

We did eventually get a table after a long wait.  Outside.  The interior remained empty.  It is very nice on the patio and we were fine to be outside.  The food was very tasty, though it too took a long time to arrive.

The oddest thing, other than the grumpy bartender, was we were close to a POS station with glassware.  A few waiter/waitress were taking care of business and a glass fell and shattered by an occupied table.  The wait staff just finished up their business before checking on the affected patrons.  That seemed weird.  They could have been cut or gotten glass on them.  Seemed very uncaring not to check on them immediately.

Great location, people watching, food/bev, but oddly uncaring service.

Great service! Recommend for a decent breakfast/brunch. Ate here at 12:30 on a Friday and got seated right away. Food arrived quickly. I had the veggie omelet, which was packed with veggies-def didn't skimp. But, it desperately needed some salt, and was a little overcooked. The home potatoes were awesome! And yummy english muffin. My hubby had the cinnaroll waffle, which wasn't overly sweet and was delicious. He had a side of bacon that was overcooked. The people next to us got the chicken and waffles and said they were fabulous. Overall,  good.

I've been there twice now the first time was when it had first opened slow service friendly staff decent food you get chocolate at the end with your bill (it was terrible tasting) we had even ordered dessert since it's what the place was known for it wasn't very good (the second time we went we noticed the dessert menu was totally changed) second time around we get seated in a tiny table outside in 90 degree weather with load traffic jams beside us we sat there for about 30 min waiting for out waitress almost was about to just leave when she finally came around we asked to be moved inside there were people smoking and it was too hot to be on the patio they let us move inside but the table was still basically outside literally right in between in and out even though the dining room was almost completely empty we waited about 30 more minutes for water we placed out orders at the same time then waited a good 45 minutes for food it tasted fine the portions were small we left hungry after paying over $100 for a 2 meals I obviously wouldn't recommend this place go next door to Paris way better food and service

After we meandered in to the restaurant looking for the bar section, we accidentally ended up in the regular dining area. Our server Sean didn't skip a beat and seated and served us promptly. In a nutshell, service was great. However, the food was pretty average which was too bad since I really wanted to give this place 5 stars.

We went for the smoking bubble drinks, our server Steven was AMAZING!!! Our drinks were spot on and would totally recommend them, the purple dragon was my favorite! Steven helped point us in the direction of some awesome spots to visit on the strip along with providing us with a great experience while at Hexx. We plan on going back for their amazing breakfast today and hope he is there to serve us! Thanks Steven for being SO NICE to girls from the East Coast!!!!

Hexx.....Way better than Sugar ever was!  For those of you that don't know Sugar was previously in this location.  Service was excellent!  The sausage pizza was simple but amazing!  I loved the twist on an original sausage pizza with the addition of pesto and baby spinach.  So good!  Of course you have to try dessert since it is their specialty.  The mini gourmet ice cream cone sampler was so fun and deliscious.  The ice cream was truly gourmet; very flavorful and creamy.  Definitely coming back!

We went here for late dinner when we stayed at Paris hotel in Vegas. The location of this restaurant is simply amazing with the views of Fountain at Bellagio. There was no wait and had plenty of seats as we went late. Service was good and food was excellent. We ordered Sandwiches and Pizza and both were pretty tasty. One main factor I would not go there even though everything else is good is, this place is expensive and not for weak pockets.

I ate lunch at Hexx today and was quite disappointed after reading such great reviews. We waited 45 minutes for our food, and judging by the ice cold steak placed in front of me, our food waited for quite a while too. My eggs, ordered over medium, were basically raw. My tablemate's diablo Bloody Mary was just horrible, although the other bloody Mary's we ordered were decent. To top off the already mediocre experience, we were seated in the rain and had to move to a new table ourselves after asking the waitstaff to move us several times. Not the experience I expect when paying $40/head pre-alcohol.

Was passing through Vegas and stopped here for lunch. We had lobster roll and hexx burger. Both were delicious. The lobster roll was perfectly seasoned. Our server was attentive. Location is great, right across from the Bellagio.

We had a Groupon and went here yesterday for Sunday brunch. It was busy as usual but the wait time wasn't bad at all (10min maybe). The food and service was excellent.  My only issue is we were seated next to the back exit door by the band area, and there were a couple times the kitchen crew took out the garbage. The sight of trash bins being dragged out a few feet away from your table takes away from an otherwise pleasant dining experience.
Breakfast was delish! Turkey club, ymmmm. Thanks Julia for great service. Good for people watching.

Burger was well done. Way too hot. It was so done i burnt my mouth. Asked for medium. Artichoke cheese appetizer small. My son's spaghetti and meatballs was lack luster. They did not charge me for hamberger but overall place is expensive a food a three star for they way the sell the place.

A decent spot for brunch on the Strip

*Hostess stand is located at the entrance facing the strip..if you enter in through Paris, you'll have to walk through the dining area to reach the stand.

Wait: ~25 minutes without a reservation around noon.. they ask for your phone number & will text when your table is ready

Ordered: Pork Rinds with lime Vinaigrette,Corned beef hash, Steak & Eggs, Meat Omelete

Wait for food: Pork rinds came out shortly after ordering (served cold) & just as we were finishing up..our waiter stated that our entrees would be ready shortly after

The food: Pork Rinds with lime Vinaigrette- portioned for sharing with the table, vinaigrette paired perfectly with the pork rinds
Corned beef hash- smaller portion than expected, I helped my table finish the rest of their food. Poached Egg was overcooked.
Steak & Eggs-Prime rib eye steak was chewier than preferred. Presentation was poor
Meat Omelete--filled with plenty of small meat bits, egg itself was overcooked. Presentation was sloppy

Service: Good. Servers were friendly,attentive, and checked in regularly throughout our meal. Small snafu--server removed our appetizer plates and utensils before our mains arrived and did not replace the utensils. We sat for a couple minutes (eager to eat) but without utensils.

Ambiance: The main dining room gets pretty loud. Considering the number of bachelor/bachelorette groups & unlimited mimosas..I believe it's to be expected.

Overall: Decent casual brunch experience--could be improved by greater attention to food portion and presentation.

Great find! We were super impressed with the service.  Parish (the nice man outside) explained the menu to us and convinced us to go in and we're so glad we did! Very high quality food for a moderate price.  The broccolini appetizer is a must; we also got the filet and NY strip which were both cooked perfectly and very yummy.  We sat at the bar to get 2 for 1 peach cocktails that were so good, in a pint glass, and only $10 for two! Molly our bartender was also very kind to us.  Would recommend for anyone looking for a fancy dinner that won't empty your wallet.

best chicken a day waffles I've ever had, not like I'm a connoisseur of chicken and waffles or anything. all I know is I wish I had it right now, for the 2nd day in a row. yummm! it gets four stars for service though it was about 5am or 6am...

Awesome awesome awesome . 
Our server Sean was so cool kind and attentive. Drinks food interior everything was on point. My friend had birthday day before so he brought her little cake with candle. Champagnes jelly dessert it's must have! Thanks guys!!!!
This place is awesome!! We had the Ribeye and it was delicious!! Kevin is a great Server!! We will be back for sure!!

I come here every time I'm im Vegas! 
I love the fact their outside patio is right on the strip! 
The plus side is that you can watch the waters of Bellagio show while having your meal! ;) 
Menu options are really good with reasonable prices. 
Really recommend this place! :)
All 4 of our foods were cold, soda had no carbonation. Took quite a while for the food to come through. 3 stars for presentation of food. Server was nice, music was decent, however not coming back.
Tracee was absolutely awesome. Extremely attentive and highly personable. This place does not disappoint. Always great food and service!

absolute garbage food.....good service but the food is ridiculously overpriced for what you get....steaks are dry and not cooked properly....the management makes the customer feel bad for complaining about the food not being good....no apologies, no refunds.....the worst on the strip......DO NOT EAT HERE

On a recent Christmas Holiday trip to Las Vegas where we stayed at Paris Las Vegas Hotel& Casino,we had breakfast at HEXX kitchen+bar. Upon entering and being ushered to the hostess and after requesting if we could sit indoors but near the windows, we were immediately escorted to a table right at the front of the restaurant that provided a view of the strip as well as the Fountains of Bellagio directly across the street. The waiter who oversaw our servers was named Sean and he,along with the rest of his team, provided very attentive service and our breakfast selections prepared exactly as we had requested. When we were ready to leave they even brought us additional coffee in 'to go" cups,rather than just giving us what remained at our table. Excellent food and outstanding staff that provided one of our best dining experiences of our trip! We will definitely return and would highly recommend HEXX kitchen + bar.
Really good food and great service from Sean and Alex, keep it up! From your strong black coffee guests from Sweden

I came to Hexx with a group of 4 for brunch on a Saturday morning around 11am. The wait was not very long, just 15 minutes. The staff is very nice and the restaurant is very pretty yet casual. I love that the atmosphere is relaxed but has a higher end feel. We all ordered the bottomless mimosas which were $23 each person and shared the smothered fries. The smothered fries were very good. The fries held up very well even though they were topped off with gravy, pulled pork, cheese curds and cheddar cheese! 
For my entree I ordered the corned beef hash. It really was not what I expected. Its made with grated sweet potatoes and Brussels sprouts. It was good but what disappointed me was that it was missing the crispiness that I expect with corned beef hash. I did however enjoy  the poached egg, great touch!  
I tried a bite of my friends entrees also. I really liked the Johnny cakes great texture. I would not recommend the chilaquiles, they are pretty much nachos. The tortilla chips do not hold up well at all. The majority of them were very soggy. 
So overall I enjoyed the restaurant itself, service was good, and food was good but not as expected from reading the menu
TRACY TOOK CARE OF US IN THE BEST WAY. She was amazing. We appreciate her so much, even though she is a cancer and cancers are crazy. She's amazing

Our waitress Tracee was amazing and had a fun personality, making the experience that much better. The food is amazing, and the bottomless mimosas will leave you feeling some type of way (but only if served by Tracee). Xoxo

It may have been wrong time of the year and the chef on vacation but service was awful and the food even worse. I ordered spaghetti meatballs and the sauce was directly of the can and meatballs cold and dry (tasted like old falafel ). I wish I could give one more star for the view but the view couldn't make up for the horrible food.

One of the better casual restaurants on the strip. Their best quality: the employees. Our waitress, Joana tops them all. She was very attentive regardless of the number of tables she has. We did not feel rushed, in fact, she made us feel like we are her only customers! That's quite a feat. She made four ladies happy with our bottomless mimosas . 
The food was pretty good albeit pricey. Try the steak and eggs, and don't skip the potatoes that come with it. Take the carbs, it's worth it.

We went to Hexx for the first time this past Sunday because I had a family member in town that wanted to eat out on the strip. With 4 out of 5 stars and over 1,000 reviews I expected way more. 

It only took about 10 minutes for us to get seated, but over an hour for the four of us to receive our food! The service was very slow and the waitress was very forgetful. We had to literally ask them what was taking so long with our food.... then 10 minutes later we got our order. A group of 10 girls got seated 30 minutes after us and got all their food at the same time we got ours!  Also, we did not order bottomless mimosas, but we still expect our beverages to be refilled every now and then.

I wanted to give only one star for the awful service, but gave two because the food was pretty good. The Hexx benedict was okay (I've had better eggs benedict) but the burgers were good and the carrot cake pancakes were super yum!  

All in all, I probably won't be going back. Not impressed. We arrived at 1pm and left at 3pm. It shouldn't take that long to get lunch.

Very disappointed. The positives first: attractive trendy looking restaurant. Located at front of Paris casino so you get a nice view of strip if u want it. My protein breakfast was very good (chicken egg whites etc). But everything else was sub par. Took almost 20 min to get 2 sodas n even then I had to tell the manager we were waiting on them. The French dip was overcooked & lacked flavor. For less than their $19 price, my hubby has had way better. The spinach dip tasted so bad he didn't want another bite. Once you're seated and get bumped by other patrons and your server trips over your chair 2-3 times, you realize the layout is way too crowded- like management didn't account for being at full capacity when they placed the chairs.  In fact, my work blazer ended up on the floor twice after the woman seated back-to-back with me stood up and bumped it off my chair as she kept squeezing in & out of her seat (she was a very slim woman btw).  Overall, a pretty poor experience, especially when you consider the price for everything.
Love this place. Love all the drinks. However our server was not the friendliest. Glad we had some drinks there tho.

The $36 cocktails are big enough to share and they are awesome! The waiter we had was slow and seemed like he really hated his job. We had to ask a hostess if we even had a waiter. Ask for a patio seat! You can see the bellagio water show from the patio. Food wasn't that great or worth the money. The online menu needs some updating.

I appreciate the ambition to do fresh food as the menu states and not to use mass produced product.  My wife and I are both disappointed with the food. Perhaps we're being a bit unfair since we had dinner yesterday at one of Ramsay's restaurants, but we're not likely going to be back. Too many other better choices. 
The broccolini starter was so pungent and the florets so overly dried out that after one bite we asked that it be removed.  The waiter removed it from our table but not the bill. Disappointing. 
My wife had the scampi. The sauce was thin and lacked flavor. She's had scampi at many fine restaurants and knows her stuff. I tried it and thought exactly the same. 
I decided to go safe after the broccolini incident and went with the classic burger. I asked for it prepared medium. It was medium well but still juicy. The cheddar they chose has good flavor but is extra dry so is not a good melting cheese. This dry texture on a juicy burger may not be for all. 
My burger came with simple French fries. They looked good but we're quite soft. 
Overall the atmosphere is quite good, it's modern but touches remind you this is at the Paris hotel. The service was fine. It's located directly across from the Bellagio so the view is good. 
Is this restaurant the Paris Hotel's answer to the Bellagio Cafe since both are open 24 hours?  It only wins if you care less about food and more about a patio with a view.

We're locals and frequent this place. This is a tourist spot that makes you feel like a local.  The view,  the service,  the atmosphere,  the food all keeps me coming back.  There are many places to spend your money, but this is one of the favorites and I look forward to coming back here and enjoying new items on the menu. It's hard to be overlooking the Bellagio Fountains.  The cauliflower is amazing, the charcuterie  board is a favorite, and the deserts are delicious.  Ask for Brad to serve you. He's top notch!

It was pretty empty when I got here around 5:30. The customer service is ok.. I asked them to get a side of mashed potatoes, they didn't get it for me. They messed up my steak and it was well done. 

Our waiter was pretty rude, because he was like yea whatever. It took about 20-25 minutes and everything was salty, there was nothing good about this place. 


I don't recommend this place because their service is bad as their food. Save your money and go somewhere else.

Every single time I come to Vegas...I MUST come eat breakfast here! The food is delicious and it is located right in the middle of the strip. Outside seating is the best! Get to people watch and you get to see the fountain show across the street. 

I love their decor too!

Beautiful fountain views from in or outside candied bacon with mayonnaise Late night desserts   

Alexia was a pleasure to have and suggested a great menu for us tonight- highly recommended

We stopped in for desert and found it delicious. We enjoyed peanut butter cheesecake and s'mores semifredo. Both were very good but the semifredo was my favorite. We also ordered a Peach Julep and a Desert Smash and they were very tasty.

This place is amazing! The food was fantastic and the service was even better. Sean and Shannon were our waiters and they killed it. Super attentive and nice. We had bottomless mimosas and Shannon came around often to refill. He even gave us to go cups at the end! We were in Vegas for a bachelorette party and Sean made the bride-to-be feel so special. 

Hexx is a lot of fun and super lively. The music is pumping and people are having a great time. Definitely check it out and tell Sean and Shannon we say hi :)
Stopped in for appetizers but was disappointed with the selections. Ordered the Poutine fries (they may have been described as gravy instead) but the look was unappetizing. The fries were soggy.

Delicious brunch food and bottomless mimosas is my kind of place!!! It's $23 for the mimosas or you can get a $36 Bloody Mary which also looks on point but I am more of the bottomless type  
One disappointment I had was the fact that you can't mix juices on the mimosas, I prefer passion fruit or pineapple in my mimosas but I choked down the orange bc it was a good ratio. 
We ordered the chilaquiles and the french dip which were yummy, but I have had better in my home town (hard to beat San Antonio chilaquiles). They also brought the champagne ice free for my birthday which was really tasty!!

I had the burger here and it was delicious! But the one problem I had was that it was a little pricy and the menu barley had any entrees available. But if u like burgers this place does have a pretty rockin burger!

Our server JP was awesomeness!!!  Catered to our needs and went above and beyond.  Jalape√±o pancakes are to die for.  Buttermilk pancakes are the best I've ever had.  
Pear naked lady drink was perfect!  Would have more of them if I could but one was enough to get me tipsy.

Upscale trendy decor and atmosphere. Enjoy patio dining on a cool night with an excellent view of the street life and the Bellagio fountains. Come hungry, food is delicious and the white chocolate bun burger is a must! We will definitely visit again!

First things first. Kevin, our server, was a great all around fun guy. Social, energetic, and quick. Joked with him through our entire meal. Good guy and would ask for him upon request next time (if I decided to return).

My food was good but not great. I had the Hexx burger which included American cheese, fried onions, bacon, lettuce, tomato, white chocolate bun. My main YELP photo is actually of the burger. It was flavorful beef and the burger all together wasn't too shabby but the lettuce was literally one of those wedges of lettuce. The chunk was so large I thought Vegas would soon be going through a lettuce famine.
