I guess it may be considered "cool" when creating the menu but no one past, present, or future needs or wants that much lettuce on any type of sandwich.

With so many options on the Strip I wouldn't return as the only memorable thing is that damn lettuce.

I loved the attitudes of all the staff at this restaurant. I can't remember the last time the staff was so playful and felt genuinely happy to be working at a restaurant. I came here during slow hours for brunch, and the fried chicken and waffle was delicious!

I'm not sure how they got the fried chicken to be so crisp, but it was definitely one of the top 3 fried chicken and waffles I've eaten. There's a slight spicy kick to the dish that I found enjoyable, but it's a little bit different from your normal fried chicken and waffle place. The portion size was generous, and I was struggling to finish everything.

I don't like Vegas, but I'd definitely drop by here again if I come back to this city!

I ordered a Groupon for 33$ for 50$ worth of food at Hexx kitchen. This is one of the restaurants "you don't judge a book by its cover". From the outside it seemed like an average restaurant located near the Paris hotel and the beer park. Going in -the layout, seating were perfect. There was a terrace with heaters but it was too cold to sit outside in Dec.

Food: my friend and I ordered a bunch of appetizers to share instead of a main meal- tapas style. 
White bean hummus (3/5) was served a little chilled with pieces of naan like bread-it complimented well with the roasted cauliflower (3/5) that had curry styled spices; the baked spinach dip (3/5) was really nice that came with bagel chips; macaroni and cheese (2/5) a white cheddar based Mac -it lacked salt, but was perfectly cooked; lobster creamed corn (5/5) was by far my most favourite dish- the spice level was perfect with a generous amount of lobster. 

For dessert : cake and shake (5/5) this dessert was so pretty! cream cheese mouse with a chocolate milkshake that comes in a cute souvenir mixer. I couldn't finish it- because I was so stuffed. My friend had a vegan based chocolate pudding that she enjoyed. 

We has to pack most of our food to go, with so many leftovers!

A big shout out to Moon for his incredible service. He even made sure I has no ice in my water each time. The attention for detail put me in awe and is really what highlights his excellent customer service! 

Thank you Hexx Kitchen for a wonderful dining experience!
24 hours...except when they don't want to be. Unapologetic, rude, terrible experience. 7am breakfast shouldn't be so hard.

We came in to be greeted quickly. There was no wait for a table.

We choose the outside patio, as it quieter and quite lovely. The waiter greeted us and they offered three types of water: Pellegrino, Fiji and tap. The water show in Vegas goes on right a crossed from the outside dinning. Nice entertainment while you wait for your meal. 

We order the gravy and fries, aka poutine, chicken and waffles and I ordered the shrimp scampi. 

You have to wait for your food, so don't be in a rush. It's upper class and the average meal is $25.00 bucks, apps around $10.00 

The people next to us got a really cool looking drink. Bubbling blue monstrosity. 

The fries came out quickly and my brother said they were really good. Crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside. The gravy was hot and toasty and the curd were stringy. The ranch is defiantly made in house and vey creamy but it's a little more sour than your average ranch, sour cream based. 

The scampi was very good, the sauce wasn't too thick and very buttery. The chili was a nice note. And bread was my favorite part soft and buttery nicely toasted. 

The chicken and waffles my brother said it was juicy, the breeding could have been a little crispier, the pickles/onion slaw were really good and the waffle was crisp and pretty standard Belgium waffle, real maple syrup. The bite all together was quite delicious.

Definitely a place to try on the strip.

I would definitely make reservations at this place if you want to start your day with a good food and a boozy brunch. My friends and I had 24 hours in Vegas and this was our first stop. You can get all you can drink mimosas for $23 along with delicious brunch food. 

Our waitress was very attentive and kept refilling our glasses without us asking. I had the Ham and Cheese croissant which was soooo good. It was actually a lot bigger than I thought. It was so cold outside so we got to sit inside at little tables but it would be nice to sit on the patio to people watch on the strip!

I'm a local and happened to be down on the strip when a friend was visiting one morning so I stopped here for breakfast before heading home. Sat on the patio which has a great view for people watching and also the bellagio fountains. I got the veggie omelet which was delicious!! It didn't come with cheese (which I didn't notice) but the waitress suggested it so I was glad she did ($2 extra)The portions were very generous - my omelet was huge and there were a ton of potatoes along with an English muffin so I had leftovers as well! I love breakfast leftovers so definitely a win for me!

Let me start by saying I've been here before and had a delicious meal, so good I had to come back on this trip. This time I had a horrible experience. I ordered the filet mignon and a tortilla soup. Waited about 10 minutes for the soup, which I didn't mind, but it was the wrong soup! Brought the right one out 5 minutes later. Waited an additional 20 minutes for the main course, they brought us the wrong order. I was starving and craving the food I ordered, but with a fussy baby, I wasn't waiting any longer. That's what happens when the waiter doesn't write anything down.
Amazing Food. Excellent staff.  Polite and courteous.  Seated quickly and food came out on time and it tasted Amazing.  Great decor.

Amazing place with amazing service. Got the Benedict and it was perfection. The mimosas are also very strong and they don't cheap out on the champagne. Sean was awesome and he was helping us before we even needed more water or mimosas. He was super nice. Thanks for the amazing service Sean!

This place was a disaster from the get go... The host rude, the server had no personality and only did the bare minimum, the managers just stood and talked to each other, and the food was mediocre at best. I get it's a high turnover restaurant and they will never see most of the people that come in again, but as a local I would never go back just from the lack of hospitality.

Sean and Patrick are positive, friendly, and wonderful people to be around. Definitely go there and ask for them. Also Sean is an author of positive body image, which is a beautiful and important thing.

The decor and ambiance of this restaurant is modern and classy. 

My fianc√© and I had the same dish. The fettuccine bolognese. I though it was ok because it lacked flavor. I tried some of my fianc√©'s and hers had more flavor. Their seemed to be a lack of consistency in the food.

Our waiter made recommendations of a brocollini appetizer and a Cabernet wine, both of which we ordered and loved. 

The view of the strip is great.

My boyfriend and I work having a slow start to the morning and arrived late to bottomless mimosa brunch with our friends. The "bottomless" deal was about to end, but Julio talked to the manager and allowed us to do one hour of bottomless mimosas. The chicken and waffle breakfast was amazing as well. So thankful for Julio our fabulous server and being so accommodating, quickly refilling drinks, very friendly, knowledgeable about the menu and making our experience great!

This place is really beautiful and the food is decent but the service was terrible. The Host/Hostess were the rudest I have ever encountered at a restaurant! Our server was okay but she didn't seem thrilled to be serving myself, my husband, and our 2 year old son. He was just playing with my phone and not causing a scene, and my husband and I were not being disrespectful or making unreasonable demands so I don't know why we were treated so poorly. I would never recommend this place to anyone. Save your money, time, emotional and mental well being and go to any other restaurant but here!!!

This place has a great patio with a view of the Bellagio Fountains.  The whole staff was very friendly, from the host to the bartender (while I waited for my patio table) And the waitress.  

They gave me an amazing table (see the photo to see my view).  Their food is good, I had a Ceviche and, my guilty pleasure, Mac and cheese.  I have to confess that I liked the Ceviche way better, the max was missing some flavor.

The prices are not the cheapest for cocktails, a martini was like $18.  For the food, as I ordered an appetizer and a side, it was a good price.  But is Vegas and that's what you can expect.

Overall, I had a very nice experience.

Huge disappointment after reading previous reviews. The service left so much to be desired compared to what we had experienced at all the other restaurants we had gone to while staying in Vegas.  Not once were we ever asked how are meal was or if there was anything else they could bring us. We split the prime burger and was told it was far better than the Hexx burger that was no longer on the menu. Well our server was wrong. For starters if came out rare and because we were never checked on after it was served I went without eating as rare hamburger is not my thing. For $25 I expected better and I certainly expected better customer service. Hopefully others will have a better experience but this place will not be on my list on the next trip.

When in Vegas, you just don't get up early enough for breakfast but this particular day I was craving breakfast. I came upon this place through yelp and it's opened 24/7! They had breakfast menu at noon! Score! I had the veggie omelet and it was descent. Nothing really exciting but the potatoes were good! I also got the carrot cake pancake to share with the table. It was a little dry but still good. So if you're up for breakfast food late in the afternoon then you can always be sure to find it here. Thank you for serving breakfast for this late sleeper!

Hexx offers semi-private, bar, indoor and outdoor seating with Bellagio fountain views @ your table. We ordered the following appetizers - hummus, crab-cake, calamari & a shrimp cocktail.  Everything was very fresh & tasty. Our servers were prompt and friendly. 
*if you drink bottled water - San Pellegrino & Fiji are available for water service,  recommended.
The food and the service were both amazing, plus we had a great view of the fountains at the Bellagio. Get the mashed potatoes, you wont be disappointed.

Awesome food and service by Steven. The antipasto salad was delicious. The pizza was just as good. Portions are big enough for you to split. The chocolate dessert to die for. Sit on the patio for great people watching. Great on the strip restaurant.

Been to HEXX for dinner and brunch and both times were great experiences. I love the high tables and tall windows with all the natural light shining in and the overall modern/upscale feel. Wouldn't expect it to be as reasonably priced as it is compared to other Vegas restaurants. 

Food: When I came for dinner there was a little hiccup where the server never put in my order and then when my steak finally came out it was overcooked, so I had to send it back and wait some more. The key manager on duty was a little off putting when I was explaining the situation, but the server was very apologetic and everything was fixed right away and the steak was delicious I would definitely order it again. Mac and cheese wasn't that great so I'd probably get a different side. For brunch I got the Carbonara Pizza, with the crispy bacon and cheesy fontina, I almost ate the whole thing it was so yummy!

Drinks: HEXX's bubbling potions are fun to share and get you where you need to be, if ya know what I mean. They are pretty pricey but hey you're in Vegas enjoy yourself! If you come for brunch opt in for the bottomless mimosas, loosen up and enjoy your fave jams courtesy of the live dj!

Very disappointed with this place! Looked every where for this place because I wanted something sweet! They claim to close at 1am, I arrived at 12:19 and asked for a dessert menu and was advised that they closed early due to the "slow season." The hostess was also very unpleasant as she didn't seem like she wanted to help, or care. Wow. 1 star for getting me all excited about getting a sugar fix only to disappoint me. Not cool Hexx...

I was sad to see Sugar Factory go, but I have one a half hour away at home so all is good there... this is the NEW Sugar Factory located across the street from the Bellagio Fountains right outside Paris.  They are also open 24 hours.  Their breakfast menu appealed to me, but we stopped in for lunch on our last day in Vegas before heading to the airport.  2 chicken sandwiches, one turkey club, 2 glasses of sangria = $98!!!  Yes, the food was good however being in Vegas and all, it's pricey.

My friends ordered the chicken sandwich and I got the turkey club which was actually too big for most people's mouths...I had to remove the inner piece of bread.  I was debating getting chicken & waffles but I ended up with the sandwich paired with the white sangria which was delicious!  I asked our server for a recommendation, she gave us the white.

Good location...good service.  Next door you can find ice cream, cookies, chocolate, all kinds of neat gifts - none which I bought, but this place is absolutely worth a visit while browsing the Vegas strip!

Dinner with my husband. the spinach and artichoke dip and Broccolini appetizer were to die for. Al had the jambalaya (better than New Orleans) and I had the short ribs (melt in your mouth tenderness). Our server Jessica and Manager Mike Main were very attentive. We even got a complimentary dessert. Our over all experience was excellent.
Went here for breakfast and had the cinnamon roll waffle and iced mocha. Both awesome. Cool view of the from the table, friendly staff. Going back for dessert tonight and can't wait.

Amazing food but very slow service. We waited approximately 1 hour to be seated (pretty hungry at that point) and then it took another 10 mins for the server to order our food. Then another 30 minutes for our food to come out and then took forever to get the check! Great food but not worth all the waiting.

Great Bloody  Mary's  &  Eggs Benedict. Sit outside to people watch and great view of fountains at Bellagio.  Shrimp salad is tasty too!  Hang at the bar for a casual burger and fries after a late night on the strip:)

A huge disappointment! Not good service either. Was offered a tequila shot by waiter asked about 3 different higher end tequilas each time waiter came back & didn't have them. Just assumed when offered tequila,place had a good assortment,wrong! Asked for 2 types of WHISKEY instead....NOPE ended up w/ a weak pour of Jack Daniels! Caesar salad was bland & NOT crisp & Magherita pizza was luke warm & NOT cooked well. Tough time getting ice tea refills too. Great people watching though,could have done that for less than $87 though!Like I said, other than the outside seating,a complete waste of time & money & very disappointing!Stay away!!

My sister and I were looking for a place around town to eat at. I saw this place and they had lobster roll my favorite. 
We came to restaurant around 1:15pm expecting high expectations as always since I work in the restaurant industry. 
We got sat at around 1:15 it took 10 minutes for us to get served. I had to flag another server who then told me my servers name "Spencer " but she can take our drink orders. Erick was the busser he was AMAZING !! He was so respectful , very attentive .. honestly he needs to be a server . 
Spencer didn't come to our table until I asked for him to do so.. why would I have to ask for my server to come to my table that should be common sense ? Right .. anyway he took our food order .. my cocktail came first then my hot tea why would that happen ? I have no idea improper training no reason why this should happen neither .. now .. moving on food took another 45 minutes to come out the manager came to the table with fruit to apologize meanwhile our server said the food is ready .. confusing .. We told the manager it's been hour she argued with her customers that ticket time"30minutes " no reason why manager should argue with customer rule of thumb .. anyway horrible customer service .. will never go back ever again .. very tasty food .. the restaurant can make good money if they train their manager and servers correctly .. servers should always work as a team .. no reason why my plate should be sitting on my table for 20 minutes and take 20 minutes get my Check .. I was on vacation I wasted my whole day in this establishment ..

Service was awesome. Lupe gave us great recommendations and was very excited about the food here! I had the short ribs with Brussel sprouts and I have to say I've never had better brussels in my life. They were perfection. My husband had the scallops and he really enjoyed them. For dessert we had the cake and shake and it was the perfect light dessert to end an amazing meal.

We used to love this place when it was the sugar factory, the food was awesome and the people watching on the patio justified strip prices. Now that it's changed to Hexx the coffee is not great, but the food is still average. Today we came with a specific request to sit by the railing on the patio - a request that came with a wait. We waited for our table and we were placed on the patio far from the rail. As a local, we don't pay strip prices for something less than what we ask for ... we requested to be moved to one of the several open rail tables and were told we would have to wait. Seeing as how we had already waited, this was upsetting. A conversation with the "manager" revealed that she wouldn't move us because people specifically wait for those tables ... read above. She was very unpleasant and unapologetic for the lack of service. We left today and didn't have breakfast. We will not be coming back and hope that tourists heed our warning - you will pay a lot for breakfast here, it's not worth the cost when the food is average but the service is terrible.

Came here with a group of 12 people and despite some minor errors, I had an enjoyable dinner experience here. The interior of the restaurant was very pretty spacious, with patio seating available outside if you want a view of the strip. It would've been nice for brunch but since it was too cold, my group opted to sit inside. 

We wanted to try some drinks so we ordered 2 HEXX potions, the Jungle Juice and the Kinky Fruit. Obviously 2 wasn't enough for 12 people but all we wanted was to try a little bit so we didn't mind. I personally didn't like the Jungle Juice because it had Malibu in it (yuck) but my friends seemed to enjoy it. They are overpriced but I think it's cute and fun to watch the dry ice do its work. 

For food, my friend and I ordered the smothered fries and jambalaya. The smothered fries was basically a plate of fries covered in BBQ gravy, cheese curds, and pulled pork. I didn't taste any BBQ in the gravy but I actually didn't mind it. They gave a generous amount of pulled pork, so much that we didn't have enough fries to go with it. The dish was super heavy and filling but I would still recommend since who doesn't like fries, right??

The jambalaya was definitely ON FIRE. I'm usually disappointed at many restaurants' versions of "spicy" jambalaya because they're never actually spicy but HEXX got it right. The dish was pretty spicy and they gave SO MUCH SHRIMP! Ugh it was so good...I would definitely get this dish again if I were to come back. 

I got to try some of my friends' bucatini carbonara and tomato & burrata. The tomato & burrata was very light and refreshing, a nice contrast to our heavy dishes. I really liked how the sourdough toast was perfectly crunchy! The bucatini carbonara was very creamy and again, the restaurant gave a very generous amount of bacon! Unfortunately, my friend found a piece of plastic wrapper (?) in the dish so the restaurant had to make us another one. What I thought was unfair was that the restaurant took the original dish (which my friend ordered with chicken and garlic bread) and when they brought back a new one, there was no chicken or garlic bread. Like um, excuse me? My friend didn't mind but if that had happened to me, I definitely would've said something. 

Overall, my experience at HEXX was enjoyable. However, because of the carbonara incident, I would have to give a solid 3.5 stars. Service was good though and at the end, our waitress even split our bill for us 6 ways for our convenience. I have to say the food is overpriced but...it's Vegas so what can you do...

It's an OKAY restaurant. Lots of hype on the reviews but it's not worth the price and the desert is pretty small for the price. We got a brownie with espresso ice cream. Brownie was good, ice cream was not.

Waitress was extremely rude for literally no reason  and every other worker we talked to (the seater etc). Wouldn't recommend it at all after our experience.

Was f√ºr eine leckere Pizza Carbonara! Der beste Boden, den ich seit Jahren gegessen habe! Als ein schusseliger Ober ein Glas mit Pellegrino Wasser auf unserem Tisch vergossen hat, wurde die Flasche am Ende nicht berechnet - immerhin 10$.
Unbedingt √ºber groupon.com einen Voucher kaufen!

Dined here for dessert with the Lip Smacking Food Tour. Sat outside on a warm night and watched all the hustle and bustle of The Strip. The cake was unlike any cake we have had before. (even had candles to celebrate our anniversary...aww...) Service was prompt and informative.  Will return for full menu dining.

This restaurant took us by surprise, we stopped and ate here cause it was open when we landed which was super early turns out they are a 24/7 establishment. The food however isn't what you'd expect from an all night place I highly recommend the cinnawaffle with mixed berries but any you order will be great. Another tip ask to be in Steven section awesome server and very helpful.

We decided to do a nice dinner on our last night in Vegas at Hexx. I was browsing the groupon deals earlier in the day and I had seen a deal for Hexx. The menu looked pretty good so when it was closer to dinner time, I bought the groupon and we decided to check it out.

It was about 9pm and we were able to sit outside on the patio overlooking the fountains which was nice. Soon after seating the waiter took our drink order and I asked about how I go about applying the groupon. He then told me just to show him my phone when we get our bill. Okay. No problem. But then he goes on to tell me it has to be more than 4 hours since buying the groupon. Well I had maybe bought it about 1-2 hours prior to dinner.  It wasn't a new groupon that had rolled out that same day or anything. I read all the fine print prior to purchasing any groupon out of habit and nowhere does it read that it must be 4 hours before I can use it. I conveyed this information to the waiter who then proceeds to tell me "Oh, I'm SURE it's on there." So at this point I'm a little frustrated/annoyed. I reread the fine print. I was then told it wasn't their policy but groupon's policy. So I was thinking "hmm that's weird" because earlier in the day we purchased the groupon for the Eiffel Tower experience literally 5 min before walking up without issues. And when I read groupon faq's, all it reads is "most Groupons can be used right after purchase, up until the expiration date, but may not be combined with other specials or promos". Again, I was told this 4 hour clause had to be on the site. We'd been walking around all day. We were hungry. So not wanting to wait the 3 hours more, we decided to leave.

I figure since the waiter wasn't very empathetic and guaranteed I had somehow misread the fine print, that I would ask the lady at the door. She told me they had apparently just had a meeting on groupons and this is the information that they had been told but that she would ask a manager for us. To make this part short, the manager came out (who was definitely more understanding) and scanned our groupon and it amazingly worked within maybe an hour and a half of being purchased... Lol. All that trouble? 

We were seated back at the same table. It was shift change and we had a super nice waitress (wish I could remember her name). We ordered and everything went pretty smoothly from there on out. We had the spinach and artichoke dip which was about average. I had the shrimp scampi which was pretty good. They were more generous with their shrimp than I was expecting. My boyfriend had the chicken and waffles and ate everything on his plate so I'm assuming he enjoyed his food. His plate was also a decent portion size. He originally ordered the jambalaya and although it was good it was way too spicy for him to eat comfortably. I did feel the food was a little overpriced for the quality but it IS Vegas. 

I am glad we had a groupon though. But, I guess I wouldn't have been so put off by the initial service if I didn't have a groupon. 

Just be aware and buy your groupon well in advance y'all. It will save you the hassle.

Came to the bar this past weekend. I was excited about trying their Bloody Mary because I've read reviews saying they had one of the best ones in Vegas. To my disappointment the bartender was totally rude. She gave us a menu and completely ignored us after. My husband even said 'excuse me' to her a couple of times when she walked by but she just kept walking. Mind you the restaurant was DEAD  at that time and it was just us 2 and another couple at the bar but the bartender was way too concentrated on helping one couple. We ended up leaving without ordering anything and definitely will not be back here.

We made a reservation on OpenTable and all our special request were met when we arrived. We were seated immediately on the patio just like we requested. 

We choose the outside patio, as it quieter and quite lovely. The waiter greeted us and they offered three types of water: Pellegrino, Fiji, and tap. One of the reasons we choose the patio is because you can see the fountains of Bellagio show beautiful entertainment while you wait for your meal. 

We ordered the shrimp scampi, spaghetti with meatballs and the chicken parmesan! Everyone enjoyed the food with some white wine as well. They also have a very large selection of wines which was really nice!

I must say that you do have to wait for your food, so don't be in a rush (the fountain show makes the time go by a lot quicker).

My scampi was very good, the sauce wasn't too thick and very buttery. They are also really generous with the shrimp! And the bread was my favorite part soft and buttery nicely toasted. 

Definitely, a place to try on the strip!

Had to come through and show them some love on the review . I was part of a party of like 50-60 ppl who came in at different times throughout the time of the brunch ... and they were very attentive and had us covered amongst the chaos . Big shout out to the black waiter dude who started a month ago . Make sure you keep him !
Hexx was great! Our server Taylor was very attentive and super fun, we'd come back here any time we're in Vegas. Great food and awesome servers. Thank you!!

Tracee was awesome! We missed work because she was so goood too us LOL THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR EVERYTHING! 


Also, great mimosas.

Rafael was awesome! He was so friendly and fun! The food is awesome here. Bottomless mimosas are only $23 so worth it. He was so quick and easy going with our complicated orders it made it so easy to order! I have never had such great service. Thank you Rafael for being such an amazing server! This man should be CEO!!! Such a lady charmer.

I'm in Vegas for a night, business trip. This place has great food, great service, and a great view of the Bellagio (it's on open concept). I requested an outside table which could frustrate a server since I am a party of 1 and taking up prime real estate.  The severs made me feel welcome and even brought out a complimentary dessert. I am definitely coming back here next time I'm in town!

This place was delicious, but very overpriced. My friend and I split a large group drink, an appetizer, and an entree, and we still both paid over $50 each. The food was great as well as the service. The large drink we ordered was tasty and strong. We were trying so hard to finish it and made a joke about to go cups. The server was like oh yeah we can totally do that! So in case you didn't know, you can get to go cups of alcohol in Vegas.

AMAZING! Came here for brunch and did the bottomless mimosas. The food was amazing and they kept our mimosas full constantly. I'm writing a review mainly about our waitress, Jody.. SHE WAS AWESOME. I'm visiting from New Jersey for a long weekend and I can honestly say she was probably the best waitress I ever had in my entire life. She was super cool, attentive, and overall great. The staff in general is fantastic. We had to wait a little bit for an outside table, but it was definitely worth it. 

Definitely would recommend it! Definitely would come again! My friend and I can't get over how much we enjoyed our experience.

Nom nom nom!!  The food here is great (Mac and cheese: oh good God!) 

Request Chauncey as your server. He gives you the best advice on the menu, he's honest about what he likes and doesn't, he's so patient and doesn't rush you, AND he's hilarious! My sis and I had a great start to our evening because of him. We will certainly be back! Thanks, Chauncey! ;)

The food was underwhelming and small portions for the cost. I had the eggs Benedict which has undercooked poached eggs to the point where the egg whites were clear. My latte was terrible. It was half filled and so burnt it was undrinkable. I think the rating for this place comes from the mimosas. The atmosphere was like a nightclub at 10am. Hard to hear the waiter speak to me.

Stopped in at HEXX for brunch while on a girls trip in Vegas. We were searching the strip for somewhere to eat and HEXX had lots of diners enjoying brunch so that's always a good sign!

Our server was fantastic! Really wish I could remember her name, but the service any place we went in Vegas was really just wonderful. Every server was top-notch!

We ordered the Colossal Bloody Mary to split between 4 girls. It was huge and came with a king crab leg, shrimp, bacon, and pepper skewer. 

The food was average and good enough to combat a hangover. The one shining star to the meal was the pecan sticky bun! OMG order this if nothing else because it was so so good. Everyone in the group order an omelette, which came with an english muffin and side of potatoes. The potatoes were tasty; potatoes roasted and topped with parm. I didn't care much for the meat omelette since there was just too many random meats in it, like the pork wasn't very good and especially not mixed in with chicken and bacon.

Atmosphere was cute with an open dining room and doors that open into the patio area so the space feels very large. Decor was light, neutral palette and reminds me of a Santa Monica vibe.

Wow! Great food, great service (thank you Jody), great location, and great ambience. I had the turkey sandwich with a side salad - yum. Everyone enjoyed their food and drinks. Wide variety of Bloody Mary's and specialty cocktails. Add this restaurant to your Vegas vacation.

This was my first visit to Hexx since the change over from Sugar Factory and WHAT A DIFFERENCE!!!

The decor is open, clean, sleek and comfortable.
I did spy some cozy, intimate, pillow lined small booths near the bar with great mood lighting that would be perfect for date night.

Our server was phenomenal!

She was on top of it from the very start!

She suggested the Ghost Pepper bloody mary.
DELISH!   Tasted almost like a gazpacho with a kick.
Very fresh and unique.
You could literally taste every ingredient one by one until that little kick of heat hit the back of your tongue. 


Cinnamon Roll waffle!
I had to make myself stop eating the yummy cream cheese "frosting" by itself after I had finished the perfectly cooked, fluffy, flavorful waffle.

PLUS!
They had a bottomless mimosa special for $20!
You can't beat that in Vegas!
My friend indulged in 4 of them during our leisurely  brunch and said they were STRONG!

I'm glad they took the cheesiness of Sugar Factory out of there and replaced it with Hexx!

The food is good but the bottomless mimosas are not what you think. They bring you 10 glasses and the service is spot on but the champagne is definitely watered down. I got a glass of plain and it definitely tasted watery. If you're looking for a buzz, not the place to drink.

Service was nice and friendly.  Didn't like the smoke smell while eating. CNF fee was a Dang surprise, beware! I won't be going back, because of this added fee.  

Braised Rib was fall off the bone tender and juicy.  Great subtle flavor and the accompanying Brussels sprouts were charred just right.  However, the mashed potatoes tasted old and hard; the rib presentation was on point, as the mash was a smash dud.  

Salmon with Black Quinoa was unique in a sense; quinoa colored your lips, and was cooked appropriately.  Yet, it lagged on the flavor.  The Salmon was nice and moist, yet didn't pair well with the black quinoa.

Food is good, but service is slow. Ate brunch here twice and on the second day it took over 30 minutes to receive an omelette and breakfast croissant. We asked for salt and pepper and it took forever to receive (I don't know why they're not already on all the tables??) and we had to ask our server twice for sugar for our coffee. I really liked the home fries, they were delicious!

I do love the atmosphere here and on Friday afternoon there was a DJ playing music. But, the music is loud inside and you can't hear your server or have a conversation with your spouse. We saw a lot of people texting at the tables and we joked that that's how they were probably communicating with each other because it was so loud. I recommend sitting outside if the DJ is playing music.

BEWARE - This restaurant adds a CNF charge to your bill. Ours was over $3 the second day and we never found out what this fee is for.
Amazing food and amazing drinks! We come here every year on our group trip- We had Sean as our Server 2 years in a row- he is the best! So friendly and attentive  Get the Hexx Benedict

The service was outstanding; I appreciated the staff members, who were clearly well trained, and must be treated well enough to be content with their work. Kudos to them, and the management.

The food was somewhat disappointing - not terrible, but not great either. I had roasted Brussels sprouts, which were fine, and calamari, which was brought to the table just warm (deep-fried foods should always be piping hot), and dressed in an overwhelming sauce - not the subtle sort of flavoring or careful preparation I hoped for. 

Additionally, it was very loud in the dining room. Our server stated that it was due to all the windows being closed. The view of the fountains is a nice feature of the place. Perhaps it is a place to visit in the summer. 

Finally, I question the $$ rating - it at least borders on, if not qualifies for, $$$.

This is one of my most favorite and memorable restaurant!! My boyfriend and I went here for a nice dinner out my 1st time in Vegas and sat by the window that looked out to the water show which was pretty cool to watch! Starting out our sever Steven was amazing a professional enjoyable server, the dirty grey goose martinis were perfect along with out meat and cheese plate to start out with.  Then moved on to and delicious bottle of serra barbaresco 2010 which was delicious! For our entrees I had the shrimp scampi and my boyfriend had the short rib both were fantastic! For sides we had broccoli I really enjoyed my dinner the chef knows what he's doing! To top it off at the end they asked us to sign the bottle to put in up in the ceiling and leave a little of us in Vegas we will let everyone know about this place! Thank you everyone at HEXX
Tracee made sure my bachelorette party and I were treated RIGHT!! What started as a much needed breakfast turned into a highlight of the weekend. Thanks Tracee and Hexx!!!

Such a great kitchen. We were visiting Vegas and could never agree on where to eat, especially with my pescitarian diet. But here we both found great dishes. I had the lox and chive waffles. It sounded weird but ended up being amazing. There were no pictures of it so I'm including one. My boyfriend had the carnitas hash. He really enjoyed it as well. Out server josh was amazing. He said that he had only worked there 3 days but I couldn't tell at all. He was a pro!

Saturday April 7th. First impression when you walk in is the unfriendly rude hostess's at the front. Don't work in customer service if your going to be rude to customers who come in. Based off of that we went elsewhere.

We came across Hexx because it was right next to the hotel we were staying at. The restaurant has a cool Miami vibe to it with plenty of outdoor seating in front of the Paris hotel. Fortunately, the wait was not long for an outdoor seat during weekend brunch. If you choose to sit indoors the windows open up to bring the outdoors inside as well. The ambiance was very casual chic.

Bottomless mimosas were $23 and there was a good selection of brunch items from sweet and savory items such as French toast to benedicts and omelettes. I opted for the veggie omelet. It has spinach, mushrooms, and peppers. There was a good amount of veggies cooked with the egg; however, I wish my omelette was more hot and not room temperature. The side dish of home potatoes was tasty and the seasoning was light. I also tried the Gravlax benedict, and the salmon was fresh. The muffin was not too heavy and they offered strawberry jam on the side which was also fresh.

We were very impressed with how quickly our order came out and the service was good. Our waitress was attentive and friendly. If you request bottled water, a Fiji water bottle comes out with no cap. For some reason they do not let you leave with the cap? I thought that was strange because if you paid for the bottle you should be able to bring it with you.

Went here for Sunday Brunch with my family for my mom's birthday. 
The weather in Vegas is beautiful this time of year so we sat outside on the patio and it was absolutely lovely to watch the Bellagio water show while we enjoyed our meal. 
My dad got the salmon, brother got the carbonara, mom got the veggie omelet, and I got the chicken and waffles (which was a huge portion! So that's good!) All the meals were maybe slightly above average, other than the waffles, the waffles were definitely above average! The brunch in general was definitely not worth the price, but it's on the pricier side because of the location of course. 
The service was very okay. Our server was super nice, just extremely slow though.
I'll come back for the atmosphere and view.

Decent brunch. Crazy Bloody Mary choices and 24$ endless Mimosas - what else can a girl ask for?  We sat outside (which I recommend). It's fun to people watch and much less noisy. Food is typical brunch style. Nothing special. Service is great. Perfect mid morning hangover food/cure.

I had one of the best burgers ever and for $16, it better be! However my rating was lowered because of the other item we ordered. My husband had jambalaya and he said the shrimp was cold. And the sausage and chicken was old. I could see that it was dried out. So we had mixed results on the food. The drinks were great. The service by Maria was impeccable.

Stopped at Hexx for drinks and apps after arriving in Vegas on Friday afternoon. It was the perfect spot to sit outside, relax, and people watch for a bit. The crab cake was great, the calamari was good, and the chorizo meatballs were okay. We got a pitcher of the red sangria, which was good, but it definitely tasted like more juice than wine (pretty sweet, not strong). However, for some reason on the bill, the pitcher cost $10 less than what it said on the menu, so no complaints here! Service was good, as well!

Came and tried hexx and the service was awesome but the frittata was definitely a disappointment!!! It was super small and had no chorizo in it as stated in the menu and over priced for what it was!! Bummed out!

I stopped by Hexx for Sunday brunch and we got the French toast and the chilaquiles. The food was amazing and the plates were big. I was too full too finish! Our server was great as well and the outside seating was perfect right in front of the Bellagio fountains.  FYI- they have bottomless mimosas for $20.

I love this place! I always make sure I come to this restaurant when I'm in Vegas. It's surprisingly affordable to be dead smack in the middle of the strip. In fact, we even found a Groupon for this place. The food is amazing. I've been for brunch a couple times. Shawn (or Sean?) gave us great service...shots out to Boston. He even escorted my God sister's mom to the restroom. The entire staff is friendly and the food comes quick. Can't wait to go back!

This place is stupid incredible. No review will capture the flavors that you will encounter here. Had to go back to back days here for breakfast. First day I had a younger server so not sure of her experience level but she disappeared for quite awhile. Second day, had a friendly guy who was definitely on top of things. So as far as breakfast, I had the chilaqueles the first day and they were out of this world. Second time I ordered the banana nut French toast and it was just wrong. Sipped on the El Diablo Bloody Mary and even that blew my mind. This place is a gold mine for breakfast.

I'm so sad! So much has changed within a few months. And not very good. 

Apparently they offer brunch.. and ONLY brunch until 4pm - which is when the dinner menu is out. Who eats brunch til 4?

Anyways. We came in wanting something savory and healthy - unfortunately our options were heapingly sweet and big/unhealthy options around lunch time. Boo. So we left and chose another restaurant. 

That same weekend, we came in around 2am.. they have a VERY limited menu late at night. Which is ok. But how UNFRESH the seafood were.

We had the lobster sandwich (think of a lobster in between two biscotti's for size comparison) and a flat and left out Caesar salad with no dressing.

We ALWAYS get their cocktail shrimps because they're amazing - but in his case they tasted like old fish and was warm... 

And we had the hummus, stale "pita bread". 

I'll also add we were intoxicated by quickly sobered up after tasting how awful the quality of their food had changed Just because it was late night. It really made us think was our $100 bill worth it for these 3 items? Probably not. Really disappointed because we've had much better but just during a different time - but quality shouldn't change just because high traffic times do.

The food here was average and not worth the price. I got the Margarita Pizza (flatbread, tomato, pesto, basil and mozzarella). It was decent. My fianc√©e got the shrimp scampi. The noodles were okay but the shrimp was bland and super oily. I would only go there for an appetizer. We got the artichoke dip and it was amazing.

What a great restaurant for brunch!  The place was packed and so we ended up eating at the bar.  The bartender was fantastic and spent time recommending drinks and favorite food items.  She was spot on.  The food was great and they even accommodated my daughter in law's gluten allergy.  The only downside was the 2 young hostesses who treated everyone in line like a bother...we were leaving the restaurant to go somewhere else when we spotted the 3 spots at the bar.  Best decision of the day!  We will be back and I hope the hostesses will be more professional.

The food and beer was amazing, however there was only one bartender on staff which made service at the bar slow. There was 3 of us total at the bar and service was still slow. My wife got the veggie pizza and I got the prime rib
Both were really good. My wife even liked the prime rib and she usually doesn't enjoy meat at all and is pretty much a vegetarian. Used the yelp checkin for free dessert which was a bonus.

Had a fantastic meal today for lunch at hexx. Brunch there is amazing and their bottomless mimosas are wonderful. The food is super good with great menu items. Prices are also very good especially for the atmosphere and location. This is always a very happy place. Customers always seem happy and the staff is soooo friendly and efficient. Our server, Sean, did an amazing job and made our dining experience wonderful. Hexx is a definite must go to when on the Strip!!
LOVED the views here!  The food was delicious and the staff was super friendly and attentive.

The first time I visited was the sweet shop. The ice cream and cookies were both great!

My second visit was the restaurant. Two of us split the charcuterie plate and the short rib. We had great service and the food was excellent. 

It's a pretty busy place, but we didn't have any issues being seated without reservations. They have both indoor and outdoor seating. The outdoor has some great people watching.

I was really excited to try out this place, but NOW I'm even more excited to never revisit again. 
We decided to sit at the bar area because we wanted to eat quickly. Welp, that was a joke because our dining experience was ridiculously long. Firstly, the blonde bartender who "assisted" us was beyond rude. We sat at a table for 15 minutes before she even gave us the time of day. The best part is the bar wasn't even busy. She was extremely unhelpful when elaborating on the menu and barely even came to check on us. Even when I tried to get her attention, she ignored us. Anyways... 

We ordered mimosas, two basic salads and and the artichoke dip. It took over an hour just for us to get those items. The salad was a joke. It was costly and not worth it. If you want a salad, just go buy some from the grocery store and prepare it at home because it will probably have more flavor. 
The spinach and artichoke dip was okay. I'm saying that it was okay because we were starving...so anything at that point was going to suffice. 
The mimosas were eh. They didn't taste like they had any orange juice in them at all. 

I feel like this place is overhyped for no reason. It left a bad taste in my mouth, literally. I won't revisit again.

The worst place ever!!!!!!! Do no go there!!! Worst service ever!!!!
Me and my husband went there to have brunch , I ordered a VEGETARIAN OMELETTE, my husband ordered margarita pizza, we waited 40 minuets for our orders and drinks and then when when the drinks and food finally came , I got a VEGETARIAN OMELETTE with BACON inside my omelette!!... I'm vegetarian for 16 years !!!!! If I'm ordering a vegetarian omelette like it's written in the menu, I expect it to be vegetarian!! When I called the manager and show her the bacon inside the omelette, she said she's sorry about the misunderstanding , it's not an answer to me. So me and my husband just left the restaurant upset and disappointed!!! We never come back to this place or recommend to our friends!!!

The 2 stars are for the service alone as it was awesome!  The food..... not so much. 

Spent $30 on the spicy jambalaya and $10 on the side mushrooms.  Jambalaya was over cooked and under-seasoned. It was very mushy and the mushrooms were WAYYY too salty.  I also got the hexx potion of jungle juice which was tasty but not worth $36.  

Overall, spent $85 on a dinner that I would not even pay for anywhere- PERIOD. 

Not worth it.  Lots of other and better food around, esp in that price range.

We had brunch here it was pretty good. Variety of food to choose from we ordered chicken chilaquiles, omelet, pancakes, coffee and their signature drink.. We got to sit in their outside area, which was a pretty cool view of the strip and the Bellagio fountains.. It's connected to a candy store that has a variety of unique buys.. We bought a couple things .. Overall I think we would go back :)

Taylor and Josh were the absolute BEST!! They both went above and beyond making sure we had everything we needed and more. Without a doubt the best service we've experienced. They did a wonderful job. Great view of the Bellagio and right in the middle of the strip - I would highly recommend based on location and atmosphere. Super happy!!

Great customer service always trumps a bad experience. I decided to take a couple of clients back to HEXX for a meeting. We did truly have great service, without me mentioning the previous experience. At the end of the meal, I asked to speak to a manager and she took care of the bill for us. It was really nice and overall, my opinion has changed and I think that the first time we went, the waiter must have been having a bad day. It is not reflective of the rest of the staff.

Overpriced & not worth it. 

Food was cold. 
Service was awful. 
Drinks were just ok. 

Awful, terrible, and regrettable experience. Just keep walking. There's much better in Vegas than this shithole.

Thank you to the Hexx staff for making the day after the wedding brunch such a success . Sean was very attentive ,always had a pleasant smile and was willing to help (even through the storm lol) . The food was great and came out pretty quick so a big shout out to the kitchen team as well   I loved how we did not have to ask for mimosa refills  Again thank you for the hospitality Sean

If you're in Vegas, awake, and able to go to happy hour, I'd definitely recommend Hexx! They have a great Happy hour drink menu from 2-6pm. It was perfect because we had just arrived in Vegas and checked into our hotel and wanted something to drink and eat. 

The drink prices were great and there were still a lot of choices! You just have to sit at the bar for happy hours, so you can't sit outside. You also only can order food from the starters and pizzas, but food is 20% off! I loved the two drinks I got: the blueberry cocktail and the bartender's infusion. Both were extremely fancy cocktails I wouldn't usually expect at happy hour!

A complicated process to be seated, 2 people asked if I wanted water...5 minutes passed and still thirsty.  And a 4th person involved by the time I could order a drink.  I had a pizza which was good but service by committee with secret service ear buds and overstaffing takes welcoming to cumbersome.

I came here last weekend with my cousin who was visiting from out of town, and had an amazing experience. We both enjoyed great drinks and amazing portions. Tonight, I came to this establishment, expecting similar results, and was completely disappointed. The outside patio was not slammed at all (I worked in food industry for 5 years) but the server was completely rude to us. We had horrible service. The waiter Kevin, was nice and friendly to every patron in the establishment, but was very rude and delayed to my party of 2. When we asked for the check, he simply placed it, when we asked for a box, he rudely placed it without uttering a word of conversation. It was completely different than the way he was interacting with other guests. I must say, I was excited about this new eatery I discovered being that I went here twice in one week, but I will not be coming back.

Service, food, and drinks were on point.  Our handsome server, Sean, was so nice and went out of his way to make sure my friend and cousin and I were well taken care of....he even offered to walk me by the arm to the bathroom as my unwalkable heels were slowing me down (these heels weren't made for walking....) Located on the Vegas strip within the Paris hotel vicinity, I'll definitely make sure to stop by again when I'm in town.  Please don't ask for Sean as I want him all to myself and I'm territorial as fuuuuuuuuuuuuuucckkkk...........he's that great!

So my previous review may so what contradict this one however, second chance are not always a bad thing.

Dined here the other night for dinner and was quite surprised considering my first experience. Our server, Kevin, was the first pleasant experience. He was knowledgeable, friendly,attentive and very personable. His first recommendation for a cocktail was right on point. He listened to what I wanted and described a delicious drink which tastes just as great. 

Our apps were the crab cakes and beef tartare. Crab cakes were wonderful while the beef tartare was thick and a bit chewy. For an entree, we enjoyed the lamb oso bucco. I am on a lamb kick at the moment so this entree looked quote appealing, on the side we had the oven roasted mushrooms. 

Mushrooms 
Lamb 
Pleasantly satisfied with this delicious dinner!!

BE AWARE OF THE HIDDEN FEE ON YOUR RECEIPT CALLED CNF CHARGE WHICH WILL BE 4.7% of your total bill.  This is very deceptive and unnecessary.  Heard a few other places  are following suit. 

Skip the strip, shop and stay downtown.  Between the resort fees, parking fees,  and the CNF fees, this is SO ridiculous.  

I feel sorry for the servers because people generally will not leave as big of a tip as they normally would.  Wake up you greedy las vegas casinos and restaurant owners...........before it is too late.

On vacation in Vegas for the first time over Memorial Day week. We hadn't eaten on the strip yet and wanted a snack after a concert at Planet Hollywood. I had read the reviews and was a little cautious due to a suggested inflated prices and unsatisfied reviews. We were very pleased! We arrived close to midnight- promptly greeted and asked inside or outside. We chose inside however the doors/windows were open so we could see and hear the comings and going of the strip. We were seated inside and Philip was our server who was happy even at midnight. 
I love pizza -self described pizza snob and hate a bad pizza. We ordered a pepperoni pizza (6 slices) and crispy fries. My hubby and and I shared. Huge pepperoni slices-a great crust- the pizza did not disappoint!  and fries were definitely crispy! Hubby said they were the best fries he's ever had!? The fries were hot and salty-the best kind of fries! We had a great time and would definitely go back! Mind you the candy/ice cream store is not 24 hrs!

Taylor and Tristan were awesome! Food was amazing and the service was quick! Plus you can't beat bottomless mimosas! 
I had the lobster roll and it was amazing!
Amazing food and bottomless mimosas!! Taylor is the best waitress and provided the greatest service!! Definitely a brunch must!
Wouldn't come back. Mimosas are great otherwise never again... food was over priced and bland. Go to Margaritaville and you'll spend half the money get more food and have much better food and service

Here for EDC weekend had the most amazing drink (jungle juice) super happy and excited to see the smoke it was really fun !!! The food was soo yummy it hit the spot and that pineapple upside down cake .. trust me you need to try to the service was super friendly nice and everything was perfect the good the service and the atmosphere (superb) thanx to Sean and Bobby for making this a really great experience looking forward to coming back next time
Got a yummy berry bowl with vegan coconut whipped cream but besides that not many vegan options

I'm giving this a 5 star because of the service. Jose the manager and Denise our server were amazing. Super attentive and very friendly. It was my birthday and we came in for a late night drink. We'll be back for dinner soon.

Hexx is a must for bloody Mary's, endless mimosa's and a great breakfast. We hit it with just my wife and I, or a large party. It's always been great food, drink and service. 
Ask for Sean he must own the place because he treated us like we were his only table.

I loved the Sugar Factory and was sad to see it go... But I had such a great experience here that I didn't care! My friend and I shared a cheese platter that was tasty, simple of course. We also had a delicious mango cocktail that was on special and cheap! The highlight of everything- dessert. We ordered 2 sundaes (they were both. HUGE, but we wanted to try a bit of both!) Bake Sale and Birthday Cake. They were heavenly. Everything you would want if you have a sweet tooth!!!! The service was also outstanding. I'll definitely be planning a dinner here with friends on my next trip!

We visited Hexx lounge during happy hour.  We were told certain beers, snacks, apps, and pizzas were 1/2 off. Seeing the beer prices, I opted for a beer listed at $8, as did my husband. We ended up ordering a second round, with one $8 beer and I think the other was listed as $10.  The only thing we ate was the cheese & charcuterie, which was good. When it came time to close out, everything was listed as full price, coming to $58.69, when supposedly our beers and the charcuterie plate were "half off." I double checked with the bartender, asking specifically if these were the happy hour prices, and he assured me they were.  So I guess a non-happy hour snack there would be more than $100? I know it's Vegas but that's ridiculous. I would not return.

Long story short:  buyer beware. Confirm prices before ordering.
Stay far far far away from this place. New name same crap management and it encourages its employees to write reviews. Shady business and even shadier management.

Soggy slider appetizers that came after my entree. Sat on a nice little patio with misters yessss got to people watch and be in the shade on the strip. Cute little lesbian server. Best french fries iv ever had in my life. Amazing shrimp salad-add avocado for extra yumminess:) will definitely eat again

This brunch was AWESOME. The food was delicious, the bottomless mimosas were such a great deal. TRACEE WAS THE BEST!!!!! She made our meal top notch, we had a blast. She made my sister (the bachelorette) feel like a queen and we all felt like rock stars! We sat inside, but it still felt like open air/patio. Highly recommend!

Pretty disappointed. The place looks like it is 'higher class' but we had to send the tortilla chips back due to them being stale, the calamari was cold, and the fries tasted like they had been sitting out awhile.

The drinks, however, were very good. The Moscow Mule and Mint Julep. Our server told the manager about our complaints and he really seemed unconcerned and didn't even bother to come over and sat anything (isn't a managers job to deal with these sort of situations..?) This place has potential, but the management is obviously of poor quality at this time of evening (6pm on Monday). 

We will most likely not be back.

Seriously kudos to Chef Loche! It was a group of 6 of us we ordered the Spicy Jambalaya, shrimp scampi, smothered fries, regular fries, and crab cake. My SO got the hypnotizing strawberry drink which everyone else ended up getting as well. 
I was a little skeptical at first when Jay, our waiter, said that everything he's tried has been great. He was not lying! We all shared the plates and everything was tasty. I would say my favorite was the jambalaya. I was worried it would be too spicy so I asked the chef if he could tone it down and he did well for my baby taste buds!

I would definitely go again!

I loved it! Came for brunch and had my heart on chicken and waffles but got the Hexx burger instead to cure my hang over and oh did that hit the spot! The burger was delicious, soft buns and juicy meat patty! My girlfriend got the turkey club and I had a bite and it was even more delicious then my burger. Service was great and we got seated in the patio which gave us a perfect view of the bellagio fountains! Can't wait to go again!

Came here for brunch and I must say the moment we walked in I was in love with the d√©cor! We were seated right away (thanks open table) and our server greeted us within seconds. She was very sweet and attentive. Mimosas are delicious as the same goes for the food we ordered. If going for brunch, make sure to order the meat lovers omelet!
Loved it!!!! Food was good, service was great, staff was lovely, and they kept the mimosas flowing!!!!! Definitely worth the money!

It was Waffle-Fest time for brunch this Sunday. No wait at 10:00am. Grabbed a strip view table inside. Claire our server was awesome. 

My wife and I shared each other's dishes: the CinnaRoll Waffle & the Chicken and Waffles. What a great combo. They were both outstanding. The cream cheese frosting on the cinnamon waffle was a perfect complement to the lightness of the waffle. Our fav was the chicken & waffles though. The massive sized apple cheddar waffle paired perfectly with the sweet and spicy pickles and the syrup. And the 2 pieces of fried chicken were huge, crispy, and fresh out of the fryer. Ask for extra pickles. 

This place came close to dethroning my Bkft King in LV (Hash House). It would have if it wouldn't have been almost double the cost of HH. Ask for Claire...

Came of breakfast  The food was SO GOOD.  The buttermilk pancakes were borderline too sweet, but still delicious.

And the prices were reasonable for being on The Strip

When we got there they were about to close, so I thought but in actuality they're open 24 seven.  

It looked like they were closing, I say this because they seemed exhausted, at least the waitress that helped us out looked like she had enough, uninterested in her job and uninterested in serving us with a bad attitude she took our order.

The burgers were decent, fries were decent, the place is clean and somewhat cool looking, but not special enough to go back or give it more than 3 stars.

Time to get a drink and forget about this joint. I put a hex on you!

Just keepin' it real
The Real Foodie

Nice brunch spot located at the Paris hotel street facing the Bellagio. Friendly, attentive wait staff. Food was great but nothing special or different from your typical dishes...especially considering the price tag. I felt $20 for an omelet and home fries was a bit much but we just rolled with it. The space is clean and there is indoor and patio seating. Recommend patio seating of course!

There is a lot that is great about this place.  One of the great things is to sit outside and people watch.  There is a whole lot going on.  The restaurant is nicely decorated and very modern.  I wanted to try the carrot cake pancakes and they were so accommodating in letting me order only 1/2 an order.  I also ordered the chilaquiles and a guava mimosa.  Everything was delicious, the pancakes had shredded caramelized carrots in between and on top, it had a dollop of cream cheese frosting.  It was a great excuse to have cake for breakfast.  The chilaquiles were very tasty, not too spicy, so my husband probably would have liked to add something to give it a kick.  Between the two of us, we couldn't finish the pancakes.  Overall, this place is solid.

We had a great brunch at Hexx!   The staff was dressed for the Game of Thrones theme and our waiter, Sean,  wore it well!  Sean recommended apple cheddar bourbon chicken & waffles.  It was great!  He was very attentive and engaged is in conversation which was very cool.  Good service is rare in LA!  Hexx is worth the calories.  Just walk the strip and burn it off in the heat :-)
Took 20 min for someone to even come up to our table for our order. The food looks good, but we'll see how long it takes for our server to bring it to us.

Had dinner here last night with a friend, and up until this morning at 3 am I would have given this place 4 stars - but at 3 am she threw-up all of her dinner and has been sick in bed all day.  I know this is Vegas, but we can't blame this one on alcohol as neither of us drank last night, nor did we eat anything else after we left the restaurant.  She's got all the signs of food poisoning.  Which really sucks because we're in town to attend a conference that we paid for out of our pockets, and now she's missed a full day of sessions.  We're praying that she'll feel better tomorrow.  So far the best she can do is small sips of Gatorade.  She ordered a pasta dish, I think it was one of the house specials.  I'm pretty sure one of the listed ingredients might have been egg yolk.  Looking back now, that seems odd - why list egg yolk unless it is raw - in which case - what the heck?  She thinks she remembers seeing that too but, at the time, not giving it much thought. 

The location is amazing (right across from the Bellagio fountain).  As far as my dinner - it was okay.  We ordered the spinach and artichoke dip - which is one of the best I've ever had.  For my main course I had the fillet which was cooked exactly as I ordered (medium), but a bit dry and lacking any flavor other than when the pepper it was dusted with before cooking happened to touch my tongue.  There was a very small dollop of 'steak sauce' on the plate, I suppose it's there incase the pepper didn't work.  I tasted the sauce - nothing to rave about and I'd prefer something better than homemade A-1.

This space used to be occupied by the Sugar Factory... and I was really hoping to eat there.  It wasn't until we made the trek up from the Mandalay that I realized Sugar Factory was gone.

Another small positive note - Hexx just opened, literally.  I think last Friday (Feb 27th) was it's first night.  So the place was still fairly empty at 7:30 pm on a Monday night.  

Might be empty because it's so new, or might be empty because my friend isn't the only one to have spent the next day puking up her dinner.

I visit Vegas a lot - and I'll keep an eye on their Yelp reviews to see if this was a one-time fluke.

Bottom line - should you go here?  If you want a great view of the fountain and fabulous spinach dip - give it a shot.  Just stay far away from anything else on the menu that might get you sick if it's not cooked/prepared properly.  Good luck!

was a little disappointed in my brunch here. i ordered the gravlax benedict, not really realizing how salty gravlax is, so maybe that was my fault. in general though, i think i could've still enjoyed my benedict had it not been for the completely overcooked eggs on top. my other friend who ordered the benedict had one egg poached correctly and the other one also overcooked. i just can't understand how a restaurant like this can mess up poached eggs so consistently. i'd say the best part of the meal was the tiny side of mac n cheese that we shared among us. views and atmosphere were lovely too but food was nothing special.

Why try Hexx? 

Because it's simply the most underrated restaurant in Las Vegas. 

I've been coming here since it opened. This restaurant is unique in that it is a 24 hour farm to table restaurant, great for late night and excellent for lunch and dinner during normal hours. The food is amazing and the quality is impeccable. 

The manager Juan and staff are outstanding, this is my go to spot whenever I'm in Las Vegas.

We used the travelzoo promotion for 2 4-course dinners with wine flights.  Pretty disappointing.  We started with the charcuterie appetizer - 2 cheeses, 2 cured meats and a giant pretzel with condiments.  It was huge and decent quality.  2 simple salads were also good.  3 of the wines came just after the salads - decent wines, small (2 oz) pours.  Unfortunately the rose & white were served cold but were room temperature within minutes because of the small size glasses.  Promotion (still today) lists sea bass which was taken off the menu.  It also lists 14 oz ribeye, but menu price is now higher than promotion value.  After discussion, we got the ribeye, but it was the smallest 14 oz steak I've ever had - more like 10 ounce.  Way over cooked - ordered med rare and it was grey all the way through.  Venetian cheesecake was mediocre.  We get better cheesecake at Outback.  Not worth the money, even with the promotion.
Wonderful food and amazing service! Food portions match the price compared to most places around here. Highly recommend it!

This place is incredible, especially for brunch! Bottomless mimosas plus the Hexx Benedict and the cinnamon waffle, such a delicious and perfect combination. What made our experience even better was the amazing wait staff! Sean, you were SO great! Will definitely come back here every time I'm in Vegas! (Only sad part is that they got rid of the chocolate candied bacon!!)

Amazing service
Great short rib and loved Ecuadorian brownie
Love French sized portions of food so you dont over eat

the food was great. I had the hexx burger. it looks strange when you see the white chocolate bun but it's actually pretty good. the sweetness is not too strong but it balances the salty of the burger. the choice of beers though it's not that great.

Excellent service and friendly staff and great food. Nice outside dining great early morning for brunch. There is also plenty of seating inside when weather is warmer. The staff very attentive and helpful.

Sugarfactory is closed and this place is the new sugar factory. The candy store and everything else looks exactly the same except some changes to the menu. 

The drinks which were previously made of candy are now made of fruit, which is always a great thing. They still smoke and make both kids and adults smile and snap. 

Im in b/w a 3-3.5 for this place and kind of wish yelp had a half point system so i can increase my rating by half a point. 
We came here for dinner and lunch. Dinner was definetly a better experience than lunch. The dinner and lunch menu are similar except some slight differences. 

For dinner, we got the spinach and artichoke dip as appetizer and shared the shrimp scampi for entree. The dip was quite tasty and came with chips and pita chips. The dip tasted much better with chips to we stuck to them but if you are extra hungry, the appetizer is quite filling. 
The shrimp scampi was delish and we cleaned the plate away.

For lunch, me and a friend ordered the chicken and waffles (hugee dish btw) and another friend ordered the cheeseburger. Both entrees were ok. The chicken was definetly the star of our dish and was a huge portion. Easily shareable between two people and a third could also take some bites. Only thing i didnt like was that i dont tend to like a huge portion of fried chicken just being dumped on my waffle - thus making it soggy. I also like plain maple syrup and theirs had a strong cinnamony kick to it so if you are like me, order the plain one.
Sean was the man - awesome server, attentive. Very good food. Highly recommended lunch spot.

Taylor our waitress was amazing....best spot for breakfast by far. Off the strip in Paris. Bottomless mimosas. Goood vibe and food is true to the pictures and taste even better. Breakfast panckcakes and potatoes amazing. Breakfast croissants to die for. I will certainly be back ever time i touch down in Vegas....yassss. love it!

The Hexx is a cool spot to go if you are in Vegas. It's perfect for any occasions and it can be as fancy as you want to make it (if you want to dress up) or as casual as you can come. The environment in the restaurant is fantastic. The employees here are the best employees in Vegas, they are energetic, and have a positive attitude and always with a smile. Our servers Sean and Charles were attentive, friendly and really took care of us really well. The food, the food was AMAZING! I had the Pepperoni Pizza and it was perfect, my friend had the Carrot Pancakes and they are to die for! Next time I'm in Vegas I'll for sure hit this spot again.

I went here twice (with family going a third time without me) and I'm taking all of those experiences into account for this review. If I had only visited in the early morning this would probably be a 5 star review.

We came here very early shortly after opening for a breakfast. We were still on East Coast time and decided to get some food and avoid the crowds.

Service was attentive and friendly. 

We were sat on the balcony in a still cool breezy morning. 

I ordered the eggs benedict and my husband had the cinnamon bun waffles. The food was perfect, I was completely in love with my benedict, perfectly cooked eggs with ham and asparagus ontop of gorgeous scalloped potato. Probably the best benedict I've had in a very long time. My husband was over the moon with his breakfast as well since it came with an actual mountain of cream cheese icing.

The problem we get into is the other visits. On my recommendation family went later on in the day and had a much less enjoyable experience.

A day or so later we stopped by in the evening on a whim to grab a few drinks and same deal.

It seems that the second they get busy, all bets are off. They recieved cold food, and the night with drinks we had an incredibly long wait for ordered drinks, so long we couldn't justify getting more than one. 

So all in all, it's a good enough place but they really struggle when it comes to dealing with a full house. Unfortunately, where they're situated on the strip, they will ALWAYS have a full house during peak times.

If you can go crazy early like I did, you'll have a great time, otherwise maybe choose somewhere else!

Just stopped by this place for brunch with a friend and the food was delicious but my favorite thing was the service. Sean and his assistant Big Bobby provided amazing service. The decor of the place is pretty great also. I'd definitely come back here.

Well, we had a chance to eat 3 meals on a short weekend in Vegas, 2 of them as ate at Hexx. Teddy was our waiter for dinner and I let him choose all our food. So impressed at the level of service and the attention to detail and presentation with the food! Unbeatable for the cost, truly blew us away so we came back the next morning for brunch.... Tracee was our server and she recommended the chicken and waffles so my husband got that and I ordered a omelette. My food was so so good until I tried the chicken and waffles and then pushed my plate aside to eat half my husbands breakfast! We have already made brunch reservations for mother's day, there is no where else I would rather eat!

Came on a sunday afternoon to have lunch, all of the food arrived quickly and was very tasty. The fruit platter was really big and was super refreshing! All of the meals my friends ordered were a great size (turkey club was amazing). Our waitress Tracy was the highlight of the meal she was so attentive, and delightful!

I have mixed emotions about this place. Food was super good. Like super super good. Bartender was great too. Bottomless mimosas were great. What sucked was the wait. 55 minutes to get our food. 55!!!!!  Like I said, food was great. Service great. The wait blows though.

Came here on a Friday morning for the mimosas. The chilaquiles were amazing and our server Melissa was very attentive and had some great recommendations for our weekend in Vegas! Would definitely come here again! Great food and even better service!
Steven was a awesome server. The food wasn't up to the price. Good atmosphere. I gave it a five star because the server was worth the five stars.

I came to Vegas for my 21st birthday with a few friends of mine and right when we landed we came to Hexx for food. Our server Sean was absolutely incredible, I never ran out of a mimosa and I was treated with a wonderful birthday dessert. We ended up coming back the next day for him and the bottomless mimosas but he was too busy in his section :(  The food was incredible and the service even better. The ambiance of the restaurant itself is just as amazing. Totally recommend (this restaurant and sean) and will be back.
Great service, good food, and sweet ambience. I think the steak menus are a better deal compared to pasta or anything else.
Stopped in for lunch.  Drinks were awesome, and the burgers were delicious.  Sit in the bar area to avoid the hectic atmosphere of the Strip.  The bartender took good care of us.

Great spot! Food was amazing, service even better! Our server was busy as hell. However he still kept his composure and treated each guest amazing. Kudos to him!! We chose the breakfast pizza and the chilaquiles. They were great!! I thought they would be spicy but they were just right! Definitely will come back!

Man. I was very disappointed with the food at Hexx. My family and I were super excited to try this place out. At first impression, Hexx is a beautiful place to have brunch-- you walk in, and you just feel the classy-boozy-brunch ambience. That feeling of, "Hey, let's get a morning cocktail to nurse this slight Vegas hangover."

The staff is incredibly attentive, accommodating (had to move to another table to accommodate my ankle injury), and personable. Our waitress was super funny, and our host was very sweet. But the food-- meh. I'd say that if you're getting something sweet, go for it. But their actual meals were just dry and tasteless. 

We ordered a mocha to start. Delicious. It was smooth, foamy, and not too rich. And then I got a bit too excited and ordered one of their dry-ice smoking cocktails -- the Elixir (most definitely did not give me life). It tasted and looked like an AMF. The worst is that I low-key was annoyed that this particular cocktail was recommended to me by the staff and now no one at the table wanted to drink it lol. There goes $36.

I'd have to say that the highlight of the meal was the Cinnaroll Waffle. The decadent cream cheese and cinnamon flavoring was amazing. I expected the chicken and waffles to be as great too, but it came out to be kinda dry and tasteless. So was my protein omelet-- the chicken was cardboard. And the corned beef hash? Not enough potatoes. And the salad? As DJ Esco would say, "Too Much SAUCEEEE."

Bye.

I liked the Dulce de Leche Milk Shake, but the chocolate tasting turned me off to buying anything chocolate in this place. Just stick with the ice cream and the drinks at the restaurant. 

I had not had any food as this trip was strictly for sweets and drinks.

I planned a family vacation to Las Vegas and wanted a special dinner for our first night. There are hundreds of excellent restaurants to choose from and Hexx is at the top of the list.  Great view, amazing food and service that was attentive to all our needs.  Michael Main, the GM, went out of this way to make this a special night for our family.  The wait staff was attentive and perfectly timed the delivery of the appetizers and food.  On a night that was 105 degrees, the waiters made sure our water glasses were always filled.  As for the food...the fennel sausage pizza was amazing as was the Margherita pizza.  The Chicken and Waffles was the best my son has ever had (and he has had that dish many times) and the two pasta dishes were magnificent.  There are a lot of great restaurants in Vegas, but is a MUST visit restaurant.  By the way, the Banana Sundae is a must. Get multiple spoons if you must, but this is Vegas, so treat yourself to a great dessert.
Bottomless mimosas.  Sangria.  Chicken and waffles.  Turkey club.  French fries.  Sean and Josh kept our drinks and bellies full.  Thank you so much!!!!

My friends and I were really looking forward to trying out there Chilaquiles and Chicken and waffles and other tasty meals offered here, unfortunately an hour had passed after the server had taken our order and we STILL did not have no food out for any of us. Their excuse was because we were a group of 9, but there were 3-4 tables with groups of four people that arrived 30 min after us and all of them had their drinks and food!
