We are outraged and had such a disappointing experience

Although you're in Sin City, there's nothing sinful about eating chocolate! Well, unless you eat too much and then you're a glutton... Or maybe you have too much pride and skip eating chocolate because you're too concerned about your figure... Or if you bypass the chocolate, and as a result you get angry and it invokes your wrath... Or if you decide to eat chocolate, but eat too much and people think you're greedy...

...Ok, well I guess you're damned if you do and you're damned if you don't, but hey, it's Vegas so go indulge at Hexx!

We were lured in with the promise of a build-your-own ice cream sandwich, but before we could partake in that very serious business we were sidetracked by a chocolate tasting. That's right, we sat down at a bar and sampled several bits of chocolate and real hot coccoa for free! Each bit was better than the last, and when I announced my favorite, they hit me with a sample of that kind of chocolate made into hot chocolate. It was awesome. Moreover, we watched the staff hand pick coccoa beans for quality control while we ate all that chocolate.

We made an ice cream sandwich made out of (1) peanut butter and Reese Pieces cookie, (1) snicker doodle cookie and stracciatella ice cream. It seemed to make sense at the time and it certainly satisfied.

Two thumbs up!

This place is great for breakfast and brunch.  Service was good and the prices were ok by Vegas standards.  We went on our last day in LV and by the time we were done chatting with our server and drinking bottomless mimosas, we ended up extending our trip by a day.  If you are in the area I'd definitely recommend trying this place.

Jodie is the best server I have ever had. Such an amazing lady who is an expert at her job. She is so caring, considerate, and sharp. We had a wonderful experience and it was all based on her service. Thank you so much!!!
Great for a late night dinner. Generous portions and not crazy prices. Denise was a great waitress. Sat outside looking over bellagio fountain.

The food was amazing!!! I got the burger and fries with macaroni and cheese on the side with of course the bottomless mimosas. I was hesitant due to the fact Yelp has failed me wrong once or twice. Everything was delicious since we all shared as a family table. Service was awesome we had Stephen. I will definitely be back!

A friend and I decided to stop in for lunch during our conference to get away from the crowds.  We were planning to go to Martorano's, but we got there too late to enjoy lunch.   Hexx seemed like a good option and I was extremely pleased with my selection.  I enjoyed the chicken sandwich - it was messy, but oh so tasty!  This restaurant has great views of the Strip and the Bellagio fountains, the service is great and the decor is comfortable and classy at the same time.

Food was great!
Prices are too high...
The rib-eye was amazing! but not enough asparagus in my opinion...

One word:  EXCELLENT!

Excellent food, Friendly & Smiling hostess and wait staff, coupled with their Perfect location... HEXX is my new and must go to dinner spot in Vegas!

I've always walked along the strip and found HEXX to be perfectly located... their patio seating (with fan or heater) is the picture perfect spot for your Vegas visits.  

We had a reservation at 5:30 (wanted to arrive earlier to grab their patio seating).  Upon arrival, the smiling and friendly hostess greeted us right away.  We hoped for and got the perfect patio seating -- overlooking the strip and right across from the Bellagio fountain, where we enjoyed the fountain show every 30-mins while we dined.  Thumbs up!!!

HEXX has the best wait staff!  They don't miss a beat.  They are fast, friendly, knowledgeable and flexible.  We were offered water right away.  Then the waitress came over to greet and check on us -- and made some dinner recommendations.

We opted for the following:
* Purple Haze -- one of their signature drinks.  Very good with the fog ... unique drink 
* Prime Rib (my fav!) -- cooked a perfect medium rare.  It was flavorful and tasty.  Prime rib was fresh and a true 16oz!
* Rib Eye -- also cooked perfectly and perfectly seasoned.  
* Brussel Sprouts -- sides.  So good!  For those of you who don't like your veges.. you will be hooked!  ;)
* Pumpkin creme br√ªl√©e -- recommendation by waitress and she is spot on.  Excellent creme br√ªl√©e and not too sweet.  I often don't like dessert where they use sugar to mask all taste..  but this creme br√ªl√©e is not like that.  You can really taste the pumpkin and it's really good.  Highly recommended.

We enjoyed an excellent dinner at HEXX and I'm kicking myself why I haven't come sooner.  We've got this as our new Vegas dinner spot and will be back for sure!
Josh and Stephanie are the best people I've ever met! Genuine people, genuine atmosphere, and bottles mimosas.... Nuff said.

Food was good - had a filet with mushroom rice.  Tried to use a Groupon that said it was valid on any day but a federal holiday and New Years.  Manager said the owner can choose not to accept Groupon if they don't want to anytime.  Would not honor the Groupon and we ended up getting cash value for it.

Such an awesome vibe. Very pretty inside and the menu was great. The staff are all so friendly and you can tell they all genuinely get along which was nice to see. Our server Tracy was such a lovely lady and gave great suggestions for off the path places to see. Great place will definitely go there again! Try the Lychee Martin it was excellent!!
Delicious food and thoughtful service. We enjoyed dinner (halibut, salmon, short ribs) and breakfast -(Hexx Benedict). Even better they are open 24/7

Came here with my kids thought we could have great experience here. Boy was I wrong. my food was so salty. I ordered the prime rib and asked medium it came out well done. I was not going to wait for another 20 mins. The chicken entree was also salty. I asked for a side of mash potato and it never came. Bad service and bad food was my experience.  I paid for a lot and food was not that great.

Hexx was phenomenal. We were seated quickly after receiving a text from the hostess. Our server (Rafael) was in a great mood and gave us a quick run-down of the cocktail menu. We decided to go with the bottomless mimosas, and were not disappointed. They take that "bottomless" part very seriously, I think my glass was empty once the entire morning.

For our meal, we ordered the Hexx Benedict and the Steak and Eggs. I had the Steak and Eggs, and they were nothing short of spectacular. The steak was cooked to my liking (medium rare) and the potatoes and eggs were over the top. It also came with an english muffin. Every part of the dish was tasty and the portions were generous but not crazy.

What really nailed down this 5 star experience was Hexx's willingness to accommodate us when we decided we'd like to spend the rest of our morning at the bar. Our server transferred our bottomless mimosas and they let us keep drinking them as we just sat and watched football! Unbelievable. I'll absolutely be back.

I was curious about their potion cocktails, but $38 was a bit too steep for my morning beverage so I passed. 

The Hexx $15: I opted for this cocktail instead. It was really good, like a grown up chocolate milk! 

Cinaroll Waffle $14.95: The icing on this was really good, but sweet. The waffle itself was just OK. I personally prefer a thinner waffle. 

Bacon $5.95: The waffle doesn't come with any sides, so a side of bacon sounded good to me! It ended up being a really good idea to help cut the sweetness of the waffle. 

Marife was our server and she was amazing! She was really friendly and personable. She even split the check for us by what we each ordered without us asking! Although the food was OK, I wouldn't mind coming back to try something else due to the great service and location across from the Bellagio fountains.

The Chicken and Apple Cheddar Waffles were amazing!! A must try! We say outside and had the perfect view of the Bellagio and saw the fountain show. They have a Happy Hour, but only honored at the bar unfortunately. It would be nice to honor the Happy Hour wherever you'd like to sit because they have good specials.

The service at this place was beyond fantastic- so glad we chose Hexx for my birthday dinner! We ordered one of the pitchers of cocktails that came with dry ice so it looked like its was smoking and it was so delicious! Then they brought us a free pitcher of a different flavored steaming cocktail because it was my birthday!!! Loved that!! The manager also came to our table twice to ensure that our meal was good and wished me a happy birthday which I thought was very nice. 

All of the food we had was delicious but j must say the dessert and the cocktails were the best part. We got the mocha espresso flourless chocolate cake and a chocolate ice cream sundae and both were phenomenal! 

From the outdoor seating area you can see the bellagio fountain show across the street which is a must see when in Vegas! I thought the prices were very reasonable for the location. I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone visiting Las Vegas!

Hexx is a nice looking place in a great part of the strip, however we received some of the worst service I have ever had. After being seated, it took us 20 minutes to be asked for our drink order and then another 30 minutes to receive our drinks. It was not even a complicated order, simply 4 beers, two glasses of wine and a couple of vodka tonics. The place was far from packed and the bar just had two people sat at it, so to have to wait nearly an hour for drinks was completely horrendous. In addition to that, one of our party ordered a steak cooked rare and it turned up medium well done. When he spoke to the waiter, he then removed just the steak, leaving the rest of the meal and returned 15 minutes later with it cooked properly. Meaning the rest of the meal was cold by the time his steak turned up! To top things off, they did not comp the steak until we complained to the manager. The rest of the food was actually pretty decent when it turned up, but at that point our night was ruined. My tip is for you not to go here, unless you don't intend on doing anything else that night.

Wow, what horrible service.  Sat down at 10:50 and didn't get our food until 11:30.  Coffee was lukewarm and I got up myself twice to fill my wife and I's cups.  The saving grace is the location on the strip.  You pay for the ambiance with high food prices and below par service.
We went on a weekday for dinner. We were pleasantly surprised by the excellent service, and delicious food. The prices are reasonable too. So I would definitely revisit and would recommend it.
It was wonderful,  loved the veggie burger which was delicious and ipenbottom mimosas got me buzzed!

My husband and I were just walking along the restaurant when we saw 'bottomless mimosas'. We immediately rushed in. It was about 15 minutes for the bottomless mimosas to get over. However, our waitress for the day, Tracy was so sweet that she kept pouring mimosas for us although we were way past the cut off time. 

The food was amazing. I had a veggie burger with fries. The burger was excellent. The veggie patty and avocado which came with it was too good (absolutely no words to describe). 

My husband however didn't like what he ordered. He ordered for a veggie omelette and looks like they had made the omelette using a cheap version of some oil or they probably used the non-veg oil to make it. It was horrible that he threw away most of it. However the mashed potatoes he got along with it was tasty!

This is a must visit restaurant for an amazing brunch with bottomless mimosas and if the food is not good, you can always tell them and ask them to change it.

The ambiance is great,  the service is impeccable & the food is delectable!!! From the moment we walked in until the moment we left Mr. Teddy Thompson gave us stellar service!!! I am a foodie & world traveler and the service we received was 5 star top notch service!

Mr. Thompson recommended food for our table & every dish he recommended was phenomenal! There were 6 of us & the food was plentiful with enough to share. We tried: hexx chopped salad, crispy calamari, crabcakes, and cheesy garlic bread. The chopped salad had hearts of palm avocado,  tomato, sweet drop peppers, artichokes topped with green goddess dressing! The calamari was spicy with buffalo sauce, topped with carrots. The crabcakes were not filled with fillers but were made with authentic crab meat. The cheesy garlic bread... heaven.

Mr. Thompson shared interactive stories about service & the menu throughout our meal. Teddy Thompson is a gem and asset to this establishment.

Omg first time here and the service and food was great!!! If you visit this place you will need to ask for Tracee she is the best waitress ever really nice and happy person and she will keep your Mimosas coming!!! Really great costumer service!!

HEXX was ridiculously good!  My friend and I randomly came here for brunch on Sunday before heading home.  The restaurant is open air and awesome for people watching.  The service is good and on top of things.  All the drinks looked amazing and the once we had were delicious.  Both the food and drink prices are crazy good, especially considering you are in Vegas.  I had the Ham and Cheese Croissant.  It was huge and cheesy and just what I needed.  My friend had a huge burger and she loved it as well.  They also have a chocolate and candy store attached with tons of cool stuff.  You can also do a free chocolate tasting there.  HEXX is a great place for food, drinks, chocolate and candy.

Went there for breakfast. Ordered the steak and eggs. Service was good but food was not impressive. Steak not really prime and covered on too much pepper.
Place is nicely decorated with large winery and waiters very friendly.

Review is for dinner 10/30/16

I had promised to take my wife to a 'nice dinner' before a show at PH next door, we slipped in here after browsing the menu posted outside.

We were quickly seated inside, since it was starting to cool off and windy.  The indoor dining room is lovely, the chairs super comfy.  The server was right there, took our drink orders (just soft drinks).  Nothing on the menu indicated how much they were, was a taken aback to see they charge $4.99 for a coke.

Anyway, before you quit reading,  I want to point out something I didnt see in any review:

"CNF"

What is that?  After I questioned it, the waitress told me its a Concession/Franchise fee.  An additional 4.7% of your bill tacked on at the end.  Surveying the menu again, I spotted it, sure enough in very small print at the bottom they state this.  I hope this isnt another monstrous Vegas trend, like 6/5 blackjack, resort fees, or parking fees.  Anyway, just make sure you dont TIP on the TAX nor the CNF.

We were a little short on time, so we both ordered entrees, no appetizers or sides.  Wife ordered Tagliatelle Scampi (shrimp, butter, garlic, wine, parsley, chili in fettuccine noodles) and i ordered 8oz Filet Mignon with roasted asparagus) - medium rare.

Soooooo, out comes the food - now, I ask you, how many pieces of asparagus would you expect? 6 (standard serving)? 8?  How about 3.  Yes, 3.  I know this is an a la carte restaurant,  but if you say it comes with asparagus, I expect a whole serving.  And sadly, for $37, they cant get a piece of Filet Mignon cooked right, its on the done side of medium.  I dont have time to wait for a refire, so I ate anyway, and didnt complain.  I was given every opportunity, but didnt.

The Scampi were fairly small shrimp, i'd guess in the 51-60 range, cooked about right.  But the sauce seemed bland, neither of us detected a hint of garlic.  The 'chile' were shaved pieces used as garnish on top, we both thought pretty inedible.  I wouldve salted this up a bit, but like any haughty restaurant, you wont find salt/pepper at your table.

High prices, a somewhat hidden tack on fee, bland scampi, didnt get the steak right, i'm left at 2 stars.  If we had ordered a full meal and 'real drinks'  we wouldve easily been over $61 each, so its $$$$.

Wanted to stop in for drinks but all the hostesses were very rude and unwelcoming. My friends and I ended up high tailing it out the door. What type of hostess doesn't smile or ask if you need help? Literally they all just stood there and talked to each other lol... So weird and terrible management for allowing that to happen

Amazing! Awesome! Joe made great
Manhattans with bullet whiskey. tomato & burrata app. They toasted the sour dough to perfection. Ended w/Pappardelle pasta. Thank you to our server Kevin!!

My girlfriend and I were just at the Paris for 4 days and ate at the HEXX twice!
The food was fabulous and the service from Tracee the best it gets
Table 217 gets you a great view for people watching
Thanks Tracee for a great time

Trendy restaurant in the Paris Hotel and Casino. A lot of food options including dinners and tapas options. Outdoor dining allows you to watch the Bellagio water show from any seat really. You can watch from inside too as the patio is open to the dining room, that's really nice. The Sangrias were good! They have at least eight different kinds. I had the Salmon for dinner, it was delicious but the falafel was just alright.  Music is very loud, if you choose to sit inside, I think a lot of people complain about that, it really didn't bother me much but if want to have a conversation, it could be intrusive and definitely hard to hear. Solution is to sit outside. Band started around 9 pm and they were good, can't remember their name. Dessert was the most notable part of the evening at Hexx, chocolate cream br√ªl√©e.

On a quest to try something new rather than our favorite handful of restaurants, we came here. I was surprised by how big the space is actually. From the street you don't get that impression.  We sat outside which in and of itself is fantastic with a direct view of the Bellagio fountains.  I had the "special" salad. It was delicious!  It was a large bib/butter lettuce drizzled with oil and white balsamic which in and of itself was mmmm, but then sprinkled with blue cheese, chocolate nibs and onions.  Just a super interesting and great tasting item.  We also had the jambalaya, which was great. 

I had the gin slush drink which was unique and also great. 

The banana cream pie was just ok.  It gets high points for having a whipped cream with no sugar on it, but otherwise the quantity of the whipped cream completely covered any banana taste the dish might have had.  

A nice spot to enjoy the view and every dish delivers.

Everything was good until I got a bite of black hair in my burger. I brought it to the servers attention who sent the manager, Christian, over who basically made me feel insulted for even bringing it to his attention. He immediately asked me if I was sure if it's not mine, I know my hair and I wouldn't purposely add my own which is basically what I felt he was insinuating. He told m he'd take my extra side off the bill, you know bc that was the issue. All in all I won't be returning, for as expensive and it's location I would've expected better customer service.

Only reason for 4/5 stars: it took forrrrreeevvveerrrr to get our food after we ordered. But other than that, the food was so good! Excellent French toast, perfect fried potatoes, the eggs Benedict were delicious too. Great ambience, an open air patio that lets in fresh air, and couches as part of the table seating were a great setting. Would highly recommend to anyone with a picky pallet and time to kill.

Awesome new restaurant experience on the strip. We are locals and have eaten everywhere, this place of going to be a winner! We took some out of town visitors and  they loved it. The calamari and rock shrimp appetizer is excellent. I had the Jumbalaya, my wife the short rib. All well prepared and very tasty. But what sets Hexx really apart are two things: 1. Some really awesome servers and 2. The chocolate. The desserts were off the charts. I don't usually have dessert but I'll definitely have it every time we eat here, which will be frequently. If you're coming to visit Vegas, make this a must do. If you live here, go tomorrow. Did I say they have a view of Bellagio's fountains?

I was hesitant to eat at Hexx since I had read about its chocolate specialties but nothing about their food. However, the food was fantastic and the ambience of the place is trendy and pleasing. It is a little noisy, perhaps because the seating arrangements are so close together and the room is open which creates acoustics of the voices over the background music. Still the food we had was delicious and the service was superb from the hostess to the waiters, we were always attended to with great attitudes. Their deserts are phenomenal and because we couldn't decide on one, we ordered them all. Definitely worth it!

Sean was AHHHHMAZING! 
I have never met a more friendly and respectful server. Patrick was great at being attentive to our crew. Thank you so much to these two for making a hangry group of girls- happy!!
The front desk is very rude and has bad attitude. Food is fair but the people were not nice.

I went down to Hexx with my sisters and a good friend.  It was the perfect location!  We sat outside on the patio and was able to see the fountains and do some great people watching.  The patio stayed nice and cool in the heat with the misters.  Our waitress was amazing and very attentive.  The brocollini was amazing along with everything else we got.  I ate bone marrow and was obsessed with it!!!  Anyway, I totally recommend Hexx.

Katie at the bar was amazing & took such great care of us. She was quick, efficient, and anticipated what we needed through out our stay. She was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu and drink options as well. We had a great experience and would definitely come back.

And 1 Star is being NICE . The restaraunt was pretty empty (about 5 tables of people) but the service was BEYOND slow. 3 tables went up to the bar to pay their tab because the servers were so slow. Aside from the slow service- the food was undercooked. The chicken was PINK. I sent it back
To
The kitchen and the waitress came back with the plate and said "Chef said the chicken breast is cooked through, but he will make you a new one"..... I immediately explained I jus needed the check, nomore food. She took about 10 minutes came back with the tab. Then we ended up
Walking up to the bar to pay the tab and another couple was there waiting to pay. Horrible horrible horrible
I really liked the Candyland Factory store and restaurant, so I was really disappointed to see this replaced it.  The store seems to be the same except Candyland was better.

The food is amazing it's worth the wait it's been our go to place now ever time we come to Vagas!!
Natalie our waitress is on top if it !!

Really disappointing. The menu descriptions made me want to try everything, but the food that was delivered made me wish I had eaten somewhere else. Too salty. Or if not too salty, then dull and tasteless. My first visit will be my last.

We had a groupon for this restaurant and went as a group of four on a Wednesday evening. It was bustling inside but we were seated immediately even though we didn't have reservations. You can tell right away that the restaurant has a classy/sort of upscale ambiance, but without the pricetag of other high end restaurants in Vegas.

We got the mushroom pizza to share which was a tad bit salty but still very tasty. The mac and cheese was amazing! Perfect warm cheesy goodness topped with a slightly crusty layer. We also got the purple haze cocktail which is huge so be prepared to share that with a few other people. They add the dry ice at the table which is pretty cool to watch. Our waitress was extremely attentive and very quick. She refilled our waters multiple times during the evening and was very efficient getting our orders and bringing them out. Overall great experience.

This is one of my new go to breakfast spots in Las Vegas from now on! I have passed this place  multiple times while walking on the Vegas strip but I never stopped until this most recent visit. There is not usually a wait here (well not on the two times we visited two weeks ago) and the staff is really friendly! If there is a wait, they take your phone number at the front and send a text message, which I think is better than having a buzzer that cannot go far.  They also have bottomless mimosas for only $20 bucks (which I think is winning)! While here I ordered a side of bacon, an omelet, and a sticky bun. Our server (on both days we went) were very nice and friendly! My server from the first day also stopped by our table on the second day to say hello, and say she was happy to see us come back. The manager also stopped by on our second visit here to check on the hubby and I, and make sure we were being well taken care of. She was very friendly as well, and I appreciated her stopping by to check on customers ( she checked on every table to speak with customers--just amazing customer service). The sticky bun we ordered was AMAZING! We asked for extra Carmel glaze to make it stickier and more delicious and BOY WAS IT! My bacon was also cooked to perfection and the way I wanted it! My omelet was okie, I might have took a wrong turn by ordering ham, but I could not finish it. I also loved being able to enjoy the water show at the Bellagio, while we waited for our food (great views all over the restaurant). I am def. stopping back by HEXX on my next visit to Vegas!

We ventured to Hexx on a Friday with 12:30 p.m. reservations. We were so glad we had them as they were really busy. Despite arriving early, we were quickly sat in the main dining room. We were offered the option to eat outside but it was warm and windy. They have the giant windows / doors so it's still open air seating, but it felt cooler inside. This restaurant faces the Bellagio Fountains so the view is amazing. 

We got two appetizers - calamari and garlic bread. Both were wonderful. The garlic bread is unique that it's a pull apart bread. We wanted more immediately.

My fianc√© got the Hexx Benedict and the Cinnaroll waffle. I went with the Chicken and Waffles. The other couple with us got the protein breakfast option. 

They also do bottomless mimosas for $20 a person. It felt pricey with four of us but they were poured well and we definitely got our money's worth. We also shared one of their really cool potion drinks that have dry ice to give a smoking effect. I could of skipped the drink. It's cool, but it's a whopping $38 per drink. 

The foods was hands down amazing. We enjoyed each bite and the table unanimously agreed the Hexx Benedict was the best dish. It's served over potatoes for a unique twist, and the layers of flavor shines through. I kept taking bites as my fianc√© ate his waffle. Ha! I really enjoyed my chicken and waffles. Perfectly cooked chicken that wasn't heavily breaded and a light, fluffy waffle. The protein combo looked good and was a nice balance to the heavy appetizers. The couple we were with really enjoyed it. 

We skipped desert as we were full. Out tab was around $289, but we had five entrees (the cinnamon waffle counts as one), two appetizers, a potion drink, and four bottomless mimosas so it balances out.
Heard all the rave about this place, it was delicious. The bottomless mimosas are bomb. Had the veg omelette which was on point but the best part I must admit, was the service. Ms.joann was

Came here for breakfast and bottomless mimosas with two others and a forth to join later. The server was frequently unavailable and many times we searched for her for refills and the time I had to send my breakfast of frittata back due to lack of sausage in it. She came back with excuse that bar was busy(8am?) It eventually got so bad(20 mins for a refill and dropped check without us asking) I had to go speak with manager; she was pleasant and our service went better. Our forth joined but our bill was over $150 and my meal was sent back and only three was drinking mimosas; just expected a little courtesy from manager. I would never recommend this place.

Absolutely love this place! The atmosphere & vibe was perfect! 
First time here during breakfast & we sat out on the patio. Great view of the strip. Good music played in the background. Our waitress was very nice & attentive. 
My friend & I are both got the sangria flights (comes with 3 sangrias) with different flavors. Couldn't tell you which ones we got, but they were all good. 
I ordered the lobster roll with fries & both were delicious! 
Def my new favorite spot in Vegas.

We came here for brunch and made a reservation online. turns out that if you want to sit outside, your reservation time is not accurate. We had to wait an additional 20 minutes to sit outside, with no option to request outside seating when reserving online, and sat at the indoor bar while waiting for our table. While at the bar we ordered a "Farmers market" bloody Mary and a morango cairpirinha (each$16). The farmers market bloody Mary was extremely tasty and comes highly recommended. However, the caipirinha should only be ordered if you enjoy cachaca and a very strong drink; we did not find it particularly enjoyable as it was not very well muddled.

When we finally did get a table, we ordered one order of bottomless mimosas  ($23)as well as the "Hexx Benedict" ($16) "and the "Hexx Burger" ($18). The bottomless mimosas go until 2 pm Monday to Sunday.

The Hexx Benedict were rather bland and under seasoned, although well cooked. The hollandaise was also perfectly done, although also bland. The portion size was small for the price, especially compared to the Hexx burger. We requested the Hexx burger medium rare, and found it to be cooked exactly to order as well as perfectly seasoned. Overall, we would reorder to the Hexx burger over the Hexx benedict, both for taste and portion size.

As far as the atmosphere, this is a great place to have brunch. You have a great view of the Bellagio fountains if you sit outside. The music selection was electric; a  mix of 90's and 00's pop hits and throwbacks from the 80's. The music sound volume wasn't overly distracting and provided a nice background and atmosphere. 

This is a great place to go if you want a great brunch view overlooking the strip and reasonable pricing, although the pricing matches the food quality and requires advanced reservations as well as additional wait time if you want to sit outside.
Great place to grab a bite! Highly recommend the halibut, Brussel sprouts and s'mores dessert!

My wife, myself and my daughter went on a Friday night. We had a great meal, 2 steaks and fish. The drinks were tasty, the service was efficient. Our waiter was friendly and we didn't wait long for food. My problem, and it was a BIG problem, was when the bill came. There was a charge for $8.00 for CNF. I asked the waiter what CNF was. He said it was a concession fee, a charge for the privilege of sitting outside on the patio. WTF?? I immediately told him to take it off. I wasn't going to pay it. Now, it wasn't the $8.00. I had just spent $197.00 on steak, fish and many drinks. It was principle. He immediately removed it. And I thought, "How many people are paying this extra fee, and how much more money is the restaurant taking in on this scam"? Be careful. Read your bill.

Food here was DELICIOUS, however the management and host staff is horrendous. If you're OK waiting for double the quoted time to deal with wherever they seat you, then you will certainly enjoy what the kitchen prepares for you. The food is great, but it's hard to endorse a place that clearly takes advantage of a transient crowd who won't be around the complain the following weekend about how they were treated.

Great food, not so great waiter, really great other waiter who helped us!

We went here for brunch on Friday and it was packed. We had a reservation but still had to wait about 20 minutes after our scheduled time. No big deal though because its a restaurant and we know they cant kick people out to give us a table, especially not when there are bottomless mimosas. Speaking of $23 for bottomless mimosas is not bad. Especially when we had about 7 each. Our waiter was less than helpful but there was another waiter near by who helped us several times and he even refilled our drinks for us!

The food was delicious and portions were more than generous!

Looked like a really cool place and the menu is very impressive. Couldn't wait to try the chicken and waffles... However, after sitting at the bar for almost 10 minutes unacknowledged, and then after a bartender asking if I had been helped and handing me a menu I sat there another several minutes with no water and no service. I don't know if they were severely understaffed or unprepared for this Saturday afternoon but I'm terribly disappointed I walked here from down the strip and left hungry and disappointed.

Great location! Can't beat the view! However.... I spent 3 days telling my husband about how amazing the candied bacon is, only to show up and hear it's been removed from the menu!!! WHAT?? That's blasphemy!! You can't take the best thing on the menu off! So sad. Thank goodness Tracee is our waiter and her sweet personality made up for it! Word of advice: promote Tracee and bring back the bacon!! #makehexxgreatagain

I loved the ambience of the place. We were seated outside with a nice view of the strip. The food was very nice too. I ordered the Veggie Omelet which came with fried potatoes and English Muffin. The omelet was soft and fluffy and had onions, pepper, mushrooms and spinach. It was a good breakfast.
Faboulous food great atmosphere but our server Steven was amazzzing.  Great personality super attentive. Hexx is very lucky to have him

If you are looking for a yummy brunch you must go to HEXX in the Paris hotel. Not only was the food amazing, the service from Sean and Patrick was incredible!! Bottomless mimosas and fully loaded bloodies= you're welcome!!
Amazing service, Brittany is fantastic! Sat our party of 19 in less than 15 minutes! Bottomless mimosas are on point, food is even better! Thank you for taking care of us!!!

Came here for brunch for a bachelorette party weekend. Great food and atmosphere. Tracee our waitress was the best waitress we've had in Vegas, she is literally the best and deserves a raise!!! So down to earth and made us feel welcome! Ask for here, she's great!!!

Oh em gee. The food here is ridiculously delicious.

I was skeptical because I'm always super skeptical about those fancy, shmancy restaurants that serve small portions but charge ridiculous amounts. I had a slight impression that this was going to be one of those restaurants but BOY WAS I WRONG. 

I came here on a Friday dinner date night and was seated immediately for two. Right away we were greeted by super friendly servers who were nice, offered recommendations and treated us like royalty! We were already soo impressed! 

Located at the front of "Paris" right under the Eiffel Tower, its beautifully decorated with a clean, classy, upscale vibe. The menu was just as beautifully crafted as the ambience of the restaurant. They have different options from seafood, gourmet meats, pizzas, etc! 

We ended up ordering the "Big-Eye Poke" Appetizer and omg, it was easily one of the TOP poke's I've had in my entire life. The fish was SO fresh and seasoning was on point. There were crispy onions/leeks and macadamia nut pieces on top which added and amazing texture to the soft poke fish. Not too salty, not too fishy, just freaking delicious. Me & my bf were literally eating it super slowly to savor every delicious bite. 

For entrees, I ordered the Pan Roasted Salmon which was SO unbelievably good; crispy on the outside & fluffy & moist on the inside. (BRB salivating while writing this review) They really do cook the salmon PERFECTLY. The salmon is served on top of a "quinoa" mixture with black quinoa (YES, BLACK quinoa.. don't worry its freaking wayyy better than it sounds), wild mushrooms, peas, and a lemon-ey gremolatta sauce. This thing was just as crazy delicious as the salmon, so together it was just an explosion of flavors in your mouth. I don't think my body was ready for such deliciousness. 

We also ordered the Pan Seared Scallops which was another explosssion of deliciousness. Words cannot express how delicious this food was, friends. My explanations really don't do it any justice. Scallops were light, buttery, fluffy, perfectly crispy yet soft. Came on top of a deliciously creamy puree & various cooked veggies. SO GOOOOOD. 

Surprisingly, we were pretty full from all the food even though we expected not to be. Maybe because our mouths were trying to recover from such outrageously delicious flavors. This place is now a new DEFINITE must to go-to in Vegas!! This place is open 24/7 so there are no excuses not to try it out!

By the way, sorry for saying delicious like a billion times. :D
I thought meal was OK.. Very small portions and a lil pricy.. Overall staff was good but some had no courtesy. I will not return.
Great place! Food was excellent and service was great. Highly recommend it. I liked the spaghetti carbonara and my co-workers pizza was very good.

We went to Hexx for brunch on a Saturday morning and had a great experience. The atmosphere is classy and fun, with good lighting. The food was very sweet and very good. The cappuccinos and hot chocolate are both very tasty. 

I shared the apple cinnamon pancakes and protein omelet with my sister. Both tasted great and the dishes were HUGE. So so much food, we couldn't finish it all. My boyfriend ordered chicken and waffles which were amazing! I'd order that next time!! All dishes were very good and very filling! 

The service at Hexx was exceptional - Tracee was the BEST waitress we've had on our whole Las Vegas trip! It was my boyfriend's birthday and she brought out his chicken and waffles with candles and got the entire restaurant singing happy birthday, cheering and celebrating with us! It was so special and fun!! 

Overall, one of the better restaurant experiences in Vegas.

Staying at the Paris Hotel for a couple of nights, we went to Hexx for breakfast the first morning just because it was convenient -- and then the second morning because the first experience had been  so positive. It is an open, airy room with very comfortable seating; the food was good to excellent, especially the delicious (and sorta decadent) home fries, crispy on the outside and melting inside; and the service was excellent both days. A special shoutout for Sean, our waiter the second morning, who was efficient, accommodating, and very personable -- plus, as my daughter correctly pointed out, it doesn't hurt that he looks a lot like The Rock.
Stopped here for lunch today. Food was awesome and our waiter, Sean was great and made sure we were taken care of!

Had a wonderful breakfast on the last day of our vacation. Our server Sean was very friendly, and made sure we were taken care of. Sean is an asset to the team, and we hope to see him again on our next trip to Vegas!! Also, yay for bottomless mimosas!!! Thanks again!!

We stopped in here for breakfast today! Our meals were very good! I ordered off the menu and they didn't blink an eye. I ordered eggs Benedict which were perfect. Some places get a poached egg all wrong. This place knows what they're doing. They served it with asparagus which was a little odd but tasty! My husband ordered an omelet and it was huge! It came with an English muffin and smashed red potatoes. The smashed potatoes were amazing! We also had a Bloody Mary and iced coffee - both great. The patio seating was a nice touch considering in Vegas you tend to spend too much time inside. The service was quick and we were well taken care of.

Juan and Moon we're awesome thanks for helping us out guys making a bad situation right. There's a reason you're managing at a hip spot like this in Vegas you guys are on top of everything and know that mistakes will happen and when they do you more than fulfill expectations. Food was amazing drinks were awesome not much more I can say good work well played.

The food was mediocre at best. Chilaquiles didn't have much flavor and the lobster roll was mayonnaise-y and didn't have much lobster. Had a pitcher of Bubbly sangria and that was really good. Go for the drinks and people watching with their outdoor seating.
Sean and Alec made our bachelorette brunch FABULOUS! Great service and food. Highly recommend.

This place was EXCELLENT! While I was craving comfort food and went straight for their pepperoni pizza, my dinner mates each ordered steaks. For appetizers, we had the meat and cheese platter and the spinach and artichoke dip (one of my favorite appetizers, so I get it almost everywhere... This place gets first prize. It was incredible). Three of us split two sides, the creamed corn and the mac n cheese, and it was enough for all of us to go with our well-portioned meals.

Their motto is something like "simple food done right", and I truly can't agree with that statement more. Everything I tried from here was top notch and hands down one of the best things I'd ever tried, but nothing was over complicated.

For dessert, none of us could decide which one we wanted the most... so we each got two. Overall at our table we had the orange bar, the peanut butter cheesecake, the panna cotta, the s'mores, the champagne shaved ice, and the passion fruit mousse. Each one was delicious in its own way (and the dessert portions were small enough to merit two desserts each). My favorite ended up being the passion fruit mousse. 

My only gripe was the server. I'm not sure if this is a restaurant-wide policy or if it was just our server who did this, but any time we would ask about an item on the menu ("Are the sides large enough to share? How is the Waygu beef aged?") She would answer our question and then list off her favorites from that section of the menu (even though we never asked for suggestions)... And because we had questions about each major section, I could walk in there right now and order an entire meal for her from start to finish. She was very nice, but that kind of information wasn't asked for, nor was it relevant to anything we did ask.

Great casual dining! Big patio on the strip. Our server was attentive & fast. I had the pasta & my husband had the jambalaya. Although my dish was vegetarian, the server asked if I wanted chicken or shrimp so I added shrimp which was perfect! Would definitely go again. As we were leaving, I noticed they had a nice little bar as well that we might have to try before we leave.

I don't understand why people work in industries where they deal with people when they clearly don't want to be bothered! Our waiter was very unattentive and acted as if we were inconveniencing him. Even the hostess that sat us seemed disgruntled. We clearly interrupted her fascinating story she was telling the other hostess....No one that worked there seemed happy and it wasn't even busy! He checked on us maybe twice and every time he filled my friends water glass she would say thank you and he wouldn't even acknowledge that! I didn't want to give a tip but my friend convinced me it was the right thing to do BUT not to give him any more than 10% which I didn't! I'm sorry that you hate your job but here is a tip (haha get it?) get a new one preferably one where you don't come into contact with people!

My family's experience at Hexx was incredible. The staff was accommodating and friendly. We enjoyed a round of appetizers. The bacon was delicious and the broccoli was some of the best I had ever tasted. My entree was a New York steak prepared as I ordered. It was melt in my mouth incredible. Our two younger kids enjoyed the meal as much as the adults. After wonderful dessert choices we were treated to a factory tour and tasting. Delightful!

Brunch: Got seated here, but the wait for service was so long and staff were inattentive we ended up leaving.

The bar on the other hand is hands down an amazing experience.

HEXX was the first Vegas foodie destination that my friend and I experienced on this trip. I made a reservation a couple of days in advance for a table for 2 at 10:30 a.m. After reading about how busy this place gets on Sunday, I was glad we did. We entered through the casino and received assistance in locating the hostess who was located near the front main entrance off the strip. The casino entrance looks legit but the official entrance is actually from the exterior. 

This restaurant is HUGE! There are several rooms, each with its own unique feel - some airy and sunlit - others more dim, ensuring a more intimate mood. With a plethora of seating options inside, and a highly sought patio-arrangement, HEXX is Modernly decorated, ultra trendy, and THE hotspot for Sunday brunch. 'Nuff said about the venue itself...on to the rest: The reason you are spending money! 

SERVICE: 4/5 Stars
Our server was friendly and helpful enough, but she managed to disappear for upwards of 15 minutes toward the end of our meal experience. I was desperate for one last mimosa and my friend just wanted to obtain our check - so we had to ask a nearby busser to come to our rescue.

BRUNCH FOOD: 5/5 Stars
YES TO ALL THINGS FOOD. 
We were sold on the Carrot Cake pancakes after seeing the pictures on Yelp. Our Carrot Cake pancakes didn't quite resemble the modelesque photos, as they seemed to be missing some of the topping ingredients...either way, the pancakes were LEGIT. You could literally see the shredded carrots on the bottom of each pancake. Basically if you want dessert for breakfast, this dish is for you. We shared them and could barely finish the plate. 

Steak and Eggs - I ordered my New York Strip medium rare, eggs scrambled. Just do it and don't look back. This dish is also accompanied by yummy skillet potatoes and a fluffy English muffin.

My friend had the Farm Fresh Eggs and she reports that this dish was just what the doctor ordered. She ordered her eggs cooked over-medium and that they were cooked perfectly - a hard task to achieve apparently. And the bacon was perfectly crispy...YES!

BRUNCH BEVERAGES: 3/5
I had better mimosas when I gambled at Planet Hollywood. For $23 per person, you can add bottomless mimosas to your meal, or you can just skip the meal and pay the $23 for unlimited mimosas. They come pre-mixed with O.J.  Meaning, each glass consists mostly of OJ, which you have to guzzle through in order to the next one. 

They do not have any other flavors, but when I inquired about changing up the flavor, our server said she could add Peach Puree for an extra $6.00 and basically give me the bottle to make my own mimosas. I upgraded to the $29 but I never got to make my own mimosas. She brought me a glass of potent peach puree already pre-mixed with champagne. I poured most of it out and ask for a top-off of just champagne. We never had the bottle on our table and we barely got them to approach the table with it.  

If you are looking for awesome food at a trendy Vegas-central location, choose HEXX (but be sure to make a reservation). If you are looking for delicious mimosas and decent food, hit up the Bellagio Buffet. You'll spend a bit more money, but you'll enjoy unlimited food and potentially have 100% access to the champagne (so long as nothing has changed since I was last there in 2013).

We came for brunch for a Bridal shower. Our waiter Sean took really good care of us and made sure everything was perfect! He was attentive, friendly and catered to all our requests! Thank you Sean for a fun lunch experience!!

I ate breakfast at 12pm here and it was very delicious. I got the baked french toast and my babes had the chilaquiles. I actually didnt like my toast caz it has too much chocolate. However i tried the chilaquiles and damn they were very. Delicious!  I traded plated with my babe caz he liked my plate and i like his. Everything was great even the service. Our server lady was great. When we started eating a man in a nice color shirt name Michael walked up to us and ask how we were doing and if we needed anything. That was really nice of him. So far good!! They serve breakfast till 2pm!!

We tried HEXX on a weekday afternoon hoping to avoid the crowds, which we did. My husband and I both had the Hexx burger, which was really good. He ordered his medium (their default) and I ordered mine well done. Both burgers were cooked exact and even my well done version was moist and flavorful.  The white chocolate bun was a nice sweet touch to the salty (but not overly so) burger. The fries were good but nothing to write home about. I didn't care for the sweet and spicy pickles on the side, but my husband enjoyed them. Our daughter ordered the Mac and cheese with bacon bread crumbs, but got Mac and cheese with bread crumbs. It's too bad the bacon was missing because Mac and cheese wasn't good, and at least bacon would somewhat cover up the very bland and gritty (like the roux wasn't cooked properly) dish. Now, our daughter *is* four, but she is the least picky child ever, and regularly tries and eats things most kids won't.  If she doesn't like the Mac and cheese, there's something wrong with it.  I tried it just to make sure and while I wouldn't call it inedible I *would* call it a complete rip-off, considering it's $8. Skip the Mac and cheese. Dessert was fantastic. We ordered the chocolate cheesecake with popcorn on top and it didn't stand a chance.  The chocolate samples with spell cards were cute, but you REALLY have to be a chocolate purist to enjoy the samples. This is the real deal, so don't go here expecting Hershey, or even Godiva. It's a very pure chocolate. Even the milk chocolate tastes like dark chocolate. Service was satisfactory but not exemplary.  We didn't get offered the dessert menu (which is strange considering that's kind of its thing) and had to ask when the check was brought instead. I don't think we were being rushed out, though. Overall, 4-stars because the burger was really good, but this was probably a one-time visit to the establishment.

Santa here, 

Hexx had me Hexx ed!   Nice place,  will come back. Staff was nice,  food was great.

Love ya all

Started with the friendly hostess seating us inside with a great view of the strip and the fountains across the street.  Our server, Jessica, was super sweet!  We got some waters to start from friendly Abel then ordered an amazingly good cocktail (must try the bowls)!  We ordered the Jumbo lump crab cake, Pan seared scallops and Roasted cauliflower to share.  Everything was delicious.  Toward the end of the meal, the manager, Andrew stopped by and checked to make sure everything went well.... it did!  We will be back again.  Yum!

We have gone to Hexx multiple times since it changed over from Sugar Factory.  It is fine for what it is but don't expect to be blown away.  The food is average and your paying a premium for the location.

They keep changing the name of the place but it is the same old stuff, sandwiches and burgers.

Sunday brunch with some friends 
Wait time to be seated: 45 minutes 

In the meantime drinks at the bar 
Michelada=delish not too watery
Flamingo punch for $40!!!so worth it !!!

Once seated : order for 7 people took about 50 minutes for our food to get on the table . 

I had the cheeseburger and fries and the corn hash

My boyfriend and I had a meal package here for a Vegas show we purchased.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  We could only order from a prix fixe menu because of the special we had.  I ordered chicken and waffles and it was the most basic food for what was ordered.  The chicken looked like a kids menu from Denny's.  My boyfriend ordered grilled King salmon which was excellent.  Overall I would recommend this place but stay away from specialty item meals.

I give HEXX 5-Stars because of TRACEE!

Tracee is simply amazing. As an avid bruncher, I am confident in saying that she provided one of the best brunch experiences I've ever had. She was fun, charismatic, and would be the reason I would want to visit HEXX over and over again.

I also want to sprinkle a little shine on Bobby and Ginger Lisa too!

Overall, my friends and I had a splendid time at HEXX. 

And shout out to the Cinnaroll Waffle.

This has got to be my favorite place on the strip to go and have dinner at. Today was my 4th time visiting this restaurant, and they never disappoint. Every time I've gone, the service has been excellent. We are usually greeted quickly & with smiles. The staff is great & their food/drink recommendations are always on point. The food amazing! The flavors are so well combined, and so flavorful. 

Tonight my friend and I had the Working Husband & the El Ni√±o drinks. Both were highly recommended, and they did not disappoint. The Working Husband was a perfect balance of sweet & spicy, which was just right for me. The El Ni√±o was delicious. If you like Moscow mules then you would enjoy this drink. I was a little skeptical about the ginger beer they use for the mix, but when I actually gave it a taste, it was amazing. 

As far as the inside space, they have plenty of seating. The indoor seating is beautiful. Big open space, with lots of lighting, and looks quite fancy. The outdoor seating also has enough seating. You have the front view of the bellagio fountains. It could get a bit loud when you're seating outdoors, because of all the pedestrian activity and traffic on the strip. I don't mi d it at all though. It's actually quite entertaining, watching all the people passing by. 

As far as food, my friend had the Halibut which was sooooooo delicious. It comes served on top of this amazing risotto. Such a beautiful fusion of flavors. In this risotto you can taste hints of curry, and coconut, and different spices. So well paired, balanced & made to perfection. I had the butter lettuce and I loved it. The Cocoa Nibs took that salad to a whole other level. It was delicious. We also had the spinach dip which was also amazing. The spinach dip comes with these toasted flattened bagel chips for the dip which were so good. And the dip itself full of flavor. We also had the spicy roasted cauliflower, which was super tasty. It was cooked just right, and extra crunch from the toasted almonds kicked it up a knoch. I also had a mushroom risotto which was also very delicious. I'm obsessed with garlic, so the fact that I could actually taste the garlic in this dish, made my night. Now for dessert we had the passion fruit mouse cake which was to die for. This is a must have item on the dessert menu. It's so light and airy yet full of flavor. 

Overall, all I can say is that this place is truly amazing. The chef really knows his stuff. And the staff is excellent. I will continue coming here and referring all my friends to this place!

Disappointed! I had heard so much about Hexx and was looking forward to the visit. Our party of 4 came here at 2am after a concert. Had to wait almost 30 minutes to be seated. Only 2 small groups were before us! After being seated we counted and only about 12 tables were taken and most of them were party of 2! It took 45 minutes for the food to come and the Mac n cheese was cold. The veggie pizza was hot but bland. The calamari was also hot but fatty and cheap bar snack type. The waiter knew exactly what was going on. He apologized and offered discount from the manager which was appreciated. That is the reason for my 3 stars. Otherwise the food and service was one star. It seemed that the kitchen was low on skilled staff. My party's previous experience was much better.
To give them the benefit of doubt, I will try Hexx one more time to see if it is any better.
They have bottomless mimosas which was the draw! They are amazing! Super friendly and great atmosphere....breakfast was amazing. Our servers Sean and Mike were the best! We had a great experience.

We always have a good time here and never mind waiting for a patio table to open up. The food is great, cocktails are flowing, and the view of the bellagio fountains are spectacular! Staff is always pleasant and welcoming. Plus they typically have Groupon's that are well worth it for a great outing. We will absolutely be back!

Ive been here about four times now and I always ask for my two favorite waiters Jay and Jerry, always have an amazing time here. Food is great, Chef William Loche, is a great cook. 
And always please and entertained by Mr Juan. Usually you don't see the manager engaging the customers but he definitely goes above and beyond to make sure I'm given the best service.
Quickly seated outside under the heaters with a great view of the fountains. Delicious food, a tad pricey but not too much for the quality. We will be back

I was looking for a cafe that had chilaquiles and this was the spot! Highly recommend it!
Although it is a little pricey, approx. $18, for chilaquiles the view, service and decor make it all worth it.

This is a must try for brunch.. patio seating; bottomless mimosas for $23, and GREAT food! Absolutely loved everything about this place.. we made a reservation on open table and they sat us on the patio within 5 min! The bottomless mimosas are totally worth your money.. one mimosa is $12 so as long as you drink two you save a minimum of a dollar.. and they never let our drinks run out! Definitely coming back!

Delicious brunch!! Good deals, especially the bottomless mimosas. Sean and Luis were such an amazing team in serving us. It was my birthday and they made my whole table feel so special. Our glasses were never empty and they gave us more ketchup as soon as we asked! Def come here if you need a good place on the strip to eat and go!
TAYLORRRRRRRRRRRR also Bobby holy shit go to this place for brunch and ask for one of them. Worth it

My friend and I came to Hexx for brunch. Our server Sean was fantastic and helped kick off our Vegas weekend on the right foot! Mimosas and coffee were free flowing and the food was fantastic. Try the chilaquiles and the protein omelet. We will definitely be back for more!

We went here this last Friday to kick off my bachelorette weekend! Tracee, the mimosa ninja, was our server. She was fabulous. So nice and friendly and kept us laughing!! The food was super good and such a great atmosphere. We will definitely be coming back next time!!
Great food! Great bottomless mimosas. Service was just a bit slow.

This restaurant is right on the strip across from Bellagio. Highly recommend. The first evening in Vegas we had dinner here. My sister got the pepperoni pizza - delicious and a large serving. Six slices I believe, could definitely share if necessary. My other friend had the veggie pizza - delicious as well. I had the wedge salad, great choice- so fresh and yummy. Definitely satisfied. 

A few days later my sister and I stopped in for breakfast. Again a great experience. Bottomless mimosas for $23, definitely worth it. I had the ham and bacon omelette. Very good. My sister had 3 eggs scrambled.

I stopped by here with a business associate for lunch. When I arrived, we asked the hostess for a table outside since the weather was amazing, and this restaurant's outdoor patio is directly on the Las Vegas strip across from the Bellagio water fountain display. The hostess showed us some available tables, and we asked for one that was directly in the sunlight (our bad). After sitting there for about 10 minutes it began to get uncomfortable. We didn't even have to ask our waiter about moving, because a manager named Matt approached us and asked us if we would prefer to be moved to a spot that was shaded!

I had the jambalaya and my associate ordered the salmon. They were both excellently prepared and arrived at our table in good order. Everything about the experience was excellent and I will be bringing future business lunches here.
Unlimited Mimosas=Sunday Funday. Chilaquiles were kind of disappointing but tasty, the chips were soggy. I should've gone with the chicken & waffles.
This place is so amazing! Not only was the food amazing the service was great. Tracy our server was on top of it and made things very personable and great. #Seahawksnation

My first ever brunch in Vegas and I'll definitely come back. We had reservations for 11:30 and still waited half an hour- not a great start. When we were finally called, we were told by a grouchy hostess that only a patio table was available, even though we sat across from multiple empty indoor tables for the duration of our entire meal. Luckily as we were seated on the patio the chilly morning burned off into a gorgeous afternoon. 

We dined under an amazing view of the Bellagio and Caesar's, and the pop of orange from the umbrellas made everything that much cheerier. For our table of four every dish was incredible. Eggs Benedict, Cinnamon Roll waffle (with a mound of cream on top), Margherita Pizza, and Ham and Cheese Croissant Sandwich. We all loved our food and marveled at my husband's cinnamon waffle until his last bite. 

A large rowdy bachelorette party kept our nerves on edge as they would burst out in loud sing alongs to the music- but for a place with bottomless mimosas I guess that's going to happen once in a while! 

Would be 5 stars for the food, interior design, location and beautiful view, just wishing the service was a bit better. Still an awesome experience overall.

Went for brunch during a mid week trip to Vegas. Sat on the patio and the view/people watching was great! They didn't advertise their bottomless mimosas (I think since it was during the week) but when we asked they still gave us the deal. The food was really good and nice portion sizes. One of my favorite meals in Vegas for sure!

Great breakfast and awesome customer service. The hostess went out of her way to find the cost of the GIANT Mo√´t bottle of champagne in the front window for my curious young children.   $1,800 by the way!  Our waiter, Sean, was outstanding. When they couldn't find crayons to go with our kids' menus, Sean actually offered to go to the CVS and buy them some!  He explained the menu, brought the food fast, and kept our drinks filled. His assistant, Patrick, was equally as helpful. Will definitely come back!
I've visited this restaurant twice while in las vegas. Both times had good service and well executed, creative meals. I'd be happy to return again.

We visited Hexx for my sisters 21st birthday brunch and were lucky enough to score Sean and Marc! We never felt unattended and Sean kept us smiling the whole time. The food was incredible, the table split carrot cake pancakes and couldn't get enough. I had chicken and waffles and it was amazing. We enjoyed awesome bloody Mary's and a very generous bottomless mimosa deal. By far our favorite meal in Vegas so far, topped off with Sean having the whole restaurant sing to my sis for her bday! And small detail but nonetheless AWESOME music.

Slow service and when we ordered a pizza, burger and appetizer for 1 adult and 1 child, the waitress didn't even think to mention the size of the pizza being enough to feed two. Way too much food and we waited so long before anyone even offered us a drink despite the place being over half empty. The good: nice decor (although my daughter's chair had a loose point that kept poking her and she was too embarrassed to let me switch it out for her), and the patio seating is nice.

The server we had gets 5 stars. However, we had a reservation for 12 at 11:45am and didn't get seated until 30 minutes later. What's the point of a reservation if our table isn't ready? The food was okay. The mocha coffee tasted more like chocolate milk. Service was kind of slow in terms of the time it took to order our drinks, order food, and getting our food. The food didn't all come out at once, either. They did do a good job of refilling water and mimosa!

My family of 6 went to celebrate my daughter's 21st Birthday. It was awesome!!!!!!! The atmosphere, the staff, the food, the drinks... Everything was A+++
Together we ordered a speciality drink, which was huge! Definitely enough for 2-4 people! We ordered 4 appetizers, the hummus, meatballs, pretzels and smothered fries (loved those). For dinner, we ordered the salmon, filet mignon, New York steak, chicken & waffles and the lamb. There wasn't a bite left on anyone's plate. For dessert we went with milkshakes. Vanilla, chocolate and espresso (loved it)!! Everything was great! The staff was so friendly and made our night unforgettable!!! Thank you Angie & everyone else who served our table!!!!

GREAT food with large portions. We went for brunch on Monday/Labor Day, and didn't have to wait long to be seated. The drinks are definitely overpriced though - $4.50 for a cup of coffee and over $6 for hot tea. That's just crazy

If you can't decide between the Hexx Burger or the French dip, GET THE BURGER! I will share this struggle with you guys. I got the French dip and regretted it.  I took a bite of the Hexx Burger that a friend ordered... TWO THUMBS UP!
Bun of the Burger has a hint of white chocolate taste.  Surprisingly delicious and goes well with the meat.  French dip was good, but nothing special.  You can get french dip anywhere else just as good for a lot cheaper price (Arby's or Lion's Choice).  I honestly don't even remember how it tasted.  That's how boring it was. 

Maybe we went at a bad time too. Couple girls were very drunk and loud. They kept screaming at each other, but none of the workers went over there to ask them to quiet down or leave and continuously kept serving them more alcohol. They weren't even sitting that close to us, but we can hear their whole conversation.  It didn't bother me or my friends, we actually thought they were funny...but there were annoyed customers surrounding them. 

Server wasn't as attentive as we wanted her to be.  She was sweet but......Refill our drinks and bring us our check already.  We got stuff to do.  
Anyway, they gave us a little piece of chocolate with our check, but it was horrible.  I spat the chocolate right out.  Bleh!  Want to try their other desserts the next time I visit Vegas.  I believe they make their own desserts there so that's pretty awesome!
Great service!!!!! Best wedge salad!!! Delicious pepperoni pizza!! Open 24 hours. We will be back for dessert.

Had an awesome time for brunch at Hexx! Food selection was great - highly recommend the protein omelet. So.much.food. But so worth it! My partner in crime had the ham and cheese croissant, and he literally smiled the whole time he ate it. Our waitress, Tracee, was amazing! She kept our drinks filled and had us laughing like crazy. Keep up the great work! We'll definitely be back.

I came here with family to get alcohol. We were told that we couldn't sit in the outdoor tables and only get drinks. This is a bar, we were paying customers. Meanwhile, three were almost no tables with people seated.
Below average service. Chicken and waffles greasy. Tomato bisque nice enough. Food and service doesn't reflect the price tag.

Candied Bacon, bread pudding, chocolate cake, and drinks were all delicious! Sat in the patio area and felt forgotten for a while, had to hunt a waiter for refills on the water and our check. But the dessert and drinks made up for it

Beautiful restaurant! We had the prime rib and the sliders. Also the amazing lobster and creamed corn!  We weren't able to sit outside this time but we will wait next time. You have a great view of the water feature at the Bellagio.
I am excited to return

Fantastic meal.  He had the hummus.  The Cessars salads were delicious.  The Brussel sprouts were to die for.  The Mac and cheese was just ok. All our steaks were cooked perfectly!   Wine was great.  The service was top notch.   So glad we stopped here!

service was a little slow and we asked our server to bring us a thing of water because we all knew we'd be going through it but he didn't leave us water and didn't come back very often to check on us for it. the food was amazing and the location is perfect though!

Little oasis in the middle of the desert!!

We stumbled upon Hexx while galavanting on the strip.  The family was hungry and were very pleased with the ambiance and menu selection.

As someone into design, I loved the interiors of the place.  It all added to our dining experience.  We were greeted promptly at the door and seated immediately.

The service was very good, and the food met all of our expectations. If and when we get a chance to get back to Vegas, we will drop by again.
Did the chocolate and wine tasting with my mom and sisters. Had a great time. The atmosphere was wonderful. Great wine and chocolates!
We came here 2 days in a row.  Food was excellent and so was service. Kudos to JJ and Jordan. Great service. Awesome food. And the $38 Bloodymary was definitely worth it. Thank you!
Service here sucks. They took too long for every thing! The food wasn't great either. Honestly, what you see in the pictures is not what you get. Don't be coming here again.

We were staying at Bally's, which is connected to Paris in Las Vegas. Due to time constraints, we needed to find a good place near the hotel to eat and selected HEXX because the menu looked the most promising even though the options were limited. Although there were no reservations available online for 5 people at the time we needed, we called and they were able to accommodate us. When we arrived there was a line out the door of people waiting to get in so we were glad we had a reservation. We were seated at a hightop inside where we had a perfect view of the Bellagio's night time fountain show. We were disappointed to learn they were out of both bottles of wine we wanted to order, and it took almost 60 minutes to get our order of 2 burgers, chicken and waffles, caesar salad, and spinach dip. If you're eating anywhere on the strip in Vegas, plan to be there 90 minutes. The chicken and waffles got great reviews, but I thought the bacon cheeseburger was just average. The spinach dip was good and cheesy. Overall, there was nothing special about HEXX other than the view of the Bellagio's fountain, which you'll pay a premium for.

Brunch was by far the best one I have attended in Vegas. Our waitress, Melissa made or time worth it. She was very patient and was very helpful when it came to explaining different dishes on the menu. If you come here, request Melissa for a superb service.

We decided to try out Hexx for brunch during a trip to Vegas for my bachelorette. We went around noon on a Saturday and surprisingly we were able to be seated (outside) right away as a group of 5. 

I ordered the Carnitas Hash which has braised pork, salsa, home fries, eggs, and pico de gallo. The dish tasted great - savory, pork cooked right, home fries flavorful - and the portion size was good - definitely big but not overwhelming. 

Drink-wise I got the Yellow Ghost which was a Bloody Mary made with a yellow tomato gazpacho. It looked striking but wasn't very flavorful - they could have spiced it up more with some seasoning. 

Overall, this restaurant has very good brunch food but my cocktail left something to be desired hence the 4 stars.

On a side note, they do offer bottomless mimosas at breakfast for $20 which is a good deal in Vegas
for a nice restaurant.
The mac n cheese was super creamy and the Caesar salad had a hint of lemon. The chicken Parmesan was outstanding...hella good when you lit like a torch

We just had a great breakfast at hexx. Honestly our favorite part was the amazing service. Our waiter Sean was on top of everything and so nice. And Bobby was also great. Very good way to start the day! A+!

Me and wife were on our short 3-day vacation, and on our second day, we decided to check out Hexx, as the menu looked really appetizing. Little did we know that the dining experience (brunch) would blow us away. I started out with a berry bowl, which was really good. Then came the main course: Hexx Benedict for me and Protein Omelet for my wife. 
The presentations were simple and very eye-appealing. Loved the asparagus topping the whole of egg benedict. The ham and the thinly sliced potatoes were really well complementing the dish. 
Protein Omelet was really, really good. It was nice and moist and fluffy. Far from all the omelets we've had in the past. The guacamole was a very nice addition to the dish. Adds a very nice flavor to the whole dish. 
This is one brunch we're not going to forget anytime soon and will reminisce for weeks to come!

Ps. Forgot to mention our server, Enrique. Very attentive. Very courteous. Right on point. Would recommend him.

I really enjoy the atmosphere of Hexx and what it has to offer. The few times I have been here the service has been awesome and so is the food. Overall, great place for date night and or just for hanging out with friends.
Excellent drinks and food for the cost.  Service is super friendly even though they were very busy.

The food was delicious. We came for brunch and had the bottomless mimosas as well. Our server JJ was AMAZING! He was sweet, constantly checked upon us and was on top of refilling our drinks. Will be coming back again.

Great spot for brunch or any meal, for that matter, because of the street level view of the Bellagio fountains. If you want a sweet dish to start your day, the chocolate pancakes are the way to go. It's made up of four thick chocolatey pancakes that are plenty sweet with a cake-like texture. It's essentially like eating chocolate cake for breakfast, but you'll feel a little less guilty because pancakes are a breakfast food, after all. The carrot cake pancakes were slightly better, in my opinion. Fluffy, well spiced and full of bits of carrots, and much lighter than the chocolate pancakes, they can be very sweet as well if you consume the entire mound of cream cheese frosting on top. The brioche French toast is rather pedestrian compared to the other stuff we got, but well executed. The "overcooked bacon" was just that, overcooked to make the 1/2 pound of bacon strips exceptionally crispy, with a maple glaze covering them for a touch of sweetness. I can see this place being popular just for the view, but the food is a good enough reason to pay them a visit.

Great views of the Strip and the Bellagio fountain show from the patio year round thanks to outdoor heaters. Good service, good food, and a fun (and more budget friendly) to enjoy dining al fresco in Vegas. Portions are shareable and the house made chocolates were a lovely treat!

Great food and an awesome place to people watch.  Be sure to grab a seat outside where you are right on the strip.  Late night menu hits the spot when you've been out drinking.  I highly recommend the crispy broccolini, it was so yummy!

This is a good restaurant, but why would I go back when only a few steps away I could go to Mon Ami Gabi, which has the same great patio views, similar comfortable ambiance, and even better food, for about the same price?  Well, I suppose it would be because Mon Ami is often full to the gills, while Hexx was half empty.  Other than that, though...

The menu had a little bit of something for everyone (including a pizza or two, which seemed out of place) but only a little bit.  There were items among the eight listed entrees that sounded good, but Hexx seems to be mostly a steak house.

My wife and I started by sharing the Surf & Turf Sliders - a creative idea which was pretty good, but far from astounding.  We then each had a wedge salad, which tasted like a wedge salad - pretty good.  For the entree I decided to try a steak other than my usual favorites (filet or rib eye), so I went with the hanger steak.  Once again, good but not great.  Perhaps that's just because hanger steak is a cheaper cut.  Or perhaps not.  Anyway, most of the flavor came from the B√®arnaise sauce.  A side of creamy mashed potatoes was very good.  My wife thought her Spaghetti Carbonara was excellent but, seriously, isn't that dish sort of excellent by definition (assuming you can afford the calories)?

Our server was pleasant and attentive, but made a significant error in adding up our check.

One last gripe, which is not specific to Hexx.  Both of the big casino chains on the Strip (MGM and Caesar's) seem to insist that their online menus do not include prices.  It's annoying.  So, for reference of Yelpers, the meal described above with two rounds of drinks came in at about $170.

My Desert Mash drink was phenomenal! Vermouth Gin, blackberry and rosemary was the perfect combo!!! Thank you Lupita for your adorable service! Best waitress I've ever had at Hexx! Highly recommended to anyone wanting a great dinner with a perfect view across from the Bellagio! Ask for Lupita, she's fantastic!!

First time here and the place was super busy.We sat in the bar.The place is really loud.We ordered bloody Mary's and bottomless mimosas.All were great but it was the service from Sean in the bar that made our experience even better.We got great service and he was super friendly.Thanks Sean

As much as I use Yelp, I never review or comment on any restaurant. However this time, it was necessary! Love this place! The atmosphere was great!  Food is amazing!!!! Service is totally above and beyond!!!!! Couldn't find what I wanted on the menu as a meal, but my amazing server Jan gave me wonderful accommodating suggestions! I was more than pleased with the results! Only in Vegas for less than 24 hours and couldn't have been happier with the decision of choosing HEXX for brunch! Food came out really quick, staff was extremely attentive, and accommodating! Will be back to visit on my next layover! Thank you Jan soooooo much for an awesome experience! When you have terrible service you are more likely to tell more people than when you have a great one! I will definitely RAVE about this place and JAN!!!!!!!!! So worth it!

Over priced food,  horrible service,  below average food.  Chicken and waffles consisted of soggy cheesy waffles with overcooked chicken fingers for 26 dollars.  Only thing that was good was the view of the fountain at belagio

Hype......long wait even after seating. Food was bland. Had the chicken and waffles. Chicken had no flavor. Waffle was good though. Ordered the veggie omelet for my wife. She said it was okay.  I'm writing this review while I wait for my check which will take a while for them to bring anyway. The atmosphere is nice though, the service kind of kills it. They are nice, just not sufficient. I asked for hot sauce, God knows where that is now.  Prob nice to try atleast once. Paris doesn't have any other nicer place anyway.

Yummy breakfast and bottomless mimosas.  My boyfriend and I each had an omelette and shared the brioche French toast.  Omg the English muffins that came with the omelettes were delish - they were home made, not like any English muffin I've bought at the store or had anywhere else.  The side of potatoes that came with the omelettes were also so amazing - crunchy and had some spice going on.  We really had good service and enjoyed our time here.  Recommend making reservations as it's busy weekend mornings. :)

Killer brunch walked right in off the strip.. Bloody Mary (red snapper) was excellent and that coming from someone who has been a bartender for the better part of a decade. it was made with bacon infused gin and the celery salt rim made the cocktail just right.
