I got eggs Benedict on a bed of scalloped potatoes. Was very good but not noteworthy. My girlfriend had bottomless mimosas for only 23 bucks and surf and turf sliders she was raving about. They looked scrumptious! The reason I simply had to review the restaurant was the excellent friendly service from Sean. Really solid brunch right across the street from the Bellagio.

TRACY! TRACY! TRACY! Had Tracy has our waitress for our bachelorette brunch and it was a large party of 18 girls and she gave the best service making sure our bottomless mimosa was filled and all our food came out correct! And we all did separate bills and she was such a trooper!

Definitely adding this place to my favorite places to eat when you're in Vegas! Really good food, good size portions and I absolutely loved the view we had of the fountains at Bellagio. 

I went for breakfast and had the Veggie Omelette with crispy potatoes and English muffin. My friend had the Eggs Benedict. We shared an oversized Cinnamon Bun. Everything was so yummy! And our waitress was delightful and helpful with menu selections. 

I'm going back soon. I want to try the crab cakes and some of the fun drinks on their menu!

Let me start with the fact that this restaurant is under rated. The service from the time we walked in was superb. We had Taylor as a waitress and Tristan as a hostess and they were extremely accommodating. Compared to most of the food on the strip this place was really unique. We started with the broccolini because I needed some veggies. The broccoli was just the right consistency and it had an orange vinaigrette which made it all the better. I had the French toast with fresh fruit which was refreshing and well seasoned. My husbands omelet was heaven, he did the meat omelet minus the pork (it would have been too much) it was so good the chicken was a pulled chicken and after eating it we felt like we went to a buffet. The homemade jelly for the English muffin was a great topper and the home made potatoes were seasoned and cooked perfectly. I can't wait to come back here!

Breakfast here twice now. One word......AWESOME! You have to try the cinnawaffles or the chocolate pancakes or preferably both at the same time. The cream cheese frosting on the waffle is too delicious to not spend it on everything. This is my go to spot for breakfast in Vegas now. Oh and did I mention the bottomless mimosas
Place has a Nice vibe, good food, decent prices. I had the grilled shrimp chopped salad, with a good combination of flavors and textures.

This place is so great. I've been several times now and am always able to get in with or without a reservation. The food is pretty good, prices are moderate by Vegas standards, and the staff is attentive but not annoying. The best part about Hexx is that you can walk right in off the strip and sit inside or outside, you never have to walk through a hotel/casino. So nice. The decor is modern and the space is clean. The ONLY drawback is that it is connected to Paris which is moderately atrocious, and you have to use the casino/hotel bathrooms.
Best breakfast stop in Vegas, the meat homelet hit the spot, the customer service is excellent and and the waiter are hot lol
The food is very good!!!  But most importantly the service is Ah-maxing.  Jan is the bomb!!!!  I will ALWAYS visit HEXX when in Vegas!!!

Came here for brunch with 5 friends and we had the best time! The bottomless mimosa brunch was incredible! The service was outstanding, Sean our server was so attentive and helpful, gave great recommendations and took great care of our table throughout our lengthy brunch! He really made our experience. Can't wait to go back on my next trip to Vegas!

Holy wow.  Short rib. Thank me later.  Screw Gordon Ramsay and all the other Vegas.  14 year local and that short rib changed my life!! Not to mention great drinks, bar tenders and atmosphere.  Please dont go here... all mine.  The best ever!

Ok came back again and STILL the best!  Best service, best food, great atmosphere.  Im in love
Food was pretty good & so was the service. Nothing super special about the place but I would go back.

I'm going to give my honest review as a resident of Las Vegas. 

I came here with a few coworker's to have our annual Christmas dinner on a Wednesday afternoon. We all live in Las Vegas, so it took us awhile to find parking to the hotel & casino, and then walk to the establishment. 

We had reservations and we were quickly seated. We decided to sit inside, although they had heaters on the patios outside. We wanted to be warm. 

Service 3/5:
I'm honestly not sure what our server said her name was because she spoke so quickly I really couldn't understand her. I did hear her ask what type of water we would prefer to drink, and there were several options; which was a nice touch! Service could have been better. She was friendly, but spoke way too fast.

Food 2/5
I was so disappointed. I ordered the King Salmon, and I'm not sure why I was expecting it to be king sized. I ate it in 4-5 bites. It was a super small portion but the presentation of the salmon was beautiful. I was going to order the chicken and waffles that my coworker ended up changing her order to, but I didn't. It looked way more filling than my salmon, and it also taste so much better than my food. I should have ordered the chicken and waffles. 

We also ordered two alcoholic potion beverages. The first one was the Jungle Juice potion. It was very delicious, but of course it had low alcohol percentage. When we neared the bottom of our potion drink, we noticed a hair in our dry ice. We were all disgusted, but we work in the food and beverage industry so we know what it's like to have unruly customers. We told our waitress, and a manager came and quickly resolved the issue. Thank you! We also ordered the berry potion (I forgot the name). 

Ambience 5/5
Hexx Kitchen was beautifully decorated and very spacious. The patio was also very beautiful, and every 15 minutes, we were able to watch the Bellagio's water show. 

Overall 2/5
Unfortunately, I felt we could have spent less money on the same portion-sized food. It also took forever to find parking, walk through the hotel and casino, and find this place. It was an alright first time experience, but I more than likely won't be returning.
Tracee was so bomb! Her service and personality really shined. She really serviced us to our every need. The food was delicious but the mimosas were extra special.

Great location right on the strip! I would highly recommend the patio seating for an amazing view of the street. My boyfriend and I ordered the Hexx eggs Benedict, lobster roll, and calamari. My favorite dish was the eggs Benedict! This dish came with a perfectly poached egg and a very rich hollandaise sauce. Instead of an English muffin from most places, Hexx serves poached eggs on scalloped potatoes! It was very tasty, we enjoyed every last bite. With that being said, I do wish the serving size for the eggs Benedict was a little bigger since it is more on the pricey side (but worth it)!
I had the protein omelet and the fruit smoothie. Nothing was bad, but it was all ehh and the omelet was too oily and pretty overpriced for what it was. It wasn't bad but I wouldn't come back.

This was an unexpected surprise. The vegetarian food here was pretty good! They had broccolini which had a sweet glaze on its tips, and it had a very unique and fresh taste for a vegetable. The cheese fries and hummus were also really delicious. The veggie pizza was unexpectedly really good. Generally, a lot of places offer a bland version of veggie pizza, but this place definitely rocked the veggie pizza. It was even good the next day I took it back home to Houston. If you sit outside, you can catch a good view of the Bellagio waterfalls.

Note:  There is a 6% resort fee added to your bill.

Hexx was a strange restaurant.  I liked it, but it was very bizarre.  The music at the place was extremely loud. It didn't really fit the restaurant.

The food was great and the desert was even better.  The wine selection and variety was great.  Bottles started at around $50.

They offer gimmicky drinks with dry ice.

So at one table, there is a couple dressed up eating meals with wine.  At the next table at a bunch of people eating burgers and drinking dry ice cocktails.  It made for a bizarre mix.

Got in at 10 AM on a holiday weekend and got seated at the outdoor patio right away, Mon ami Gabi, our usual first choice , was an unknown wait time, so it worked out really well. 

Had the $20 bottomless Mimosa's and Juliet, our waitress, was attentive and kept them filled. Had the classic burger and it was cooked perfectly. 

Ordered 
the chips and dip, which probably wouldn't do again, but it was fun to order something different. 

They have a fun menu, and not terribly prices for Vegas

My buddy and I attempted to eat here at 11pm on a Saturday night but we were unsuccessful. 

We were greeted by two hostesses upon entering HEXX. We were told there would be a 5 minute wait because they had to clean a table up for us. That being said, I expected there to be a packed restaurant. Hostess #1 asked if we would like to sit at the bar instead because there was no wait there. We replied yes.

As we walked into the main dining floor/bar area, we noticed HEXX was practically empty aside from a few occupied tables and a handful of patrons at the bar. As we sat at the bar, this male bartender told us that this other blonde female bartender would be taking care of us. She came up to us and asked if we wanted any drinks tonight. We replied with "No, can we start out with two glasses of water?". She replied yes, and that was the last we saw of her.

Long story short... we never saw those glasses of water. Our bartender never came back to us with those waters even though we saw her standing idly by, 20-25 feet away from us on the other end of the bar. She never returned to take our order even though we had read over the food menu for five-to-seven minutes already. My friend and I cut short our dining experience here and left abruptly because we were put off by the service here at HEXX.

Not bad and fairly priced for the strip the Sugar Factory was better though 
Service was great and food was good

Came in on Memorial Day for my birthday!!! SEAN thank you so much for making my 24th memorable !!! Service was excellent!! Our food was delicious & arrived at a timely manner. We got the hexx burger and the chicken and waffles ! Chicken had great flavor and was tender and juicy! Sean was very attentive and has a great personality!  Must try one of these!

It was an ok experience as my first time. First of all I like I can sit where you have shade and a view of the strip. The wait for my table was fast. But the food is mediocre. The burger was so dry. I think the missing spreading makes it dry. All I got is lettuce tomatoes, bacon and dry bun and the patty... sadly..I have better burger at local drive throughs. Service was decent . just bring your drinks, food and bill.. my house  Bloody Mary was good though.
The food was amazing. The endless mimosas were awesome and service was great. Great location on the strip and an awesome first breakfast for my first time in Vegas on a girls trip

Tracee is by far the best waiter I've ever had! We were here for a bachelorette brunch & she's so much fun & kept us laughing the entire time. Tracee along with the rest of the waiters kept all of our orders (18 of us in total) all straight, had the food & drinks out FAST! Thank you Tracee for such a fun morning!

Our girl Tracee was amazing. Super busy but she was on the spot. Never had to look for her, she was there. Food amazing and just enough. Thanks to her suggestion about mimosa bcuz I can not have orange juice. The guava was great. Will definitely come back.

The food was great with great service the staff at the tropicana recommended this place. The food was great and the service was awesome just as it should be. They have a chocolate shop right next door that's a must stop at also.

Our first server Sam was really kind and told us we should come back for the breakfast because it's really worth it. We stopped in for a quick bite while we were out on the strip for some fuel food, pretty late in the night (about 2am). Our server Brad, quickly got us waters and took our order. We got the $10 late-night breakfast special-eggs were cooked well and the potatoes were good, but different for me. I definitely enjoyed the bacon. It's hard to believe people can screw up bacon but, you'd be surprised. 

I definitely want to come back for the main breakfast menu items.

I have to begin with the fact that I was never impressed with Sugar Factory (3 stars).  Hearing that Hexx has the same owners I would think it was as good as SF.  Unfortunately I was really disappointed with my visit.  I ordered the soft pretzels, club salad, and a diet soda running me $34 plus tip.  The pretzels were tough on the end, like leather.  Aunt Annie's has better.  The salad which said had turkey must have been turkey broth.  At least the croutons tasted better than the pretzels except there were tons of them.  The amount of croutons was overwhelming and dominated the serving.  The service was 4 stars good, but what I ate for the price easily knocks my rating down.  Maybe some of their other dishes are better or maybe they have more kinks to work out.  Either way I feel there are far better dining options around.

Make sure to get a table on the patio over looking the Bellaggio fountains! They have umbrella outside that cover most of the table depending on time of day. We had a groupon and went there for happy hour and midday snack. Happy hour is only at the bar inside. We did the cheese & meat plate with wine and a dessert. Would go again for appetizers since the entree items were not that impressive. Service was great and the view is worth it.

The food here is amazing!

May be a tad overpriced by a few dollars, but otherwise reasonable. The food quality is above average and the restaurant's decor and staff are fantastic. I came here for breakfast with my girls after partying the night before. Hexx's food was supposed to be my hangover-relief. And they definitely delivered.

I had the meat omelet and substituted the pork for tomatoes. It came out nice and toasty, and was accompanied by hot and crispy hash browns and an English muffin.

It was a much needed breakfast pick me up and our server was kind and very attentive. When I am in Vegas again, I would definitely come back and have a meal here! Come and check this place out if you are visiting Vegas.

The worst place we ate in Vegas. Giving it 2 stars bc the food was okay but service was horrendous. We were a group of 4 and the place was not busy. Took forever to get drinks and each persons food came out 10 minutes apart. By the time the last person in our group was served the first person had been done eating for over 20 minutes. It was insane. Waitress just rolled her eyes at us. Definitely skip this place.

If you want an amazing brunch in vegas, stop here!  Bottomless momosas and the food were top notch. Prime rib french dip was superb and my wife has the benedict that was to die for. On top of that, Sean and Charles killed the service portion of our meal. We will come back when we visit again!!!  Thank you Hexx, Sean and Charles for an amazing brunch!!!!
Just okay the prices are pretty high!! Service was minimal and the good was marginal at best
Sean and Mark were excellent. Find a way to clone them. Sean & Mark should be promoted. You can't afford to lose this team to your competitors. Excellent customer service.
Excellent!  Had a New York steak and it was perfect.  Fair price for what you get.  Vegas steaks aren't cheap but this was reasonable for the quality.

From the outside, this place looks like the most hoppin' non buffet brunch place on the strip. but don't let that deceive you.

Price: About $15-20 per dish. Small portions

Food: 
Corned beef hash $18: I would not order this again. Too much hollandaise sauce and a pip squeak amount of beef. This dish was TINY... probably the size of my palm.

Carrot Cake Pancakes $13: This was pretty good as I am a HUGE carrot cake fan. The pancakes were not as fluffy as I had hoped and came out to be a little dry. 

Drinks: bottomless mimosas until 3pm?

Service: SLOWWW. I had to flag down my waitress every time I needed her. Food took greater than 30 minutes from ordering to come out. 
Honestly, I'm looking elsewhere for brunch... but don't forget to check in for free dessert!

Came in for breakfast..it was decent. We were automatically led outside to eat without being given a choice to eat inside. When we asked to eat inside, it seemed an inconvenience but we were accommodated. Customers like choices. Pancakes were really good, came out hot. Our egg plates looked as if they were sitting around, waiting while the pancakes were cooking. We had to ask for extra syrup; one shot glass size syrup is not nearly enough for 4 fluffy pancakes. Even the extra shot glass of syrup wasn't enough but I didn't have the heart to ask for more. I ordered coffee..pretty good but my complaint for the coffee refill is this; the coffee canister hangs off the tub that holds multiple canisters of ice water. The coffee refill was lukewarm at best. Because it was lukewarm, it tasted bitter and wasn't worth finishing the cup. This doesn't make sense to me. The server was pleasant and eager to please. The complimentary chocolates at the end were a nice touch. They promote the connecting dessert store next door and it was a nice tasty treat to finish the meal. Overall, the presentation was nice..good pancakes, potatoes and service. Not sure it's worth the $60 for breakfast but that's standard fare in Vegas. Probably won't go again for breakfast..a crepe from La Creperie will probably suffice.
Food and drinks are awesome! Everything about this place is cool, except for the hostess who are extremely rude. At least you do not have to deal with them too long.

Stopped in for some two for one drinks (courtesy of MyVegas Slots) and snacks to check out the place that was once The Sugar Factory Bar. All was good in my opinion and besides decor, an outside patio and a different cocktail menu...there were no other noticeable changes from the last time I stepped into this building.

Ordered some spinach artichoke dip, a Barrel-Aged Chocolate Manhattan and a Mandarin Mule. The dip brought nothing new to the table in terms of flavor from other spinach artichoke dips I've had but was good nonetheless. 

The Barrel-Aged Chocolate Manhattan is where the party was. This cocktail was awesome! The chocolate infused Bourbon was strong and gave a nice aroma of chocolate and a hint of chocolate flavor. I'm not sure what role the sweet Vermouth might have played in this cocktail besides its inclusion of more alcohol. The more the better. This wasn't a drink you'd take back fast and move on. This was to be enjoyed slowly and I most definitely enjoyed it with every sip. The Manderin Mule was the opposite as it was good but a drink I consumed faster. This was on the more tangier and sweet side with a ginger flavor. 

There was hungry friends back at the hotel so we ordered a custom topping pizza to go. A pepperoni, jalapeno and mushroom pizza that was delicious. There was also the Classic burger ordered by a friend who said it was delicious as well. I didn't get to try it for myself but this friend hasn't steered me wrong with good food so I'll take his word for it. 

A pizza and that Manhattan is most definitely on my list to be ordered again at Hexx. I'll be making my way through the cocktail menu for others to try but you better believe the Barrel-Aged Chocolate Manhattan is being ordered right by its side or free if Myvegas Slots Loyalty Points are used again.

Snack 4/2/2016

Very welcoming atmosphere with a friendly staff.  Love the smothered fries and the lobster roll sandwich has so much flavor. We stopped in at the ice cream bar & enjoyed the chocolate tour. Such a unique gem in the city!!
This place is great, the food was delicious and the bottomless mimosas were truly bottomless. The staff was very friendly also. We will definitely be back.

Only reason for the low rating was because of the service! Came here on a Wednesday morning when it wasn't busy at all. Food was OK.

Definitely would not go there if I am in the area.
SEAN S-E-A-N! A great server and very consistent and polite couldn't be more grateful #katies21st

I purchased a Groupon deal while visiting Vegas. Located directly across from the Fountains of Bellagio so you can imagine the view especially at night if you opt to sit outside. It's on The Strip so there's a lot of foot traffic. The atmosphere was nice & the food was great!

My wife and I had a show at the MGM we were going to see but wanted to see the Bellagio Fountains before hand. So we parked at The Bellagio and walked around waiting to see the fountain show, but ended up waiting 2 hours due to the high winds. Right across the street is Hexx. A reasonably priced venue for food that makes you feel fancy even when you're on a budget (compared to other places on the strip). My wife and I shared a margarita pizza which tasted fine, nothing special, and the hummus and pita which isn't your typical hummus. The garbonzo beans were whole and had a lemon tahini paste that kept it together. The server we had was super friendly and the view wasn't too bad. We sat right next to the window looking towards the fountain. There wasn't any wait and we were seated right away. Overall we spent about $35 for an iced tea and the food.

I came back because I really do love it.

This time I got the bisque soup with garlic bread (which I had to request, they really need to remember to offer it when people order it) and the salad with the turkey.

It was a HUGE salad but not worth $18.....  I'll stick to the Simple Salad.
Great food, fantastic location, decent prices, and mimosas that totally hit the spot!

Ok so went there for my daughters 21st. Staff great, only thing is they charged 35.00 to cut and serve the cake I brought. There was only 7 of us. Don't mind paying something but thought that was a bit out of line. Beware of the CNF charge!!!! Will not return

Hexx is one of the few 24 hour dining establishments within the Paris Hotel. Previously I never dined with them but I was a bit hungry upon my return from a show (I ordered around 12am) so I decided to give it a try. I was dining solo and was directed to sit at the bar. Once I placed my order it took a while for the food to get out so I changed my order for takeout. Service was somewhat efficient however not very warm or inviting. The lady ringing me up said she was unable to charge my room as there were too many people with my name and that I did not come up under my room number. Although it was not a terrible inconvenience I found it a bit open to doubt as I made 2 charges to my room within the same hour prior to placing my order with no issue.  The portion size of the Gnocchi Pomodoro was fairly small and the creamed corn seemed more like a liquid with bits of lobster. I do understand that it was late night dining and thus my rubric should be adjusted. However after arriving to my room and ascertaining what I received for roughly $60 (including tax + tip), I did not feel fairly satisfied with the meal.  I feel if I were to actually dine-in I might have a better opinion so I will do a follow up on my next trip.

I only post if something is exceptionally good or bad and this place was awesome. Our server, Natalie, was spot on and the food was delicious. We had the chilaquiles and salad. Our new favorite weekend brunch!

Highly recommend for brunch! The restaurant set up is super cute! They have an outdoor/indoor concept with a large bar area. Brunch menu was great and features large drinks for groups! I ordered the pancakes and the syrup was infused with vanilla that gave them an amazing flavor! They offered healthy menu options and also some that were more indulgent like the cinnamon roll waffles! Great spot for a birthday brunch or bachelorette!

Great location on the strip, not extremely expensive.  Portions to price is not too bad but still does warrant a $$ rating.  Two sides to sit in, unsure what the real difference between the two is except at night sometimes there is a DJ on one side.  Menu is cafe sized, so not a lot of options but they still have a great variety of options.  I had gotten the mashed potatoes side for $10 but the portion was underwhelming for the price.  I had also gotten a wedge salad for $12, and that was perfect for the price.  For dessert, the cake and shake (21 y/o+) and that was incredibly worth the $9.  Did not purchase any alcoholic drinks so bill ran me $31 before taxes.  Service is great; waitress and delivery folks all moved with haste, checked in with our group's satisfaction, and refilled drinks without us asking.  Even though restaurant was moderately busy, they acted as if we were the only ones there.  The Bellagio fountain "sneak peak" view is nice, just remember you have Las Vegas BLVD traffic blaring by, as well as Bellagio property line trees that prevent you from getting a full view of them.  Overall a very pleasant and classy dining experience.  Next time, will have to try the red meats on the menu.

Good food and a nice location to sit along the strip and view the fountain show at the Bellagio.  I thought the food was slightly over priced for the amount that you received.  For example $17 for a small dish of calamari or $9 for a piece of cake that wasn't a piece of cake, but two small lines of cake the we're about an inch wide by 3 inchs long.  But by far the thing that really pissed me off was the 4.7% concession fee that was added on to my bill by the restraunt.  When I asked a server about this charge, he told me that it was imposed by the owners to help pay for the cost of owning a restraunt on the strip.

DINNER REVIEW 
As most of these reviews are for brunch I felt compelled to share our experience for dinner here. Hexx could possibly be the best on Las Vegas Blvd restaurants. The views/service/food was simply fantastic. 
We got a great table on the patio where we were met by Kevin. A funny but great server! He was great with suggestions and really made our experience great. We started off with the crab cakes and spinach artichoke dip. The crab cakes were delicious. Very clean and fresh tasting and I love how the sauce that came with it was very light and did not drown out the crab cake.  The spinach artichoke was great too, one of the best I had. 
For dinner, I had the short rib and my lady had the seabass. The short rib came with a delicious mash and Brussel sprouts on the plate. It was fantastic. One of the best things I've ever eaten. The short rib was so soft it was easy to simply flake with a fork. 
My lady's Seabass was phenomenal. It was so unbelievably fresh and clean. The dish itself was so refreshing and delicious. It wasn't fishy at all and was super mild. Seared to perfection and perfectly cooked. 
One of my favorite things parts about Hexx is the chocolate bar. After we had our meal, Kevin walked us over to the chocolate bar where we got to see chocolatiers make chocolate from scratch and got the chance to taste all the chocolates they offer. 
Overall, with the great food, service, and views, this restaurant is the best bang for your buck on the strip. I love the experience of the chocolate factory next door. Finally a restaurant on the strip that offers more than just great food, but a great experience as well. Well done Hexx! We'll be back and so should you!

I went to this place for my birthday dinner! My boyfriend and I sat outdoors and our server was very nice. It is a very romantic ambiance. We ordered a spinach artichoke dip (5/5) best I've ever had, but we had to ask pita bread along with it, because the toasted bagel bites were hard and stale (1/5). Broccolini was pretty good and we loved the flavor (4/5). White bean hummus dip (5/5) so goooood! I also ordered lobster tail (3/5), but was disappointed in the small size and it wasn't the best I've had. I've had better at Red Lobster. They brought out a carefully decorated birthday cake for me with flowers on it! It looked much better than it tasted. But it was free! Prices were expensive, but well worth it.


Overall, I would recommend this place and would come back again next time!
the chocolate budino was Interesting but nothing great. the roasted walnuts and caramel made the dish. the hot chocolate was just ok. Best part was the staff. all were helpful and friendly.

Amazing food and drinks. The manager was extremely kind and brought us a bowl of some amazing concoction of watermelon and cucumber. Service is great and food is even better. Nothing beats this amazing view.

The chicken & waffles...YUCK!  Overdone, fried & battered to death.  Does this pic look at all appetizing?  Two stars instead of one because at least we got it refunded and had an okay spinach dip instead.  Much preferred the restaurant that used to be at this same site about a year or so ago.  Dissatisfied and won't being going back.  If you must just try a pizza or burger less likely to be burnt and gross!

Mark was our server and he was really great!! He was such a nice I person and so attentive I practically wanted to ask him to join us. Food was wonderful. I had the filet mignon and my friend had the scallops. The peanut butter cheesecake was really outstanding. It was a very refined dessert and the perfect amount of sweetness after a big steak. Totally enjoyed ourselves!!

Hexx Benedit was amazing! Perfect spot for brunch on a Saturday with unlimited mimosas for $23 dollars. The service was also amazing. We didn't have to ask for anything. Definitely ask for Sean! He won't let you down.
Sean is the best! Amazing food, unlimited Mimosas, great Bachelorette & Birthday celebration atmosphere.
Beautiful building. Friendly staff. Great prices. Location was great. Superb taste and a great atomsphere

I really liked this place. We sat on the patio and enjoyed the amazing view of the Bellagio fountains and massive crowds of people walking by as we ate dinner. Our waiter was such a cutie and very good at what he does. I ate the Margherita Pizza for the first time and thought it was delicious. My friends order stake and some other things and we all thought our food was perfect. To top it all off, they brought me out an ice cream Sunday since we were there to celebrate my birthday.

This was our favorite "nice" place to eat! Nice atmosphere, attentive staff. Salad was fresh and delicious.  It was recommended by the waiter who left stuff off that I said I didn't like--hubby had a steak that was cooked perfectly. Want to go back to try there breakfast !

I was really looking forward to eating here. Made a reservation for 7 for a special brunch with some ladies for a bachelorette. The waitress was really nice and accommodating in the beginning. We got our cocktails and water but food didn't come until an hour and a half later after we kept following up. At that point we were full on bloody Mary's and dejected from the long wait. One of the hostesses even came up and told one of my friends she couldn't sleep on the table. My friend was exhausted and hungry and put her head down for a reason. An hour and a half to wait for food is unreasonable. The restaurant seemed poorly managed since there were several waiters standing around yet our waitresses seemed to be so busy we couldn't find her most of the time. 
Food was sub par and certainly not worth the price. This restaurant needs to better manage its staff and take care to make sure customers are attended to. 
Will not be coming back here. 
If you do decide to go get the bloody Mary's! But for brunch food there are plenty of other much better options at the same price rate.

I arrived with my friends in Las Vegas and checked into our hotel around 11pm. We decided to check this place out. We ate at the bar and ordered the Margarita Pizza, Candied Bacon and Spinach & Artichoke dip. All of which were DELICIOUS (especially the bacon). I do not remember what my friends ordered for drinks but they did enjoy them. I ordered the Blackberry Bramble which was VERY strong and I could only handle a few sips. Regardless, the service was extremely friendly and I would be back!
Hexx was great! Fantastic service, and the meal was tasty. Sean was our waiter, and he was absolutely delightful. I highly recommend eating here for breakfast.

Excellent brunch!!! The brioche French toast was AMAZING and the chicken and waffles was even better!  In spite of my sister being pretty bitchy to our server, Andrea was very patient and kind. She was on top of every request and did it with a smile! I would definitely recommend this place and will certainly return on my next visit to Vegas!

This is by far hands down my favorite breakfast place in Vegas. My friend and I literally sat down to eat someplace else this morning and I threw a little baby tantrum because I wanted to come here...again! 
I loveee the HEXX Benedict (hopefully that's what it is on the menu) I don't eat meat though so I sub spinach. I'm totally a potato girl so even though it comes on top of some delicious scalloped potatoes, I have to get a side of the even more delicious breakfast potatoes-along with a toasted butter croissant because omg *mouth waters* it's sooo good! I could seriously keep going on about this place but the inner fat girl inside of me is getting mad because now we want this yummy meal..again but it's too late lol.

Went with three other couples. 
The menu is really diverse -- which was good for the picky eaters in the group.
The seafood tower was good -- little pricey.
Must get the cheesy garlic bread. damn it was good.
The filet was one of the best i've had in awhile -- expensive steakhouse quality for half the price in vegas -- that's for sure.
Sides : get the broccolini and the cauliflower. so good.
and deserts -- the peanut buttter cheese cake was rich and delicious. and if you like after dinner cocktails -- the tiramusu deconstructed is really good. but it's very boozy.
I have followed the new executive chef -- from Fiamma at the MGM (when it was good ) to his wine bar Due Forni and now at Hexx. He's really classed up this class.
The crab cake was delicious but the macaroni and cheese could definitely use more cheese.

We sat in the bar because it said service right away, our server was not the friendliest, the guy filling our coffee and water was a lot nicer. The food was ok, the ham and cheese croissant was nothing special, their smashed potatoes were good though. Next time will choose a different place

This brunch restaurant is delicious. The omelette was filling but the other foods were a bit pricey for the small portions. This restaurant is more on the high end so it is fancier than your average brunch place. The carrot cake pancakes were still unique and quite yummy.

It was good all around the service was a little slow but I understandable based on the fact that it's located on the strip. My boyfriend order the jumbo shrimp salad which he loved!! I order the chilaquiles it was pleasantly good except too many chips for my appetite. Also they have bottomless mimosas but we order a Bloody Mary spicy which was very well made!

Fantastic service!!

Had Sat brunch of wagyu steak and eggs. Couldn't be better. Seriously.

Wife had some of the best chilaquiles we've ever tasted. Note -- the eggs on this dish come over hard by default. So be sure to order them the way you want.

It was an excellent place for Sat brunch.

This is somewhere we'd had good food in the past. Not anymore. The only " good" thing was our server Krista. Everything that transpired she had no say over, EXCEPT she should of asked about our food, should of asked if steak was cooked properly. She didn't ask, never checked after bringing our food. Our dessert The banana cream pie, we questioned her on after flagging her to our table. The crust was EXTREMELY HARD, we thought it was frozen, but she said no. Ok, it was a graham cracker crust that could not be cut with a knife. 3  people tried. Jambalaya was SO spicy that a lot was leftover. Here's the BIGGEST THING, check your bill and be prepared, they add on a "cnf " fee. No this is not sales tax, this to literally to help them pay their rent. Lol. We asked about this charge, they would not take it off our bill. It's not listed in small print like you see additional fees/service charges in other restaurants. Tried to tell us a lot of places in Vegas add it on. We ate at many places the last week there. They were the only ones.

Go for the drinks and leave because of the food.  I'm not sure why this place has such a high rating but just order a pitcher of drinks and nothing more! Nice view and good people watching. Barf city on the food!
Got the Special on Travel Zoo able to try the carrot cake and the signature dry iced Smokey drink excuse me for not remembering the name

so this is a great tourist trap if you love chocolate. there is lots of dessert places around that honestly have the same over priced over fattening mess desserts. i wanted some candy but no one would help me. only one girl at the counter i tried to but stuff in a bag but then i just left. its very expensive and fattening. i really didnt see anyone even buying anything

I've gone for supper several times and the flavor (overpowering or missing) just didn't measure up.  The deserts are fabulous.  From the reviews sounds like brunch is worth having, but if I'm going to Paris for brunch, I'm going to Mon Ami Gabi.
Kevin, aka chocolate thunder, was absolutely amazing!!! Such a great time!! Our steaks were cooked perfectly!!

Excellent chocolate. Cool store. Beautiful design on the hexx merchandise. Rainbow eyes and lips. And ice cream! And loose candy by the bag! Right outside of the Paris Las Vegas Hotel. We used a groupon for the chocolate tasting and saved 50%.

We couldn't find a place to eat that had good reviews in the Paris Hotel; luckily we found this one.  The ambiance is classy and clean.  I think this place is $$$ not $$. 

::Drink::
Hennessy and Pineapple, my own creation.  The alcohol portion was on point.  

::Food::
We ordered the Spinach Artichoke Dip.  It was served with crispy tortilla chips and slices of pita bread.  The dip also has garlic and cheese; it was creamy.  I thought the Tagliatelle Scampi was bland.  It was made with white wine, garlic, butter, chili, parsley and it came with a side of toast.  I liked the Spaghetti & Meatballs balls better.  For the price, the food was just average.

::Dessert:::
We loved the warm Carrot Cake!!

:: Customer Service::
Friendly but it took a while for someone to take our orders. 

:: Highlight::
The restaurant is across the street from the Bellagio Hotel.  From where we sat, we could see the fountain show. 

::M's Notes::
-Inside and Outdoor Seating
-Park at the Paris Hotel

Good reasonably priced brunch spot on the strip. The open dining room and patio seating are great. Staff was nice and everything we ate was tasty. Would definitely o to HEXX again on our next trip to Vegas.

We had a wonderful dining experience at Hexx two nights ago on a quick trip to Vegas.  We ordered the Calamari & Rock Shrimp appetizer and it delicious!  I love that peppers and lemon were also fried  and served with the seafood and the dipping sauce was amazing.  So much flavor!!  My kids ordered the pizza's and they loved them.  My husband and I both ordered a rib eye and it was absolutely perfectly grilled, juicy and flavorful.  The Yukon gold potatoes were crispy on the outside, creamy inside and perfectly seasoned.  It was a great meal with an awesome view of the Bellagio water show and an attentive and friendly staff.

Went to Hexx with a $50 groupon. I realize it is strip pricing, but dinner was $$$ One person could easily spend that on themselves with a drink and a mid priced pasta dinner.
2 apps, 1 little salad, 1 side, 1 drink was $90ish.
Beautifully decorated and a great patio.
Dinner was good...nice presentation...but not a "Wow" factor restaurant.
Mushroom pizza was delicious. The carbonara pasta was tasty. Service was good. Beautiful room. Fantastic patio if you can get a table!

Pricey, but completely worth it!  We had the crab cake, hummus, and cheesy bread.  At first we weren't sure we wanted to pay for the prices here, but the food exceeded our expectations.  Splurge here, and eat on the patio.  You'll be right across the street from the Bellagio fountains!

Hexx is located where the old Sugar Factory used to be (in Paris).  They still make their own chocolate and sell candy in the old candy shop.  Pretty neat.

The surroundings are fresh and modern, the menu is unique and the food very good.  I had the "Chicken & Waffles" and it was fantastic.  The syrup had a burbon and cinnamon flavor that was very unique.

Specialty drinks and cool desserts top off a solid dining experience.

4 stars!

Very good food.   The breakfast potatoes and protein omelette were delicious.  The butter lettuce salad was interesting and yummy.   Cocoa nibs were an interesting co ready to the steak and tangy dressing.   The veggie burger was top notch.   Only one or two vegan entree options for those traveling with vegans as I am.   WAY TOO LOUD to have a conversation across the table.   Very good service.  Spinach dip ...meh.

Another great experience at Hexx! By far one of my favorite restaurants. The music is great, the staff is awesome and the food is bomb!!!! This visit we had the pleasure of Joahana being our server and she was AMAZING!! Super friendly, came to our table just enough, especially with our bottomless mimosas:) between her, my bomb ass chicken n waffles and mimosas my friends and I truly enjoyed our brunch and everytime I go to Vegas Hexx is a MUST

I was a proud repeat customer of Hexx for the past 3 years but now that's no longer the case. After the extremely unprofessional behavior I witnessed I won't be returning to this establishment. During my last visit I overheard some extremely unprofessional remarks being made by a woman with blonde hair (I asked around & found out her name was Allison M., she looked like management). She was cursing & using foul language towards the employees ON the floor while guests were within earshot. One of the comments in question went something like this "If you guys don't seat this side I am going to have a FUCKING panic attack." as well as this same woman addressing another employee & telling them "You look like shit," again right on the floor as guests were walking by, one of which shot [Allison] a look of disgust before continuing on, passing the restaurant. Which I would've done had I been in their place to be honest. I honestly feel bad for the employees working under this woman as she doesn't seem to have a grasp on how or when to speak to those under her. The blatant condescending disrespect towards her employees is palpable & quite frankly disgusting. For these reasons I will not be coming back, I can only hope any future customers don't have to witness what I did.

Excellent food, excellent service. We made a reservation and got a table right away. Our bottomless mimosas were awesome the food was delicious.  Our server Taylor made our day!! When I come back to Vegas I'll definitely be visiting Taylor & Hexx again!

The hotel concierge recommended this place for a last minute reservation.   They said it was "just American".  We sat outside and could see the Ballagio fountains and Intel light show.  The service was nice and didn't hurry us.  The food was also good.  I had the salmon over squid sauce.  The squid sauce was a little bit heavy, but the salmon was perfect.  Overall, I would recommend this place to others visiting Vegas.

Went to this spot for brunch today and wow was it good! I took some friends from out of town here and we ordered the bottomless mimosas and I had the meat omelette which was loaded with great flavor. We were seated outside on the patio with a view of the Bellagio fountains across the street. Morning person or not, mouthwatering food and mimosas with a spectacular view will start your day off on a high note, cheers Las Vegas!

The food was good not great, the service was fine!
***
If you are not a gambler at the casino do not expect to get the sits overlooking the strip. Its reserved for their special guests even if there is plenty available they will not sit a random guest by the strip! FYI

Yup, these desserts were the first things we ate at 11:30 am in the morning. I don't have a sweet tooth so I tend to shy away from eating sweet desserts, but I caved in and came here. 

I had the Budino which was a massive oval shaped dessert. The chocolate was light and the sweetness was just right. There was also a banana flavored undertone to the chocolate boudino, which was interesting. I appreciated that their chocolate is made from real cacao beans. I also enjoyed the crunchy walnuts topped with caramel. 

The single scoop of banana ice cream was a reprieve from all the chocolate. Without the ice cream cutting through the richness, I would not have been able to finish most of the dessert. If you are not a serious chocolate lover, do not get this. I do not really like chocolate all that much. So after the first few spoonfuls, it stopped tasting wonderful. As I continued to eat, it started to become very heavy in my stomach.

I sampled my friends' French Silk pie and Brown Cow. The pie was topped with massive amounts of whipped cream and was indeed silky. The chocolate was fluffy and sweet. The Brown Cow, which sounds complex, in the end was just a simple chocolate milkshake with root beer.

Our server was great. She offered to have all of our cards individually processed. The atmosphere was sunny and relaxing. I would come again to try some of their other desserts.
Had so much fun here. Great service and great bottomless mimosas! Definitely get the chilaquiles. So good!

It was so good we ate here for lunch and dinner. Taylor was our waitress for lunch and she was one of the best waitresses we have ever had. We checked in and got the free dessert. Chose the hazelnut pudding...oh my gosh!!!!! Definitely a must do!

We had Tracee as our server and she was simply amazing! Helped us out with food recommendations along with sports bets. Doesn't get better than that! Food was perfect and so was service. I highly think this is the place to be with brunch. Come here and you will be happy you did:

Wow! Everything this place puts out is unbelievable. Had breakfast and dinner there same day. Steak and eggs was great. The home fries (potatoes) were no afterthought. Heck, even the English muffin was good. For dinner the salmon was great and the wife's ribeye was awesome. Service was top notch. Everybody chips in to help and they hustle. You can't beat the setting and view there too. Possibly my new go to in Vegas.
A must try - the Carrot Cake Pancakes ! Not served on Sunday - delicious :)) the candied bacon was worth the try too ...

We enjoyed the brunch.  My husband had the steak and eggs which he absolutely loved.  I had the egg and bacon breakfast which was delicious.  Our server was attentive and cheerful and added to our wonderful experience.  Sitting outside along the sidewalk, watching the Bellagio fountain and listening to Pavarotti added to the lovely breakfast.  We will definitely eat here again on our next trip to Las Vegas in June.
I got the chilaquiles which were meh. I tried the carrot cake pancakes and they were UHMAZING
Rachel my waitress was amazing, the service was great, if you come to Vegas this spot is a must! Everything is prepared beautifully and the bottomless mimosas are fantastic!

We went for breakfast about a month after Sugar Factory become Hexx . We were disappointed that it was no longer Sugar Factory as we had always had good meals at SF.

Not knowing what to expect, we were pleasantly surprised to find that the menu was basically the same as we remembered from SF. My wife enjoyed a large omelet with some crispy potatoes...very good. I ordered the Sausage Breakfast pizza, which turned out to be enough for two people, and was also very good. This was the same order that we had the last time that we ate breakfast at SF, and the execution of the food was identical.

We enjoyed a great breakfast on the patio at the base of the Eiffel Tower and had really outstanding service. We will go back for breakfast next time we are in Vegas.

TAYLOR is the best waitress is the world! I came with a party of 6 and she made sure we were well taken care of. Her attitude and enthusiasm definitely added to our experience! Thank you Taylor for starting off our Vegas Trip on a great note!

I can't comment that on the food or drinks. The service was hilariously horrible. The hostesses suggested we go into the bar for happy hour pricing at about 3:30 on a Friday. We went in and sat at the bar. We waited 5 minutes and had some menus delivered. We were then ignored for 15 more minutes. So we left. The bar was not crowded. Does this fly in Vegas?

Service is great here and you can sit outside and watch the Bellagio water fountain shows while you dine. I had the scallops and risotto. The risotto was excellent, perfect texture and flavor. The scallops were prepared well; often chefs will over cook scallops leaving them a bit rubbery. However, they were not bursting with flavor. A sauce would have been a nice compliment to add flavor. I would try this restaurant again, but probably choose a different entree.

Food is by far the best food I have had in. Eva's. Taste palette is a wide range in flavors. I usually don't eat burgers but they have such amazing amazing burger I took the executive chefs advice being that the menu was recreated by him. Calamari is beyond amazing. Lobster ceviche is amazing. I would have to say that chef Carlos has made an amazing choice in making a change to the menu. Had the best food experience and  our server Jessica was amazing at giving us suggestions on the menu.
Delicious food - I got the veggie omelette and it was a large portion. The drinks are good too. The only reason I give it 4 stars is due to the CNF fee they charge at the end.

Hexx kitchen really reminds me a lot of the Sugar Factory in the sense that they have these $36 signature drinks that are or were equivalent to the Goblets that were sold before. The ambiance of the place is definitely LUSH! I enjoyed that for sure. Now onto the food.. After looking at the previous customer's pictures they ordered on yelp I really saw nothing appealing other than the deserts and things that they normally serve during breakfast. I ended up going with the $20 Hexx burger. It was good.. Worth $20? No... The  $28 jambalaya was good very spicy, my bf liked it so that's all that mattered. Service was just okay.. Nothing that was over the top or exceptionally great. Our waitress was.. Different... I have to check out the breakfast before I completely rule out never returning. Oh and the Bellagio water show that goes on across the street is awesome so make it a priority to get some dining on the patio! Remember most of the high price you are paying is for the location so you may as well enjoy it fully with the scenery right?
Sean was great! Friendly and attentive, always had a mimosa refill before we even had to ask.

Popped in for breakfast on a beautiful Sunday morning. Sat on the patio with two other guests. My husband ordered the carrot cake pancakes and my mom and I had the three egg breakfast. The coffee was awesome, best I've had in quite a while. My breakfast was good. My husband loved the pancakes. Our waiter was a tad slow at the end of the meal with our bill, but it was a lovely morning and we weren't in a rush...though the people waiting on tables may have been. (Lol) Overall, great place to enjoy the weather and have some breakfast.

I had Hexx for dinner a couple years ago and it was great (highly recommend the spaghetti). Recently, I had them for brunch and it was EVEN better. I get very annoyed when restaurants stop serving breakfast after 10 am-- especially in places like Las Vegas where you're usually up pretty late and then sleep in. Thankfully Hexx had it all day so we chose to eat there one day when we slept in some -- and glad we did. 

The location is great -- next time I'll sit outside so I can have an across-the-street view of the Bellagio Fountain show. The price is pretty standard for Vegas -- about $20/person.

I had this meat omelette that was amazing and quite filling. Their coffee was delicious also. Great Ambiance and there's an even a candy store attached if you need a little something afterwards

OMG!
This is the best place for Sunday Brunch!
Everyone from the hostesses to the support staff was incredible!
Our Server Steven B was so amazing, patient, professional and super knowledgeable! 
He made our experience unforgettable.

Patrick was also so attentive and on top of his game!!! I recommend and will return.

No comments!!! Is not worth paying 75 for a breakfast plus waiter was rude!!!! Also went to buy some lollipops for my daughter i got two in my hand both of them say best by 8/8/2015 and this was 8/23/2015 i was about to tell them but my husband didn't let me so we just left it there and walk away!!

Wow what a huge space they have!! The hostess desk is actually on the Las Vegas Blvd. side, we came in from Paris hotel and were sent back there. We were seated within 10 minutes but got to sit at the bar and order some drinks. Yes it was breakfast. Their special bloody Mary with the crab and shrimp looked amazing! Our server was very attentive, the view and people watching added to the ambience. 

I ordered the Benedict, we also tried the chilaquiles and an omelet. All very delicious!  I would come back again, we normally go to Mon Ami Gabi but didn't feel like waiting!

Completely bad service!!! We got seated and they took our orders but didn't bring our drinks until after 4 tables that were seated 36 minutes after us received their drinks. Then they still brought their food 3 minutes after we received our drinks. We still waited 30 minutes and they didn't bring our food and they continued to serve other people. We were forced to walk out since we brought this issue to the managers attention and she gave us an attitude about how we still had to wait.

I really enjoyed the Hexx kitchen and bar. My wife and I went for dinner. We started with the Spinach Artichoke dip which I thought was the best I've ever tasted. She thought it was too salty but still good. We both had the wild mushroom Pappardelle for our entree. The server suggested an added protein (chicken or shrimp) and we both added the shrimp. Let me say that it wasn't necessary. The shrimp just added calories and I'd suggest not adding any addition protein to the Pappardelle which was fantastic. The pasta was cooked perfectly and the mushrooms and sauce were awesome. Despite the protein issue our server was great.

Me and my girlfriend decided to stop into Hexx for a quick bite to eat. We wanted to get something small but our server Alexia sold us on the smother fries and the were ABSOLUTELY PHENOMENAL! Then she suggested the spicy jumbayla to my friend and I was interested in a red wine so she suggested the banfi cab with the ribeye and it paired SO well together!! We were set with our meal but she dropped the dessert menu and explained the Hexx chocolate experience.. we were so full she suggested that we check out the retail store to get a tour. It was the perfect way to end our meal because we got to try all the different chocolates from around the world. I'm going to make sure to tell my friends about this place and will definitely be back again to see her! Thanks for everything!
Went here for a birthday dinner. The service was great. The waitress went above and beyond but sadly the food is just not good. I'd go back only for the drinks, which are really good.

The greatest jambalaya, wonderful roasted beet salad, different And excellent food.  Cec was our waitress and did a fine job. The environment was incredible and we can see the Fountain's across the street at the Bellagio. We highly recommend this for lunch or dinner as it was in unexpected surprisingly good and unusual surprise
Food was good but way over-priced. And what's with the convenience tax that is added to the bill? We were not given a reasonable explanation for this added charge.

went out on a date with hubby last night and I've always wanted to try this place out. Our server Kevin gave great service and made our stay pleasant. Love the jambalaya and the calamari. Enjoyed our dinner with the nice Bellagio fountain view.
will b back for dessert next time!
Awesome brunch! The sangria flight is a must, they have so many delicious flavors!! The food and service were absolutely wonderful!

We came here for brunch during a short stay in Las Vegas. Our initial experience was good, however once the food came, I found a paper napkin or something in one of my pancakes which put a damper on the meal. We thought about mentioning it to the staff but they took so long to come by with the check that we just wanted to leave by then. The food tasted good otherwise and staff was friendly.

Awesome spot right on the strip opposite the Belaggio, so you have a great seat for the water show while you dine. I had the Jambalaya and it was probably the best I've had (full disclosure: I'm not from Louisiana and I've never had anyone's mom's Jambalaya). My wife had the Sea Bass, about which she agreed with the server who described it as "cooked to perfection." Speaking of which, Allexia was great. Her recommendations were on point and she was courteous, timely, and professional.

Definitely a recommended spot for a nice dinner and we will be back next time we're in Vegas.
Met a friend this morning for breakfast. Food was great and Sean our server was fantastic!!

The food was good here but the service was terrible. We waited quite some time to get our table which was okay because we were informed it would be a while. However, once inside we waited even longer just to get our coffee and water. Waiter was hard to track down and when asked for something was rude and took another good long while to come back with requested items. The couple next to us also had there order completely forgotten and had to reorder.

Wonderful meal on the heated patio looking across at the Bellagio fountain show.  Excellent food and drink recommendations by our fabulous waiter Kevin aka "Chocolate Thunder"  will definitely eat here again next time we are in Vegas.

There restaurant itself is a 4 star but the Short Rib dinner was a 5. Would definitely go back for that and the Jambalaya was a 4 star. Also the patio is a nice place to people watch overlooking the strip.

This place is SO GOOD. The cheeseburger was amazing. I split it with my mom and we got the fries.  We were sat immediately outside with a fantastic view of the bellagio fountains and our server Sean was great. He was helpful and didn't forget a thing we asked for! Great food, great service, great views!

Got seated quickly but service was horrible! Got our food and still.. no drinks. Server brought my drink finally but STILL no drink for my hubby! Finally half way through the meal she brought it. Ridiculous and it wasn't very busy. Used a Groupon cuz I wouldn't pay full price for this. Food was okay, when service starts off poor, food can only be okay.

Amazing food, amazing service, amazing view. First time in Vegas and we decided to do the bottomless mimosas brunch here and it completely exceeded all of our expectations. The mimosas are on point! The Margherita pizza was delicious. The food was incredible, and best of all was the service. Our waitress, Taylor, was attentive, empathetic, and kept the bottomless mimosas coming all morning. She was great at making recommendations and was so sweet. She deserves a raise!! It was the perfect balance of great service and a fun environment. Overall, I will be recommending this restaurant to everyone I know, and I can't wait to return next time I'm in town. Thanks Taylor for a great experience, we will be back!!

Great place to drink bottomless mimosas, relax and people watch! Bellagio is just across from HEXX kitchen so ask for a table outdoors. We waited approximately 15-20 minutes but worth it.  The food was good, so overall was a great place to dine.
Really nice indoor-outdoor concept for Vegas.  Had a good breakfast there on the patio during the daytime.

Due to the Travel Zoo voucher.... this is one of our favorites, BUT I can say that would not be the same if it was not for the discount received from that.   

Positives:  They have very good drinks and the food is awesome.  I have not tried anything I have not liked on the menu.  But, overpriced at that.  

I have had the short ribs, scallops, veal, fish for entrees all were excellent.
   My favorite was the Veal Milanese!

I have had the Brussel sprouts and loved them the first time, didn't love them the second time, so there were some inconsistencies.

The app of garlic bread was excellent.  Spinach Dip, excellent.

We had the ceviche and that is the only item I likely would not get again

They have a good selection of house-made drinks 

  Negatives:  It is more cumbersome finding the check-in desk, even after eating here 3 times, I always forget, you have to walk thru the restaurant to get to the check-in desk.  The other thing is, last time I was there they seated us relatively close to an open door and it was FREEZING.  Even our waitress had to put in her jacket, which takes away from the enjoyment and the vibe.   They should have at minimum offered to move us, or something.  It was not just obvious to us, even though we did comment on it and asked if the doors could be shut.

Even after getting 45% off from the Travel zoo deal, I ended up still having a bill of $300 for 4 of us.(after tip)  Which means, this meal was a $550 meal for 4 people.   We will only be back IF we get a deal.  It just was not worth $135+ per person. I think it would have maybe been worth $75/pp.

I visited Hexx for brunch on a Sunday morning. We had a reservation and arrived on time, but we still had to wait several minutes before we were seated. That did give us the opportunity to walk around the candy store and they offered us a free sample of chocolate which was divine.
The bottomless mimosas is definitely a deal that you can't pass up - it's not extraordinarily cheap, but it's not unreasonable either.
The service was great - our server was very friendly, helpful and attentive. My mimosa flute was almost never empty! The atmosphere had an open and almost European kind of vibe, but the music was playing very loud and it was hard for us to hear each other when we spoke.
I ordered the chilaquiles on the behest of the server and I'm so glad I listened to her. It was so much food I could barely eat half of it, but it was so tasty. The balance of the different components was perfect. The potato chips were a little soggier than I would have wanted, but I'm sure plenty of people prefer them that way.
At the end of our brunch they brought a birthday cake to the table for our friend who was wearing a birthday crown and boa - we didn't even have to request it, they just provided it and it was not only beautiful but incredibly delicious.
All in, I was originally skeptical about Hexx because it seemed a little too touristy, but I'm so glad that we came here. I was incredibly pleased with my experience!
I had the French toast, yum! We were 11 people and were seated very quickly. We all enjoyed our dishes! Also visit the chocolate store, worth a look!

I loved this place. Came here with a couple other hungry girls for brunch. We had no reservations and had to wait abt 20 mins.  Once seated the place is open, loud, and busy. The mimosas were delish. We pretty much enjoyed all our food. What I wasn't expecting was how surprisingly their fruit salad was...it real good! I was expecting a typical fruit medley but this salad was big and each bite of fruit was sweet and perfectly ripe!  Our server was great too. She was friendly and attentive. I'd come back here.

Loved eating on the patio. Provided excellent people watching on the strip and a great view of the Eiffel Tower. I ordered the Eggs Benedict, which was delicious. We even considered going back the next day for a repeat meal.

Came with the family for brunch. Patio was full so we sat inside, six people total. Service was good, got our drink orders in quickly.

We ordered a variety of things from French toast to eggs benedict. The time to get the food was a slow and it wasn't packed being a Wednesday. I know some places do run a bit slower to allow time for apps, visiting, etc. and no one complained at our table, so it's all good. I'd say it took a solid 20 minutes but the wife says it was closer to 30 mins before the food was served.

Everything was very good, eggs were all cooked perfectly and the French toast was very good. The bacon was a little undercooked for some of the folks but it was how i like it...not so crisp that it breaks into pieces but still a bit soft.

I'll be back again and do recommend a visit if you're in the area.
Had a great experience at Hexx!  The food was delicious.  We had the best server Tracee.  We loved her energy and enthusiasm.  Her customer service was great and she kept the mimosas bottom-LESS!!

No complaints ordered the ribeye and asparagus and I was pleasantly surprised. I mean it's not a steakhouse so I wasn't expecting the best of the best but the rib eye was delish. Cooked perfectly, I always order more steaks medium well. It was cooked to perfection and tender and juicy. The asparagus was great as well. 

The service was good, location is great (the old sugar factory). It's a good late night dining option in Vegas.

I swear the worst manager were talking to him and he started yelled at us and his like you talk like people what the heck .
The food is okay but for service the worst

This is my FAVORITE brunch spot in Las Vegas hands down and that's saying a lot seeing as how I'm a bruncholic. 
It's located inside the Paris, the interior is so cute. You can see them making chocolate next door from the bar/lounge area which I thought was neat. Every time I've been I've sat out on the patio which gives you an amazing view of the bellagio fountains for when they go off. 

My first experience was the best, got some brunch with a close friend and my fianc√©. We got the bottomless mimosas. Blade, our server, was out for blood. I could NOT reach the bottom of my mimosa he kept filling it up even after a sip. I was in heaven, I get very cranky if I reach the bottom of my bottomless mimosa. They also had a yellow ghost bloody on the menu that was made with gazpacho and ghost peppers. BEST BLOODY MARY EVER! The yellow gazpacho  made the best base ever. Toe curling delicious. 

I ordered the carnitas hash and it was amazing. The eggs were cooked to perfection, the egg yolk mixing beautifully with the carnitas and the potatoes. It was absolutely divine. 
We finished eating and just sat around enjoying the beautiful weather out and people watching while still enjoying our endless mimosas. He served us them past 3 pm even though that's when brunch ended. 
It was an absolute blast though, I'm surprised I was able to walk out of the restaurant, we probably had 15 mimosas. 

At the end of the meal the server delivers a plate of dark chocolates with their logo on it, and every chocolate has a spell card. Some are for wealth, some are for fun, some are for wisdom. Either way it's a very cute touch and the chocolate is probably some of the best chocolate I've ever had. 

The second time I went the server wasn't as enthusiastic with the mimosas. Obviously still got my 20 dollars worth but I did reach the bottom of my mimosa. 

I ordered the chive waffle which was really need. They brought me hard boiled eggs, lox, chives, cream cheese, onions and capers I think. It was REALLY really good. My friends ordered the chicken and waffles which were the best chicken and waffles I had ever had. 

It was only 11 am and paramedics were already carting someone off property on a stretcher. Gotta love vegas!

Service was very slow. Food was very bland. Came here because it said vegan friendly and our friend is vegan.......they have one "vegan" option. Don't waste your time. Too many better places to eat in vegas before wasting a meal on this place.

Taylor and Ivan were amazing!! They really kept up with our table as we were a large group. Always made sure our table was clean and we were okay! Taylor gave us amazing costumer service making us feel like she was our friend and wanted us to have A great experience. The brunch was delicious. 10/10

Sean is literally the best... We came for drinks and snacks and sat on the patio. Amazing food and Bloody Mary's!!! Sean and Josh were wonderful... truly a great customer service experience. **It helps that they are also easy on the eyes :)** thanks so much Hexx!!! We will back for sure!

We stopped in to HEXX for lunch on a Monday around 12:30. The dining area was fairly large and we were seated without a wait. Servers were friendly and the restaurant had a nice air-conditioned view of the street to people watch. They have a patio section as well, but the shade was sparse at the time of our visit. I had the chicken Caesar salad, which was sizeable and fresh. Dining Partner had the grilled chicken sandwich and fries and he downed it quick. Our waters and ice teas were constantly filled. Great service, good food, great area and vibe.

We had a pretty horrible experience here. If you find yourself here, do NOT order the chocolate manhattan. 

Trying to find a quick bite to eat and escape from the crowds, we approached HEXX from inside of Paris. Looking into the restaurant behind the hostess counter, it appeared dim, quiet, intimate, and a little upscale. 

But then we were escorted to our table. A walk down a hallway and around the corner...and arrived at our table which appeared to be in a completely different restaurant. It was bright. LOUD. Packed. We considered leaving immediately but we had been searching for a spot to eat for a while, so we decided to tough it out. Wrong decision. 

Here are some silly things that happened: 

-- The staff allowed one large table of 20+ people to be disruptive to the entire restaurant, as they did the high-pitched whistle over and over again to get the groups attention, sang Happy Birthday 5+ times, and basically screaming at each other. 
-- It took over 20 minutes for anyone to visit us originally. Basically 10-20 minutes between any server visit. The entire meal took 2 hours when it should have taken 45 minutes, if not less.
-- For some reason, people from the strip kept (accidentally?) entering through a side door that entered into the restaurant. The signage on the door wasn't really clear and no one from the staff was regularly in that area, so people would open the door and stand there with the door open, or open and close it, etc. It was 40 degrees and windy while we were there. The tables right next to that door were literally completely bundled up with hats, gloves, EVERYTHING. We kept our coats on. 
-- One of our food items that was delivered was bad. Really bad. (It was the mac & cheese - how do you screw that up?) It was so bad we each had one tiny bite and didn't touch it again. Server never asked how our food was, and picked up the completely full, nearly untouched dish at the end of the meal without even questioning it. 

Nothing on the menu made sense. There is no theme in the cuisine - it's all over the place. One thing we ordered was the sausage pizza. It was the highlight of our meal but consider that every thing else was terrible. Basically, it was slightly above average in ingredients and flavor. 

The only -and I mean ONLY - saving grace of the meal. I ordered the chocolate manhattan. Now I will drink pretty much any adult beverage no matter how bad it is. But I couldn't choke this down. The server did notice I had barely touched it after about 30 minutes and offered to swap it to their moscow mule for no charge. For this gesture they earn back a star. 

There are so many excellent restaurants nearby -- do not stop here.

There are so many good things and bad things going for Hexx. Let's start with the good. You have a wonderful view of the Bellagio fountains and strip with the outdoor seating. Check-in with yelp and get yourself a free dessert. They limit this 1 per table do that is the bad thing. My friend and I are both yelpers but they wouldn't accommodate both of us checking in on yelp. They have brunch 7 days a week. Nuff said. Bottomless mimosas (til 2 pm) and a colossal Bloody Mary served in a pitcher. 

The service started out pretty good. Besides the fact that  the hostess at the hostess stand stood there instead of helping the other hostess seat people. We waited for about 10 minutes before we were seated even though there were tables clearly open. I'm guessing it's because that don't have enough servers. I ended up ordering the Hexx Benny. Absolutely no regrets on this. My friend ordered the same and also ordered a Bloody Mary. The food came out before the Bloody Mary did. I brought it up to our server because I'm guessing he forgot. The base of the Benny was made with scalloped potatoes. Layered with Canadian bacon, poached eggs, asparagus and hollandaise. Those potatoes stole the show in my opinion. Such a great switch up on your typical eggs benny. As we finish up our meals, I brought up the yelp check in offer and our waiter had to go ask if we could both use it. He comes back and said that they only allow the 1 per table. So I let my friend use hers because I was going to take it to go anyway. When our server came back I said can we have separate checks. He agreed he would bring it out. He brought the dessert, but no checks in site so I brought it up again. He brings out the check and it was 1 check instead of 2. For whatever reason, restaurants in Vegas love bringing 1 check out. So I asked him again and it wasn't until the 3rd time we got separate checks. Highly recommend the Hexx Benny, but the service here needs some work.

This place is so So and expensive.  Paying for view of strip and the Bellagio i guess.   Food came out completely cold and service was slow.  The cheesy garlic bread was not good, I under cooked and doughy.  It tasted like Pillsbury dough from a can.   $38 for short ribs that were dry and stringy.  Don't recommend this place for dinner.

Came here on a Sunday. Made our reservation for 12 and was able to get our table earlier than expected around 11:45. 

Taylor was our server and she was amazing. She made our experience great. Our bottomless mimosas ($23 unlimited pp) were never empty! The food took a while to get but considering it was Sunday afternoon, I wasn't too surprised.

I got the chicken and waffles and I almost licked the plate lol. 
Plus the view is amazing. On top of everything it was my birthday and Taylor surprised me and my friend with a bowl of two chocolate lollipops and a birthday song. 

5/5 recommend!!!!

Located on the Strip, underneath Paris' Eiffel Tower.

Very popular brunch place, especially on the weekends so try to make a reservation beforehand.

Lots of seating available, try to snatch one in the outdoor patio because it has a great view of the Bellagio Fountains.

Hexx Benedict:  Instead of an English muffin, they use scallop potatoes as their base which I thought was a great idea.  Only 1 serving instead of 2 but it was surprisingly filling nonetheless.  I enjoyed their hollandaise sauce.
Farm Fresh Eggs:  Very filling entree with eggs, bacon, home fries, & English muffin.  All good!
Strawberry Cocktail:  Very taste & strong.

Did I mention that it is open 24/7?!

The food was great- bottomless mimosas even better! Sean S was the best! He was very attentive and always had my mimosa filled to the top :) he was super friendly and was very helpful when we asked for things to do around the area. 10/10 recommend Sean S if coming to Hexx.

Chelsea was amazing! Made my friends birthday unforgettable!! We were a large group with high expectations and she made sure to exceed them all!!! Great service! Fantastic food! And countless memories! Thanks for a great time!

We went for Mother's day brunch and it was great service, great food, and great drinks. I had the steak and eggs and it was perfect. We also got the bottomless mimosas and they are definitely bottomless. My drink was never empty and we tried, every time we got 3/4 down, our server was there to fill us up.

This is our favorite breakfast place in vegas. Great view of the strip and great food! The service was fabulous today! Our server was Sean and he was very friendly and attentive. Can't beat great service and great food on the Vegas strip! We will definitely be back!
Went to lunch here had the classic burger. Little cold so sat inside. View was great of the Bellagio fountains. Food was good you could tell they used quality ingredients.

While I can't speak for the kitchen... in my opinion, the candy bar is a must try! 

If you've walked by the Paris hotel, this place is the giant candy store right next to it. Wifey and I walked in and everyone was super friendly and cool to talk to.

I ordered 2 scoops of fresh mint chip and my wife ordered an ice cream cookie sandwich which totaled about $15. 

It was late at night so we had a chance to sit in their outside seating area and just people watch for a bit. Based on the reviews for the kitchen, we may have to come back and give that a shot too!
Not a long wait. Good very delicious. Had the corn beef hash and brioche French toast with bottom less mimosas. Alec was great. Very attentive.

Location, location, location! HEXX has prime real estate on the strip. You get a great view of the Bellagio fountains from the patio section. The food is okay and a little overpriced (but whatever, its Vegas!) but the location can't be beat! The patio serves as a great refuge from all the sun and is a good spot for some people watching. The inside was nicely decorated as well but it was beautiful day outside the day we came. 

Although the patio is first come, first served - we made a request for it in our reservation and they were able to easily accommodate us. We ordered the smothered fries for the table to share. They tasted just how you would expect -  fries smothered with gravy and cheese. This dish came out extremely fast which was a good thing for us because we needed something to munch on after a night of drinking. They could have let the cheese melt for longer though because in some sections, the cheese was a coagulated mess. Our table of 4 ordered all three of the omelet options (protein, veggie, and meat). Omelets were all okay - kinda wish we ordered something else but everyone was feeling eggs. The smashed potatoes that were served with the omelets were pretty good and seasoned well. Pricing is reasonable for Las Vegas. Oh...they provide you with dark chocolate at the end with cute little "spells". Cute touch! I wouldn't go out of my way to dine here again but it was just the type of place we needed to chill at after a night out.
