Hands down one of the best brunches I've had in my entire life. And we like to think we are branching pros. TracEE (be certain to know it's double Es) is pure trouble. The mimosas are $20 for bottomless and it's the only time I can say she could fill them faster than I could think. Could be because I was tipsy. Could be because she was so fast. Could be because she is a mimosa ninja. All I can say is go. You won't be sad you did.

First time ever in Vegas. We had a Tracy as a server and Melanie assisting her.... they were the BOMB. Very attentive, helpful, polite, friendly, accommodating and overall had a very good brunch experiment. I had the chicken and waffles and my girls had the French toast. Everything was soooo yummy. You can never go wrong with bottomless mimosas. Definitely will recommend this place and ask for Tracy or Melanie !!!

BEST BLOODYMARY IN THE WORLD!! My favorite drink is a bloodymary if you couldn't tell, and I'm extremely picky about the ones I drink. If a bar does not make a good BloodyMary i get really disappointed, and for the most part many places have crappy tomato juice mixes. Hexx is my absolute go to spot for brunch because not only do they have an amazing bloodymary, they have about 4 options of them, variation in the vodka & flavors infused into them. The one I took a photo of here is the "campfire Mary" soooooo delicious!!!! Last time my sister and I shared the big one I forgot the name of it but OMG SO GREAT! It's to much for one person, however if someone wants to drink with you, definitely go for the big one it's totally delicious & worth it. I'm craving one as we speak. 
Now moving to the food. Amazing amazing amazing! I ate the Hexx Benedict, mouth watering! Seasoned to perfection, the potato was cooked in a unique was it was a great brunch. My fianc√© had the French toast with bananas, it was honestly the best French toast I've ever had. The food is delicious & priced fairly, you won't pay an arm & a leg and you will receive a meal of top quality. Hexx is on my must visit list for Las Vegas, definitely give it a try if in Vegas & wanna brunch!
Super yummy food. Patio is very nice and comfortable and a great view to the Belagio fountains. The cake and shake dessert is bomb.
Had a Protein Omlet.  Very good.  Efficient service and great bottomless Mimosas.  Others in my party liked their dishes too.  A little on the expensive side for breakfast but well deserved.

We stopped in for a late lunch/ snack. The food was very good and our waiter team of Sean and Mike were outstanding, very personable, attentive and helpful.
The location is great too right on the strip with all the sights and people watching you might expect.
We will definitely be back.

I'm all about atmosphere when it comes to restaurants, besides the food and customer service being superb...this trendy spot on the Las Vegas Strip definitely won me over! 

I had the Vegetarian Pizza, which was amazing!! 
I ate the entire thing, even my friends were trying to get a slice With my pizza, I ordered a glad of white wine, perfectly chilled and crisp for sitting on the balcony. 

I've only been here twice, however I will return with an appetite and my iPhone. 

Please enjoy my photos...I tend to take myself on a restaurant tour while I wait for my food. 
Besides being an ultimate foodie, photography is my other passion.
Sunday Brunch @ Hexx!! Sean was our waiter and it was fabulous .. the service was over the top and our food exceeded every breakfast/brunch expectation!! Thank you Sean!! See you again soon!!

Went here for my birthday this past weekend and my entire party (mind you there was 8 of us total) enjoyed our meals! I called only about an hour before to reserve our table and they were able to accommodate us, even for it being a busy Saturday night. Great food & Great vibe. And our waitress was more than helpful.
The place is beautiful and the food very good. Good music, and the service is efficient

Our first visit to HEXX was for dinner on the strip Thursday night. Ordering their HEXX burger and filet mignon, we were not disappointed.

The meat was tender, flavorful, and the portions were more than enough to fill my S/O and myself. The sea salt fries had excellent texture, color, and taste.

The ambiance inside was clean and upscale. The staff was very friendly and accommodating when we requested a specific table outside along the strip. Our waiter was chummy and interesting.

The bill for both of those entrees as well as a shrimp appetizer came to about $120 including 20% tip. A fair price for the food and a prime spot sitting outside across from the Bellagio, taking in the view of Vegas while the hustle and bustle moves about below us.

Recommended! Just be sure to grab a seat outside and enjoy the patio.

My BF and I lucked out by choosing this place for lunch without doing any research. We decided on sharing a sandwich that came with fries. We really wanted to try the smothered fries shared appetizer too but didn't want to get to carb crazy so we ordered the Prime rib sandwich and asked if the fries could be changed to "smothered fries". I was expecting some long winded explanation as to why they can't do that.. but the server said it could be done, no problem. She was friendly and on point from the start. We ordered a few drinks while we were waiting for our meal. The place is pretty big but it wasn't too busy.. the food did take a while to come out, but when we were finally served the wait was worth it.

To start, we didn't tell them we were sharing but they separated our meal anyways which was awesome (they even gave us 2 bowls of au jus).. Like I said, on point! The food was delicious. The sandwich was well made. The smothered fries were so so good. Definitely worth a try! And can't wait to go back and try the other items on the menu. 

The d√©cor and ambiance inside was enjoyable and classy. If you want to be constantly misted and see "people of the strip" walking by, the patio is the place to be. 
5 stars for them on the basics & more - Great food, great staff, on top of their shiz (topping off drinks, etc), great atmosphere. 

The entrance from the Paris hotel is a little funky but it's nothing to fuss about.. so, you have to walk 20 more feet to get to the front desk - so what? Do you want to  sit, eat and drink or.... not?
Came here twice while on vacation.  Great ambiance. Great customer service. Decent food.  Awesome view of the Bellagio fountains. Will come back to grab a bottle of wine and chill
Tracee is the absolute best! Bottomless mimosas for $23, great food, and excellent service. We will be back!

Located on Strip,  quite busy during holidays. Typical service, food is decent. It's just convenient.. Location location and location.. because its on strip, right across the Bellagio Fountain.  I would recommend it to people who wants decent food, but not really expensive to visit Hexx. I had New York Striploin there, portion is not big, but taste good. Not much to say. Just a typical American restaurant and bra

We came here for brunch and the food was amazing! It was walking distance from where we were staying at and we got seated right away. The environment is extremely clean and you can choose to be seated inside or outside. The outside has a view of the strip and faces the Bellagio hotel. This restaurant serves mainly American style dishes. Next door you can find their chocolate bar to fulfill your sweet tooth.

Every time we come to Vegas this is the breakfast spot, the coffee is the best!! Service today was a little slow today being it was a Tuesday, but overall being that the weather is wonderful and that we were seated outside makes up for it! This spot is must!
Cheese and charcuterie plate was acceptable. Drinks also standard. Service below par for wait staff to cistomer ratio.

Went for the location on the strip & outside seating. Great server. The food was good. Not extraordinary but good. Would go back for the spinach artichoke dip. Limited menu selection was a negative for me.

Very good food!  I only wish they had a few more menu items.  I tried heirloom tomato soup with basil oil sauce, antipasto salad, mushroom paparadel and chocolate molten cake with coffee ice cream. The  server Jessica A was great and introduced me to their in house bean to plate chocolate process, their amazing extensive dessert list, and was very attentive and polite.  The molten cake was serve deconstructed and the cake had no form - it made for an unusual dish and I'm not sure I like it that way but it tasted good and rich.  I really also like all of the different seating options and this restaurant and this is great for a meal or even just a dessert stop.

The brunch was delicious, our server was perfect. The food was some of the best food I've ever had! The misting on the deck outside was a little annoying but it was only with the wind. The bottomless mimosas was deadly but it did the trick. Would highly recommend!!
Very delicious food. A little pricey but definitely worth it. There brunch menu is the best. Definitely recommend this place for breakfast. The service was terrific here!

Service was great. I loved the location. The restaurant was beautiful but I expected better food for the price. The Wagyu steak was average and the halibut was pretty flavorless. The kids grilled cheese tasted like it was made with processed kraft cheese squares. I kids chicken was good and so were the mashed potatoes. I really wanted to
Love this place but Hexx did not live up to my expectations.

Had this meal at 1:00am, surprisingly the quality did not decline despite the time. 

Menu shortcut: http://www.hexxlasvegas.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/hexx-menu-late-night-161010-np.pdf

APPETIZERS:

-MARYLAND CRAB CAKE: Okay, these were a miss. MEH. Although fried to perfection, the inside was off tasting and the texture a little too mushy for my like. an app that tasted extremely heavy even though it doesn't look it. 

-SPINACH ARTICHOKE DIP: Cheesy, creamy, excellently fatty for the chips and the pita was so fresh and warm you wouldn't believe that was possible at this time of night and with the cool weather. It was good, heavy. 

-CHICKEN AND WAFFLES: Great! I love this dish and wanted to check it out and it delivered. Juicy perfectly fried chicken, seasoning on point, saltiness just right, the apple-cheddar waffle was soft inside, slightly crunchy outside, sweet, excellent batter i have to say. The bourbon maple syrup was delicious and just rightly sweet. Must get!

Good service. Despite a miss (crab cakes), most of the meal was good and I would recommend this place. 

Tip: They take Total Rewards points but do not give.

When we visited we ate here at least twice because it was that good. It was a bit pricey but what isn't in Vegas? The food was great as well as the service. We got seated right away and got to get a table outside right on the strip. Def recommend!

this is the most amazing brunch in vegas. it is everything you want in a luxurious vegas brunch. food is excellent and service is fun, friendly, and helpful. the inside/outside seating makes the experience even cooler.

Sean (or shoe) was such an awesome server. The food was amazing and the service was even better. Sean was extremely friendly and efficient. Highly recommend coming here for brunch and if you can get any server ask for Sean - seriously never saw the bottom of my bottomless mimosa!

Had the simple salad and the hexx burger plus one of those awesome bubbly drinks. The food was ok, nothing that stood out and a tad overpriced but a cool experience. 

Be forewarned- why I am giving this experience two stars... we had an amazing seat outside right next to the sidewalk on a beautiful day when it was 70 outside. Perfection right? NO!!! There was a HORRIBLE man set up on the sidewalk singing. SO LOUD, my date and I couldnt even hear one another. It absolutely RUINED the entire thing. There are NO WORDS as to how awful this was. We couldnt wait to finish eating and get out. My ears were ringing for an hour afterwards.

Eh. Overpriced, and the food was whatever. Only reason I gave 2 stars, is because the staff were nice. 

Anyway, I never splurge on myself. Like, when I go out to places, I don't order the salmon cause I'm a cheapass and I just don't. BUT, I was in Vegas and I thought to myself, ehhh what the heck. So I ordered the salmon, and my friend did too. YUCK! It was beyoooooond salty. I mean, unbearably salty. The only reason we ate it is because we ordered avocado with it, and it drowned out the taste (and because we were so incredibly hungry). My boyfriend ordered the turkey club sandwich, which he said was good. He had no complaints. 

All in all, I was angry because I figured "It's Vegas, their food should be good, right?". I'm just gonna stick to not splurging anymore, because it's just not worth it. At least at this place.
Good food and good service. Venue is cute too! We went in a large group for a batchlorette party and everything went really well, would recommend for large groups or as a cute date spot!

I was in Vegas for a work conference and we booked two separate client events in their private room. The managers were extremely accommodating on a last minute notice and the food was excellent. Definitely try their potions, pizza and pasta! Hexx is a nice break from the gaudy Vegas strip. A must.

My corporate office was in town from New Jersey and staying at Paris. One of the girls was dying to try this place because of the confections and sweets. From the outside it doesn't look like much. There's was a real nice girl holding up a menu but she didn't really know that much about the menu items. 

They tried to give us an amazing table on the patio but we wanted to sit inside so they found us a table. Our server was Lisa and she was awesome from start to finish. She was very knowledgeable about the menu and gave us a lot of great suggestions. I ordered the beef short rib with horseradish mashed potatoes and Brussel sprouts. It was amazing. The meat was very tender and melt in your mouth. Horseradish mash - delicious and the BR were flavorful and crunchy. We ordered the broccolini and it was definitely a hit at the table. My boss ordered the salmon. It came out over the top of a red clam chowder soup with actual clams. He said it was very good. 

For drinks I ordered a bubbles champagne drink to start and a glass of Malbec with dinner and I would recommend both. Great restaurant, excellent service - can't wait to come back.

After our desserts they also brought out little chocolates with fortunes. Very cute!

This was a great place to have brunch.  We stayed at Paris so this was a perfect place for eating after checkout. 

We had reservations and was seated within 5 minutes.

Service was ok but food was delish! I had the chicken and waffles. The portion was huge and it was warm, crunchy and seasoned well! 

Definitely would come back here even if I didn't stay at Paris.

They have misters if you sit outside but we sat just inside with a view of the outside and felt super comfortable temperature wise.

Made reservations a month ahead of time to get in here. It was worth it.  Omar and Seth eerr amazing and made tbe experience ebven better- if possible. Staff was all great and friendly. Food was awesome and drinks were amazing.  Defiantly a Vegas favorite!

Came here for breakfast on a weekend.  We waited about 15 minutes to be seated.  Very friendly hostess.

We were seated outside within great view of all the strange folks walking up and down the Vegas Strip.  We ordered chilequiles and a side of broccoli.  Great tasting food and very filling for 2 people.

The bonus was the bottomless mimosas.  These were very good and our waitress kept them coming.  

Great spot to take a break from all the craziness.  Prices are good too!

Had an amazing dining experience at Hexx! Would love to go back when we make a trip to Vegas again. We didn't make any prior reservations but got seated pretty quickly. We got a nice spot from where we could see the Bellagio fountain every 15 minutes.

Our server Jessica was super cool and was very nice to us. We wanted to try one of the Hexx Potions since it looked very interesting and asked her to suggest something from that list. She suggested us the Purple Haze and that was absolutely amazing!! The whole experience from the way she poured the drink into the pitcher to the point we tasted it was memorable(See video). We couldn't finish the drink but in Las Vegas, it is okay to carry alcohol in a to-go glass and that is exactly what we did. The Desert Smash from the Speciality Cocktails was nice too.

In the food, we had the Baked Spinach dip with bagel chips. The dip was very creamy and yummy. Bagel chips were something different and were nice and crisp and were a perfect accompaniment to the dip. Gnocchi Pomodoro was for my husband and he enjoyed it with additions of more veggies which cost 2 bucks/serving. I had a Halibut which came alongside tomato risotto, lime coconut broth & herb salad. The risotto and the broth were so yummy that I kept wanting more. The fish was poached beautifully to perfection! Absolutely delicious. To end our dinner which rather turned into a feast at this point, we had a Red Velvet Cake which was such a beautiful sight and super classy. It was just the perfect quantity for two.

Rating the following out of 5:

AMBIANCE - 5
Loved the ambiance. Quiet and beautiful. 

FOOD- 5
Everything deserves a 5!!

CUSTOMER SERVICE - 5
Jessica was amazing!! :)

WAIT TIME - 5
No wait time.

HYGIENE - 5

PARKING - 
We walked down from our hotel. Parking in Vegas, especially the strip is a bit cumbersome so it is better to take Uber/Lyft.

Also, this restaurant is 24/7 which is awesome!

We had read other positive reviews of this restaurant so we were ready to enjoy the varied and innovative menu. We arrived to find a small line and were quickly seated. The Carrot Cake pancakes were moist and flavorful with a nice texture. The coffee was very good and the friendly, capable server kept it topped off for the entire meal. My wife and children all raved about their meals. The price was reasonable for the Vegas Strip and if I were to return to Vegas in the summer I would make it a point to visit this clean , friendly well presented establishment.

Let me start off by saying the food was great!  Everyone enjoyed their brunch offerings. Little on the pricey side but we took advantage of a groupon deal!  
Now for the not so greats...we made reservations at 1pm on Sunday and were seated immediately. The wait for food was a bit long. BEWARE of the CNF fee that is attached to every check!  This is a ridiculous unexplained fee. Even worse no one can really quite tell you what it is for. If it wasn't for the deal we got I'd take my business elsewhere!

A nice brunch place on the strip. The view is nice because it's right across the Bellagio water show. The service was great and timely. I had the corned beef hash and I thought it was pretty good, a 8/10. They have unlimited mimosas for $23. They also have a large variety of bloody mary's if you like those.

Great brunch! Perfect for waking up in Vegas ! Carrot cake pancakes were AMAZING ! The service was on point , Sean and Abram were two of the best servers we've had , anywhere ! Highly recommend for foodies and those who appreciate great service !

only had the Big ass bloody mary...pricey worth it??? not bad...its a meal so come hungry...it is horsedaishy(?) so heads up...the mix is pre made as most are but this tasted like Mr. T's, and service was ok but at $40+ for 1 I expected more...and hello its a crab leg give me a fork and napkins...its sad people dont care about details anymore...
Sean was our server, and we had a great experience! He's attentive and friendly and the food was amazing. I highly recommend Hexx and Sean!
The shrimp ceviche was fantastic!  Such a great place to people watch, right across from the Bellagio fountains!  Great service from Cherry!!  Altogether a wonderful experience!
The food was great. Fun and lively atmosphere right across from the fountains on the strip.

I was in town for my bachelorette party and we went to Hexx on our last day for brunch and it was the best way to end our trip! Their food was amazing and our service was even better! Not to mention their bottomless mimosas...
Open 24 hours, right on the strip, great pancakes, meat omelet & French dip sandwich.

so the service wasn't all that great, but they were extremely busy, so totally understandable.
their alcoholic beverages are yummy! I can't remember which one I got though. and their eggs benedict, along with the steak and eggs, and waffles were finger licking good.
definitely would go back

First off I'd like to say we had Jessica as our server and she was spot on. From beginning to end, she helped with any questions and knew about everything to do with the menu as well has the chocolate they specialize in making. She was super friendly and hard working. So thanks for making it a great experience. 

As for everything else. We were able to walk in and be seated right away. The meals are reasonably priced when compared to many other places on The Strip. 

As for me, I had the prime rib. It was probably close to an inch thick, tender and juicy. Be sure to make use of the au jus and creamy horse radish dips. It also comes with a side of mashed potatoes.

My girlfriend opted for the flat iron steak (the best butcher cut).  It was delicious and perfectly cooked. Her side of roasted cauliflower really hit the spot. The spicy aoli provided the flair and the spiced almond provided the crunch.

The atmosphere of this place is awesome especially if you can get a seat outside to watch the Bellagio water show. When visiting Vegas this restaurant stayed packed, they have some featured drinks with dry ice, seemed cool but it was to early for me to try. I did have a mimosa and you can order unlimited mimosas for $23. My meal was the classic burger which was delicious, I rarely finish an entire burger and I was very close. My husband ordered a chicken sandwich and he seem to like it. The wait staff was friendly and attentive. This restaurant is good just a bit pricey.

DON'T BELIEVE THE HYPE. Not related to any of the other reviewers here... didn't come with them and I don't know them lol but the experience was the same so that should tell you something...

Came here on Saturday at 11am for brunch. Portions are small, prices are high, wait is long (30-40 minutes, even with a pointless reservation), service is mediocre, food is absolutely nothing special. 

I had the chilaquiles, which was a mistake. Egg was fried hard (like, what?), no chicken, and the red sauce tasted more like pasta sauce. 

My husband had the eggs Benedict. It was ONE egg on ONE half of an English muffin, basically a half portion. For almost $30. It tasted ok. 

However, it was nice sitting on the patio in the beautiful weather watching people walk the strip and the Bellagio fountains do their thing...None of which is by this restaurant's own doing.

If you're trying to actually eat a tasty meal, don't come here. The prices are laughable for the food, wait, and service. If you wanna pay at least $100 for a cool place to sit, by all means...enjoy!

Service was indeferent to say the best.  The clincher is having people sitting down 15 minutes behind us and get served before us.     We had a few pizzas but so did they, so it wasn't what we ordered

I absolutely loved this restaurant! I went here with a friend for brunch while on vacation and it was such a treat. I had a beautiful fruit platter spread as a starter and eggs with bacon and french toast as my meal. The atmosphere of this restaurant is lovely as well. Great service by the staff. I'm would totally come back next time I'm in Vegas!

If you are a Blueberry lover DO NOT get the Blueberry Oatcake...You will be extremely disappointed!
The atmosphere is cool but the Patio seats are very uncomfortable, so I recommend sitting inside where the seats are a lot better!
Overall experience not good...
Extremely expensive orange juice 6$

I'd like to give this place 4 or 5 stars because the food was outstanding but the service was not as good, unfortunately. We waited almost 10 minutes before we were asked what we wanted to drink and then we were asked twice, by two different waiters. We finally got our drinks, gave our order to the waiter, and waited quite a while before finally getting our food. I had the protein omelette and my sister got the corned beef hash, both of which were outstanding! Again, the service was nothing to brag about as once we finished our drinks, they remained empty the entire time, and nobody bothered to check on us until we were totally done eating. I was really excited to try this place and was pretty bummed with the service.

Was in Vegas for 2 nights and 3 days and ate at Hexx 3 times!  The location was great and we got to see the Bellagio fountain show repeatedly.  The food was terrific!  Loved the sea bass, the antipasto salad and the turtle dessert was spectacular!  The wait staff was friendly and the seating comfortable.  The lighting in the restaurant was perfect too.  Loved the open air feeling yet away from the activity of the street.  I highly recommend this place.
Sean and Big Bobby, our servers were so amazing. We came in after a long night out in Vegas and they made our hangover recovery so pleasant! Definitely recommend this place for the service!

Worst experience ever!!! 
Our waiter did NOT pay attention to us. 
I asked for packets of sugar and never received them. 
I asked for ranch and he never brought it. 
No refill. 
No "Is everything fine". 
Our food took a long time to come out. 
We were there before some other groups and yet they received their food quick. 
I don't know if it was because we were Mexican and they were Caucasian.  
I had to raise my hand in order to get our waiters attention. 
He even admitted to us that if I wouldn't have raised my hand that he wouldn't have came since he had forgotten about our party of 4. 
Never again. 
Beware my people of color. You may be ignored and put aside if you're not Caucasian.
Came here for a friends birthday dinner and the drinks and food were amazing. Excited to come back again.

Great ambiance, nice setting; open to the Blvd. the lighting is nice and I loved the comfortable couch like feel! We didn't feel rushed to eat, even though the place began to get busy half way through dinner. Our waiter was good! We used a pre-purchased Groupon, so it took a while for the manager to come over and verify our purchase, luckily we had time to spare. Some of the dishes are a little pricey! The food left much to be desired. I ordered the Pappardelle and the sauce was very bland. I added shrimp, but the sauce actually made the shrimp taste bad. My boyfriend had the Tagliatelle Scampi, which was okay. We had planned this in advance, so we were really looking forward to dinner here. Unfortunately, we were let down. However, we tried the carrot cake dessert.... Now that was delicious! I highly recommend it.
This place was AWESOME. The pitchers were delicious and fancy. The chicken and waffles were bangin. Great place for lunch or dinner and the candy store is amazing.
Delicious food and great customer service! Good price as well. Amazing view and the portion of the food was big. I recommend this place %
Tracee was an awesome server, great food and the best colossal bloody mary! Right under eiffel tower at Paris, Kenny had the best steak and eggs ever! Outside seating but shaded..
Wish I had been feeling better when we came here! What I did get to eat of my pasta was delicious. Loved the view from the patio of the Bellagio

Worth the wait! It was super busy when we came here and the wait was worth every minute. The food was delicious, and the drinks were great. Our server Taylor led us to the best things on the menu and a bloody Mary that would make you slap your mother. Abram was great too, always making sure we were taken care of. Definitely better than a Vegas buffet!

The first night in Vegas we had a really good experience! We ordered chipotle spiced guacamole and a Bloody Mary, the bartender, the food and the drinks were great so we decided to come back for our last night. This time was ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE. Our first waitress was completely rude but the second one was very nice. However, we ordered tomato bisque and a Caesar salad. The tomato bisque was very cold and the Caesar salad had absolutely no flavor. We had to send them both back. Even the free chocolate they give you at the end they make at the restaurant was terrible this time, and I absolutely love chocolate. We both ended up with food poisoning from this restaurant. We will never be back.

This place is a bit overpriced for the quality, service was lackluster. I had the Hexx burger which was not bad, the patty seemed like it may have come out of a freezer, but tasted good. Just too perfectly round. A little weird. Also, they charge a cnf. Concession fee for being on the strip. Something like 5% added to your bill. Manager said the owners charge it because of how expensive it is to run a business on the strip. Also, it's a decent view of the Bellagio fountains, however it is very, very loud because it is an open environment. I would not go back. Many better options here in Vegas. Try Giada's at Cromwell instead.

Hexx saved the day...or at least breakfast for us on the last day of our trip! We had planned to eat breakfast at The Henry in our hotel but were so disappointed to see it closed for a facelift. That's when I remembered Hexx and how badly I'd wanted to try it.

I was worried we wouldn't get in without a reservation on a Saturday morning but we only had to wait 10 minutes to be seated (it would've been more if we had wanted to sit outside). The Yelp pictures of the food here kill me; my god everything looks amazing. I ordered the Chiliquales and my husband got the Farm fresh eggs which is basically an all american breakfast with the works. Everything tasted as good as it looked and we saw at least five other things we would've liked to try on the menu for next time. But the kicker was the Flamingo Punch we ordered to share. I had heard of the famous Hexx potion drinks but I had never seen the one we ordered. Our waitor was stopped a few times as he brought the rose gold disco ball filled with our cocktail to our table. We got a lot of questions about what it was from passerby and nearby tables as well, but who can blame them? We had a giant, shiny disco punchbowl at our table! The drink was amazing and definitely something to share. We got ~8 glasses each for my husband and I out of that order (don't quote us on the number since we got too boozy and stopped counting after round 4). Come here for a one of a kind Vegas dining experience that's for sure. We will be back guarenteed!
The only thing better than their chicken and waffles and bottomless mimosas were our servers Sean "Connery" and Bobby "Big B". Absolutely fantastic job, best servers I've ever had. You the man Sean!!
Pricey, but everything is on the Strip. Ice cream was good and the guy helping us was super nice and polite about all the samples we wanted. Cool place to grab a quick dessert from.

With a generous amount of tequila, nothing can ever go wrong!

After getting off the monorail and going through Paris, we came out to the Hexx Bar. With our 32 ounce mugs in hand, all we had to do was decide on a flavor of slush. We did electric blue and lemonade mixed. It tasted fantastic. When she posed the tequila, I wondered how much were they really allowed to give us? She filled up the jigger, then kept pouring over that. That means nothing of course, until you take a sip and taste perfection.

I hate it when all you taste is the slushie.

This was not the case. We took a sip and it wasn't too strong and it wasn't too plain. It was nice to get a real drink made. That's pretty much what you get in Las Vegas. 

We talked to the girl behind the counter for a min and she was very upbeat and welcoming. 

Thanks for a great drink!

Had dinner here with some coworkers the other night, and was fortunate to be seated right away. They were pretty busy but service was extremely slow. Took 20 minutes for us to get our cocktails (jack and coke, and an old fashion) I opted for the ribeye and it took a little over 45 minutes to receive. Needless to say it was cooked perfectly and was very tasty. I also shared a side of the mashed potatoes with my co worker since I was told that a side was for 2 people, but it wasn't even enough for me. At $10 the side seemed like a complete ripoff. Overall this restaurant has good ambience and very good steak, however they do seem to be lacking in the speed of service as well as portion size for their sides.

Excellent meal & mimosa. The atmosphere & service were great! I had a Caesar Salad that was fresh but not extraordinary. My girlfriends meals were very good! I would definitely recommend this place for not just a great meal but visit the chocolate side as well!

Worst service in Vegas. Ordered the steak and eggs, medium rare, it took 45 minutes to get to us and it was so well done I could barley cut into it. I sent it back and asked for medium rare again. Another 30 minutes goes by and the whole table was finished eating by then, the steak comes out again, it is so rare it's comical. The waiter had the audacity to call ME out and say "so you wanted it medium?" I said "No I want it medium rare just like my friends ordered it and got it". Another 45 minuets go by and I still don't have my steak, I told the manager I didn't want it any more. For the first time in about 2+ hours were our bottomless mimosas filled without us asking. They are called bottomless so we don't have to see the bottom of the glass. They blamed their lack of attention to your table on being busy, when there was clearly 20
Empty tables around us. If I could give it a -5 stars I would. Never going back!!!!

10 out of 5 stars!!! We had a reservation but they lost it and we had to wait 40 minutes... SO WORTH IT. They pour your bottomless mimosas higher than your glass. The place is a party. The server Rafael and Tracee dance and sing like nobody is watching. It makes the atmosphere so amazing- best brunch ever. Food was phenomenal. Wow.

So....... Every City we visit we just have to try a brunch spot. When i looked up endless Mimosas on yelp HEXX was the first restaurant to show. I ordered the meat omelet, and the meal was great! Guess What was even better? TAYLOR!!!!!! We ordered bottomless mimosas and she didn't let the glass get half way empty before coming to fill us up. She had other large parties, but was still very attentive to all of her Parties. That's something that doesn't happen at restaurants often. Taylor offered premier Customer service.

Don't believe the hype. 
The $36 Bloody Mary was awful.
They give you half a crabs leg, 4 shrimp, 2 olives, 2 pieces of cheese, some bacon, and it was watered down. The Golden Nugget has a better BM for $12.

The ceviche was flavorless.

The Brussels sprouts were good but tart.

The mushroom risotto was over down with mushrooms and also flavorless.

Burger was a tiny little patty. 

The only good thing was the patio on the strip.

My girls and I went out for a drink and apps and Hexx was perfect!    The food and Bloody Mary selection was great!   We wanted to try them all!!!   Service was amazing!  Sean and Josh were Awesome!  What a great way to spend some time with friends!

I wanted to get breakfast somewhere and tried this place on a hunch. They have a really nice outside patio which is great for people watching if the weather is nice. I really like coffee, their coffee is really good here! I would come here for the coffee alone. 

I ended getting the chilaquiles (shredded chicken, roasted salsa, avocado, tortilla chips and eggs etc). This was an amazing breakfast dish! Packs tons of flavor, some heat but not too hot. I was full after this dish and didn't get to try anything else. 

Great service as well. I will definitely make a point of making a stop here next time in Las Vegas.
Food is very good. Great service. Nice atmosphere. Very relaxing place. I had the anti pasta salad and it was excellent.
Tracee is the best server I've had on the strip - kept the mimosas coming, she's friendly and so accommodating. The food was great but our experience was exceptional thanks to Tracee! Thank you!

i was very impressed by hexx! we went for an early breakfast & got seated out on the patio. our servers were great, our meal was delicious, & the atmosphere was very comfortable. the potatoes & english muffin that came with our meals were excellent as were the entrees. tasted very fresh.

Went here on a whim.  Seriously craving a Coke and  they have Pepsi products.  My server, Sean, went to cvs and brought me back a bottle of Coke. Honestly that was way above and beyond any expectation I had.  The food was great, I had the burger and am kind of picky and my order was accurate and delicious. I cannot say enough great things about Sean, truly an exceptional employee!
What a great place to eat! Inside was a bit loud . We ate from the brunch menu. Would love to try dinner. Server was very friendly. We will be back for sure.

Breakfast here is delicious. The restaurant is spacious, clean, and inviting. The service was phenomenal, the server doing a great job of being attentive to guests while also not rushing them.

There's an outdoor patio as well, if you'd rather sit outside and people watch on the Strip.

We came here with an opentable gift certificate. We started off with their version of poutine and were impressed by the large portion. For our main entrees, we ordered the filet mignon and burger and I had a custom mudslide cocktail.  Service was fast and attentive.  The pepper crusted filet mignon came out huge and flavorful.  I wish the presentation was a little more appetizing, but not a big deal. The burger was good too, though not special enough to be worth the cost.  All in all, Hexx is a decent place to eat on the strip.
Tracee with two E's was a sweetheart. We had the best time. If you love sweet pancakes get the carrot cake pancakes!
Amazing food. Amazing service. Johnie was our server. He was the best.  And so attentive.  We got bottomless mimosas. Highly recommend. I just can't say enough good things about this place.

Great service, food and drinks. 

The restaurant is located right on the Strip inside the Paris across from the Bellagio fountains. A great view to watch the fountain show sitting inside or out on the patio. It was a little loud inside.

Self parking is available in the hotel parking garage or main valet in front of the hotel.

They are open 24 hours! The menu offerred a lot of variety. The menu focuses on dishes made from fresh, quality-sourced ingredients.¬†

It was a Tuesday night at 10pm and the place is still packed, that's a good sign.

Drinks are pricey, ranges $15- $36. The food came out quick. The sliders and cocktails were tasty!

Our waitress was friendly and attentive, even with it being a busy night. 

Make sure you go next door for the chocolate.

Love this breakfast spot. Been here several times and the service is always great as well as the food. Last time we had Natalie and she was top of the line! Best experience so far? I mean really...how does it get better each time?!
Food was excellent!  Lobster roll was amazing. Sean and Crystal provided awesome customer service.  We'll be back again.

Our server Rafael was very nice, attentive and accommodating.    My daughter had the veggie omelette and and I had the eggs Benedict and we both had bottomless Mimosa's.  He never let our drinks get below half and was very kind.  The food was good.  We sat on the patio so the view was pretty and relaxing.  The music was just right.  Will definitely be back.

After seeing O we wanted dessert before heading to Fremont Street for a fun night at Don't Tell Mama piano bar. We walked across to Hexx following the scent of the yelp reviews. 

The people watching outside is fantastic! But I only give 2 stars because I was expecting a much better dessert experience. The presentation was lovely but the taste was lacking. Too much almond in the tiramisu and it was dry. The fancy s'mores wasn't crunchy and lacked a smooth warm chocolate sauce. Overall I was disappointed. I would try another option if I were you. But enjoy Vegas!!!

Great Brunch location, significantly bettered by the staff. Sean was our server and he was particularly excellent. Will be going back! Sticky bun was HUGE!!

Reservations a good idea.

Came in and was seated right away. It took the waitress a good 15 minutes to come over and ask for our drink order. We ordered the chicken and waffles and Margarita pizza. The chicken was chicken strips and kind of meager for the price. The pizza was good, not impressive. Hex felt like a tourist trap. Overpriced for average food. They do have a great view of the bellagio fountains at night.

Ok so the bottomless mimosas were cute a little weak but cute and the French toast was pretty good but let's get into why this place gets a 5 Star......

It was my friends bday and our waitress Tracee was the isssssshhhhhhhhh. I think she was the best server I have ever experienced! YES! EVER!!! She danced with us, kept the mimosas with the help of Ginger and Bobby who was super cool too. 

We need more servers like Tracee in every restaurant thank you for making my friends bday brunch forever memorable. They played great hip-hop music too!
Came here for some late night eats. I ordered the carbonara pasta. Definitely would recommend this dish. Extremely flavorful. Definitely in my Vegas rotation.

Wow, we LOVED this place! We went on a Sunday afternoon for brunch. Service was prompt, we didn't have a wait at all. I loved the decor, all whites and beige. The interior of the restaurant opens directly onto the large patio so we got lots of fresh air and sunlight which was fabulous. Our waitress was attentive and quick. My friend who is a salad snob said her "Simple Salad" was one of the best she has ever had. I got the protein omelette which was very tasty. Our other friend ordered the sticky bun which was massive. Definitely will put you in a sugar coma if you try to eat the whole thing. The bowl of fruit was huge (definitely not the little side dish you typically think of) and has a great variety of fruits to snack on. Definitely one of my favorite restaurants on the strip.

Food and service are great! The only thing i didn't like was that if you order steak it doesn't come with a side. You have to pay extra for that. Which is not good specially if you are paying $39 for it.

Very cool place to have breakfast or brunch. We were a party of 6 and we had to literally wave and dance to get the waitress attention every time we needed something. Other than that the food was good and I liked the fact that we could see the water show at  the bellagio from where we were seated.
Amazing service! They view was unbelievable and the food was spectacular, the best calamari ever had!  Pro tip: The beer park right above is the best view in Vegas!

Cute brunch spot, but quite underwhelming. The food certainly wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either. The benedict was a very small portion, and my friend who had it finished his food well before the rest of us, leaving him dissatisfied. What stuck out at HEXX, though, was the service. Our waiter, Sean, who asked us to mention him specifically if we left a review, constantly tried to upsell everything we ordered, persistently trying to persuade us to order more when we'd already declined. He failed to tell us that upgrading the potatoes with "onions, mushrooms, or peppers" would cost an additional $2 PER topping. So the $6 upcharge on our bill came as a surprise. Sean also kept referring to Patrick, the person refilling our waters, as his "assistant," which seemed pretty demeaning and self-important, even if it was true. Amidst his constant upselling, Sean also made strange comments that came across as faux-charisma: for instance, we asked for salt and pepper, to which Sean replied "upon request"... The atmosphere and decor of the place is cute and "aesthetic-y," which I'm normally a big sucker for, but in this case it felt like a pretty face with a bland personality. The seats were uncomfortable to boot. Overall, it was a fine brunch, but ultimately we wouldn't go back.

I had the Farmers Market Bloody Mary, split the Caesar salad and veggie flatbread. Everything was great! The Caesar had a crunchy ham on it that was salty and delicious. The veggie flat bread had sauce made from squash, which gave a delightfully sweet taste. A fried got the butter leaf salad with steak.

The food here was fantastic but even better than that was our waitress Tracee!! She had so much energy and went out of her way to make sure we were all having a great time. I would come again just sit at her table!!
Went here with the hubby and he had the steak and eggs and I had the lobster roll, they were both delicious! I would def come back here if I am ever in the area!

It's best to go early for breakfast because it does get crowded and long wait. The food was really good. I ordered a omelet and it was huge but the potatoes it came with were really good. The pancakes were very good! They were so fluffy. They have bottomless mimosas which is great for brunch.

Very nice and fancy resterunt
Great position and you can see the bellagio show from your table and that is so fun.
great dips and snacks before the real food that is also very good
Big and tasty portions

Ate here for the first time for a friends birthday today 11/4/16. I was really disappointed with the dining experience. First off my friend was previously here for his girlfriends birthday and it happened to be when the Paris hotel had a complete loss of power. So due to that situation the manager informed him that the next time he made a reservation at the restaurant it would be taken care of. So for his birthday he made a reservation and informed the person on the phone that he would be bringing a small group for a dinner and that the manager should be informed since it was going to be taken care of due to the previous incident. The person on the phone confirmed it with the manager and the reservation was set. We came for the reservation and ate our dinner but when the bill came we were all shocked that suddenly the dinner would not be taken care of. They claimed that they never said they would be taking care of the dinner and even went as far as calling security to watch all of us to ensure the bill would be paid. Horrible customer service and very hostile manager. Lied to us about a wonderful dinner to make up for their wrongs. Very disrespectful calling security on us when we were not hostile towards the staff. I would highly recommended you not eat at this establishment. Not worth your time or money. They ruined our night.

My favorite place to hangout with friends! Great view and such a fun atmosphere! 

Thank you to Melody, Ari, and Steven for ALWAYS welcoming me and my friends to this great place! 

Keep up the great work and we can't wait to come and hangout again!
Awesome breakfast menu. The carrot cake pancakes are to die for. They are also great with drink service. We never had an empty glass.

The patio dining here is across from the Bellagio Fountains, and has a lovely view, which is reason enough to check this place out. The food is great too and has a wide variety from burgers to steaks and pasta.... So if you are dining with a kiddo, like I was, there is something for everyone!

After a night out, my friends and I were looking for a place to get brunch before heading home. Luckily there was no wait here and it was a quick walk from our hotel. A seat outside or by the window will get you a spectacular view of the Bellagio fountain show. Our waitress was so nice and gave us excellent service. I ordered a protein omelette with was make with egg whites and chicken topped with avocado. It also came with some potatoes and an English muffin. It was a perfect light omelette for the trip back home!

I had extremely low expectations for a restaurant right on a strip that was open 24/7. It had to just be a tourist trap, right?

WRONG. 
This was one of our best meals in Vegas and we went to caesars buffet. I would come here over the buffet HANDS DOWN. 

We were able to get reservations for 10 for brunch and were seated immediately. Win. Despite being busy, our servers were all incredibly efficient and also extremely easy on the eyes. Win again. The food came out quickly and was not only presented well, but absolutely delicious. 

My burger was cooked and seasoned to perfection. I devoured the entire thing despite having just eaten mcdonalds breakfast 30 minutes prior. The servers did not leave a single water glass or mimosa empty. Oh - did I mention the bottomless mimosas for $23!? It was heavy on the champagne too!  

Overall, HEXX surprised us with the high quality of their food and the phenomenal service. Highly highly recommend

I got the ribeye (medium well), Mac and cheese, and fries to share with my friend. The steak was very good and tender and the Mac and cheese was substantial but not too heavy. We also got the potion bowl, that was also very good. Servers were attentive and very helpful. 10/10 would come again.

Best place ever!!!!
Reasons: 
1. T&t tracey and tristen are the best! Tracey is the bomb and gives you as many mimosas as you can handle! We love Tracey!!!!
2. Bottomless mimosas $20!!!! 7-2!!! 
3. The food is awesome!

Love this place, so much space from indoor to outdoor, the bar is beautiful, the decor is elegant and very fancy like but not too fancy where you feel out of place. The food is great tasting especially brunch with good portion sizes. Service is always great and it's a fun restaurant!
Went here today the have breakfast and the food was amazing! If your a carrot cake lover, you'll love their carrot cake pancakes! My husband and I can't wait to go back to try some other dishes.

So completely over priced it's sad. And the place is freezing!!! People at my table, and other tables, we're shivering but the management wouldn't turn it down and they wouldn't let us sit outside, even though they had empty tables. You go here because you are already walking by and you can see the bellagio fountains - my suggestion walk across the street and watch the fountains and find a cafe inside paris hotel.  But if you do eat here, get the groupon!  8 people in my party. We all shared, so we ordered 4 dishes, 3 cocktails ordered, and the bill was $200.00 so not worth it!!

**Vegetarian Friendly**
I ended up at this restaurant twice in a 5-day span, I had breakfast and dinner. Great atmosphere with an indoor and outdoor setting right on the strip.
 
Breakfast: Chilaquiles
Definitely more of a brunch dish as opposed to a breakfast. The salsa and chips combo had a kick, and the toppings balanced the dish. Only downside, gotta eat it quickly so the chips don't soggy!
 
Appetizer: Tomato Burrata and Crispy Broccolini
The burrata was very similar to a bruschetta, with a honey reduction. The honey complimented the cheese. The broccolini sounds very odd, and I'm not sure what they do to it, but it's definitely worth a try! It's a very unique flavor and a great new spin on broccoli. 
 
Dinner: Pappardelle Pasta
The pasta was incredibly fresh, and the mushrooms weren't overpowering. Dish was big enough that 2 people could share.

Sean's service was incredible and the food was great. 
Great spot for a quick bite and people watching on the strip.
Cool chill place for lunch. You can see the water fountain show at the Bellagio from here. Our waiter Sean was very nice and extremely funny. We would definitely come back!
Delish brunch! I feel like Tracee saved my life! Lol! My mimosa was never empty. The food was great! Check it!

My girls and I went here for the first time and I was really impressed with how lovely it looked and how friendly everyone was our server was great and busser was on point with refilling our water, the music was pretty fun also my friends and I enjoyed our breakfast and time there

We visited a few days ago, excellent service! We started with a round of drinks and the butter lettuce salad as an appetizer. For dinner he had the braised short rib entree and I had the gnocchi pomodoro. Both, cooked to perfection! Mine was bursting with flavors and his rib was falling off the bone, I had a bite and it melted like butter, delicious! He liked the brussel sprouts, but commented the mashed potatoes didn't wow him.
We both had drinks, I went with The Hexx, a little  chocolate number that's delightful! Was told it's been changed a few times over the years before they feel they perfected it, well, I was very pleased with it. Only snapped one photo as we like to enjoy each others company versus staring at the phone, so just a drink shot..no meal ones. Trust me, you cannot go wrong in stopping here. 
Our waiter was amazing, the server, crumber and busboy were very friendly and attentive. Very friendly staff, would highly recommend it! Plus is you can view the Bellagio fountains that go off every 30 minutes. Enjoyed our visit!

Dined here on Friday, March 9, 7:00pm, extremely busy. Mushroom risotto was under cooked and crunchy. Order 2 burgers medium well. Waitress must have written down medium rare because they were so pink we were afraid to eat them. She never returned to check on us, so we simply paid the tab and left. Disappointing!

Joanna was our waitress and she was absolutely phenomenal!!! There was an increased number of people because it's raining outside (IT NEVER RAINS) and many people had to move inside who were on both wait lists. When Joanna came to introduce herself and apologize for the issue she was more than accommodating and made us relax from a hectic travel experience just to get here. The restaurant is extremely clean and price aware for being in vegas. I appreciate the value of training they have done on all employees and they accommodated by a free appetizer. Great work Hexx!

Wow! First morning in Vegas and we pick Hexx. Natalie was fabulous. She steered us toward bottomless mimosa, chicken and waffles and cinnamon swirl waffle with fruit. Very pleasant watching the parade of people while eating good food. The chicken and waffles were very moist and the added pickles were perfect. They were thin shaved and perfect for the dish.

First off, this place is amazing! Our server Lake was so sweet and attentive, so much so that we would come back every night!! Must try and big respect for the lovely management 5 stars all the way!!! :)

Just WOW! We have been to LV for years and have never been here. Tried it today and the wait was very long, however worth it!!! The drinks and food were top notch. The service was stellar. Tracy was just amazing. Fun, great recommendations, danced with us, never made us feel rushed, we LOVED her!!! Ask for her for sure!!!! Excellent place for brunch! Oh and drinks...

I was not impressed with the food I received. I went on Sunday during brunch, and it wasn't busy luckily. I ordered a croissant sandwich which came with a croissant, cheese, and ham. I added in an over easy egg to go with my sandwich. 

The service was okay, nothing special. I didn't really enjoy the sandwich. The eggs weren't warm and the ham was cold. Considering it was brunch, I was expecting a warm sandwich. The other people at my table didn't enjoy their meal either. I would recommend going else where for the money.

I went to Hexx with a very large group for brunch one Sunday as our last big hurrah in town. Hexx did a wonderful job seating our party of about 12 as well as keeping us entertained before being seated. Once seated, our waiter introduced himself promptly and we all loved him, he was fun and dynamic. Several of my friends ordered the bottomless mimosas to get the party started. After ordering our food, we had a strange encounter with the kitchen staff... as they were bringing out our food (which was brought individually, not on one of those big platters), the girl carrying the food approached my friend and set his food down very quickly in front of him, knocking over his mimosa and spilling it all over the table and him. At this point, she turned to all of us and scolded us, saying "You guys are going to have to move your drinks, that whole situation could have been avoided." She didn't apologize, offer to refill his drink... she was blatantly rude. Mind you this is a busy restaurant, we did not know our food was coming, and he was the first to receive his food, which was our only tip anything was coming. I was LIVID. I was literally shaking and my voice started cracking I was so angry. We all kind of jumped on her and she just got angry and walked away, she was very unprofessional. We told the waiter and he was very understanding and assured us that the restaurant did not stand for that kind of behavior and that she was scheduled for a sit-down meeting with the manager at the end of her shift to discuss her behavior because it was unacceptable (the waiter's term, not mine). After a few minutes, she came back and gave an obviously forced apology and quickly walked away. I did think it was a little strange they did not comp my friend's mimosas or give him a free coffee or anything, especially since he was so nice about the whole ordeal (he kept his cool while we all got mad on his behalf), but it was nice to know that the restaurant did not endorse this behavior.

As for the food... I had ordered a meat omelet and was impressed by the taste. The omelet contained bacon, sausage, pork, chicken, and cheddar cheese... mmm. It also came with a sort of breakfast potatoes and an English muffin. I rather enjoyed my food and everyone else at the table seemed to enjoy theirs as well.

All in all, I appreciated the waiter sticking up for us and telling the manager about the way were treated, but the whole ordeal sticks out in my mind as one of my more frustrating dining experiences. I don't necessarily believe that is indicative of the restaurant as a whole and therefore would not say I will never come back here, but if I do, it will be at someone else's recommendation, not because I truly want to come back.

HATE  Nothing.

DISLIKE  Hostesses weren't smiling nor were they very welcoming. Kitchen was out of sticky buns which were recommended by server (so maybe a lack of communication).

LIKE  Protein omelet with avocado mousse. Cinnamon roll waffle. Passion fruit margarita. Variety of brunch selection. Friendly server.

LOVE  Location and view of the Bellagio fountains.
The place is nice with a nice view all around of of the strip. For breakfast,  the place is not very busy but the service was absolutely SLOW. The food was pretty good but our waiter SUCKED!!
Nice location. I ordered the carbonara. I've had better and more filling in Detroit at a good Italian place.  Service was ok.  Outside seating is an ok view of strip.  I don't suggest.

We are in town from Dallas and we loved  this restaurant! We had Sean and Bobby as servers. They were amazing! The food was great but the service was even better! We highly recommend this restaurant! Sean refilled our glasses even when we had a few sips gone!

I am a frequent visitor to Las Vegas and this is my favorite place for breakfast. I haven't had dinner here, but I highly recommend Hexx for breakfast. I got a traditional breakfast, which is available but not on the menu. I love the chicken sausage and the country potatoes. The bottomless mimosas were also really good. Sit on the patio if it's available. Good people watching and a nice view ofT The Bellaggio across the street. It's a little pricey, but anything that keeps me out of the casino is a bargain!
Terrible chilaquiles and the chips for the spinach dip where hard and stale !!! The wagyu was over cooked!! Over priced food and just terrible !!! GREAT SERVICE but horrible food

HORRIBLE customer  service. 
Waited 20 minutes until a server actually came over to take our order. 2 people came just to ask if we wanted something to drink , then finally someone came over to tell us that our server will be right with us. 30 mins later we order our food & I order a starter with my meal. As I waited another 25 mins until my food actually came out. I had to let the server know to cancel my starter because it was not out yet. The whole purpose of ordering a starter was because I was hungry and I knew that my food would take long. The manager did not car , he was rude , CHRiSTRIAN was his name and stay away from Juliet that was out server. Never again will I pay my money for there horrible customer service !!!!!!!!

We actually went here on a whim. It was there, we were hungry... However, I was pleasantly surprised at this place. Service was great, the wait  for a table was fairly short even though the place was packed. We got a great table and the waiter was attentive and friendly. The food was delicious! I ordered eggs, bacon, English muffin and potatoes.m; my husband ordered pancakes, bacon and potatoes. Everything was well cooked and the English muffin was the biggest, fluffiest one ever. We would definitely go back to this restaurant!

Kevin, our server, is the best!  We appreciate his honest recommendations on pairing wine with the items we plan on getting.  He doesn't tell us "great choice" like most servers generally do.  He asks, "what's your second choice?"  Lol.  He then makes suggestions on a wine or two and explains why he thought that is better.  
We shared a Jumbo shrimp cocktail and based on his suggestion I got a glass of the 
Sangiovese, The Seeker.  the man was right. The Seeker went well with the shrimp. 5 stars to Kevin.

Outstanding in every way! From the incredible aroma of chocolate in the air when you walk in, to the view of the Bellagio fountains on the patio, Hexx delivers an awesome experience. The lobster roll is perfectly toasted and meaty and the short rib bolognese pasta is to die for! My partner loved his meal as well and I can't wait to bring my grandma in for dessert! The service and wine list both ROCK and the chocolate is truly one of a kind. Hexx is a must for locals and tourists alike. Enjoy every bite! Went back again last night with a group and the food and service was fantastic!

Been here for both Dinner and Breakfast, and both times were pretty great. Most recently I went for breakfast/brunch!

Here are the highlights:
1. Bottomless Mimosas = because who doesn't love these!?!?! $24 for the bottomless option, and they come by to fill you up often, which was nice. 
2. The Sticky Bun = do yourself a favor and order this. The bun itself is sweet and fluffy, and the cream cheese frosting is decadent and pairs perfectly on top. It's a heavy dish, so plan on sharing.
3. The Chilaquiles = GET THIS! I love me a good chilaquiles, especially after a night out. The chips were the right level of crispiness, and the dish has a nice amount of extras (guac/salsa/sour cream) without being too messy. Also they slice up the jalapenos nice and thin, but they still gave off some heat. I definitely recommend this dish!

The only real issue I had was with the wait. I'm not crazy, I know you're going to wait for a restaurant in Vegas on the weekend, but we were initially told 15 minutes and it took well over half an hour to get us seated... so I just wish they would be more conservative with their estimates, since nobody loves to wait. 

Stay Cheerful ;)

I made a spontaneous trip with a friend to Vegas for 48 hours, and I am so glad we were able to squeeze in brunch at Hexx during our short visit! The price is a little high for normal breakfast/brunch cost but nothing unexpected for the location and atmosphere. I highly recommend sitting outside as you have a great view of the strip and attractions, plus it's just a great vibe! 

I ordered a coffee (black) and a bellini. Both were delightful but don't come close to how AMAZING the food was! I ordered the banana bread French toast and oh my gosh, I could eat it again right this second. Without a doubt, it was the best meal I had on the trip

A small warning: They casually suggest add ons such as fruit for many of their breakfast meals, these are an extra cost. Our server didn't mention the additional fee.
The options were limited but the food was really good. The atmosphere was nice and quite. They even packed up our leftover food. Will return!
Three stars for the location but the food is just eh... the patio was wonderful for breakfast but the food is over priced and just okay.
Had breakfast here this morning. Service poor, food just as bad.  Nice venue, bright and sunny but the service was awful, food pricey and disappointing. Would not return
Good food.  Service was a bit missing.  Waitress was friendly. Drink took a little too long.  Music was a little too loud and kept playing the same millennial stuff over and over.
3 things you must order. The potion drinks, pizza, and chocolate cheesecake. You will leave happy !

TRACEE IS ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL! My girlfriends and I came in for breakfast and bottomless mimosas and had the best server ever. Tracee was amazing and took such good care of us, she had the best personality and attitude! Thanks for the laughs :) oh yeah and good was also amazing thanks hexx!
- the 88s and cancers from SD

The chicken & waffles dish was not good at all, more along the lines of awful. The "apples"baked in appeared to be more like just apple skins, but tasted like pickles (and I opted not to have the pickles on top, so that should not have affected the taste). Overpriced for the poor taste. The mac and cheese was just ok.

Excellent food and service. Had the Hexx Eggs Benedicts and they are to die for! Service was outstanding. Quick response to our needs and very cordial. Highly recommended! Plus, the location is perfect.

We wanted to grab some dessert at the Paris hotel, but ended up in this restaurant for dinner and dessert.

It was a little confusing to get to the front desk to get a table. We went in the restaurant from the hotel, but the main entrance is at the other end of the restaurant, facing the Bellagio hotel! 

Server wasn't really attentive, probably because he was really busy serving at least 7 tables. Even though the service wasn't great, the food was fabulous. 

We had:
1) Pan seared scallops - this was our favorite! 4 huge juicy scallops were served with onion pur√©e. 
2) Filet mignon with King Crab Oscar - the beef was tender and juicy
3) Roasted cauliflower - the cauliflower was delicious 
4) Mushroom risottos - this is also our favorite! Not too creamy, but yet tasty!
5) Chocolate hazelnut pudding - tiramisu was sold out, so this was the next option. It tastes like Ferrero Rocher with Nutella, this was alright. Not a mind blowing dessert.

If the service improves, we will probably return for the scallops and mushroom risottos.
We got the candy at HEXX. The kids loved it. A lot do seelection to choose from. We would come again. Very clean too.

Had a wonderful mousse dessert with coffee and baileys Irish creme on the cool and we'll appointed terrace while enjoying the occasional blast of the Bellagio musical water fountain directly across the street. The terrace elegantly juts into the side walk making you one with the passersby while also elevating you so not to be completely in it.

Great people watching! 

The food was great but the servers Jessica and Kevin stole the show! Rarely do you find wait staff more genuine. They are good people, engaging and passionate about their craft. 

Great dessert, cool vibes, incredible service, a beautiful fountain while people watching! What more do you need?

I got there just in time for brunch and bottomless and it was the best decision I've made in this city. The omelette I had was amazing given that it wasn't super expensive. The service was the best part though. Johana was on it with the bottomless mimosas and my glass was never empty. If you're thinking about a bottomless brunch, definitely hit this place up

The food was great like always. My girlfriend and I have been here half a dozen times and have always been satisfied with the food and service. This time it was different because we were served by Rafael. He made the experience very enjoyable. We came for a late breakfast so we had bottomless mimosas. He made sure we were always topped off and he would come and dance with us! I swear his vibes and energy were high and oh so contagious. Super nice guy. The visit started with him making funny jokes (usually at his own expense) and making us feel comfortable. His service was excellent, but his attitude is what made him stand out. We love Hexx, and Rafael made it that much more enjoyable thanks to his upbeat attitude and great service. He also loves to dance and groove to the music, very cool! Thank you Hexx and Rafael!

I have eaten here a number of times in the past. I noticed the presentation and taste have relaxed. No more attention to detail. Perhaps there is a new Chef or Manager. Not impressed with Hexx this time around. They still charge the same prices though along with a 4.7% franchise fee just because they can! I guess it is time to find a nicer restaurant for our out of town guests. Maestros never disappoints.

Tracee and Ceecee are absolutely amazing servers! They were attentive and extremely friendly. The food was delicious and the bottomless mimosas were fabulous. I'm so happy my girls and I chose to have brunch here on our last day in Vegas. Please come here and request Tracee or Ceecee as your waitresses.

My boyfriend and I usually come here to eat every time we're in town. It's one of our favorite places to eat. It has the best atmosphere and the sweetest servers. We recently helped by tristian and Taylor. The absolute best. They were attentive and made sure we were happy with everything. Such sweethearts and made our brunch so much more enjoyable. I recommend coming and eating here, especially for their endless mimosas during brunch.

Awesome!! YOU HAVE TO TRY THE BROCCOLINI! It was so good we ordered it twice. Also the Hexx martini was tasty. We received great service from both our server and the bartender Craig who was happy to make us our fancy Last Word cocktails. I appreciate the text when your table is ready so that you may walk the strip or drink at the bar. So happy we went with lunch here, it's beautiful and the food is delicious!! Will love to be back next time we're in Vegas!! :)
This brunch is legit!  Have never had anything bad here. And the views of the fountains are perfection!! If you're lucky you might even get a singalong with the staff!!

Only giving this 2 stars for the view. Stopped here because it's the only place that's open. Food was blah, blah, blah. Pasta = blah. Margherita Pizza = super bland. Only come here if you're drunk, hungry, have $40 to spend and nowhere else to go.

The view and location was great. However our waitress (I think her name was Megan on the receipt) was ok at some point, but when we tried to get our check to pay and leave, we couldn't get her for a long time......., she was chatting few tables behind for a loooooooong time, she was the only server close by that time, all the other ones were busy in&out, probably because it was pretty late after 1:30am. So kept looking at her (thinking she might turn her head so we can wave at her), she was chatting for a long time and we just had to wait.

For the prices this is one of the best values for steak I've had in Vegas. Ribeye with the blue cheese crust was cooked to perfection.  Had awesome spinach dip starter. Wife had salad and waiter suggested adding a protein which worked out great! Hazelnut pudding was amazing. Service outstanding.  I will return. Want to go back to try breakfast.

The Bloody Mary the Farmers one specially was delicious, I'm coming back here soon for that! We had a party of ten and had a reservation we were seated promptly and the waiter was patient in dealing with a large group of us. The food was good I had the chicken and waffles but the Bloody Mary was bomb.

I first checked this place out on Yelp and the pictures of the food didn't look appealing to me and people complained about the service. I said what the hell let me try for myself and see how it goes. So Hubby and I and another couple went and we had a good time. The service was great and so was the food. We ordered the maple glazed bacon for an appetizer. It was really good. It was thick cuts of bacon more on the line of small cuts of pork belly. Hubby ordered the Hex burger with white chocolate bun with fries. I ordered the club sandwich with herb aioli and cranberry bread. It was so delicious. Our friends ordered a meat omelette and Hex burger also. Everyone was pleased with their food. When we are in Vegas we will be back

Rafael was absolutely phenomenal!! At a lot of places with bottomless mimosas, servers "forget" to keep coming back to give you refills, but he was on top of eyeing when our glasses were empty. Super friendly service and he was 100% honest with his food recommendations and we both LOVED our food after taking his advice. 12/10 for service!

Great food! Good prices. We were able to make a last second reservation on OpenTable on a Saturday during Brunch. We arrived and saw a few open seats on the patio and asked if we could sit there and they were able to get us the perfect people watching spot against the rail. We could see the Bellagio fountains as well! Even with the brisk wind chill the heaters out on the patio were perfect. The bottomless mimosas were great! The waitress even changed my single mimosa to a bottomless mimosa without a fuss when I changed my mind at the last minute. I would definitely recommend this place!
Very expensive, bartender got our drinks wrong a couple of times. Service was ok. I didn't eat there just had a couple of beers and spirits. Probably will not come back

Service : 5 stars ! Ambience : 5 stars ! Menu Choices : 5 stars ! Taste of food : 5 stars ! Presentation: 5 stars ! Prices : very reasonable!! Drinks : absolutely delicious  Final Verdict : Highly recommended !!
Something new , in the thick of the strip , trendy , not cheap but not outrageous , kid friendly , food was very good ..

Passed by this place for years when it was the Sugar Factory, I decided to stop by and eat lunch. Ordered the Ribeye Medium and a couple French 75's . The steak was cooked almost perfectly and the French 75's were made with top shelf alcohol. I sat at the bar and it was a cool atmosphere and attentive service. Will stop by more often.

I had shared a pepperoni pizza with my husband and had tropical tea.  Also we had guacamole w chips.  It was good. environment was great, if u sit outside its not really hot bec they have blowers blowing cool air.  Our waitress was very nice.  We watch people walk by and u can see the water show across the street. 

I think the place is a lil over priced but good.

AMAZING!
The food is wonderful. I will definitely be coming back for the veggie pizza. The butternut squash as a sauce and perfectly roasted veggies is an all time favorite of mine and next time I come back to Vegas will be coming to hexx specially for that! 
The calamari was great with light breading and flavor. 
Overall good service. They do seem to be a little busy but the food is worth the wait

Great food (minus one star for no vegan options) with nice atmosphere, all brunch menu seem to be in a decent price range for Vegas. The staff was nice and friendly. Our waitress forgot one of our orders to go and she apologized profusely. The outdoor seating has a great 'street view' to look at Bellagio and the Cosmopolitan. I heard their drinks are really good too. Will definitely go back there.

We had good food and great service here! Would come back. I had the scallops; they were delicious. And the butterscotch cr√®me br√ªl√©e was amazing. Also, the butter lettuce salad with white cheddar, coffee nibs and vinaigrette was a great beginning!
We had a great deal by purchasing show tix to Paranormal (at Bally's) in a pkg with dinner here at Hexx! Very nice evening!

Anthony is phenomenal and the Pear Naked Lady is delicious! Get the artichoke and spinach dip. Lobster roll is a bit too saucy. Broccolini is good but too sweet. Anthony and the drink make this place a must stop-by.

We had an amazing meal and our server Sean was absolutely fantastic! Very attentive and kept the mimosas going all morning!! Thanks for starting out our wedding weekend with a bang! Ivan was great too!!  Thank you

Awful, awful service. Went there for an early dinner with my friend, and the staff was extremely rude and did not pay almost any attention to us. The food was delicious, but the portions were ridiculously small, and when combined with the terrible service, it is definitely not worth the time or money spent. I had to remind the waiter of the drink I ordered after he brought us our food, and Our "bread & butter" service was just 2 slices of stale bread and olive oil. Even after we asked for butter (again), we never actually got the butter. This whole time we were served by 4 or 5 different people. All around terrible service and would not recommend wasting your time or money at this restaurant.

Love HEXX for brunch, it's always our first stop in Vegas and especially for the bottomless mimosas, my girlfriends and I always love dining here!! Service is fantastic, food is wonderful and we love the ambiance!!

The menu is too basic; needs more variety. However, the food is excellent. Portions are generous. Service is superb. Ambient is relaxing. I love the view. Had their Caesar salad; it was light and fulfilling. My brother had the traditional burger, may I add that it was scrumptious !! (yes I took a bite) lol

Their artichoke dip was fabulous ! Will be coming back ! :)

Good service right next to the Eiffel Tower Hotel
Turkey Club Sandwich it is good except would like to see a different kind of bread a little dry.

Very good thin style pizza. Ask for patio sitting and get a kick of watching everybody stared at your food. The only draw back because of the location is the price and sort of small menu.

You must try the Chocolate candies a killer.
OMG....good food and the best wait staff ever!  I love good customer service,l and Steven, our server, was the BOMB!!!!

Located at the Paris hotel right by the Eiffel Tower, Hexx kitchen is a great place to go for brunch. I was here with a couple of friends, and we ordered mimosas. Can't go wrong with OJ and champagne!

It has a patio outside where it is great to do people watching. There are a bajillion of people walking on the strip. You're bound to see something interesting.. or maybe it was just the alcohol? Nonetheless, this place has an enjoyable ambiance surrounding it and the service was great. The food was good. I took a bite of my friends pancakes which were fluffy and good.

Whenever I visit Vegas, I come here for breakfast!! Today I had a great breakfast and unlimited mimosas! However, the best and most wonderful difference today was my server Tracee! She was kind, informative, efficient and FUN!! Made my first day in Vegas start out great! Keep up the good work Tracee!! Love your energy!!!
