Wanted a good  steak in Vegas, with outside seating and a view. With Hexx I only got 2 BECAUSE THE STEAK WAS GREAT!!! Totally unexpected but I got a flatiron steak ( I like thin steak sliced and particularly enjoy a flatiron steak ) 

This out of control steak was 3 eye rolls ( an orgasm is 3 so no sex needed tonight). My companion had a filet and did an awesome eyeroll as well) pity I am sure I wouldn't be able to get that reaction from her. 

Great people watching if you sit outside ( was able to get good seats at 8:30 on a Saturday with only 20 minute wait)

You also get a bonus view of the fountain s at Bellagio. All for a reasonable price in Las Vegas. NICE!!!
Nice brunch spot with great service! The area was nice and clean. My platter was full filling.

I loved it! The energy was vibrant, the service was great, and the food was amazing! Don't forget it has the biggest patio on the LV Strip, and you can't beat the view. The broccolini is a MUST try and so is the simple salad. Loved my Branzino as well. Looking forward to going back for Sunday brunch real soon.
The portions are enough to feed two people per plate and the food is delicious! The scent of chocolate from the chocolate store across the restaurant is tantalizing!

I don't think we will be returning here. 

Let me start off by saying that we took advantage of the groupon deal to try this restaurant out. 

The food was wonderful and I had no issues with any of the dishes we ordered. They are a bit pricey for what you get but its Vegas so it's expected. 

Our server with the red hair was a gem, super sweet. The only thing that got irritating was how long we waited for everything. It took forever to get the menus, to order, to get the manager to approve our groupon, and to get our check. We got there around 8 and didn't leave until 9:30. 30 minutes was wasted due to waiting around for the check AFTER the manager came to apply our groupon. 

For the prices and the service wait I would rather go to a different restaurant. 

I'll pass on this in the future.

Lovely times had at the HEXX.  Our server Sean with assistant Josh were amazing!  Personable, outgoing and a joy to be around.  Will come back for the service and of course the bloody mary's - especially the one with the cheese on top.

The food was delicious.  My daughter had the gnocci and the lobster tail was cooked to perfection.  The jambalaya was flavorful and spicy. The salmon prepared properly  and quinoa silky, nutty and sweet,  the green peas added color and sweetness.  No wait time was great

Food was amazing ! Best lunch on our trip so far! Big thanks to our server Natalie and jordan for the awesome service!! The only down side was the manager with the glasses, he seemed really rude and just made the experience not as pleasant. Maybe find someone else with a better personality and more cheerful like our servers!

Stopped in for brunch on a Saturday. They offer brunch until 2pm on Saturday and Sunday's.  Loved the cool vibe of the restaurant. Reminded me of brunch in Miami. 

Service was spectacular. We were waited on hand and foot, and our water glasses were constantly being refilled.

We ordered a latte, chilaquiles and a meat omlet. Everything was delicious. 

Can't wait to return for the huge pancakes!

First brunch I have in Las Vegas I wanted to check out the Eiffel tower experience so I came to this spot right outside of it. Food was great, however the service was torturous, I waited so long for everything. Even ordered the bread pudding dessert and waiting 15 mins for a spoon! Overall stay duration 2 hours, took a huge chunk of my first day here.

I love Hexx kitchen and bar. They have great service and amazing food. I enjoyed the all you can drink mimosas on the middle of the strip. The food is fresh and has a lot of flavor. You can watch the Bellagio fountains while you eat as well. The chocolate bars are amazing and unique. I would definitely recommend Hexx the next time you're in Las Vegas.

This was our last stop in Vegas before the airport. A few years ago, my girlfriends and I had a memorable breakfast here - we still talk about the cinnamon roll waffles, so obviously we had to come back. It's fun to sit underneath the Paris Eiffel Tower and watch the Strip. We were seated quickly and got our drinks in short order. The cocktails are pretty pricey, so we skipped those and just got food.

My friend and I split a cinnamon roll waffle and a basic egg breakfast, reasoning that the protein in eggs would offset the sugar bomb that is the waffle. Totally works! ;) my other friend got the Benedict, which is served on a bed of has browns rather than an English muffin.

The wait for food wasn't great, and not was the service (friendly but slow), but when we eventually got the food - OMG! Get something that has the breakfast potatos! They are smashed and cooked til crispy and have Parmesan cheese and wow, just delish! Perfectly cooked eggs, crispy bacon, and to top it all off, a waffle made of cinnamon roll dough and covered in cream cheese frosting. Definitely a must for breakfast, as long as you aren't in a hurry.

Tracee is sick AF! Bottomless mimosas, gave me 2 hot sauces to choose from and they were all bomb DIGGITY, tracee know what's good! bottomless mimosas comin and the water too baby she  ask for tracee she will take care of you!

It was my friends birthday and we wanted to go somewhere nice for dinner. Decided to check out HEXX. The atmosphere and setting was nice. Hostess sat us down and we looked over our menus. I wasn't too impressed with their selections. They had very little to offer and the prices were high for what they offered. My friend ordered the classic burger that came with fries. I ordered the spaghetti carbonara with a side of shrimps. The burger was overly expensive for a plain cheeseburger. (You can go to Gordon Ramsay BurGR and get a burger for much cheaper) the spaghetti was not what I expected and wasn't that great. Service could've been better. Our server barely came around to check on us or asked if we needed anything. Wasn't busy for a Saturday night either. Won't be going back
Roman is the best waiter you can get at 3AM on the strip. The banana sundae was amazing. Service was great.

OK food and bad service. 
I ate at Hexx Kitchen on a Saturday night (7pm). We had a reservation for a group of 10. Upon showing up right at 7pm, the hostess asked us to wait just a little until our table was ready, even though the restaurant was not full (at least 1/3 of tables were open, including at least 3 which would have accommodated our group size).

After a 15 minute wait, we were seated. Unfortunately no servers came by for yet another 15 minutes - we finally had to flag someone down. By then we were all ready to order both drinks and food. Our drinks took another 20 minutes to come out.
So, here we were with a 7pm reservation were just being served our drinks almost an hour later. We were very frustrated and thankful that we had such good company and a decent view of the Bellagio fountains to distract us from the poor service.
Luckily our food came out shortly after - I was a little underwhelmed by my entree of the Bucatini, and the added chicken was quite dry. Everyone else seemed to enjoy their meal (many girls ordered the antipasto salad). 
So, the food was ok/good but not amazing, and service pretty terrible. Although, I will note that the server offered to separate the checks for each of us without us even asking, which was very appreciated.
Food and drinks are amazing. The customer service is just as amazing. Whether you have a huge appetite or just want something light and fulfilling they have plenty of excellent choices.

I went here 2 weeks ago for my sisters bachelorette party. There was a group of 6 of us and we were not disappointed. The food was moderately priced and oh so delicious! We ordered a variety of foods and tasted everything. We also had the passion fruit margarita potion (3 of them.....don't judge us, it's a bachelorette!) and it was absolutely delicioso.....we all felt good when we left there. It was a Friday night and wasn't too crowded. We sat at an outside table just under the Eiffel tower and were able to people watch while we enjoyed our meal. Stephanie was our server and she was awesome. Very friendly, answered all of our questions and very attentive. Overall a positive experience!
The food is delicious! The menu is simple but the flavor is big. Definitely I will be returning when I'm in town.

Went here with a group of friends and we found the food to be good and fairly priced for the location. It's right across from the Bellagio fountains, so you can get a nice view depending where you're seated. I had the burger and it was tasty, juicy, and a good size. Portions all seemed to be good size. Service was good and it wasn't that crowded around 6pm, much to my surprise. I'd visit again if I was in town on the strip.

Love this restaurant! The location is fantastic right in the middle of the strip across from the Bellagio fountains with outdoor seating. They have a nice variety of food for those looking for something healthy or an indulgence. Great burgers, salads, side dishes and drinks. If you are considering trying this restaurant you won't be disappointed.

Great food, staff, cocktails, and view! Overall the best experience I've had at a resturant on the strip! The jumbalya is delicious and the espresso martini is the best I've ever had. Please try to sit on the porch outside because the view of The Strip is fantastic! Also try the chocolate and treats next door. The chocolate is honestly like fine wine! I had the pleasure of meeting Issac, Chelsea and Carol they were a pleasure to be around all night! Thanks for the great evening. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!

YUM! Had breakfast here with my family. I ordered chilaquiles,-nachos with Pulled pork, salsa, eggs and avocado It was spiced perfectly, I couldn't stop eating it. My sister ordered blueberry ricotta pancakes, they were very light and tasty. You will be stuffed, the portions are large. I took away a star because its a tad overpriced. Over $100 for 4 people with breakfast coffee and juice. However I WILL come here again, it was THAT good.

First time dining here and absolutely loved it! Not only because the food was fantastic, but because our server Sean was absolutely amazing! He was so professional, personable, and really checked in on us throughout our dining experience. Eric was also great in helping Sean out! Will definitely return just to visit him! Great job!

The food here is very good but we had very condescending and demeaning service by waitress Jessica who would cut us out in a middle of sentence and growl at any simple request - such as to take out photo or bring hot sauce. Good manners and customer friendliness will take you a long way. Too bad they don't understand it at this estblablishment.

Start off service is whatever. Our waitress didn't seem to care or she just doesn't like her job. Either or whatever. We had to ask for lemon for our waters 3 times. We finally placed our orders and I was so excited to try to carrot cake pancake which was the ONLY reason why I came here. And I had to order it without walnut since I'm highly allergic. After we placed our order our waitress let us sit for about 10 mins before coming to tell us that they can not omit walnuts. She didn't seem to care. She was more like so yea we can't do that so sucks to be you. What you want to order then? 

Ok first off. It's 2018 A LOT of people are allergic to peanuts and walnuts what restaurant makes their batter PRE MIXED with nuts? Now I am sitting here with nothing because the ONLY reason I came here was for the "so call amazing service" and these amazing carrot cake pancakes. Sucks for a majority of American who suffer from a nut allergy cause this restaurant ain't for you. Don't bother coming by cause the servers don't care and won't even try to see if they can make a batch with no nuts. Or head chef you need to think about peoples allergic needs........

UPDATE. So apparently the servers here like to peep at your phone. And she saw me leaving the review and got the manager. Which he saved the day. And he was more then happy to get the pancakes made without walnuts. And I must say the pancakes were AMAZING. I am SO GLAD. They are so delicious and the cream cheese frosting was so light and fluffy. DEFINITELY A MUST TRY

And I'm sorry but I feel bad for all those people who don't use yelp. I hate that in order for a restaurant to understand that people have allergies that you have to do a review on Yelp. That's not the purpose of Yelp. It should never be a means of "blackmailing" the restaurant in order for them to provide great customer service. It should be given. Overall after a very rocky start. And the beginning of a 1 star review it sky rocketed to a full 5 star review. I hope this comes as a lesson to the restaurant that customer service should be given. And I hope you can give any other customer even without the power of Yelp to be accommodating.

Found this place walking into Paris hotel from the Strip. Was not going to try it out but I'm glad they had their menu posted outside of their restaurant. Thinking that this was only a candy store but also they have a dine-in and bar. Went to the bar and came to find out that they have daily happy hour from 2pm-6pm; amazing find in a fancy place. Their beer taps were okay not much selection but they have an extensive cocktail list to try out. As for the food the french fries here are idaho cut potatoes; a must try if you're  fry lover. And their margarita pizza was freshly made and cooked perfectly. Will definitely come back to Hexx and remember that the bar is small and tables at the bar are shared and open seating.

Short story: great food, but miserable service. 
My rating is expressly based off of the terrible service. It was awful! I was able to finish half my meal and my boyfriend couldn't even eat because he had no knife for his chicken and waffles. I had to get up and ask the bartender for a knife. Our table wasn't checked up on until I was completely done with my meal. Long waits, terrible service, but great food and cocktails.
Definitely good food! However, eggs Benedict in a bowl just doesn't work. It's very hard to cut when you have a bowl instead of a plate. Please put it on the plate next time.

Excellent portions for the price!  My guest and enjoyed our food. We added salsa to the eggs for more flavor. I didn't like that it didn't have Coke products. Our server was nice but wasn't quite on top of things. We loved sitting on the patio. The bar area was super cute. I would love to come back and try more!
The Hibiscus tea cooler which was good and very refreshing. The sweet lady with purple lipstick was very nice and offered us a free cookie that perfectly compliments our drink.
Great food, treats and cocktails the strip street side view make the atmosphere superb

Came here for a 7:15 dinner reservation. We chose this place as it was an easy walk to Planet Hollywood for a 9:00pm show. We were seated immediately in the balcony facing the Bellagio Fountains. Awesome view. We were here the weekend of EDC so it was perfect for people watching. Weather was blazing hot but they have misters to help. Our waiter was really nice and full of personality. 

We had one of their signature cocktails which comes in a cute jug and presented to you in a spectacular way, as our waiter said "it's a big production". I had the Prime Rib medium rare. It was on point with plenty of fatty parts per our liking. We ordered mushrooms to compliment the steak which were delicious and tender. The side dish orders a la carte are big and can totally be shared. 

My man had the salmon on quinoa beans. His dish was also amazing. The salmon was nicely cooked. Both our meals were large in quantity not allowing for dessert space. Pricing wasn't bad. We will definitely be back and highly recommend the place.

Came here twice on a trip to vegas. The first time was just for happy hour. We had the guacamole and it had great flavor. Some of the pork rinds it came with were really hard though. Hands down best bloody Mary I have ever had. They infuse their own vodka with a mix of peppers. The ambience is pretty cool except that it's  so loud. When we came back, I got tomato basil soup. It was barely warm so I sent it back to be reheated. It had good flavor and was hot when the second time. My friend got the ceaser salad, it was embarrassing. Basically lettuce, parm, olive oil, and croutons. The dressing had absolutely no flavor, it was so disappointing. She was so disgusted that we elected to cancel the rest of our meal. We watched people at other tables send their food back as well. I ordered a Sierra mist after drinking too much alcohol the past few days and it was 5 dollars!!! What a rip off. Our server Denise was amazing though, so sweet and helpful. Even the free chocolate was disappointing. Skip this place unless you just want a bloody Mary and guac.

I have been meaning to write this review. I went with my bf to hex about a month ago and it was the best experience I have had in vegas for breakfast! Sean our server was awesome!!!! He was so nice and attentive and overall provided us with great service. I ordered the chicken and waffles- the best chicken/waffle combo I have ever had! Seriously, the chicken was so crispy, juicy, and just plain perfect. The waffle was the right amount of sweet and the bourbon maple syrup was the perfect topping. My bf had the corn beef hash and he also stated that it was very tasty. I will definitely be coming back on my next vegas trip and I hope we get served by Sean again. If you are looking for a great brunch spot on the strip- this is a go to breakfast spot in Vegas!! You will not be disappointed! And I forgot to mention there was practically no wait time (that's a win in my book!! Especially In Vegas) thanks again for your great service Sean!

This place is great!!
The food is delicious and the presentations are beautiful. The atmosphere is amazing, right across from Bellagio fountain. Great view! The staff is super professional and courteous.

In town for my boyfriend's 30th and I found this place suggested on yelp for American and I couldn't of been any happier! 

We were going out for a night on the town, so this was the perfect place to start. Right across the street from the Bellagio fountains, we got to see three different shows from our table tucked away in a little private nook of the restaurant. 

Service was great, dirty martini (with blue cheese olives!) was everything, and we had the crab cake, chopped salad, and blue cheese crusted sirloin all cooked to perfection! They even came out with a personal cake after I had mention via phone reservation we were celebrating the birthday! Will definitely recommend for future visitors!

Came here again very late on a Friday night. We were ready to try one of their beautiful potion drinks, and snack a little!

We got a margarita pizza to share and the Voodoo potion drink. It reminded me of a Tokyo Tea with a little more midori than usual. It was good! And such amazing presentation! Huge apple in the middle, haha. Hopefully they let me post my video!

It was also super strong, haha. Perfect! Our server was very nice and kept encouraging us to have more drinks, lol.

On the downside, it was really slow to get anything we ordered here. Kind of annoying, but it happens.

BTW the potion drinks average $38 or so! So be prepared to pay for the novelty! I was.

Birthday brunch for my fianc√© was great!! The food was absolutely amazing and our server was nice. We order bottomless mimosas and our server made sure we always had a full glass to grab. To me it's the best brunch spot in Vegas.
Had to try their famous chicken and waffles for breakfast. Wasn't impressed. Breakfast @ Mon Gami Abi located next door is much better.

Came here for a birthday brunch for my best friend on St. Patrick's Day. I remember the location when the Sugar Factory was here. The staff and service here is wonderful! They were accommodating of last minute changes, even on a busy Saturday! The menu has a few options under each category, but there is a lot of variety! We had a party of 13 and everyone ordered something they liked; talk about a miracle! We sat outside on the patio and again, just a beautiful experience. I would definitely come back; maybe even for my birthday! Oh they also serve cake pops if it's your birthday :)

NOT COOL - I had a huge allergic reaction from the Roasted Branzino, that did not state it had any PEANUTS in it, the manager (whom I will leave nameless) defended his staff and only gave me a meaningless, pathetic "sorry".

Hexx is a very modern restaurant in the heart of the Las Vegas strip, where there's a field of vision outward to the Dancing Fountains at the Bellagio.


THE STAFF -

The menus are quite small and very disposable, so I could see why they would not label their dishes' ingredients.  But who's fault is that to go the cheap route? I insisted the Manager (whom I will leave nameless) to start labeling all ingredients on his menu; but, for him it was not the case, he promised that there were no peanuts, then minutes later he consulted me saying there are only pistachios.  What a liar.

Vanessa, our waitress, was very attentive, sweet, and looked like she actually cared when she saw me choking up and breathing heavily after eating my branzino THAT HAD PEANUTS IN IT - she took off the price to my fish and tomato bisque which was so generous her, but she deserved a bigger tip, so we decided to give her an 80% tip.

THE FOOD - 

Roasted tomato bisque was utter perfection!!! Seriously the best, it gave me a hedonistic sensation of nostalgic feelings.  I loved the consistency of the tomato bisque, and the creativity of the dish.

The Crab Cake was another appetizer we ordered, which had a subtle citrus savor to it but did not overpower the dish itself which takes a lot of work. The garnish on the other hand was a bit over seasoned which is an honest mistake for a 3.5 star restaurant.

The Roasted Branzino, oh lord, what can I say that I haven't already? Well the fish was glistening, cooked to perfection, but once I took a bite of the diced peanuts that were sprinkled on top, it was game over.  I had to take my dish back after choking and heaving, and watch my date enjoy his lovely looking ribeye the rest of the meal.  Total public humiliation and a shame. 

The Ribeye was ordered by my date, whom I was envious the entire time; watching each delectable piece evaporate from his plate to his mouth and the aromas of perfectly seasoned meat infiltrate my nostrils.  It's a bit rude to ask for a taste, but I did - and I was not embarrassed at all! A girl's Gotta eat, i finished 2/3rd's of his rib eye in moments.

I really wanted to love this place, my tomato bisque was astounding, but I can't accept pitiful behavior from a manager who denies accusations when it comes to him, then apologize for his so called "miscommunication". My review might not matter in this vast internet world, but I do hope I might save a life or two.

I was to Hexx once for brunch with friends.  I had a show at Bally's and decided I'd walk over to Paris and have dinner at Hexx before going home.  Although in the 90s, the patio was great and the sun was soon behind the Bellagio.  Eating good food and people watching on the Strip--it doesn't get much better than that.

I opted out of an appetizer to save room for dessert (one must have their priorities in order).  For my dinner, I ordered the Spicy Jambalaya described on the menu like this: Gulf shrimp, chicken confit, andouille sausage, and rice.  The dish was excellent.  It was spicy which is exactly what I like.  There was a large number of shrimp and plenty of andouille sausage.

Then it was time to decide on my dessert.  I ordered the single origin chocolate bread pudding described on the menu as: shaved coconut, Ecuadorian chocolate chunks, brioche, coconut milk, and mango sauce.  It takes a little while for this to be made so just have your coffee or iced tea or whatever and people watch.  The time goes by oh so fast.  The bread pudding is huge.  I was so glad my priorities in the beginning proved correct.  I was expecting it to be more chocolaty than it was.  There were pieces of chocolate in the brioche bread but I expected it to really be chocolate bread pudding.  The mango sauce was perfect and the topping of coconut was very good, too!

A good return visit and more to come.
Chicken & waffles + ham breakfast croissant were to die for.  Bottomless mimosas were an added touch!

This was our fourth time to Vegas in 15 months and I said that it would be a PRIORITY to stop by HEXX the next time I went after seeing the food and ambiance as you walk past on the strip. Also, the music selection attracted me. The Top 40 mixed with throwbacks soundtrack made it very upbeat and live. 

We went for brunch around 10:30 on a Monday and we were seated immediately on the patio. This place is so damn cute! It's very big so there is plenty of seating and one whole side is pretty much outside. The servers were very nice and attentive. The main reason I wanted to come here was to try the famous HEXX potions. They are similar to the goblets you get at Sugar Factory..very fruity with dry ice in them to add smoke...like a potion! Lol. They are expensive. ($36 for one) It is big enough for two but one person can definitely finish it. The elixir potion is a must try! 

I ordered the french toast and scrambled cheese eggs and my boyfriend had a grilled chicken BLT. Both were DELICIOUS! I want to try every single thing on their menu! And like most places, they have bottomless mimosas. We tried to go back Tuesday morning around 7am but they told us an incident happened in the kitchen and they were closed until 10. I was so hurt. 

You have to go to HEXX while in Vegas. YOU HAVE TO!

We were on an early walk along the strip and happened to stop at this hotel eatery. I had a standard eggs, bacon and toast, and my wife had the Benedict. Both were very good. Service was a little off in terms of waiting for refills and such but was good, just the same. Nothing was wrong at all, let share that out front. It was just that for standard fare, nothing stood out on the menu--especially for strip prices.

This place still the same nothing has changed and same don't acknowledge you until you go to them and ask for your server and even after that the server takes a long time to come and greet you. -00000000 stars
Breakfast/ Brunch are good! I ordered the Hexx benedict and it was awesome! Staff were really professional.

I did not have a chance to dine at Hexx just grabbed a drink at the bar for happy hour. I love the set-up and would love to eat on the patio next time we are in Vegas.The food looked so good that the servers were bringing out. We received good service at the bar.

I had meetings in the Paris and this restaurant is attached. Ate here 4 times, once of my choice, the other times due to co-workers. Decor is nice, soothing, staff is 4 out of 5; food is 3 out of 5 (I had a Chinese Chicken Salad, no chicken to speak of and blah); desserts looked good though I didn't try any but co-workers did. They are known for their chocolates I guess.

The owner must be a moron though. Twice when I was there it was about 40 degrees in the restaurant, once the front door was open and staff was not allowed to close it as per owner/management. Bizarre....it was extremely cold outside that day and I swear colder inside. There was also construction or repairs going on during lunch. 

I think the Effiel Restaurant was fantastic.

dining in Paris... Las Vegas, that is!

Hexx is located in Paris Hotel and Casino just a few feet to the entrance of the Eiffel Tower. We were led inside by the host then back outside to a table out on the patio where the view was the dancing fountains across at The Bellagio. The weather was a comfortable low 70¬∞'s. 

The menu was small - appetizers, salad, steak choices, pasta and pizza, side items (sold a la carte), chilled seafoods and some entree's. For starters we had complimentary pita bread with dipping oil. Dinner followed and I had the Flat Iron Steak with an a la carte order of mashed potatoes. The steak was tender and juicy... so delicious! We also ordered Pepperoni Pizza and Artichoke Dip appetizer taking our time eating while pleasantly enjoying the fountains across the street at the same time. Although the music was a little faint we could perfectly hear the thunder of the fountains as they danced to a variety of music which came on every 15 minutes. Juan was our server and he did a great job taking care of our table along with another server who made sure our water glasses were never empty . Oh, and I love your accent, Juan... we were well taken care of by this team of servers. There is an attached candy store that we didn't get a chance to visit but we were each given a piece of chocolate after our meals. Teaser. 

Perfect place to people watch too! For a while a couple of gals dressed as Las Vegas showgirls complete with huge feathers stood a few feet away from us. Sadly no one wanted to take a photo with them. They tried.  

Overall, nice and pleasant experience here at Hexx.

Review #0906

I tried the Hexx Benedict and the Carrot Cake pancakes.  The Benedict wasn't too bad, the pancakes a bit dry.  
Suggestion for the pancakes; layer the frosting in between... will promise they will be more appetizing.  
The bloody Mary's though... scrumptious!!!  Would definitely return for breakfast anytime. 

Cheers!!!

Overall it was a very good breakfast. Food prices were great for Vegas but the coffee and drinks make it quite pricey. Boyfriend had the eggs benedict and loved it. I had the protein omelette which was very hearty just the spices were a bit much for breakfast.
Amazing food , great service (thank you Lisa) and a beautiful view! Great place to enjoy an excellent meal and view.
The brunch here was excellent! Server was a little weird but non the less I do recommend you checking it out!

You know when you go thru all the yelp pictures before going to a place and are salivating over what you want to eat ?? Well that was me ! Too bad they had nothing on the menu of which I wanted to taste ! No chocolate pancakes, no chilaquiles no cheesecake with popcorn. I resorted to getting ala Carte sticky bun and caramelizad bacon which were tasty. Service was sub par, borderline rude and not very attentive. To top it off they charge you for eating outside but don't mention it and charge it as a CNF fee of $5.

Walking down the street at las Vegas Strip i saw this amazing Bloody Mary DRINK- it was a must to see and to taste - walk in to the bar and  Bar tender Victor with a great beard and smile said Hello- offers a Bloody Mary and I had to say yessssss- he prepares it - he works hard at it--- and the this amazing carefully crafted big jar is presented as a birth of an amazing drink- I got not paid to say this- "THIii  MOST AMAZING BLOODY MARY I EVER HAD" THANKS VICTOR AND HEXX FOR A WONDERFULL DRINK
Taylor made this place!!! So fun, great service, and we loved hanging out with her. Never let her go. :))
I loved this place. Was kinda pricey,but was worth it! Stayed at the Paris hotel and having this there was nice. Breakfast food was my favorite. Must try this place if you're around.

Could not get any service at Beerpark which is located right above Hexx (it was a Tuesday night and not busy, but the workers there seemed to not care), so we took the elevator to Hexx and decided to grab dinner here. Glad we did. We were seated in the patio right away. Ordered a 1/2 veggie and 1/2 pepperoni pizza and a pitcher of Sculpin. Kids devoured the pepperoni pizza and wifey and I finished of the veggie slices. Pizza was very good and the ice cold beer went down smooth (was probably in the upper 40's outside but the heaters outside did a great job keeping us warm). Service was great as well. With the view to the Bellagio fountains and people watching, I would recommend.

Great food. Great atmosphere. Great view of fountain. Great waiter and servers. Great location. Whats not great is the CNF 4% fee they add to the bill. It is bad enough I have to pay resort fees at the hotels. It is ridiculous that a restaurant will add an extra fee that does absolutely nothing. I ate at many great restaurants on and off the strip that none of them added a CNF fee. I will only return here if they get rid of the CNF fee.

Ambiance was really beautiful but the food just wasn't good. You'd expect to have the most amazing delicious "I've never tasted something so good" experience when you pay $120 for 2 people. Nope. The Filet Minon was $36 without any side dish. The mashed potatoes was $8 extra. And that wouldn't matter either if it was delicious. But it was spiced so weird. I eat steak all the time and this tasted odd and was way over spiced. The steak itself was tender and I'm sure it would have been delicious minus the spicing. So I tried ordering ice cream since they're known for their desserts. The chocolate ice cream was dark chocolate and bitter. Which I should have known because that's their specialty. But I just didn't like it. Overall I had a great time with my family but would have liked to have a better meal for the price.

Amazing Food & Service!
I came here before when it was Sugar Factory. Def a toned down atmosphere but still super chic and modern. 
I sat on the outdoor patio and had great view of the Bellagio fountains!
We started off with the Spinach Dip. So cheesy and fresh, tender artichoke. It was served with home made pita and tortilla chips.
I had chicken tortilla soup that was on the creamy side, great! Chunks of tender chicken & nice blend of spices.
For my entree I had the scallops. OMG! Must order. They are huge and buttery and topped with I think pancetta.
We complimented our meal with a wine flight which was really nice and included a cabernet, rose, port, and chardonnay.
For desert we had chocolate cheesecake. Another amazing menu item! Decadent with oreo crust, peanut butter caramel sauce, topped with caramel popcorn.
This is def a place to try! Sit on the patio and people watch !

Tracee is AMAZING!!!! We went to Hexx for a bachelorette brunch and she made the brunch SO. MUCH. FUN. Like I wish we could hire her to be our hype person for the whole trip. She's the mimosa ninja. You NEED to come here on your trip. Also, get the chilaquiles bc they're bomb and aren't as spicy as everyone says. You can handle it boo.

Fourth visit.
Each time good food and friendly staff.
Breakfast is good, dinner is better for vegetarian options.

Views of the Bellagio water show and the strip.
Great place to visit.

The best street tacos ever and inexpensive as well. Also they have great deals on wine and cigars but the wait time is usually higher than other places. The patio is the best place to eat and enjoy a great glass of wine

We originally wanted to go to Gordon Ramsey Steakhouse but it wasn't open yet and they recommended Hexx. When we got there they took us to our seats fairly quick BUT our table and chairs were dirty. When it was brought to the attention of the hostess she looked around and said I don't know where a buss boy is. So we took it upon ourselves to swap chairs for clean ones as she watched and offered no help. Then once seated we sat there for 15-20 mins and no one came to give us water. Another group sat next to us and within a few mins the waiter came and said "I will be with you in one minute". Now that we sat there and didn't even get a drink of water we decided it was time to go. There are so many places to eat in Vegas and do not recommend this one.

This place is great! I am a local, so touristy places on the strip are usually off the list , but this place is in the frequent rotation! Great View, great food and the service is also great! Bradley took care of us the last two times and he is awesome! Definitely a place to check out, even if you are a local.

We were walking around Paris Hotel in search of a cheese and charcuterie board when we stumbled upon HEXX.  We weren't in the mood for a full meal as we already had dinner reservations, but really in search of a snack. We walked in and were seated promptly.

Service: Service was rather inattentive for it being so slow - in between lunch and dinner.  It took a while to take our orders and our waters went empty for at least 5 minutes without being refilled.

Food: The Cheese and Charcuterie board was good.  Both the cheese selection and meats were standard with nothing to write home about.  The large pretzel as the bread component was an odd choice but it worked well with the whole grain mustard on the board.

Decor:  The modern farmhouse style was nice and comfortable.  The acoustics made it nice so that we could hold a conversation without having to yell.  Our seats also had a good view of the Bellagio fountains.

Overall an OK experience worth another try of their other menu items.

Excellent service, food, and drinks. We needed a spot for brunch and saw the bottomless mimosas for $23. Of course that's what caught our eye. The portion was larger than expected and the food was good. 

Their strawberry jelly was a hit with our group. Asked the server about it and he said it's made in house. We asked if it's for sale, but sadly it wasn't. However, he gave some in a container. That wasn't expected and really nice of him.
Sean and Brandon were so great. We came as a party of 8 for brunch and the restaurant was packed, but they were so attentive. Definitely recommend the restaurant as well the servers.

This is a very contemporary eating establishment but I would have to say it is more on the high end of cost and not the two $$ this app gives it.   The staff is friendly the food is ala cart style.   Steaks are tender and along with salmon perfectly cooked.  Very enjoyable atmosphere.
Great food, quantitative menu options and perfect view of the bellagio fountains. I like that this place is opened late. There is so much to see even when you're sitting down having dinner here.

I like this place. Open 24/7 , food usually spot on. Service almost always good as well. Prices high, but not insane. Great location as well. We love the burgers,  incredible steaks and prime rib, pastas decent, and excellent breakfast choices. I am not joking,everything is really pretty good. 5 star....not quite....but 4+ and definitely the best 24/7 restaurant on the strip. Try those bottomless mimosas! They are delicious!

I will make this short and sweet.  We were at Hexx last Saturday night (party of 10).  We were able to make a reservation in advance, which is always nice.  Our table was lovely, our server (Dave) was on top of everything!
The drinks from the bar were EXCELLENT!  Service and food was top notch.  Honestly, 10 out of 10 people totally enjoyed the experience.  The steak I had was beautifully prepared and melted in my mouth.  The desserts were SO good!  All in all, fantastico!
Just finished lunch at HEXX. The food and cocktails were amazing, and our server Sean gave us fabulous service! If you're headed to Vegas, you must eat here!

We ate breakfast here one morning. I ordered the carrot cake pancakes and a side of bacon. Both were generous portions. I ended up taking the leftover pancakes with cream cheese icing back to the hotel for later. It was still good the next day. I probably would rate it 3.5 stars if I could.

My wife, friend and I ate breakfast at Hexx kitchen this morning.  The restaurant is nice and clean and the food is outstanding.  I had the breakfast pizza (Sausage and egg/$11.95) which was awesome.  My wife had the chilaquiles ($16.95) which were one of the best I've ever had.  My friend had the banana French toast ($13.95) and he said it was delicious.  

To top things off, our waiter Sean was really attentive and checked on us often.  He was very friendly and polite and made an attempt to get to know us.  As we all know, customer service is really what makes a business thrive and Sean is a good interpretation of that.  This is what really makes customers return as I will when I come back to Las Vegas.

My 1st time here and I've been coming to Vegas for 30 years.     Great view of the Bellagio Fountains.  SEAN was a great server.   Loved the carrot cake pancakes.   Oh and did I mention unlimited mimosas for 24 bucks next time I'm coming for hours

We had an amazing brunch! We were a group of 6 and were sat within a few minutes of wondering in hungry. Taylor our server was great. Funny and totally on point along with her friend Steven. They helped each other out during the busy shift. Definitely a great place for brunch, lunch or just drinks! Fantastic Bloody Mary (ask for the Taylor special)

Breakfast pizzas pretty good. Omelette and Carrot Cake pancakes were awesome. Bottomless mimosas were great and now $23 not $20 as shown. Service was very good and people watching was fantastic sitting out on the patio just across from Bellagio's fountains.  We will make this a priority on next visit

Sean is amazing!!! We were the first sat in his section and within seconds, 5-6 tables were added. He was able to engage with every table and still make time for recommendations and answer any menu questions. He was jovial, friendly and AWESOME!! His support, Abram was also great! Always present when needed, providing refills and whatever we needed. You could also recognize his frustration when the section was not setup for success before the hostess began seating. He wanted perfection prior to guests being seated, which to me, is a priority in food and beverage. The two make an incredible team and I plan to visit again as soon as possible!

Waiting 45 minutes to our meal, they made mistakes with the order so we brought back the order and left the place. Very bad service.
We will never come back!

Bottomless mimosas. Yas. Please. Real talk, food is phenom. Sean, my amazing server... cordial, attentive, polite, so many positive adjectives I can write. 
End of this short story, good food, good ppl. Come here.

After a long night of working I decided to explore the strip for some food. I herd about Hexx, all good things. The waitress was very nice and attentive. We started off with the Crab cakes and the Hummus bruschetta. Absolutely amazing!!! Probably the best part about the whole meal. My friend had the Jambalaya and I had the Shrimp Scampi. They both decent. For the price I would except better but we were on The Strip so it's understandable.

The food at Hexx is on fire. What's great is how nimbly they dance across food trends in order to accommodate the myriad of food issues and concerns so common nowadays. Paleo? No problem? Low carb? Got it! Gluten free? Yep? Vegetarian? Gotcha covered.  Standout starters are their pork rinds (yes) enlivened with vinegar and pickled fresnos you add yourself, veggie pizza that is as pretty to look at as it is to eat; caprese salad that isn't a bore; some of the best calamari I've had in a long time; roasted broccolini that's a nice  change and candied bacon that you'll fight over. And that's just for starters. Plus there is tons more. But save room for dessert because it is Hexx after all and the chocolate is made on premises and it's a real star of the Vegas strip. You can even get a tour and a lesson on how they make it and have a chocolate tasting from all the regions they purchase their beans.

The food and drink was incredible! Most of all the service was amazing. We had a large party and Brittany G was on top of it all. She was super personable and accommodating. We'll definitely be back next time we're in vegas! Thank you to Brittany for a wonderful brunch! She made our group have the most wonderful experience and we can't wait to visit her soon.

Delish!!! I had the ham and cheddar croissant with roasted potatoes and a hypnotize strawberry cocktail... Damn I love breakfast in Vegas!!!! We sat on the patio, Our waitress Tracee had a great personality, and was great! There bloody Mary's were good too! Great place, pricey but really enjoyed it
Had apps and dessert both were great. Our server, Sean, was amazing. Made us feel like we were his only table. Great location with patio to people watch right on the Strip!

I tasted lots of great foods at our table, so I have little doubt that my dining companions will swarm this listing with 4- or even 5-star reviews. Unfortunately, my own entree was lacking.

HEXX Kitchen + Bar is a newer American restaurant that took over the Sugar Factory space. This is a great location, with entrances to the Strip and the floor of Paris Las Vegas.  I accepted an invitation to Saturday brunch, which took place in a busy and loud dining room (which drowned out the 80s-heavy music mix) with lighter colors all over that wouldn't seem out of place in a tropical getaway. Maybe that's some sort of implied appeal toward women (you know, the "XX"), but our table as well as the rest of the main dining room seemed to have an even mix of genders.

Without further ado, allow me to dissect the problem child, the Prime Rib French Dip ($19). The portion was ample, so no problem there. As expected, I experienced rich flavor between the beef and the au jus. The hoagie roll was capable of soaking up that au jus without being too thick or distracting, so another win.

The first notable concern is that I had at least two gristly bites which most would spit out and call inedible. This suggests that cheap meat may have been used or at least that the meat wasn't trimmed/cleaned completely. I also found the thin-cut fries to be pedestrian and not very fluffy or crispy. They were only barely useful as a vehicle for the "horseradish cream" that wasn't very strong, perhaps diluted with ranch or something similar. And seriously, what's up with how runny that sauce is? I already have the loose liquid dip that is supposed to saturate every crevice in my bites, so this second sauce is just going to wash off. Execution and design flaws all around detract from what could've been a great entree.

I ended up sampling various other treats from around the table, some of which I loved. However, I have to give most of the weight of the rating to the food that mostly filled my belly, so even the standouts below weren't enough for me to feel comfortable with giving 4 stars.

Magick Dragon cocktail: pay attention when the server pours the liquid into the pitcher. It instantly activates the bed of dry ice at the bottom, so a clear smoky vapor starts pouring out. This really is a great show, but the cocktail itself doesn't have any sort of tart or gingery notes aside from the sweet, vaguely tropical fruit profile. For that alone, I'd recommend against ordering this drink even if you're trying to find something to share between multiple people. Also, a minor quibble, but I'm pretty sure that the dry ice froze the last fraction of the drink. We had neither time or temperature to deal with that, but it was annoying that we still saw color despite not being able to consume any of it.

Twisted Sticky Bun ($8): huge, chewy yet soft, and non-saccharine version of this breakfast pastry. I loved the cream cheese topping and the crispy pecans. This is best for sharing unless you have a huge sweet tooth.

Chicken and Waffles ($24): Clint B's dish, which I tried a bite of after he offered to share it. Both items were crispy and the chicken was delicious and fork-tender. I didn't really get much of the apple-cheddar character of the waffle in my limited sampling, but it sounds delightful. Price concerns aside, I'd definitely consider ordering it for myself, and it's likely one of the best takes locally on this classic (and considering that Clint prefers another Strip restaurant's rendition, I'm also putting that one on my list).

We were all too full to contemplate dessert, but our server did present to us one small piece of two different, house-made chocolate blends. I can't recall the details, but one had some fruity flavors in it, and both seemed to provide complex bitter notes despite initially tasting like milk chocolates. They mentioned that we could get 15% off chocolates at their store (a separate business listing), and I may have to consider making that visit next time I'm going to Paris Las Vegas, one of the dwindling number of Strip casinos still offering free parking to Nevada residents.

Ultimately, I would consider returning to HEXX Kitchen + Bar, although I'm not in any hurry. I'll welcome invitations, but I'll just have to skip the French Dip and avoid anything else with fries like the plague.

If you don't wanna wait in the big queues then this is the place to go.  My friend and I came here two mornings in a row because we get seated right away.  The food is really good and the service as well.  And their serving size is big so be ready to pig out! Lol

Hello fellow yelpers! We came as a group of 11  without a reservation, a 23 minute wait on a Thursday morning. We had bottomless mimosas with mixtures of chilaquiles and chicken and waffles. Steven was a great hostess and server, making sure we never reached the bottom of our mimosas. Definitely coming back here for a Vegas getaway!

Came here for Brunch after our Paris Staycation.  We made reservations for 1130am and when we arrived we were given a table outside looking over the Bellagio fountains.  The view alone was awesome, sunny day and great for people watching.  We started out by ordering 2 Farmers Markets Bloody Mary's which included bacon infused gin, and garnished with bacon, white cheddar cheese, pepper stuffed olive and beef stick.  The Bloody Mary's alone were like an appetizer themselves!  On top of our Bloody Mary's we also ordered the overcooked bacon which was like ordering extra crispy bacon.  Since there was already bacon in the Bloody Mary's we probably should've went with a different appetizer, but I guess you can never have too much bacon right?  Our entrees arrived shortly after and I went with the lobster roll, while my boyfriend had the frittata.  The plating was cute but to be honest I was surprised how small the portions were, I would say there were a little on the smaller side but I was still full when we were done.  Our server was very attentive along with other employees in the dining rooms making sure our waters were filled, plates were cleared away etc.  The only reason why I took away some stars were for the pricing.  The service was great, ambiance and view was great, but after using an Open Table Dining credit of $50 and after paying CNF fees, balance due was still $51.40 so a total of $101.40 for 2 people before dining credit for brunch.  I guess this is what you expect from dining on the strip, either way, I would still recommend if you are looking for a good Bloody Mary on the strip with a great view.   *CNF fees, not listed anywhere else but apparently is a Concessions and Franchise fee that is included with this restaurant.  I didn't ask about it since I heard some restaurants on the strip may start charging this.

Rafael was an amazing waiter supreme.  He recommended the Chicken & Waffles and it was UNBELIEVABLE!  We're definitely coming back again & again.  If all the employees are half as awesome as Rafael you'll have a great meal.  CHEERS!  GO
Service & ambiance is friendly and super cute. Food taste is not what we expected for the star rating. There was a 20min wait. I believe this place is more for mimosas & drinks.

Just came to have brunch and we had such great service from Craig, Romo, and Tom! The food was delicious and we had such a great time getting drinks and food. Will definitely come back next time. LOVEEE 


Came back about a month later and had great service from Sean and Patrick! This place never fails me because of their customer service, positive attitudes and awesome food!

The food and service were both outstanding. This restaurant is also fantastic for vegetarians. The veggie burger is made with beans and quinoa, which is a welcomed change from portobello patties or patties that are essentially rice cakes. There is a pretty decent beer selection as well.

The service here is also fantastic. Sean, our waiter, had a super knowledge of the menu (for example, he knew by memory that the Caesar salad had anchovies in the dressing and was not suitable for vegetarians). He was also very attentive and very amiable throughout the entire lunch. I thought he did a categorically outstanding job.

We certainly will be coming back here.

This is probably one of my favorite places to go to brunch in Vegas now. I took my friends to the brunch and booked a reservation in advanced this was such a great place to go to it's kid friendly it is kind of loud with the music but it's fun the food there is amazing and the service was great I had a group of five and a 10 month old. We sat on the patio and it was so nice out! I wish I got the waiters name because he was awesome, I Very funny and I never had an empty glass of the endless Mamosa's. Food wise the food was very great! I ended up getting carrot cake pancakes and they are tooo diiiie for!! my boyfriend got corn beef hash and that is also amazing! So if you do go to Hexx have fun! :)

With all of the options in Las Vegas to have a meal we rarely ever do 're-runs'...HEXX is an exception to the rule.  Love, love , LOVE their breakfast menu...and with the bottomless Mimosas one cannot go wrong. Their prime rib steak and eggs breakfast is to die for as well as their corned beef hash with sweet potato and eggs..ask for the hollandaise sauce on the side...it's that good where the sauce would take away from this dish. 

If breakfast is that good, Dinner must be outstanding...we'll have to try it the next time we are in Sin City.

Was staying at Paris and this place is there so decided to check it out for dinner on Sunday night. Didn't kinks how packed it would be so made reservations for 6 like at 5:45. Really cool decor and awesome patio on the strip for awesome people watching. Had the jambalyay with shrimp, sausage and chicken confit. Big portion but it wasn't as flavorful as I would have liked just somewhat hot. My sister and the crab cakes (appetizer) but you get 3 okay sized and they were really good. She also had a side of broccillini which was very tasty as well. My friend had chicken and waffles. Big portion and delicious! Awesome chocolate shop too where they make the chocolate. Definitely a go to if your in the area!

I recommend making a reservation, this place is really popular regardless of when you  go. The food is good, the feel is way better. Its trendy and great for large or small groups.  Can't wait to come back and try their dinner menu.
Came here at the last minute to buy some treats and they had everything chocolate possible. However, the prices are a bit high, given you can buy the same things at local grocery stores.

First off our server CLAIRE was amazing. She really made our dining experience over the top, made us feel welcomed and was very sweet! We also had the pleasure of meeting David, who was a busser or server. He greeted us at the bar and brought over a bar stool so we could sit down rather than wait for a table. Chilaquiles are the way to go for breakfast!!! So good! This would have been a 5 Star review if it wasn't for the rude hostesses... Besides their lack of customer service and friendliness, my experience was great!!

This is a place on the strip that you actually get your money's worth, especially with bottomless mimosas. Great service, great food, great experience. Johanna took great care of us both times we came on our trip and I would 100% recommend it to anyone coming to town.
Food was good; service was great. Spicy jumbo was good but not great. Martini was very week.

They may be Hexxed.  Hmmm... Lets just say they are brand new and are on the strip. That's good.  Isaac the manager was kind enough to visit and apologize for the poor service and mis-marked prices on their high end sprits. He wouldn't fix the problem. If you are not turned off by the greeters, you may be...  Since they were charging $51 per shot for $18 tequila at the Bellagio, we went back to the Bellagio. I'm happy to pay $100 a glass for the good stuff.

This place just opened up and honestly have the best employees! We went to the Cafe but not the restaurant and when we went in we got treated with a free sample of a gummy bear. Jesse served us our ice cream and was extremely nice! Ice cream is soooo good! Got the mango sticky rice which reminded me of island tropical mangoes! Will be coming back!
Seriously the best meal I've ever had. Sooooo good. Halibut on some saucy rice ... Devine. Drinks are creative, and yummy. Dessert was good also

We used a Groupon for an inexpensive dinner right on the strip! The view of the Bellagio water show was fantastic and so was the food,wine and service!  We will be back the next time we vacation in Vegas!

Just came for dessert, and it was delightful! Although, I must be honest and say it was much better (esp the milkshakes) when it was Sugar Factory :/. but i still enjoyed the atmosphere and all the other food and drinks that passed us by looked very, very good.

Holy crap, I will be having dreams about this place for the rest of my life it was so amazing. Despite it being a pretty busy night and pretty late we manage to get in right before the dinner menu was done for the night. We ended up sharing him a few small plates and everything was beyond amazing. It came super fast and our waiter Brad was not only charming but a fantastic server. I highly recommend the flat bread with the goat cheese, my next trip to Vegas this will be my first stop. They had a live musician who was wonderful also, she did an acoustic version of no scrubs that will forever be in my heart.

Definitely worth going for the brunch. Loved sitting outdoors and enjoyed the people watching; heaters on the deck kept everyone in our party warm. Enjoyed the protein omelet, great flavor using chicken thighs instead of white meat. Side of potatoes were crips, but not oily-slightly under seasoned. The staff was attentive and kept my bottomless mimosa filled.

On our last day in town, we decided to hit up this place for brunch. They are a short walk from Planet Hollywood and located on the strip just outside of Paris. We didn't get the chance to make reservations, but we had good fortune and they had a table available for our party (which was 11 people!) when we arrived. 

I forgot the exact name of it, but we ordered a jug of berry mimosa (~36) for the table and was able to split a cup for everyone. It was a perfect refreshment to go with our brunch meal! After glancing at the menu for a few minutes, I decided to try the Chilaquiles ($17), which includes: chicken, roasted salsa tortilla chips, two eggs, avocado sour cream, asadero. This was a perfect just yum, it was a perfect brunch item that hit the spots with breakfast essentials such as eggs, protein, and some delicious sauce for flavor. The portion size was filling, my appetite left the restaurant quite content with the meal. I also tried some of my friend's Carrot Cake Pancakes, which was surprisingly pretty damn delicious. If I wasn't so full, I would have eaten more! The pancakes were super filling, so you should probably share it with someone or expect to take home leftovers.

HEXX was one of our food highlights this trip. Minus the minor mishap with the bill, everything was excellent. Everyone enjoyed their meal and the service was friendly. The restaurant's ambience was also high-class, very open, and nicely decorated with light colors. The restaurant overlooks the Bellagio fountain as well, so the restaurant is located in a neat spot. HEXX is definitely one of my recommendations for food on the strip, especially if you are around this part of Vegas.
Got strip side view. Nice and cool dinner weather.  The broccolli vinagrette appetizer is very very good. The flavor will make you remember this place and write a review about it.

We went in today a little before 1.  When we walked up to the hosts, they had 4 hosts standing there.  Only 1 greeted us and why she was talking to us she kept on cleaning the counter and didn't look up to talk to us.  We sat down, I understand that they are super busy, but our server never came over for over ten minutes.  Finally another employee came over and filled our waters and then we waited another 10 minutes and still no server came over.   We finally got up and walked out because there is no way I am going to pay 20$ for a burger and not get at least decent service.  I have no idea how long we would have waited if we stayed.  They need to put more servers on or at least make those hosts help the servers out.   Maybe it was a bad day but I won't be trying my luck here again.  Too many other places to eat on the strip that we would get better service at.
Breakfast and lunch were amazing. Atmosphere was amazing, very modern and sleek and right on the strip (with outside seating and heaters). Must try if your in Vegas, amazing food!
Best Steak and Eggs I've ever had!! Can't remember the last time a plate had me thinking about it days after. Would drive back into town just to have breakfast there again.

I was out with a girlfriend & wondered into Hexx for a drink to relax watch the Bellagio fountains from the patio. A courteous and attentive server Johnny Love. I don't know if that's his real name but he turned us on to the hypnotizing Strawberry cocktail which was amazing Broccolini as a healthy starter then talked us into sharing Short Ribs that just melted in our mouths. We didn't want any dessert but he talked us into sharing the Ecuadorian Brownie, so glad he did. We were so please with his service and will definitely be back.

Seriously one of the best restaurants I've been to in Vegas! Came here on a girls trip and it did not disappoint! There's something for everyone and I highly recommend it. Call in advance if you have a larger group!

Never in my life did I think that I could go out someplace in Vegas and be so disappointed! We showed up to Hexx around 9AM. It was busy on one side, but totally empty on the other. We assumed the other side was a different restaurant. We said we were okay with any table, inside or outside and the hostess said it would take 15 minutes. 30 minutes later we are still waiting for our table with absolutely no update. We finally go up to the hostess to ask if our table was ready and she asks us if we ever got a text message, which we didn't. The hostess apologized and took us to our table. We sat there for about 15 minutes when a server finally came and took our orders. 

We ordered 2 coffees, an egg white omelette, a croissant sandwich, and a yogurt parfait. Our coffees showed up in tiny little cups while everyone else had regular coffee mugs. The server said they were out of big cups and would bring them as soon as they were available. We continued to wait another 30 minutes to get our food! At this point we are hungry and still waiting for bigger coffee cups. I asked the server for bigger cups and he said, "We don't use those mugs on this side." We were the only table with small coffee cups. I decided to give up on that. 

I took about two bites of my omelette when I noticed a long brown hair in my food. I wanted to THROW UP!!! At this point I'm hungry, don't have enough coffee, and just pissed off! I called over the waitress and as she was taking the food from me she said, and I quote, "Eww that f***ing disgusting!" UMM EXCUSE ME?!?!? This is supposed to be a nice restaurant, not a trash club! Whatever, I order the yogurt parfait because I was disgusted by my food. 

I waited over 45 minutes for them to bring me my food. My friends were DONE with their breakfast at this point. During this time our server dropped a glass of champagne on a guest sitting across from us. She dropped two glasses and broke them and acted like it was the customers fault. I got pissed and went to the manager and asked for the checking letting her know I was clearly done with this trash of a restaurant. 

When we got the check, to my disappointment, she only took off the charge for the omelet! She didn't comp us our meal after everything we had been through, she charged us for the tiny coffees we ordered after we asked for mugs many times. It was disgusting. We paid and left without leaving a tip. 

Honestly, this place is TRASH!! TRASH TRASH TRASH!! With so many nice places in Vegas it is NOT worth even going here. The general restaurant at TI has better service than this junk of a place. I honestly wish I could leave a few bad reviews because people need to know this place is NOT VEGAS QUALITY and they shouldn't waste their time.

HEXX is a newer dining establishment on the strip that's open 24-7 for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. My first experience was decent, but a few things kept me from making this a four-star review. Here's the dealio...

HEXX is located in the front portion of Paris Hotel and Casino with a wraparound front and side patio that's great for people watching or taking in a view of the breathtaking Bellagio fountains. Since my husband and I were staying at Paris, we entered through the casino where there was a hostess stand, but no hostess. I hate that awkward feeling of wondering if you're meant to wait there or seat yourself. We decided to carry on and planned to ask the first restaurant employee we came across. We walked, and walked, and finally we were standing at the outside entrance on the opposite side of the restaurant where there was another hostess stand and three hostesses. Just a suggestion, but you girls might want to spread out a bit to avoid this confusion.

Once we were seated on the patio, we were finally ready to enjoy our lunch. The patio does have table umbrellas and light misting to keep you cool. It felt perfect even though it topped 100 degrees. Then again, I'm a desert lovin' girl. 

The menu had plenty of variety, all at your typical Vegas prices. My turkey sandwich served with fries was $16, but I suppose it was a "gourmet" price being that it was served with avocado on cranberry challah bread, right? It was still very tasty though and was a decent portion as well. It's rare that I have food envy over what my husband chooses. It's more often the other way around, but I guess I was off my game because I wanted to switch plates with him during our entire meal. What did he have that looked so appealing, you ask? Chicken and waffles. Not just any chicken and waffles, but chicken breast tenders and an apple cheddar waffle served with bourbon maple syrup. He gave me a bite of his $24 lunch entree after he caught me drooling over it more than once, and it confirmed my suspicion... I should've gotten THAT! 

Our server, though a sweet girl, seemed a bit off. She over-poured my ice tea nearly missing my precious phone, and didn't seem too confident in her answers to the few questions we had.

I'd be willing to give HEXX another shot due to the fact that there are plenty of things on the menu that begged me to try them. Helloooo chocolate pancakes with caramel syrup... I'm talking to you! Give me a better experience next time, and I'll bump it up a star. Until then...
Food and drinks were great. Best part was our server Sean! Hands down best service! Thanks Sean for making our bachelorette lunch a memorable experience!

Great food and environment. Breakfast was fresh, light and delicious. The wait time for breakfast rush was around 20 minutes but they have a great shop next door where you can grab coffee, treats and chocolate concoctions. Grab a seat on the patio and enjoy the Bellagio water show while you dine.

Whenever we go to Vegas, we make a stop at Hexx because the food is really good, and they have bottomless minosas.  However, our last stop to Hexx over this weekend was amazing.  Our waiter, Tracy, made our visit exceptional.  She was like a hype-woman and provided that Vegas experience that you expect when you go to a restaurant in Vegas.

We were initially seated at a table directly in the sun without shade, and she spoke to the manager to make sure that we were moved inside, despite the unpleasant hostess. She kept our mimosa glasses filled to the rim and made sure that we were all having a great time.  Tracy was entertaining, genuine, and provided all the services we needed. She went to infinity and beyond!  Thank you Tracy!


This place gets really busy, so make a reservation.

Chilaqiules are so good. Huge portion, two people could probably share. Chicken and waffles, the best I've had. Place feels very hip with loud music and patio seating - almost too loud for me though. Staff wasn't too friendly,  but service was good.

The worst service Ive ever experienced at a restaurant of this caliber. The food was aweful and brought out at different times. Two of the guests got entrees about 20 minutes after everyone else.  If money is no object and you dont care about quality and service you will find this place acceptable.

Terrible service. I watched the waitress look at me for a few minutes before she even decided to come over to my table. Maybe she was debating if she wanted to wait on my table or not. The food is average at best. The host recommended the jambalaya so that's what I ordered. It was filled with nothing but pepper spice and no real flavor. I'm going to have to pass on this place moving forward.
It would have been a 5, but they charge a resort fee tax in the restaurant! Vegas is just trying to take all our money.

After a poor dining experience, the next day I called Hexx and spoke with the real general manager, Melody. Melody was kind, listened to my concerns, and apologized. She asked if we could come back and give Hexx another chance. My friends and I were tentative (since our past experience was so awful); but we returned to Hexx for brunch and our experience was AMAZING! Our waiter, Enrique, was attentive, helpful and friendly. He checked in on us frequently and made us feel welcome. The food was good, portions are huge and very reasonably priced. 
I ordered the veggie omlet and it is definitely large enough to feed two.
The ambience is casual and calm. The restaurant was crowded but our food and drinks came out quickly.
If you're looking for a tasty and reasonably priced  brunch, I highly recommend Hexx! 
We will definitely come back to Hexx next time we're in Vegas!

Tip: brunch is from 5am-2pm on weekends. We went at noon on a Sunday and I'm glad we had a reservation because Hexx was crowded.

Great service, our server (Britt) was amazing and patient with us as we had to add 2 more people half way through the meal. She moved in an extra table for us. 

Their specials for drinks are delicious! We shared the Jungle Juice, between 4 people. It definitely is a creeper. I had the pork hash and shared it with my boyfriend, thankfully. Small dish but heavy with the meat and potatoes (good for hangovers). My friends has the chilequiles and loved it - a bit spicy tho.

I will have to say it's a little pricey but it's Vegas, lol. Share as the plates are filling.

Just came for my bach party!!! Hostess was prompt. Service was great. Taylor & Stephanie were amazing!! The food... oh. My. The breakfast pizzas and the chilaquiles were so freaking good!!!! The lunch is just as good! Must go!

Unbelievable experience. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Derek saw my wife drop her knife and he immediately came with a new one before we could even ask for one. I am very impressed with the work ethic and environment of this restaurant. The food was cooked to absolute perfection, I applaud the kitchen staff for their execution. Thank you to everyone especially Derek for making this experience special for us.

Amazing service and wonderful food. If you go to Hexx you have to sit in Tracee's section and have the chicken and waffles. It was all amazing. And Tracee... I did gamble a little more at the airport this afternoon. Only down $5. See you next year.

The Paris being...Paris inspired much to my surprise doesn't host bakeries providing any macaroons. As I entered the greeter was polite but had no idea what a macaroon was, they ended up as three dollars a piece and their chocolate tasting was awful; second encounter was made to purchase an ice cream cake which actually consisted of harsh inedible tough cookies and better than expected Horchata ice cream. Also- the macaroons where over priced and a tiny cafe further into the Paris has far cheaper ones.
Only came to Vegas for 2 days and have already eaten here twice! Our server Steven was amazing! Very knowledgeable about the menu and super friendly! Definitely will be back for our next trip!

My wife and I went here for a light dinner.  We ordered the Spinach Dip, Cheese/Meat Plate, and Gnocchi.  Spin dip was great, very tasty.  The gnocchi was decent, could have used a bit more sauce; they were super tiny (but good portion size).  The cheese/meat plate was the highlight, so many options.  I wish they gave you more honey and bread to enjoy the different tastes.  Finished off with the s'mores dessert, which was ok (not exactly what I expected).  

I'm not a fan of restaurants having a menu online without prices (seems like they're trying to trick you into going there).  We didn't order drinks, our bill (pre-gratuity) was around $85.  

Our waiter (Kevin) was great, he even had pictures of the desserts on his phone, which convinced me to choose the smores over another option.
Great place for brunch. Food was delicious! They have good music playing, lots of energy and awesome views of the water show directly across the street.

Hexx, I was giving you 3 stars but as I write this it's changed to 2. Why? Because your food is good but your help/service is horrendous. We came here twice. The first day there was no issue sitting 4 of us and the waitress was prompt and helpful. Despite the flubs along the way (omelet was completely incorrect, silverware dropped on feet, etc...) the issues were corrected immediately. Day 2, we (2 of us) arrived early and asked for a table for 6. "No problem" the girl says. "We'll seat you right away" she says. Then, instead of seating us so we can order some Bloody Mary's while we wait for the other 4 that are on their way, she says we have to wait till everyone is present. I say they went to Starbucks real quick and she says "no outside drinks". WTF? I'm thinking, should we even come here? The rest of my party shows up about 10min later and the girl says "I can seat you once they finish their coffees". How ridiculous. She wasn't even polite or courteous about it. She was really quite bitchy! So you've been holding a table for 6 for 15min meanwhile you've inconvenienced me by having me stand in a god damn lobby waiting like punishment for not having all 6 with me right away. Then when they show you make us wait longer because somehow Starbucks is shunned by your establishment. You're kidding me... you could have made a 4 drink profit by sitting us and letting us wait comfortably. Instead we stood and waited and then my friends had to throw away their Starbucks just to be seated to eat. Not only did your shitty hostesses attitude suck (she was short, unfriendly, curt, not accommodating or courteous), frankly so do you! Im not interested in coming back here for a 3rd try, despite the fact the food was good. Good service can trump mediocre food, never the other way around.

If there's one restaurant I've been excited to dine at this trip, it's HEXX. The pictures on Yelp make this place look amazing but I should have realized that most happy Yelpers came for brunch. Dinner is something else.

My bf is gluten free but I'm not, and when we ordered two of the same meal but cooked differently, they made both gluten free making mine skip the fries garlic I was craving. They didn't offer to give me me garlic and didn't stop by to check on the table for 20+ minutes. Our waters were not once refilled in the hour we were there, and we were told the appetizer we ordered was gluten free, just to find out AFTER my Celiac-disease boyfriend spilt it with me that it wasn't.

While the location is great and it looks amazing, our service killed any chance for a higher review. We spent $80 on dinner and barely received any service...along with getting the wrong food. 

I might try this again for brunch, but I wouldn't return for dinner. I can see why they're on Groupon, and hope they're able to work on their employee training so guests can have a better experience.

I went out looking for an amazing meal. And amazing meal did find moi. Their signature cocktails. A..ma..zing and fun. Wanted a steak tonight but went for what originally caught my eye...chicken &waffels ...fantastic. breakfast lunch dinner AND dessert all rolled into 1.  Sad I'm not a sweets girl because I know whatever they would have serve me for dessert would have been superior to your life in general. Thank you for making my last night in vegas perfect with this culinary abstract amazingness...pickels ....check ...Hexx if your not married. Call me.  Or if you are...ya know...vegas...PS Julie ...my waitress completed the night. As a daughter of a ginger another sign I was meant to be here and ya'll were meant to make great food #MtOlivePickles try them. Keep on keeping on xo

This place was good but overall a little over priced IMO.

Stopped here for our first breakfast of our trip in Vegas. I ordered the bottomless mimosas ($24), and split a turkey club with my mom. My stepdad and husband split the Johnny Cakes.

--Turkey Club- this has turkey, bacon, lettuce, tomato, and was on a cranberry challah bread. Overall a great sandwich but not the best I have ever had. I think the bread was the best part. The turkey was low quality you could tell but I still liked it. It also came with fries that were pretty good.

--Johnny Cakes - I tried these and they were pretty good, a little doughy for my liking, but my stepdad said that is how they are supposed to be so maybe I am just not a Johnny Cake fan lol. They reminded me of pancakes made out of cornbread.

--Mimosas - Although they were really good, $24 is the most I have ever paid for bottomless haha. But then again, we WERE in Vegas.

Pretty good restaurant but I think Mon Ami Gabi is better.

I had a wonderful dining experience here. Food was excellent and service was beyond our expectations. Our server, Sean, refilled our bottomless mimosas promptly and made us feel welcome. Did I mention we were celebrating a birthday? Well, Sean went above and beyond to make the birthday special. Will definitely come back to this restaurant when I'm back in town!
Sean and Big B WOWWED the crowd!! Very attentive even during busy hours! Totally on top of their game and an asset to the company. I'd come back to this location for sure.

First off, bottomless mimosas??!! Yes please!! We had brunch there and it was amazing!! The food, the presentation, the comfortable seating and most importantly our waitress, Tracee! She was awesome!! So personable and funny! She took real good care of us! I was with the elderly, meaning my parents, my two aunts and a family friend who is their age. Lol So she did a good job of helping me out with them.  Highly recommend!
Excellent service, amazing food! Tracee is one of the best servers I have ever had! The chilaquiles were amazing, huge portion too. Great start to my trip, thanks Tracee!!
