I made reservations for this place yesterday morning. I parked in the parking garage and it was a bit confusing trying to find it within the casino, but from the Strip is located right in front of the Paris. 

I dined in for the Brunch and it was great. Had the bottomless mimosas, which the price wasn't too bad. Our server kept filling us up when we got half way so our drink was never low. I ordered the Cinnamon Apple Pancakes and they were absolutely delicious. No need for syrup. Every bite was heaven. 

However, my wife ordered the Steak and Eggs and she had to return the steak because it was way too salty/over seasoned. But the eggs, biscuit and potatoes were good. 

I would definitely try this place again and I would recommend. The staff was great and the view from the patio seating was nice. They even had heaters outside to ensure their guests were warm to enjoy people watching. Loved it.

Rafael was an awesome waiter. The food was so good. I got the prime rib sandwich and it was so good and me and my friend shared it. We were lost in the sauce. It was great. He was super attentive to our table and was sure to never let our drinks go empty! Also, I need to include Christina she is amazing at her job! She made sure we were fully satisfied.


P.s. Rafael (tongue roll) was so good anything he suggested on the menu I bought including chicharones. Love the country boy vibe!

I loved this place! We arrived in time for Bloody Mary's and breakfast. I ordered the traditional Bloody Mary and was so delighted when it arrived. It was the best Bloody Mary I've ever had. the vegetables complimented the spicy fresh tomato juice so well. It was a meal in and of itself. My friends ordered the crispy broccolini (WOW!), overcooked bacon (surprisingly good) and the chilequiles (also amazing!). I got to taste everything while sipping on my delicious drink. The atmosphere was fun, too. A very relaxing spot and the view is of the Bellagio fountains. We all agreed that we'd like to go back and eat there again. We didn't make it back on that trip but I know I will next time I'm in Vegas!

Went here specifically for "The Colossal Bloody Mary" that they advertise on Instagram that has a crab leg sticking out of it. The bartender asks I'm sure that I want it because of the size. I said "yes, I've seen it on your Instagram page." However, he did NOT tell me that they were out of crab legs. I noticed it was missing, so I inquired. He told me "we're out of crab legs, so I added two extra shrimp." That would have been nice to know before ordering a $36 drink. Or perhaps reducing the price since the crab is what makes it expensive. Wouldn't go back. Extremely disappointed. Should have gone to TOD's instead.

Great food! Great Location and great service! Had lunch here and hosted by Maggie and I had no idea this place was that good. Best location on the strip for outdoor or indoor. the drinks were amazing as well. I recommend trying their chocolate next door. Had some of their chocolate from Ecuador.

We heard there was a Hexx Chocolate shop and were disappointed to find out that they just sold the Chocolate bars at the restaurant and did not have an actual chocolate shop. Either way we were still eager to get our hands on a 70% chocolate bar. After finding a nice place to sit down and enjoy our chocolate bar we were a little disappointed again. The bar was a little bland and just didn't hit the spot. Overall Hexx was a nice facility with friendly staff I just wouldn't get their chocolate's again. I would try their food though.

food was amazing. jack cakes with bacon and butter. bottomless mimosas for $23. The problem was our waitress. if its a bottomless service i don't want to see.my glass empty for multiple extended periods of time. I spe t hf my time waiting for drink refills. Get on the ball. It's Sunday brunch!!!!  Maybe  Tracee had a shit day.

Had lunch there today and it was absolutely amazing. Food was excellent, but the service was outstanding. I know that Las Vegas is the top in the service industry but a gentleman named Sean was our server and he was top notch. I have owned several bars and I know that customer service is the most important part of a business no matter what your selling. There could be great food anywhere but if you don't have great customer service you will remember that. Thank you Sean for a great lunch!!!
We ordered from the tapas/small plates menu.  The food was creative and delicious. Our waitress, Jasmine, was friendly and efficient.  I definitely recommend Hexx.

Ate here with my fianc√© on Thursday night. The food was spectacular. We had the prime rib and the veal! The service was friendly and quick and the view was so nice. We will deff be back!! Oh and we had a groupon and saved $20. We come to Vegas every year and this was by far the best place to eat that we have been! Can't wait to go back and try something new!

After coming down from the top of the Eiffel Tower, we decided to get something for dinner. Leaving Paris Casino, we immediately walked right past Hexx and decided to try it since it had decent reviews and was still open. It was probably well past midnight at this point, but Hexx is open 24 hours so we were able to get a table without having to wait. 

We got a table on the patio which sits right on the Vegas Strip so it is the ultimate location for people watching. We decided to split an order of Spinach and Artichoke Dip for an appetizer and then also decided to split their Ribeye Steak. Everything we ordered was good. The Artichoke Dip was pretty much what you expect. The Ribeye was large and cooked to a perfect medium. It was served with asparagus. Again, everything was really good, but nothing was outstanding...

Our service was pretty good. The restaurant has a cool modern style and great location. The prices are a little on the higher end, but not bad.

________________________
\                                              /
/   -:: OVERALL RATING ::-   \
\                                              /
/     5.0/5.0 :: Venue               \
\     4.0/5.0 :: Service              /
/     4.5/5.0 :: Ambiance          \
\     4.0/5.0 :: Food                 /
/_______________________\

-:::- VENUE/AMBIANCE  -:::- 

Hexx is 30,000-square-foot restaurant situated conveniently in the heart of the Las Vegas strip at the Paris hotel with a magnificent view of the Bellagio fountains. Lots of spacious indoor, outdoor & bar seating. The bar does feature a row of high-top communal tables. Hexx has a very open, lively, relaxing & comfortable atmosphere that makes one dining experience that much more pleasurable. It is a spot for all occasions and any type of dining too (breakfast, lunch, dinner, late-night dining & desserts) for they are open 24 hours!

-:::- SERVICE  -:::- 

Both my lunch visits here has been very enjoyable for the servers were very courteous & personable. They were attentive to our needs. But I wish the hostess could be a bit more inviting & friendlier. The encounter I had with the gal working there, was a little stand-offish (she wasn't rude or anything, but just wasn't so approachable) -- on both separate occasion when I visited. 

-:::-  FOOD / MENU  -:::-

We purchased a Groupon deal and it was great catch! The menu does  lean toward an upscale-ish feel but yet it's approachable. For what we have tried the food served is fresh and came out in a timely manner. I would definitely return for it is a very walk-able destination on the strip & food here is satisfying. 

Jumbo Lump Crab Cake   [4.0/5.0]
Jambalaya                         [4.0/5.0]
8oz Filet Mignon                [4.0/5.0]
8oz Rip Cap                       [4.0/5.0]
14oz Ribeye                       [4.0/5.0] 
Charred Asparagus            [4.0/5.0]
Purple Haze Pitcher           [4.0/5.0]


-:::-  NOTES -:::-

1) Restrooms are looking inside the Paris hotel towards the back entrance of the restaurant & bar.

OHHHH MY GOD, being a Texan I am a steak connoisseur. Until today my favorite has been the Ribeye at Ruth's Chris. Nothing could prepare me for the Ribeye with Oscar Lobster sauce at Hexx, Las Vegas. Funny thing, is I'd asked for a steak knife when they'd brought me a butter knife. When I cut into the steak I realized I didn't need a steak knife; a SPOON would do. It was crispy on the outside Med/rare and it was like BUTTER. Our waitress Alayna was amazing and so was the view of the Bellagio Fountains--absolutely exquisite experience.

What an amazing experience from start to finish. First impressions of the staff, outstanding! Friendly, attentive and amazing personalities. Drinks, incredible! Our lunch came out quickly, presentation beautiful, food delicious. Check with chocolates, you had me at hello....

My mom and I stopped at HEXX for brunch on Sunday around 11. There was a wait for the patio, as it overlooks the strip and the Bellagio fountains, but we were sat right away inside.
The waiter was so friendly and helpful directing us to items that could be made gluten free. I ordered the basic egg breakfast, subbing fruit and tomato for the toast and potatoes. It was good, though it would be hard to screw up eggs and bacon. My mom ordered the Eggs Benedict and said it was good, but nothing outstanding.
I think HEXX would have been more memorable if we were able to eat some of the other menu items, but due to the need for gluten free, our options were limited and therefore for the price, it was just average.

We LOVE HEXX. We came here by accident two days after we got married for a trade show we had to attend. They had us at potatoes. Literally the most insane roasted, fried, carb perfection you will ever meet. Couple that with the bottomless mimosas and here we are, on our one year wedding anniversary for the same conference- and we are loving the food, people watching and SERVICE. Sean was so kind, accommodating and flexible when we wanted to relocate to avoid the sun. He is the perfect example of HEXX service. The hostesses were also so friendly and the text message alert when your table is ready is so easy. This place rocks and we will be back for many years to come.

Average Bloody Mary. The whole menu is very overpriced. The chilaquilies were almost inedible. We didn't get the regular red chilaquilies sauce, instead it we had mushy chips rolled in a "green chili" that had an after bite that was very tart. Mona mi agabi is 15 feet away and 10x better

2.5 review, If it wasnt for the groupon to lessen the blow of our disappointment I would have rounded down to a 2 star review.
Our experienced started with being "greeted" by an unfriendly front desk host.  She wasnt rude but definitely did not put off a welcoming or friendly vibe....  as the host its your job to atleast crack a smile.
I ordered the chicken and waffles... The chicken was a big disappointment.  It had an odd texture and taste and dry in the inside.  It tasted like it was either some pre-breaded cafeteria style chicken or maybe even some generic shake and bake chicken.
I didnt mind the cheddar waffle, i think that worked except some of the bites with the apple gave off an odd apple taste.  I think it was from the apple skin that they may have left on.
I think the chicken and waffles from Grand Lux destroys this and they cost nearly half as much.
My wife had a steak and it lacked the rich beef flavor of what a quality steak would have.  She said she would prefer a cheapy sirloin steak from Sizzler over what she ate.

Mediocre experience... Waited about 30 mins for our food. that's about the average longer waiting time but it felt like forever. When the food came, my friends and I were really excited to eat. One of my friends ordered the veggie pizza and the other ordered the blt chicken sandwich. I ordered the hexx burger. all three of us had the same concensus: food was not flavorful. We had to ask for extra sauce to give it flavor... The price for average food was pretty expensive... Our dishes average to be about 18/dish. Probably won't come back here again. Bad first impression. One thing I wanted to mention was, they had this really yummy sauce called yum yum sauce. It turned out it was a simple mixture of Mayo and sirracha lol who knew such an odd combination could make such a good sauce.

Went here for a recovery brunch with friends on early Sunday afternoon. We had reservations and was seated immediately, but didn't seem that crowded (probably because it was already 1:30pm). Great food and atmosphere, I'd definitely recommend coming here for some recovery brunch. Make sure to make recommendations to avoid a long wait! 

FOOD
I ordered the chicken & waffles and omg you really do get what you pay for. Two HUGE pieces of fried chicken placed on top of a fluffy waffles, what more could you ask for???? The breading of the chicken was flavored just right and the chicken itself was juicy and tender. The waffle was soft on the inside and crispy on the outside. Ugh my mouth is salivating just reminiscing about it. 

DRINKS
We ordered 1 Purple Haze drink, which comes in a huge pourable & shareable jar. If we weren't so hungover, each of us would've gotten one. Great drink if you love berries. 

SERVICE
Service was on the fence. Our server was amazing, gracious, and engaging (totally regret not getting her name), but the food & drinks took way too long to come out. IDK if it just seemed longer because we were hungover, but still it was a long time. Plus it was around 1:30pm so I'd assume the brunch rush would be over. 

Overall, we probably won't visit this place again because of the service, but if we don't find anything else, we'd come here.

The New York is 100% what I was looking for.
They cooked crispy out side for me. So it became easy to cut and so delicious.
Great rail seating for people watching and enjoying the summer weather as the Bellagio fountain puts on a show.

24 hour restaurant located inside the Paris Casino on the Strip.

We came here for brunch on a Friday. I would recommend making a reservation because it was packed. The restaurant offers patio seating but it is first come first serve. The patio overlooks the strip.

The restaurant offers bottomless mimosas everyday for under $25 a person. The waitstaff never let our glasses get empty. 

The menu had lunch and brunch options. It was reasonably priced for the strip.

The inside of the restaurant had a DJ playing. He was playing everything from 70s to Britney. Our group loved it.

The waitstaff was super friendly and gave our large group excellent service. This is my new brunch bottomless mimosa strip spot.

Came here twice for dinner this year. We loved the food! The waiter and waitress are really nice! I bought coupon for Travelzoo . It was easy to use. We will definitely come back again even there's no coupon!

Very underwhelming. Fruit, sausage and strawberry jam were the part of our breakfast. Fruit appetizer took 20 min to come out. Omelette was overcooked and needed ketchup to eat. Chilaquilles were over done.  Eggs were not runny at all. Pancakes were ok but nothing you couldn't make from premix batter. Chicken sausages were good. Server was friendly but a little slow. Waited 10-15 min to eat outside on a Tues with a lot of empty tables. Hostesses were not friendly at all. I would not reccomend at all. Over rated by a lot
amazing! love it all  the lighting is beautiful and the food was delicious ...i tried the risotto, ahi tuna, a salad and of course a glass of red wine...just perfect !

Great location, great service and the food was good but I feel it was a bit overpriced.  Despite the pricing it was a great evening and the service definitely made up for the premium you pay on the food.  Filet mignon was perfect exactly as ordered, salad was good, calamari and the s'mores dessert was underwhelming.  With so many options on the strip, unfortunately I would skip this one

Went in today for brunch at 8:30 AM, and unfortunately did not have the greatest service. It wasn't busy at all when we arrived. I was with my entire family and we were served by Tracee. I am usually pretty understanding because I use to work in restaurants and it's tough when the kitchen gets slammed with orders all at once. However, my dad asked for ketchup, and she never brought it. Understandable, because there maybe was a lot going on. But, I asked for a to-go box twice. It took us about 30 minutes just for us to get the check, pay, receive the to-go box, and leave. And it wasn't busy at all. I was just disappointed based on all the great reviews from this place. It seemed like every body else was getting great service, as they were enjoying their bottomless mimosas. I'm not sure if it's because we didn't order drinks that we weren't as well taken care of, but I was extremely disappointed. We never were rude about anything, and I just hope that this isn't how service usually is for families that aren't buying drinks. Idk what the case was, but I just didn't feel as if my family was as respected as guests as other people. I'm not sure what it was, but it was just disappointing. Just because we aren't ones to complain doesn't mean we are okay with the lack of urgency with service. I don't plan on ever coming back, not that it's a big deal to their restaurant. But just be cautious if you notice you aren't being as well taken care of. I should've said something and put my foot down because I was extremely disappointed with our server even if I really tried giving her the benefit of the doubt.

This is a refreshing restaurant in the hustle of the strip. Wonderful, friendly staff. Loved the overall ambiance of the place. We had two entrees and wine, but the starters and sides looked really good as well. We ordered the halibut and the salmon. Both were flavorful, beautifully plated, and each had a unique take from your average plates. Will definitely keep this in the line up on my next trip to Vegas.

Nice decor inside and good outdoor seating overlooking the strip. Started with the meatball small plate and I did not particularly like the meatball or sauce but the polenta underneath was really tasty. Had the mushroom pasta and it was quite good! Giving it a three due to the inconsistency and the relatively slow service given how empty it was that night.

Great service and amazing food. Sean was our server and he was incredible. Fast and efficient and attentive without being pushy. It was a busy time during brunch and he made my friend and I feel so welcomed and not rushed at all. I really never saw the bottom of my bottomless mimosa.

My hubby and I ate here yesterday for breakfast and Jody was our server. She was so attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. Which was a big help, since my husband never knows what he wants to order. She did make some drink suggestions but it was too early for us to have a cocktail. Not once did we have to ask for a refill on our waters. We left very full and satisfied customers and will be back to see her again!
We loved going on the chocolate tour but there is such high pressure salesmanship that you can't just relax and enjoy the chocolate experience.
Andrew, tracee was amazing!!! Best server in vegas!! Loved the bottomless mimosas! & best service!! My girl!!!

It smells like shit everywhere, like everywhere! It's loud full of drunk people obviously. 

The food was mediocre , nothing special at all. What saved the 2 stars was the super nice waitress . Would only come back for a drink and to have a chat with her. 

Thank you for the birthday dessert :)

So it was 2:30am and we wanted something to eat my 19 year old and I. My son wanted to try this place so I said why not. Wow so happy we did. I would definitely go back. This late they have small plates he got the Prime Rib Pierogi and I got the prosciutto flatbread. The pierogi is 4 pierogi's served with a horseradish sauce. The flatbread Had smoked provolone and arugula. I also go the Modern Sangria. Everything was so good my son took the first bit and he just grind and you can tell he was in another place. I let him taste my flatbread and he took a whole slice. It's great size to share. Both were full of flavor. The flatbread was crunchy and that prosciutto and the smoke cheese was perfect together to balance the fat in the prosciutto. Sangria was citrusy and wonderful. I would go again for breakfast.

We went here for breakfast, food was excellent. We went with a Groupon though and to be honest, I find this place incredibly overpriced. 1 coffee is $5 and if you leave the strip you could find the same quality food if not better for half the price. Service was prompt and friendly. All in all it was a good experience but I probably wouldn't go back without a Groupon.
The food at this place is pretty good, but I believe they use a cheap alcohol for the bottomless mimosas, We had them and Got sick for two days
Thank you to our bartender Sheena! We had a great time! Loved the lobster rolls and the loaded Bloody Mary

Food was amazing. I also had the bottomless Mimosas and I will tell you my drink was NEVER empty. Shawn and Shannon gave the BEST service. I was so impressed. We were sitting in the bar area and I was expecting to having to have to hunt someone down but not at all. Shawn and Shannon was on it. They both was taking turns seeing about us. I'm so impressed. My hubby and I will definitely be back. Thank you Shawn and Shannon!!
Bad service takes forever food was pretty good but bad service. Makes us wait 20 minutes to get change back.

Made a reservation and were seated promptly upon arrival. Service after that was horrible-our waitress didn't check on us once after someone else brought our food out. We should have walked out. The prices were super steep, the food was bland (mediocre at best). Seems as if you only get good service when you order a bottomless drink at brunch. There are many other decent places on the strip to dine. Skip this one.
Went here twice during the conference this week due to location.  The bar happy hour offers good choices. The food is good, but the service is horrible. Long wait, so be prepared to be patient.
Amazing food, Highly recommend the Halibut and the NY strip!! Service was fantastic! Thanks Sal and Jan!

Amazeballs. 5 stars all around. Incredible service, great food, very attentive staff. Went for a birthday dinner and we decided to go balls to the walls an order tons of drinks and a ton of food to split. We started with the Mystic Berries Potion which comes in a pitcher and gets all bubbly (see video). It came highly recommended and it was incredible. We asked for recommendations on an appetizer since we were still deciding on food, and our server Jessica recommended the crab cakes. They were beyond amazing, so we decided to try a couple more apps. We ordered the overcooked bacon and baked cheese. Both were incredible, great flavor fusion and overall very impressive. I think the baked cheese was my favorite of the three.

We finally made some moves towards actually picking dinner items an wanted to get another pitcher of drinks. We ended up with another drink (cant remember the name) and it wasn't as  good as the first drink, but still good none the less. We decided to split the roasted tomato bisque, tagliatelle bolognese and the chicken an waffles. The soup was delicious, lots of great flavor, the pasta was amazing and the chicken and waffles were to die for. They were served with apple butter and burbon maple syrup, which together made for a melt in your mouth combo that made me sad  that i was so full and couldn't finish it. I will definitely be back because we were so full we couldn't even order dessert! 

Portion sizes were perfect, huge and great for sharing. They're open 24/7 so thats a huge plus. I can't say enough about how amazing our service was. Our server made great recommendations and  the staff was always coming by to clear the table and give us new settings an were extremely on top of their game the whole night. 

We had a table on the patio so we had views of the fountains at Bellagio, and the restaurant itself was absolutely beautiful. Well done and a great night!

11/11/16 - time 10:13am, server JP - 
What a fun restaurant! Brunch was wonderful - chicken and waffles are must and bottomless mimosas - yes please.  JP was our server and he was awesome! He was upbeat and kept up with our table of 4 even though it was busy. Our food was wonderful and JP kept our glasses full at all times. I would suggest checking this place out for brunch or any time of the day. Thank you again and I will be back next time I'm in Vegas!

The atmosphere is beautiful and the views are beautiful. Great decor and a excellent setting for brunch. However, the food was just okay. Got the carrot cake pancakes and side of eggs. Based on the ratings and amount of reviews--I was expecting so much more. The carrot cake pancakes were dry and bland--I had to add so much syrup just to make them taste good. Eggs were way over cooked and bland too. The place wasn't that busy and service was slow. Overall, I would only return for coffee and pastry because the atmosphere along the Strip and view is beautiful but won't order the meals ever again.
Ask for Josh and Shawn! They were extremely attentive and made sure I was satisfied! Ask fit them and they will not  disappoint !
Fabulous outdoor venue, perfect for people watching in the cool desert morning with a Farmers Bloody Mary and eggs Benedict. Excellent service was expected and received.
Sean (the new guy) was the BEST! He made us love everything about our experience here. Hexx Benedict's was definitely the best I've ever had!!
Talk about a great dinner! This place was awesome. Not only was the dinner and service superb there is a chocolate shop next door to satisfy that sweet tooth!!

Came here with HIGH expectations, but the food was mediocre and so was the service. Such a disappointment!! The server took about half hour to bring our food out - She was super sweet, but the food timing was way off. They had a limited late night menu. When the food came - everything was dry! Ordered the lobster roll (the bun was stale) and the turkey club - the bacon was burnt. Maybe it would have been better if we tried it during the day. The food from the late night menu - felt like leftovers.

We ordered 4x Wagyu, the most expensive steak on the menu and the chef just could not get it right. Even the rare was mostly well done. Also at the table next to us  the guy got a rib eye 2x and left the 2nd after one bite. If you are looking for an overpriced place where you don't want to go back to the Hexx is the place to be.
I will be coming back for hat banana cream pie, over and over. Their signature chocolate is great, but a little too bitter for me. I wish they had a sweeter chocolate. overall still great!
The food and drinks were awesome. I would def recommend the tomatoes bruatta. Our server during happy hour, Joe, was the best. Definitely request him if you can!

I love this place!!! Jody was amazing!!! She really took care of us! And made us feel at home! THANK YOU JODY FOR MAKING OUR DAY EXTRA SPECIAL!!!!! My mom loves you by the way!!! The food was so good and full of flavor. I ordered the chilaquiles and it was bomb!!!!

Sean has taken great care of us! He was very attentive and gave us great suggestions on everything. We were celebrating a birthday and he made sure that we had everything we needed and more i highly recommend it! great service will definitely come back !

This review is long overdue. Me and my wife wind up in Vegas last year for Christmas. This was a very last minute plan as our original plan got canceled. It was December 24th, we didn't have any reservations for any other restaurants. Surprisingly they were able to seat us in almost immediately. 

Service was excellent. The prime rib took the jewel crown here. It cut through like butter, melts in your mouth, perfectly seasoned and salted. Just amazing. Probably the best prime rib I've ever had. We also tried their truffle fries which was fantastic as well. This restaurant is priced very well considering the food!

We appreciate the good service. It's a nice restaurant with a great ambiance. Go here if you haven't. I have no bad things to say. Thanks guys. Will be back on my next Vegas visit.

My husband and I had brunch there this morning. Food and service were on point. Our server was Sean, he was very attentive and he had a great sense of humor! Ivan helped him out a bit and he was cool, too!
Terrific breakfast and fab service by Sean. Will definitely return. Lovely start to our day. Thanks niece Cat for the recommendation. It's a winner.
Great place to stop and get a drink while walking the strip. Shade, water, beer and alcohol.
The service, food, and vibe are so great! i was waiting for over 30 minutes on a slow friday, but it was all worth it! The prime rib was my fav & the chocolate cheesecake!

Love, love, love this place. We have eaten here twice and every time we became the menu is updated so I've always tried something new. Never been disappointed, the way that the spices and food hits your palate is amazing. You have to try this place.

Hexx is open 24 hours! My group used a groupon

Tasty menu offerings,¬† definitely pricey.¬† The¬† $50 Groupon will have you reaching in your pocket for more¬† money.
Waitstaff were like zombies,¬† almost every request had to be made twice. 
Request a patio seat and reservations are a must! If you enter from inside the Paris Hotel,¬† it's confusing where the hostess stand is located a sign or two hostesses are necessary

This place didn't impress me at all. I ordered Chilaquiles and what they bring me was a mountain  of chips, with very little salsa, pretty dry. The pork meat was pretty tasty. I had to order another side of salsa to make it a lil better . Service is super slow. We seat there for at list 10 minutes before anybody came and offer us water. After we order the water,it take forever to get to my table . I probably won't come back cs I know  other places with way better food and fast service. Like China poblano for example. Eggs Benedict were blah! Better order them in room service at the cosmopolitan hotel

Honestly I really really wanted to love this place and it did start out great but it slowly went downhill. I probably should have read some of the signs when we first arrived. We went to brunch probably around 9 so we were definitely ahead of the usual brunch crowd yet there was a line out front to see the hostess table. I truly didn't understand why because I saw maybe 8 tables with people. Once I got closer I saw that there were 2 woman at the hostess table and one of them wasn't doing a thing. The one would walk others to their table and this woman would just stand there staring off into space without even acknowledging the next person. It was also strange that everyone before me got seated which was at most 3 tables and I was told it would be a 15 minute wait. Wait for what exactly? I see tons of tables open. 

Of course I went with the eggs benedict for brunch. It's pretty much a no brainer that I order that if it's offered. It was by far one of the best eggs benny's I've ever had. It wasn't served on your traditional English muffin, it was served over scalloped potatoes. They were so cheesy and delicious I was sad when I cleared my plate. Full transparency that dish is the only reason I'm even giving this place a 2 star rating. I had also ordered a Bloody Mary with my meal which didn't come till after my food arrived and after I asked about it. Usually not a huge deal for me but given all the other service issues it was just annoying in this case. 

So why the 1 star rating without the eggs benedict factored into the equation you ask? Because the service continued to go down hill and just disappoint me. Both my friend and I are huge yelpers and we take a lot of time to write reviews, check in, post photos, etc. We both checked in and asked about the free dessert offer. Even though we had already clearly communicated at the start of the meal that we wanted separate checks we were told it was 1 per table. Had I been someone who rarely even goes on yelp I probably wouldn't have cared but I put a lot of hours into yelp. We are the girls that write not just bad but awesome reviews as well. So I think it was pretty stupid to tell us we had to pick who gets a dessert or share. We are the people getting the word out for you. Sure it may not be great in this case but if you ran a better establishment it could have been a free advertisement for you essentially. And to clarify this review is by no means my way of getting back at them for it either. 

By the time I got my dessert we had already asked our waiter for our separate checks 2 times at this point. After the 2nd ask he finally brought a check. One combined check. So we had to ask yet again for a separate check. It was honestly irritating that I even had to ask in the first place. No one should ever assume people are paying together. You should always ask if it's together or separate. I don't care what is more convenient for you. I've worked with food before and I always asked the customer before ringing it up. When the "separate" checks arrived it was really just 1 slip with it separated out. So we had to then tell him which card was who's so he could charge our cards correctly.

Honestly no one should have had to deal with the crap we dealt with at this restaurant. While the dish was amazing I don't think I could deal with the service simply to eat it again.

Dinner there was fantastic! The cocktails were a sight... They are made with dry ice so they actually smoke! A must try is the broccolini I! We loved it so much we ordered a second plate!!! Chelsea was an amazing server and very attentive. The desserts and the chocolate sampling were delicious as well. Will definitely go back next time we are in town.

Had chicken and waffles, the carrot cake pancakes and a side of bacon. We got the Groupon and went for breakfast -  ended up being around $25/person but that's not bad for Vegas prices considering it's on the Strip. It was pretty quiet when we went for breakfast around 9:30AM, the waiter was nice & attentive.  I really liked the decor, very sleek and modern. Would recommend if you're getting the Groupon! The portion sizes didn't look huge but they are - we had leftovers for our flight back home!
We went for brunch and it was such great food and atmosphere that we came back later that weekend for dessert and drinks. All their chocolate is made in house and it's delicious!

Really great experience both with our service and with the quality of the food. We ordered the Chilaquiles, the meat lover omelet and the bottomless Mimosas. I wish we had pictures but we devoured our meals before we could (our bad!) Sean and Bobby really took care of us and made our meal memorable. Drinks were never empty and they had lots of recommendations for things to do on the strip. They even treated us to a sample of the Hexx Chocolate- made in house and was sooo good. Can't wait to come back and experience the dinner menu.

What a great stop for brunch in an already fantastic weekend in Vegas for a concert! My friend and I were happily greeted by our waitress, Tracee, and waited upon by Jordan as well. Besides enjoying their wonderful company and personalities, we ate our fill of a veggie omelet with fruit and meat omelet with excellent potatoes. The bottomless mimosas were great as well and worth the $23. Don't be surprised if it takes a little time to get your food and drinks: they're busy for a reason! If you're in Vegas for brunch HIGHLY recommend Hexx and ask for Tracee and Jordan!
Had an amazing time at HEXX, with great friends. Sean was the best server, and we could not have been happier with the service. Great birthday celebration!! Cake pops are wonderful!
Went to Hexx for my friends Bachelorette party. Sean was an awesome server. Sooo nice and attentive. He went above and beyond!! Patrick was a great server assistant too.

Homemade spicy vodka in a Bloody Mary was the best! Ordered traditional Eggs Benedict, a Gravlax Benedict was but they said they can easily make traditional. It was very plain. Very little ham and not much sauce which was bland. They did offer another breakfast though which I declined so they took 50% off of the meal. Don't order off the menu.

Brunch at Hexx Bar was fabulous. Tracee, our server, made it so incredible. She was a delight to have serving us and I would come back simply to be served by her again. She was a blast and made the atmosphere amazing.

This is my favorite spot whenever I hit Las Vegas. Exceptional dishes and service is always good. Sean is AMAZING. He was attentive and patient with our questions. He made an effort to check on us and accommodate our complicated orders. Awesome Awesome Awesome service thanks to Sean!

came here around 4:00 and made it for their happy hour special. sat at the bar.  I will the say the service was a little spotty.  We ordered a cheese platter that came after our meal because i think they forgot to put the order in.  i also order scallops that were delicious!  The carrots that are part of the dish were absolutely fantastic!  we also ordered the pepperoni pizza which was good too. I think i would have originally given this a 3 star review based off service, but the food was just fantastic that it deserved another star.

HEXX was absolutely amazing. My wife, brother and I were tired of waking the strip and chose an eatery at random without really looking at the menu and were pleasantly surprised. We enjoyed everything we ate: shrimp scampi (which they made into an entree for myself), the wedge salad, veal, spinach and artichoke dip, cheesy garlic bread, pita and hummus, and brussel sprouts. Our waitress was also nice and always made sure we were happy with our experience. Would recommend business casual as I felt a LITTLE out of place with jeans and a t-shirt, but they will still seat you. All-in-all, when we go back to Vegas, we will certainly be eating there again. My only regret, knowing how good their apps, sides, and entrees were, we missed the desert!
Good music, great food, terrific service. I recommend the beautiful and friendly Dominique! Best service I've had on LVB. You can't go wrong, ask for her by name..
Melissa was awesome! She gave the best service, was so sweet, and made our last brunch in Vegas super memorable. Get the colossal bloody mary!
Excellent brunch, bottomless mimosas (our server always seemed ready to pour before we ever got close to the bottom), wonderful service, pretty patio seating.

Hexx has the best chocolate in the US.  It's also a sweet cafe in the most ideal of locations with a tremendous food & beverage program.  recommended highly for lunch.  my favorite was the Carbonara, but also very much enjoyed a bite of my friend's pizza as well as the surf & turf sliders.  been here before for salads, also well prepared, crisp and balanced.  i like taking in the strip with a glass of cold white wine when i'm here.

Came here with friends. They had already eaten but I hadn't. I ordered the pepperoni pizza. It was really good, but just dripping in grease. When I sat down I ordered a drink (nothing special just prosecco) and it took a long time before I got it. My friend ordered carrot cake and didn't get it for 20 minutes. I was already done with my pizza at that point. If it weren't for the snail paced service at times I would have given this place 4 stars. There were many great options on the menu.

Little bit of a wait even on a Wednesday but worth it. I had the carrot cake pancakes which were delicious! My friend had the French toast with a side of potatoes which were also delicious. The potatoes were so sweet and crispy. The atmosphere was open and we sat on the patio. The bottomless mimosas were 23 dollars though, a little high for me. Would definitely come back.

Go here if you want to sit outside and see the Bellagio Fountains, AND if you want to spend a lot of money on a mediocre meal. The service was so-so -- it was very busy when we were there, and I expect it is always busy because of the proximity to the Bellagio fountain.  We had a decent table inside, and the servers were whizzing by us, hurrying to tables with meals as if their marching orders were to turn tables over as quickly as possible. We started with martinis, $16 each and not even close to a full martini glass. Remove the pick and 3 giant olives, and the alcohol level drops significantly. We asked whether they serve bread basket or similar, and server said she could bring garlic bread for a price. I can't remember if it was $3 or $5, but whatever, it was too much. You know how old bread can be really fine crumbly, almost powdery when bitten?  It was that. Two small pieces of room temperature garlic bread served on a small plate that really should have been free. My husband then ordered the Jambalaya for $28, which was very good and a surprisingly large portion (much more than we expected). Beware, it is extremely spicy!  There is no accompaniment, no crackers or bread to tame the spice, unless you order the terrible garlic bread as a side. 

I ordered the Sea Bass with Couscous for $38. It was prepared well, but was a very tiny portion of fish on a very tiny spoonful of couscous. I'm not one to want large dinner portions, but this looked slightly larger than what I would expect as an appetizer dish. 

Our impression of the Hexx is that it is all about making as much money as possible as quickly as possible. People want to watch the Bellagio fountains while dining, and that's the draw. Once inside, patrons are rushed through a very expensive meal so the table can be cleared for the next diners and the next, and so on.
Great place for unlimited mimosas on a Friday ! Great food and great service, plus the artwork is pretty cool too.

One star based on my experience with the hostess. I'm in town for business, traveling alone. When I requested a table for one she immediately looked at me as if I wasn't worth her time. Before even telling me how long the wait would be she immediately told me to just sit at the bar (which was full, thanks, not my first rodeo). I then asked how long it would be for a table and she rolled her eyes and said ten minutes. 
Thanks for the warm welcome. There are sooooo many food choices in this town, Hexx Kitchen is no longer one of them.

The service here is garbage.. Couldn't take our food and drink orders at the same time.. Ridiculous. The food was subpar, burger was so greasy it was barely edible and my friends steak looked like it had half a stick of butter on it. Bad experience overall

Very slow service and we always had to flag all different waiters down to order drinks, food, get bill, etc. The food was very average. I was very disappointed and will probably not be back. There are a lot more restaurants in vegas to choose from with better service and better food.
Amazing meal - full of flavor and excellent service.  Ten minute wait which was negligible - will certainly be back
AWESOME! Food, professional friendly service! Happy Hour is happiness! A great time! My family and I eat there two days in a row. Our servers Ray & Gustavo were as AWESOME as the food!

This past weekend my friends and I decided to try out Hexx Kitchen + Bar. The inside was what really drew us in, the restaurant was so cute and they had these little sections on the side that consisted of booth/lounge seating with pillows and curtains around the area that gave the illusion of a private eating, which made us excited to sit back and enjoy the bottomless mimosas we were about to order. As we waited for a server to help us out we were being missed due to the area not being in sight. We asked the host/bar a few times for help, but no-one seemed to come and take our order. The server Sean noticed us and how we had not been attended to, he took on our table and turned our experience completely upside down! The food was amazing and our mimosas were always filled, but what made the overall expierence even better, was the service provided by Sean and the help of Patrick. Sean was very welcoming, honest, friendly, and likable. We were in such awe of how great his customer service was, we believed he was too over qualified for the job but he was that good! If you decide to eat here the food is tasteful, but Sean's service is was made the dining an exceptional one!

Stopped by for a quick bite in the hot Vegas afternoon.  We had the cocktail of the day and a couple of appetizers.  Both the dishes were excellent.  The cocktails were on the sweeter side but refreshing in the afternoon heat.  Definitely recommend.

I'm very on the fence about this place and have to give it a 3.5/5 for now. The view is amazing and the service was good. But we tried two dishes and while one was awesome, the other was not. 

Loaded Fries - Start with great Fries (nice crunch on the outside, flavorful and soft on the inside) and topped with cheese curds, gravy and "BBQ pork". While the pork was tender and had been pulled, there was nothing BBQ about it - no sauce, seasoning or smoke that I could taste. But that's ok, because the gravy was nicely done. Also, the cheese curds had completely melted and turned into gooey goodness! All in all, we loved this dish!

Blondie Sundae - This was the major fail for me. To start with, as far as I know, a Blondie is meant to have the same thick and chewy texture that a brownie has. This did not. This tasted spongy and fake as if it came from one of those awful just add water box mixes. Second, the menu said that it would be topped with Oreo ice cream. But what arrived was boring vanilla. When I asked about it, the waiter seemed to not know and guessed they must have run out. Fail! 

At this point I am willing to give this place another shot. But I would probably stick to the appetizers and avoid the desserts.
Great location, service is decent. Pizza was wayyyy salty. Not too many options for dinner.

Had brunch here on our first full day in Vegas and no one was disappointed.  This place is located at the base of the Paris Hotel.  There are indoor and outdoor seating options and the overall atmosphere here is upscale.  Service on our visit was top notch and our waitress was very accommodating and willing to give suggestions to anyone in the group who had questions or alterations to the items they chose to get.  They have bottomless mimosa options as well during their breakfast/brunch service.  Food portions and quality were incredible and my eggs came served just the way I ordered them accompanied with some of the most incredible bacon I've ever had.  A must visit if you're looking for a decent breakfast place while on the strip.

Great stop for lunch.  Our server Sean was outstanding and kept our water glass full.  We sat inside but had a great view of the street.  We enjoyed the Hexx burger with the White Chocolate bun was awesome.  Sean provided us with a sample of Hexx chocolate and the Hexx Chocolate Store was next door with delightful employees that were very knowledgeable concerning Chocolate.  Sean made our lunch stop a very nice experience.

Had an amazing brunch. The corn beef hash was to-die-for! The vegetable omelette was perfect. Had fresh vegetable and the salted just right. We ended the meal with the carrot cake pancakes, which was delightful. Plus, you cant beat the location which was right on the Strip. Definitely a must. Which they had a branch in California.

I LOVED HEXX! The location is directly on the Strip, almost underneath the Eiffel Tower. It has a large wrap around patio where you can see the Bellagio fountains go off! Prices are reasonable- bottomless mimosas for $23 and most food in the $15-$25 range. Food portions are MASSIVE- worth splitting with a friend. This is a perfect place for people watching and filling up your stomachs before a long day of Vegas!

I recently came here on a Saturday around noon for their weekend brunch. We had a group of about 6 girls and had no problem making a reservation and being seated quickly. We sat inside which had a huge seating area and was full of sunshine. One downside though is that they don't actually have their own restroom so you have to use the casino ones.

For food I went with the corn beef hash. I enjoyed the flavor of the sweet potatoes, but did wish they were a little bit more crispy. The portion size was more than enough which made the price worth while to me. I also had the bottomless mimosas which were great. They certainly kept it topped off at all times, great service!

Overall I'd recommend this place for a great brunch option on the strip.

Walking around Vegas looking for coffee,wound up at Hexx for coffee at the bar. Decided to have breakfast too....off the chain steak and eggs....Perfectly  cooked to my request, perfectly seasoned. PEETS coffee... fresh English muffin, Potatoes were  delicious....Now gonna be a regular.

My sisters and I stopped in here for a relaxed lunch on a Saturday. Surprisingly, they weren't that busy, which was nice. We sat inside, ordered a few drinks and a few appetizers to share. The drinks were very well mixed, and our food was outstanding, but three stars for the service!

Our waiter was terrible. He clearly looked and acted like he would rather have been anywhere but there; I so wish I remember his name! He brought us a second round of cocktails, at a sloth's pace I might add, and had a very hard time getting back to check on us. Or something. Then we turn around a see a table with a couple of drunk, scantily dressed ladies, and it all made sense! He was laughing and joking with them, while we and a couple of his other tables waited and waited for our bill. Not very impressive for a nice restaurant, sir. 

The food and drinks, and overall atmosphere, definitely held our attention though, so I would definitely go back next time I'm in Vegas.
The food was delicious. Time of service was fast. This is the best service we've had in Vegas thanks to Sean and Charles. Definitely will be back on our next trip.

This is a pretty cool place open 24/7 in the Paris hotel. While staying for an extended time in Las Vegas, it became surprisingly difficult to eat some where nice super late. This place filled that need. The food wasn't memorable and I believe I ordered crab cakes but the drinks . Omg. They were large pitchers filled with dry ice and smoked like a cauldron. So cool and obviously why I chose this place. In Vegas you will pay for a novelty so the drinks alone were close to $100 I believe, but hey when in Rome, right?

This review is looooong overdue but very necessary! My boyfriend and I were in town for Easter weekend and decided to stop into Hexx for lunch and mimosas. We had passed this place walking up and down the strip but decided to stop in on this day (day after Easter). Our server was Sean (he said he was fairly new). He was very kind and informative and was always wearing a smile. Our food came out in a timely fashion and everything was absolutely delicious!! Sean and the gentleman assisting him were always on top of things like questions, drink refills and plate clearing. We had gotten a bottle of champagne that was actually being retired so Sean had us sign it, along with himself, and showed us where they would store it so we could come find it next time we were in town. They have a whole display of signed bottles! Pretty cool experience. We will definitely be back! Thanks again Sean!

HEXX BENEDICT are a must!   The potatoes and sauce on that plate are absolutely amazing. 

My bf got the protein omelet and it was a great plate for someone who wants some eggs, potatoes, English bread (butter and jam provided) 

They offer bottomless mimosas for $23.

I ordered the Bloody Mary but wasn't a huge fan. 

Customer service 10/10, as soon as the drinks got close to finishing, they would refill. 

Wait time wasn't too bad (20 min)

Today I tried the brioche French toast and it was lovely. My wife loved her Benedict, she has had many in her lifetime, and considers this as her favorite. My only complaint is the chicken sausage, it was the best I ever had, but sausage would be the way to go. I would definitely return to this restaurant.
LOVED this place. Service was great and so was the food. They also had bottomless mimosas during Sunday brunch and a great DJ! Definitely will be going back!

4.5 Stars - The best meal of our trip.  We had steak and eggs.  Both of our the steaks were cooked perfectly.  I asked for medium and it was exactly what I asked for.  It was juicy and tender.  The service was excellent too.  May I say they play great music too.  Highly recommended.

Stayed at Paris and walked right on out to Hexx. Waited all of 5 mins and the host thanked us for waiting. Sat down and was greeted by Rafa. Rafa was the man. He was everything you want in a server and more. Great recommendations and was always there when our mimosa was gone. Food was amazing as well! Rafa 6 out of 5 stars! Thank you!

I had the lobster roll for lunch - - probably the worst lobster roll I've ever had...nothing in it seemed fresh.  My colleagues made several comments on how underwhelming my lobster roll looked.  The restaurant was very loud, making it difficult to have a conversation with colleagues.  My colleagues were overall pleased with the dishes they received (so I didn't give 1 star).  Staff were not very attentive.  My drink sat empty for more than 75% of the time while we were at our table.

We had a fabulous breakfast!  The ambience is beautiful and the service impeccable!  Julia was so personable and fabulous in informing us about all the specialties Hexx has to offer!  We will be back before we leave!

No pics but that's because the food was demolished.  Great service (shout out to Sean, amazing waiter, super knowledgeable and gave spot -on recommendations to a party of very picky eaters).

Visited during a recent spring break trip to Vegas with family and friends.  Party of three, we were seated and served in a timely fashion.  

We ordered the carrot cake pancakes (please believe the hype and get them.  Amazing recipe, not sickeningly sweet, spiced appropriately, shredded carrots in the batter), the cinaroll waffle (which was also great but my party preferred the pancakes) and the turkey club.

Go if only for the carrot cake pancakes.  But if you go, I don't think you'll regret it.

Delightful patio bar across from the Bellagio Fountains 
We sat outside and enjoyed the street activity
Fun vibe 
Great specialty cocktails / beverages 
The food was good and beautifully presented though a little pricey for what it was 
Definite option if you want to eat on the strip

This is probably my favorite restaurant on the LasVegas strip out of what we were able to visit on our LasVegas vacation. Ideally located right in front of Bellagio and in Paris hotel. It was fun to have mimosa and brunch while watching all the people go by on the strip. The food was excellent. We had red velvet cake as desert which was awesome. I wish to go back again and try other dishes.

The Good: The actual restaurant is beautiful, big, and located at a great spot on the strip. There was a busser there who was very friendly and tried to be as helpful as he could. We actually tipped him separately for trying to make it work.

The Bad: SLOW. Yes, it's busy but they were altogether forgetting some of our drink and food items. We were here for a bachelorette party so, of course, we're trying to really have fun and enjoy ourselves. Nobody wants to get annoyed or upset on vacation, but I swear places like this take advantage of that vacation mood. Eventually we had to start pointing out "why hasn't she gotten her cappuccino yet?", "why has everyone had their food for at least 10 mintues and she hasn't?" "This is supposed to be bottomless mimosas we've been waiting for a refill". Then people started hustling, bringing the forgotten items, apologizing and taking things off the check. It shouldn't have to be like that. Wish I could say the food was amazing and made up for everything but it was normal breakfast food. Nothing knocked our socks off.

Service here is horrible .. came here with my Bride Team out of a group of 7.. 1 person just laid her head down cause she had a headache and a manager came to our table and told us that SHE CANT LAY her head down and be sleeping in this restaurant .. really don't judge a book by its cover .. SHE wasn't even sleeping to be at it .. REALLY!! .. your restaurant isn't even upscale like that.. and plus I think worrying about one person putting their head down is ridiculous.. THEY SHOULD WORRY ABOUT their POOR Food is service which  is extremely slow .. they just been serving water water water like fuck the water ... WHERE IS THE FOOD!

Nice place. Great view of Bellagio fountains. My husband and I split a pepperoni pizza- it tasted great but was a bit expensive. Expected for a view of The Strip. 

Side note: we came around 11pm on Friday night and the music from Chateau was really loud and distracting.

Awsome menu, and amazing service. Definitely a place to hit up if you are a foodie. Love their Johnny cakes, love their pork rinds, loved their candy bacon, and most of all loved their bottom mimosas.If you are lucky enough to get Tolu as your waiter, your breakfast and/or brunch will be as rememberable as possible.

Went for brunch while on a trip in Vegas. Our server was very sweet and accommodating. The view of the strip is amazing and we were very happy with our seat outside. The food was pretty good! Eggs Benedict was delicious but portion was small. The speciality drinks we got were huge!! & fun but didn't taste that great and not really worth the money. Nice experience tho!

Awesome new menu, the place has gotten super classy! The service is amazing, the cocktails were exciting and really good. A great place to have a fancy dinner, appetizers and drinks, or late night food after partying. Go check this place out!

This place is great for patio seating and people watching, the fountains are right across the street so it is nice to sit outside and people watch. 
Fun tip make sure to pick a shaded area if you get hot or burn easily, once seated they will not move you to a different seat. 
We ordered cocktails and desserts, both were just ok. No show stoppers. 
The staff is very nice. To use the restroom you do have to leave the resturant and walk into the Paris hotel which is not far but is a little confusing.

My friends decided to sleep in, so I went out solo to wander and explore the strip on a Sunday morning.  Hexx had a table for me without a wait - right on the sidewalk.  (It was Mother's Day and was packed, but they still had a table for me right away.)  The waiter was attentive, but not too attentive.  They had something on the menu that looked, um, interesting - "Lox and Chive Waffles".  I wasn't sure about the idea of lox without a bagel, but the waiter assured me that the waffle wasn't sweet, but had chives in it.  So I tried it.  The lox and other toppings (hard boiled eggs, onion, sour cream, cucumber, etc.) came separate on the side of the waffles and you assemble the way you like.  It was fabulous!  I would definitely go back!

After reading other people's reviews, I was convinced to come here because many people talked about the good view of the Bellagio fountains. This wasn't REALLY the case. Even though I sat in the patio outdoors, the fountains were still on the other side of the street and blocked by trees. You can really only hear the loudest blasts of water.

In any case, the food here is pretty good! In my group, we ordered the spinach artichoke dip (comes with pita and chips), salads, jambalaya (very spicy), a burger, and I ordered the pappardelle. Good service as well.

Walk out into the main part of Paris' casinos to get to the bathroom!

There were two people who knew what they were doing at this trendy resto in Vegas on our recent visit. The lady behind the reservation computer and the bartender. Everything else was chaos. More than half of the tables were empty yet they claimed a 45 min wait for brunch on a Saturday. We said find and ordered a cocktail to enjoy during our wait. We were actually seated very quickly but in a table in the connecting space between the two outside seating areas that was very windy and cold. We took the table and placed our order but after freezing for a few minutes asked to be moved to one of the empty tables either further in or out but not in the wind tunnel in between. Again we were told nothing was available,. Seriously at this time there was no line and more than half the tables were empty. We let them know to cancel our order and walked out. Clueless would be a complement here. Aside from the nice view of the fountains at Bellagio across the street I can think of no reason to go here. We walked to Mon Ami Gabi 100 yards across the entrance to Paris Paris and had such a lovely meal and great service that we returned 3 more times there during this trip. Don't waste your time or money here at Hexx.

5 am and hungry, where to go? Not many options at that time. I wanted pizza but the place closed at 4 am. I coulda gotten a sandwich, but I had that earlier in the day. I wander over to the Paris hotel and after playing one hand of blackjack (yes! 21!) I asked the cashier what is there to eat. She said Hexx. 

Now because it was so early in the morning, there weren't many people in there. Sat at the bar so I could watch sports highlights. Bartender was friendly and let me look over the menu at my leisure. I ordered the Hot Mess. A mess of fries, pork, eggs, and gravy. It took a long while before my food appeared. Like a really long time. Or it seemed really long. Because I was famished and tired, I ate some but not even half. It was salty. Told the bartender and he offered to get it remade. But I was too tired to care. Paid my bill and went on my way.

Great service for salty food. What else could I ask for at 5 am?
Omgosh! i fell I'm love with the dark chocolate and milk chocolate pecan paws.  I usually have a caramel iced coffee with turbo shot and the passion fruit green tea is good as well.
Great food, i love their jambalaya.. i ate the whole thing! Waitress is very friendly and my water is always topped!

Beautiful restaurant with good service, accommodating and friendly staff with delicious food. 
We enjoyed our time there in the positive atmosphere with our grate Waitresses Julia and Taylor.  
They are the best, make sure you ask for Julia when you go there. She knows all the food and she makes good recommendations.

We came here for brunch and were so glad we did! Perfect location looking at the Bellagio and the seating outside was great! Our meals - turkey club and omelette were one of the better meals we had during our stay. The prices are very reasonable as well! $45 for 2 is a steal in Vegas!! Wish we knew about this place sooner!

Technically we ate there while they were in transition. We had dinner on Feb 26th the day before they truly became Hexx. Since there no longer was a giant Goblet to try, my  girls and I opted for the Mega Martini. Loved it! We had the berry mojito and it's a sight to see..! Also, a creeper. Before we knew it, we were leaning. The equivalent of 10 shots is in that drink... Loved it! All of us ordered different things and the food was great. We sat next to the iron fence and had an amazing view of the Bellagio and the fountain. The only downside is people, cool and not-so-cool, kept stopping us to ask what we were eating and how it was. Lots of flirting going on too. Can't be mad at that! I loved eating there, and we'll probably go again when we head back in May. Gotta say something about Josh, who made us an impromptu cocktail that night. Eat here!

This is my new favorite breakfast place in Vegas!  Every single item on their menu is absolutely delicious! 

I'm still working on trying them all, but I definitely have some favorites picked out already.  You can't visit without trying their carrot cake pancakes.  A close second is their cinnamon roll waffles.  If you have less of a sweet tooth, their breakfast pizza is made with a really delicious dough, and it is really filling.

This, hands down, beats any buffet in town.  You'll spend less and will still leave completely stuffed.  

I already can't wait to go back again.

On a side note, I didn't try their bloody mary, but we saw one at a neighboring table.  It was the most impressive looking bloody mary I've ever seen.

Outstanding location, service and menu.  We really appreciated Sean and his attention to us and he made our experience delightful!  The food was delicious and the wine selection lovely!  Only place in Vegas that felt like a vacation and treat!  You should take in the decadent chocolate they make!

Came here with my bestie and we shared a margherita pizza because we weren't that hungry. The pizza was so yummy and the service was good as well. The restaurant is really nice too, and perfect for groups!
Went to Hexx for appetizers and drinks.  We had the meat and cheese tray.  It was a ton of food.  Everything was great!  Would definitely go back!

Sean and Patrick was amazing , it was great service !! They are amazing ! First time to Vegas , made me
Feel like I was at home!!! Great great service

This place was recommended by a friend. The ambience was very nice and relaxing. It is right off the Las Vegas strip inside the Paris Hotel. The brunch menu had lots of options. I had the chicken and waffle with blueberries. The chicken was good, not dry at all. To quench the thirst I had the unlimited mimosas. The waitress was great on not letting my glass get empty. For dessert I had the peanut butter cheesecake which was ok. I should have gotten the red velvet cake. Overall this restaurant is nice and recommend this place

My wife and I were looking for a place to eat breakfast with outdoor seating and found Hexx kitchen. I had the Colossal Bloody Mary which was one of the best Bloody Marys I've ever had. I also ordered the all meat omelet which was good as well but with the mere size of the Colossal the omelet was overkill. The outside patio was very nice with view of the strip.

The ambiance is very welcoming and classy. The food was spectacular, we came here for brunch for my friends birthday. The corn beef hash was so delicious and fulfilling. The Bottomless mimosas are life here. Thank you for the amazing service Cece , im happy my glass was always full  I recommend this place , im definitely making this a destination every visit

Brittany was amazing!!! We showed up last minute from a work event with 19 people and they immediately got us a table! Mimosas and food were all out on the table for everyone within an hour. Brittany was super calm, sweet, and attentive to every single one of us. The entire staff was super accommodating, esp Andrew with bussing and helping Brittany clean! HEXX ROCKS!

All I can say is OUTSTANDING!!!! This place has a great d√©cor and beautiful view of the Bellagio water show across the street. The food excellent and presented beautifully.  I also loved the drinks.   I love the fact they used wine bottles on the grates for the ceiling.  If you decide to have a nice dinner this is the place and if you just want a quick drink and/or appetizer before a show then this is the spot as well.
Hubbies burger he says was good. My ribeye steak was amazing. Whomever was cooking at this time hit the nail on the head.  This was our third time there on are third Halloween
Tracee (of TreErik) - and of course Erik - were amazing. They are the servers of the stars! A+++++ rating for this dynamite duo!!

Casually upscale restaurant with nice outdoor seating perfect for ppl watching. Portions are pretty small so I wouldn't come super hungry, but flavors were pretty good. They also have a decent wine listing with a variety of options.
Slooooooooow service. Waited at least 15min for someone to greet me at the bar. My meal was okay but nothing to write home about.
Food was delicious. Drinks were super fun if your into that stuff with all the smokey dry ice (I am!). Nice outdoor seating off the boulevard. I'd definitely come back here on my next visit.

A casual vibe with sophisticated food makes Hexx a must-try on your trip to Vegas.  Breakfast, brunch, lunch, dinner, and tapas will not disappoint.
Staff and management will focus on you and your requests.  Great food
and attentive service make HEXX my favorite!
Sean was extremely professional and attentive. He provided excellent customer service during our visit. He always came around I never saw the bottom of my mimosa glass.

Came for brunch one morning in Vegas. This place would have gotten 5 stars but our server was an asshole. Nice beer selection and a lot of fun mixed drinks. Expensive but pretty typical for overpriced Vegas strip. Husband and I shared the pulled pork hash. It was good. Not incredible but pretty good.

I honestly can't remember what I ate, not the restaurants fault (I was too drunk to remember something in Vegas, I'm sure it happens pretty often.) I do remember, however that I was very excited to have eaten there after the fact. I believe I was able to eat both at this restaurant and at Mon Ami Gabi (Both apart of the Paris Hotel).  I will go back again just to jog my memory.
Came for some sangrias and the service was horrendous. We waited SO LONG to even get menus! You can go somewhere else for good drinks and BETTER SERVICE.

This place is the best. Came in at 3am after a show and they didn't miss a beat. The loaded fries were the best. Our server, Paul, was great. Awesome service and really helpful. I'll definitely be back here next time I'm in Vegas
Sub par food, REALLY slow service. Everything we ordered was way too salty, as well as overcooked.

Great spot.   Brunch was delicious.   Moderately priced for Vegas.   Brought in TVS for March madness and was a fun place to start our day.   Bottomless mimosas were a good deal.   Saw a table with epic bloody marys.
This place was excellent! The service was impeccable and the food was delicious. We ate here twice. I will recommend this place to all of my family and friend.

So I found this place whilst walking along the strip and the smell caught my attention! So glad to have discovered this place and would definitely recommend! 

I came for Saturday brunch and surprisingly the wait wasn't as bad as I had thought. There's a candy store connected to the restaurant that's fun to check out while you wait. Once they texted us that our table was ready, we sat down inside and had a lovely view of the Paris Paris hotel next store. The interior of this place is super cosy! It's super bright and fresh inside and not over the top "fancy". 

Service was a bit slow, but the food was so good that it made up for that! I ended up getting the club sandwich and it hit the spot ! The sandwich itself was huge and it had this almost sweet bread that ended up being the perfect complement to the salty flavours of the sandwich. The fries were also super crispy and good. My friend ordered the eggs Benedict and they were to die for!! The eggs were cooked to perfection and tasted heavenly with that smoked salmon. The side of potatoes were also heavenly. Would've loved to have tried the dinner food here as well! The pizza looked amazing! 

Additionally for brunch time, they have bottomless mimosas here for around 20$ if I remember correctly. They were super good, although after 4, the taste was too much. 

All in all, if you're looking for a good brunch/ dinner place with a big variety of different foods and you wanna try something new, give this place a shot! It can be bit expensive at around 15-25$ /plate but it's on the strip so what do you expect?

I have been wanting to try this place for a while but since I've been traveling so much I haven't really had a chance last time I was in town a couple months ago since I live by coastal but I ended up having a very quick dinner last night amazing scallops dish I was really excited about the creamed corn but I definitely did not like it but they did take it off my bill wasn't a problem and we ordered the lobster and my husband was a little disappointed because it look like a little appetizer lobster he was expecting a real big lobster or something like that and it kind of ruins my husbands impression but we had Chris as our server he was very very nice pricesOr a little bit steep but the quality of food is very nice the Decour and ambience is above and beyond it has a very upscale Hamptons feel you can sit indoor outdoor and it's open 24 hours a day it's absolutely beautiful it to the chairs to the lighting servers were great I had a nice experience and I won't speak for my husband but I definitely enjoyed myself
Food was really good. Our waitress was really cool and fun! My only drawback is the restroom is outside in the hotel and was disgusting

Decided to go to this restaurant coz we were starving and there was no line at the time. We were seated at a table for three and couple minutes later our waitress came and asked us to move to another table at the end of the hallway by the exit which super horrible and freezing. Waitress almost spilled cocktails on my cell. Foods were just plain. Not great. Ceasar salad's super Salty. Go somewhere else if u can. Wouldnt recommend this restaurant to anybody. Never again. To Manager of the restaurant if u are reading plz take this into your account. Thx

In Vegas with the girls and sat off to find breakfast.  Almost walked by this slice of fantastic.   DON'T pass up this gem.... what a great experience and decor was so relaxing.   Sat inside with the patio doors opened, a gentle breeze lightly brushing inside, we immediately got greeted, by who we named the best of the best staff, Rachael!   She was spot on and had us giggling during our incredible meal.    What a pleasure to meet such an enthusiastic person who loves her job which is proven in the service she extended.    We will be back!!
Here for a conference and will be returning daily for brunch!  Yummy!!  May have to look into the bottomless mimosas on the last day :)

Service was lacking a bit. Food was good but nothing to rave about. I looked at the pictures on Yelp prior to comong here. There were so many dishes I was interested in. When my friends and I were looking over the menu I found out from our waiter that the menu frequently changes. I would go back due to the ambience and location mostly. We sat outside on the patio and could see the Bellaggio fountain. Now we did go during breakfast so maybe the lunch or dinner menu is better.

You pretty much pay for location. The food was mediocre for the price. The service was ok. Waiter just seemed to be in a rush and checked on our table once when we were all done. Overall experience here was meh.
Service and most of all the food was great! Compliments to the chef! A must try when in Vegas. My pitcher of passion fruit concoction poured over dry ice was delicious and a site to see.
Went here with a friend for dinner. Patio has great people watching! Service was excellent. I'm obsessed with Jambalaya...theirs was legit! ;-) Cool place, i'd definitely go back.
The carrot cake pancakes and brioche French toast are amazing! They have bottomless mimosas daily until 2p which is always a plus!!!! They quoted us 25 mins and we only waited 15!

Went there for lunch with some friends while we were staying at Paris Hotel. What a great choice! Had the Chinese chicken salad, Margherita pizza, pasta, and spinach artichoke dip. The pasta was a little bland the rest was exceptional. Best salad I've had in a while. But it's not just food that makes a restaurant great...IT'S THE SERVICE. And I have to say the service was also exceptional. I would recommend it and I will be back for sure. Nice job Hexx!!

Really a great experience here!

Came for late lunch/early dinner, so it wasn't too crowded. Got a seat outdoors (which, by the way, is great for watching the Bellagio fountain show, and also for just general people watching-the outdoor seating alone gives this place an edge). 

Ordered the mushroom pizza, which was honestly huge-could have easily been shared, but I was by myself, so what is one to do? Desert was, of course, phenomenal, being that Hexx chocolate shop is right there-I usually say you can't go wrong with chocolate, but that is really true here.

Service was great, from the hostess station to my server, David. Pretty average prices for Vegas. So good food, delicious desert, amazing view, and outstanding service-what more can you ask for?

They should rename this place to "rape" because that is what happens to your wallet when you dine here. Hexx is a crazy name for a Las Vegas strip restaurant anyway so it wouldn't be that much of a stretch. 

You're basically paying to sit mid-strip at an okay restaurant. The quality of the dishes does not measure up to the prices charged. $36 for a basic cocktail with Malibu and pineapple, LOL. 

I tried some of their $25 burger on a white chocolate bun, it was pretty good but not $25 good. Would have rather had In & Out. Their fries are decent. My son had the margherita pizza, it was pretty good. I also tried their pappardelle  pasta, this is where they failed completely. The noodles were so overcooked that they all stuck together in a gelatinous  blob. Too bad because the sauce and mushrooms were pretty good.

The worst part was the hostess at the Paris entrance was immature and rude. Also, they told us we would have a 15-minute wait and it ended up being 45 minutes. Our waitress was okay but it took a while to get a menu and our drinks. 

I was very underwhelmed.
Good Food... mimosas great! Had sticky bun, pep pizza, some fancy burger, humus. Server Ninja Tracy was awesome!

Holy moly.. this is my new favorite restaurant on the strip! Love the ambience. Clean, bright, semi-casual. Sat on the inside but with the doors wide open so we had a good view of the bellagio water fountain show. 

Customer service: amazing!! From the host to our server they were just perfect! I'm very indecisive so I ask a lot of questions and my server was so kind and patient with me. Love it! 

Food: everything was so delicious! 
Rib eye: melts in your mouth. Reasonably priced. Loved the caramelized onions and little peppers that come with it. Perfectly seasoned! 
Caesar salad: I don't know what they put in the dressing but it's unlike any Caesar salad ive ever had. I'm gonna come back just for this salad!! Thin crispy bacon and crunchy croutons. Awesome! 
Prime burger: made with wagyu beef. Best burger I've ever had! So good! 

Hands down my fav place on the strip. 

I'll be back!!
Wonderful food and service! Rib eye is top! Brocolini and mash potato is delicious! Very recommended! Also they are pet friendly and were very nice to my pupps !

Hex, oh dear perhaps I'll start with the reason why I put 4 stars it's for the service which i would give a five star. If it were just the food it self sadly a 3.5 star would be accurate. We got the Cinabon Waffles the Chicken and waffles and hex Egg Benedict. 1out of two satisfied dishes hex Egg Benedict far surpassing the waffles. The Benedict was a delicious surprise where in place of a English muffin as a base there was layers of delicious potato. The chicken and waffles I expected a more moist tasty chicken, not something out of a public school cafeteria kitchen. Honestly it would have been better with mc Donalds chicken nuggets instead of the dried chicken strips that came with it. It was so dry with no taste and a rough texture.
