The waffle it self was nothing impressive just a normal waffle with cheddar coloring to it. The cinabon waffle was okay, if it weren't for the presentation and light cream cheese frosting, the waffle it self would fell epicly. It certainly did taste like a cinabon but it was rough to chew and swallow as well as had a chewy texture that taste like they microwaved the waffle before serving. The Wait staff and atmosphere are very delightful. I hope you are taking care of the staff because there the only reason why I wouldn't by pass the restaurant for a second chance.

Decent atmosphere, middle of the road food, and awful service.

The wife chose this place for breakfast (I wanted to go to Hash House A Go Go) because it has decent reviews. I guess we must have just come at the wrong time. After being seated and very promptly being met by our waitress for our drink order (apple and orange juice), she returned with them, but didn't have enough OJ in the carafe to fill my glass, and said she would return with more after taking our order. After that, we didn't see her again for a while. Our meals were brought by a different person, minus the English muffin we ordered. I ordered a waffle, but was never given any syrup of any sort. The waffle itself was very plain looking, and softer than a waffle of this style should be. We watched countless people (including our waitress who reappeared) walk by helping our surrounding tables, but never once stopping to check on us. We finally had to go get her and request the English muffin, syrup, and orange juice. The wife said her home fries were good, so there was one positive out of this.

One thing to note, the table next to us must have been getting the same service, because they had to stop someone to ask not only where the waitress was, but items they were missing as well. 

I recommend finding another breakfast place if you're in the area. You could probably do much better.

Did Hexx 3 tines in 48 hours so I have a good idea I think. Love anything outdoor in Vegas because the smoke kills me. Did drinks one night. One round for 4 people $75 with tip..About $15 a drink; not abnormal but nothing special either. Did breakfast 2 mornings in a row. First morning was early 830 am. Had omlette that is $14 and you get 2 items.Each additional item is  $1. Coffee is too strong; rot gut. Potatoes were interesting and good. Crispy and hard on outside and cooked potato on inside. One breakfast can be shared. OJ is $6 a glass! View outside nice; great waitress first morning. Terrible service last time. Waiter took an hour the next morning to bring one omlette and oatmeal. Almost missed flight, think I am over it. Inside has nice decor but think it is now a pass. Go to Mon aMi Gabi next door instead for another patio view. The location is great in that you are across from Bellagio water show.

First I wasn't sure what this place really was. The restaurant was renovated and it looks much more elegant now. There are views of the Bellagio fountains through the balcony. This restaurant incorporates it's chocolates in every food item. The service is great and the ambience is modern/classy. 
The food was delicious. I tried the burger made with white chocolate buns. Surprisingly it was delicious! Their alcoholic beverages are fun with dry ice vapor. 
The manager greeted us and asked about our experience. This place is a must go!

Came here for dinner, they are open 24/7. Sat outside and watched Bellagio fountains. Waitress was excellent she gave me their vegetarian menu which had quite a few options! I had a wedge salad and spinach artichoke dip, prices are avg for the tourist areas on the strip. Also they have homemade sodas which was fantastic!!

While my husband was attending a conference, I shopped and stopped here alone to dine. Glad I did. 

I got a Prosecco cocktail and the spicy guacamole for a snack. So tasty! Then I really was craving a cafe affogato which was not on the menu. The waitress had it made for me. It was so good they should add it to the menu! The ice cream was extremely creamy and blended perfectly with the espresso!

Outdoor cafe in Paris.  How can you go wrong.  At breakfast it is still bearable outside (in the shade) and you have a great view.  Coffee was ridiculously strong and my pancakes were excellent.  I really wanted the all you can eat pancakes at Planet Hollywood, but the restaurant flooded out 3 days earlier from a broken pipe.  So the moral is, go to PH for pancakes and if it is not open go to Hex.  PS they added Blueberries to my pancakes for $3 which was reasonable.

The big drinks with the dry ice are probably the only reason I would come back. That and the view you get of the strip when you sit outside. It's great for having a few drinks and people watch. It's also right across the street from the Bellagio fountains so you get a pretty good view of the water show. 

I tried the food once and it was only okay and pretty overpriced. But it's the strip so you can't expect anything there not to be overpriced..

Great brunch spot to people-watch as you sip bottomless mimosas or one of their fully-loaded bloodys! Other highlights:

- The home fries are crispy, delicious bites of red potato heaven. I think they are deep fried?? Not greasy but have that crispy crust like a french fry.
- Protein omelet - perfect remedy food for those long, lavish Las Vegas nights. 
- Score a seat outside to dine under the Eiffel Tower and watch the Bellagio fountains
- Interesting menu items with chocolate accents.

I reside in LV and yesterday was my birthday after a long day at work my lovely husband decided to take me to HEXX for dinner to celebrate. Very nice and yes it was a busy night with a convention in town. We got our table at 8:50pm placed our order at 9:10pm by that time it started dying down a bit. Well at 10:05 my husband and me just look at each other and wonder why the table next to us which is a party of four and get seated 20 min after get their meal. Our waiter, Lupe finally comes and states "let me check if your food is ready" it's 10:15 ish by this time my husband is frustrated, hungry and really disappointed. She came back and said it's going to take another 5 min. At this point after waiting this long, being ignored and had a long day at work and us simply just wanting a decent meal since it was my birthday failed.It really sucks to have your hopes up on a restaurant and have my birthday dinner ruined because the waiter forgot about our table. Extremely disappointed, we left.
Tracee is the best waitress I have had in months. She was more than accommodating and beyond pleasant! Great pizza and salads! Will absolutely be back next time we're in Vegas

Great customer service! The location is right across the street from the Bellagio and is in the middle of the strip. 
The reason I took away a star was because although the food was good, it wasn't great for the price you pay. 

My husband got the spaghetti and meatballs and I had the shrimp fettuccine. Both items were good but it wasn't anything to write home about.

The customer service was phenomenal though!!

In case you didn't know already, this location used to be Sugar Factory. It is however still running along the same concept of Sugar Factory, but instead of candy it looks like its gearing more towards a chocolate theme. The entire restaurant accents brown and white colors, and also has it's own store with candy and chocolates. 

I ordered their signature burger which comes with a white chocolate bun, but its not covered in chocolate, it's a very subtle flavor, however i myself do not like sweet and salty together so i was not very fond of the burger. My friends had a chicken paella, and a grilled cheese sandwich with turkey in the middle. The paella was good, the turkey grilled cheese sandwich was good too but the bread was really hard and difficult to bite. We also got some mac n cheese bites. They were good but the marinara sauce it was served with was cold.
Tracee was amazing and the food was great! If you don't have a reservation the wait can be a little long. Bottomless mimosas for the win

I wish i could give no stars. We were completely ignored!  We felt as if we were invisible! We were seated a little after midnight. Host did not have menus with her. Bus boy brought us water. We saw no one else for twenty minutes. So, we got up and left. Not even seeing a menu. 
Not likely to ever go back.

I am ABSOLUTELY disgusted. My arm looks like this because of the security guards at Paris hotel.
Me and my two best friends went to Hexx for bottomless mimosas. Yes we drank as much as we could and had fun. Yep we got drunk. BUT I swear to GOD we did not get crazy. We asked for a shot after bottomless mimosas were over they told us no. All we did was ask "why?" What did we do? We asked why are we being cut off we're not doing anything crazy and they wouldn't give us reasoning. So we got upset and we're like ???? What did we do to upset everyone? We paid, we tipped VERY well, we weren't being crazy or wild or eccentric. So the cops took Us into holding. I begged to have my handcuffs loosened because it hurt so bad. I tried to tell my friends don't yell at the security guard she's just doing her job, she completely ignored us. So I'm fucking livid. I'm pissed. This is the ABSOLUTE worst restaurant I have ever been to. I called the hotel, called the restaurant -- everyone hangs up. Call police, anyone at all, all hanging up on us. Asking "how do we get her out" no answer. We weren't driving, took an Uber but STILL arrested AFTER paying 130+$ for everything. Held in the holding cell, BEGGED and CRIED to use the bathroom but "could not" until paper work was done. Almost peed my pants for what????????? Because we wanted one more shot?????? Because what???? Who gave them the right????? Yes, we drank. Yes, we got a bit drink and so what??? Opportunity to send us to jail???? We did NOTHING. Swear, we went to the bathroom, remained calm and when we FINISHED paying we were attacked???? We even treated the whole staff amazing, complimented them I just can't believe it. Held our phones, our purses, our belongings. Locked us in the room with seat belts once they found out we were recording. Please don't go here. This place is disgusting.

This comes super late, as my husband and I visited last year. However, this place was so amazing, I just have to give them their much deserved props! Denise helped us twice last year and she was beyond amazing! Yes we went twice, because it was that awesome:) We were impressed by how friendly and attentive she was with all of our requests. Her manager made a few recommendations regarding drinks and we loved all of them! We are visiting the first week of June and we will be asking for Denise again! Really hope shes still here:) See you soon HEXX!!!

We really enjoyed the Hexx kitchen on our recent trip to Vegas. I purchased a Groupon and that helped with the cost - as with most casino restaurants - it's not cheap. We went for brunch and I had made reservations. We arrived early and they were able to seat us immediately. Reservations were probably not necessary that early unless you wanted to sit on the patio. 

We were a party of four and we all ordered different meals. Our young twenty-one year olds ordered a flatbread pizza and the other ordered waffles. My partner ordered the steak and eggs and I had the corned beef hash. All of our meals were excellent and were plenty to leave us feeling satisfied. We even took some of the pizza and steak and potatoes home. The steak was extremely tender and flavorful. The potatoes were cooked and seasoned perfectly. My hash was delicious and my eggs were cooked sunnyside exactly as they should have been - not over or under cooked. 

The girls and I ordered the bottomless Mimosas and they were truly bottomless. Our server was Johnny on the Spot with the refills which our two girls took as a challenge - which the server won lol. 

If we are ever in Vegas again, I will definitely add Hexx to the list of places to revisit!

We had gone for lunch and the food was decent, so after seeing a groupon, decided to try it for dinner. Big thumbs down. I'm really not sure how this place is going to survive charging what they do. We had a glass of wine, a beer, Caesar salad, spinach dip, and a burger and it was $110. Way, way overpriced for slightly upscale bar food. If you can, at least sit outside so you can watch the fountains at the Bellagio.
Checking in for our reservation was easy and got seated right away. Chilaquiles were good. Mimosas were great and our waitress Tracee was even greater! Will definitely be back.

I went there for my birthday treat after work and I expect tea and dessert to be amazing.But we were waiting for tea 20 minutes and for dessert 30 minutes and after all dessert was absolutely nothing.It was too sweet and tiramisu was to watery and over frozen.After all we were waiting to take our card back for another 30 minutes.Complimentary chocolate was good as always.

Great brunch with decent pricing for the strip. Service is on point. Have been here before for dinner Lisa G. Was an amazing server. For brunch we had Andrea and she was so attentive it's hard to find good service these days. I recommend this for local and tourist. Plus you can't beat their view from the patio.

The service was excellent. Our waitress for dinner was very helpful by suggesting some excellent choices. We started with the tomato and burrata, but it would have been better with sliced, toasted regular size pieces of French bread instead of the small crustini crackers and there were too few. We were hesitant to order the grilled crispy broccolini, but it was excellent. Great choice. We ordered the beet salad and a Hexx Burger. Both were very good. I would highly recommend the Hexx burger. It came with some good fends fries. For dessert she recommended the chocolate s'more and panna cotta. Both were very good especially the s'more.

Stayed at Paris Hotel which is connected to HEXX.

Ate dinner one night and had a couple of their Dry Ice drinks. Those were awesome, cool, and tasted great. Had the Jambalaya for dinner. Tasted awesome, lots of spices.

Ate breakfast the next morning there and had the best French toast ever. Wife got the turkey club and she loved it.

I stopped on over Tuesday and had the greatest waitress, Mari Fe. She was very attentive and made my dining experience much better.

I had the chicken and waffles and it was amazing. The chicken was crisp and the waffles were firm and supple. The pricing was expected for a fine dining establishment like hex. I will definetly stop by again.

Best dining view of the Bellagio and the fountain show - they have a great outside dining patio area to people watch with a great view of the strip.

The inside dining area is pretty spacious and can accommodate large parties. Very urban chic - the decor is really sleek and modern. Reservations were easy on opentable and service was friendly and prompt.

Our waiter was personable and made suggestions on appetizers/ main course. We ended up trying the yellow watermelon app - which was interesting - not bad not great - I'd recommend it if you're looking to try new things. It was a refreshing dish, slightly sweet from the watermelon, slightly tangy from the lime juice and the feta cheese. The chili string garnish gave it an interesting herbal kick. Again not my favorite dish of the night but not bad either if you're looking for something new to try.

The tomato soup was delicious - pricey for a small bowl but super good. Creamy consistency but not too heavy. The garlic and basil oil complimented the soup well. Slightly too much basil oil but I spooned some out and it was fine.

For main dishes I tried the tagliatelle bolognese - short rib pasta - portion was good. Flavor was on the lighter side but I guess less salt is healthier lol? The truffle ricotta was delicious and complemented the short rib nicely. The short rib however was under seasoned and could have been more flavorful. Ok dish in my opinion.

The bf got the roasted sea bass - delicious! Just the right amount of seasoning, light but flavorful and grilled perfectly. Slightly crispy on the outside and edges and light/flaky in the center. I didn't care for the couscous drizzled around the fish as the texture was odd but everything else on this dish was great. 

Overall a great place for dinner and a view on the patio. They have a chocolate factory next door where you can see the sweets being made. Service was great, food was good. Prices are on par with what you would expect in vegas - high yes but where is it not?

The food was good and pretty reasonably priced considering you're on the strip with a view of the Bellagio fountains. Our waiter was attentive and very helpful in finding a dish that would work with a long list of food allergies. Will definitely consider eating here on future Vegas getaways.

Had brunch yesterday and it was awesome. Gotta writethis down before my Vegas memories fail me lol.  The wait was not as long as we thought. Anyway we were quickly seated and our waitress Melissa took care of us. She's the best!  From recommending the special cocktails to the best brunch options and sides, she was on par. 

I had the brioche french toast with bananas on top, fiance and 2 others had the corned beef hash, a sandwich, an omelet, and one had the gravlax benedict. The corned beef hash is a little on the small side so I suggest you also get the pulled pork fries. Ohhhh yes.

The brioche french toast was a little dry so I drowned my toast with syrup. The corned beef hash was actually really good but I wish there was more of it. 

The special dry ice cocktail punch bowl thing was also good. We prefer the jungle juice one. Serves 2 if you really wanna get wasted but can easily be shared with 4. Drinks are actually pretty strong (at least the purple one with absolut a√ßai). 

If you come here, gotta ask for Melissa. Kept us entertained and gave really good menu options (the fries were one!!). Definitely will come back when we are in town. Thanks for giving us a good time, Melissa!

My friends and I had dinner on Saturday night. Obviously we are in Vegas and so drinks had been coming in since earlier that day. By the time we reached dinner, we were a bit too happy aka tipsy. My friends were being completely annoying with repeatedly asking the server to turn on and off the outside heater. They were also being loud however the service never seemed to change. We received fantastic and friendly service the entire time! We primarily stopped by for drinks because last time we hit Vegas, we remember the wonderful drinks at Sugarfactory which is now HEXX. The drinks continue to be amazing of course. 

Now, I'm not kidding when I say that HEXX has the BEST broccollini EVER. Please consider in trying! It's soooooo good. 

Towards the end, we were even more annoying by asking to split the bill between a lot of us. There was a bit of confusion from my friends regarding the final amount that at one point they thought we were being overcharged. But at the end of it, we were wrong and I am deeply sorry for the trouble we may have caused and so I hope that sharing my wonderful experience with the fantastic service makes up for our tipsy actions. I appreciate the friendliness by the staff during our entire visit !

Went for Brunch.. it was wonderful! Sat outside.. great weather and scenery! We had Manhattans! EGGS w/bacon, english muffin and fresh strawberry jam.. wow!! Corn beef hash... and the dessert smash! 
You can see the water show at Bellagio.. and watching the people is fun too!

Chose this place based on other reviews. 
Had a wonderful experience!! Great service.. very friendly, attentive, helpful and always present.
Food was amazing! I had the chilaquiles. They are apparently a customer favorite and I am glad I tried them!!  My friend had the ham and cheese croissant sandwich and added scrambled eggs to the sandwich. The croissant was flaky and delicious and the ham was very tasty!
I would definitely return!

Food was okay. Over priced but it's on the strip so i get it. 

Docking a star for the rude front desk women. 

I set a reservation on open table via yelp. 

Went to find out they cancelled the reservation. Um, why? Idk. I set the reservation at 11:30 AM when I was in the hotel at around 9:30 AM. 

Upon arrive to the restaurant, the women were saying that after 15 minutes from making the reservation, they cancel it. 

I don't get it and asked them to explain to me twice. Still didn't make any sense to me. 

I got the chicken and waffle. 
Was pretty good. Server was not attentive. Had to flag down for coffee/water refill. 

Oh, and they add a cnf fee to the receipt. Which I am docking another star for. 

I googled it and read an article saying to think of it as a 'resort fee' but you don't get anything for it. 

So they add a charge for just eating their over priced food. 

Oooookkkaaaay. 
Good to know but won't be back.
Taylor is the best server I've ever had. Very fun, great recommendations and very attentive!! Fantastic food as well. Bobby is the bomb.com as well

Trendy restaurant bar located inside Paris casino. Classy vibe, full bar with creative cocktails, several sangria options served by the glass or pitchers. Great menu with lots of variety, including a tapas menu for the patio area. Sit in large dining room, bar area, bar, or outdoor patio with view of the street for awesome people watching. We ordered from the tapas menu and everything was delicious with a beautiful plate presentation. I would definitely go back for cocktails, date night, brunch or lunch. This place has a little bit of everything.
Good coffee, great hangout. Food is okay at best. Did not get much out of our server. Food was brought out and that was it until the check came.

This place took over the sugar factory so I was quite confused when I got there. My group wanted to get the fish bowls from sugar factory. We weren't going to go in until one of the hostesses outside explained that they just opened and that they also had a fishbowl type drink that uses fresh fruit instead of candy. We decided to give it a try and if you don't want to eat you can go directly to the bar. There were some long tables in that area too so we didn't have anywhere to stand or sit when we first went in. There were some tables alongside the glass wall when you first turn in but we didn't know if we could sit there. No one asked or assisted us so we just sat there. Those two tables were not really in the bar's line of sight so no one came to give us a menu or anything. I ended up walking up to the bar to order drinks. I stood there for a good 5 minutes waiting to be helped while the bartenders just passed me by. I finally flagged one of them down (Apparently they won't come to you unless you actually wave at them). I ordered two big fruit martinis (peach raspberry and mango orange). When they were brought to the table we asked for 2 more straws ( we had 4 people). They never brought them so one of my friends had to go back to the bar to get some. 
The mango orange one was really sweet but I enjoyed the peach raspberry. It had a peach sake/soju cocktail flavor. They had a good amount of alcohol in them too. 
Our bartender came to tell us how much it was and didn't give us a check...just an amount. 
This place just opened so hopefully they'll make some changes.

HEXX is really underrated!  It is seriously good!  It is one of the better restaurants at this price point in Las Vegas.  It is a not just a good, but a great value.  You can usually find a discount to Hexx, and so it is always a good value for Las Vegas.  The view also can't be beat!  You can sit outside if you want, but even from the inside you have a great view of the Bellagio Fountains!!  This time we tried the Cheesy Garlic Bread and it was good, but next time I would try something else.  I had the Filet with Creamed Corn, and I seriously think the Creamed Corn at Hexx is the best I have ever had anywhere!!!  I love it!!  I have also had the Ribeye before, and it was also very good.  The Veal Milanese was huge!!  It was also really, really great.  The Smore's dessert was ok.  I have had the Tiramisu there in the past and that is amazing!  They make it right in front of you with a funky contraption!  So go for the Tiramisu and not the Smore's dessert, you will thank me later.  If you want some really good food with a really good view at a great price go to Hexx.  I try to go there every time I go to Vegas now.  I need to try Brunch next!!

On our last morning in Vegas, we sat outside to enjoy the morning air, and were immediately served by 2 people (one in training, I suppose) Both were wonderfully attentive.  We first made sure that my friend's food allergy (peanuts) could be accommodated (it could) and then we were given coffee and water.  Sadly the coffee was very bitter, it couldn't even be mellowed by with creamer, so when asked if I wanted a refill, I said no. They had no problem replacing the drink with something else at no cost. I adore good service like that. 

With our orders placed, we waited a bit, chatted with our neighbors and finally got to the food. I'd ordered a ham and cheese croissant which came with breakfast potatoes - which were amazing. The croissant was HUGE and stuffed with white cheddar and ham. It was TOO much and luckily they were able to wrap half in foil and I was able to take that for a snack/meal on the plane. 

The Scotsman chose the chocolate banana pancakes and they were smothered in a banana caramel sauce which was to DIE for. Absolutely luscious! He left nothing behind and was a member of the clean plate club. 

If/when I return to Vegas, i'll certainly Visit Hexx again.

Terrific brunch spot. Even though we went on a busy Saturday the wait was short. Open doors with a nice breeze & view of the fountains. We shared chilliquiles & French toast. Both delicious. Good service. Some really tiny two top tables. We ubered to Paris as this is kinda of mid strip location. Would return for sure.

Enjoyed breakfast here during my Vegas trip with a few friends. I ordered the protein omelet which was incredible along with their home fries which is comparable to country potatoes but thicker and crisper potatoes. They tasted great!! Everyone at my table loved their food and raved about coming back here again next trip! Coffee was good too! This setting is elegant but comfortable. Indoor and outdoor seating. Kid friendly.

Came to this place after a long drive. So glad we did!! This is a nice restaurant with cool drinks! The steak with egg on top was delicious. Don't order the poke tuna. It's way too small for $16!!!! Waist of money. The salad wedge was delicious and so was the HUGE Bloody Mary!!!
#need6stars. Tracee killed it. Kept the mimosas full and all around fantastic waitress.

I was here 2 times during my stay and was not disappointed. I had the chilaquiles the first day and they were amazing! They were crunchy and spicy just how they are supposed to be! The next day I had the brioche French toast, super yummy!! I just wish they served the chocolate pancakes in weekends too because I really wanted to try them!
Fantastic place for brunch! Bottomless mimosas and great food. We had Tracee for our server and she rocked. Make sure to ask for her! So helpful and funny and always made sure our drinks were full!

We had a really good Saturday brunch here! I had a HUGE chicken tortilla egg thing (can't remember the name) - two can split was reasonably priced & bottomless mimosas for $20 on top. They have a handful of Bloody Mary's to pick from too. 

Drinks were kept full and food was flavorful - big portions too. They are attached to a chocolate shop - some of the best chocolate I've ever had and smelled amazing in the lobby!

The staff here are dressed nicely and are somewhat quick. The area in which the restaurant is in is nice and has a great view. There is usually a line out the door but the wait is fairly short. Sometime the waiters/waitresses forget to bring you things. Maybe it's because it's busy or maybe it's because they're forget, I don't know but the food is very good. Especially the chilaquilas!

Disappointing...High prices and ok food make this a hard sell.

We stopped here for a late night meal after catching a show. 

The atmosphere is like that of a club with loud club music, but not loud enough you can't have a conversation. The decoration, white and beige, is very modern and appealing.

Service was slow, and the server, while nice enough, want really friendly or welcoming.

The items seemed pricy for their descriptions and I opted to just have a snack, ordering the pretzels. They were good, with a mustard-cheese sauce that went great with them. You get three of them for $6, and they were basic pretzels. My wife had the bolognese, and it was a bit odd-tasting. Not really bad, but unlike any bolognese I've had in the past, in a disappointing way. Uppon requesting parmesan for the bolognese, the server referred us to a small cup of white powder that had been dropped off on our table sometime before without any comment.

My wife was in the mood for an Apple pie and she was pleasantly surprised. My dessert, the mille crepe cake, was just ok. The chocolate and berry sauce were good, but there wasn't enough for the portion.

Redeemed our Groupon for the Wine & Cheese deal before dinner. It comes with a bottle of wine instead of glasses... totally unexpected and appreciated. Our server Kevin (aka "Chocolate Thunder") was great and fun to chat with. We sat out on the patio next to the railing and people watched (and got a little contact high--J/K---you will occasionally smell it though). Overall great experience!

Do. Not. Get. The. Tiramisu. At least if you do order it, don't put the amaretto sauce on it or else it ends up a mushy river of sauce. All I was craving was some dessert and a nice piece of tiramisu sounded amazing, but this tiramisu was truly horrible. I give 2 stars because the service was nice and the "fried mozzarella" was yummy. We were just so disappointed that all we could do was laugh at the money we wasted on the worst tiramisu I've ever had. This is not classic tiramisu at all, this is another Vegas restaurant overcharging in attempts to be different. You're better off walking down to Cheesecake Factory for a nice dessert.

Simply amazing. Front start to finish. Endless mimosa were great, I personally had six and I'm feeling great. Orders spinach dip (SOOOOO GOOD) and turkey club ( also soooo good). Had JJ as my server (be sure to ask for him, he's literally the best). Overall, if you looking for great good, drinks, and atmosphere COME HERE ???

Enjoyed dinner and brunch at this location. Service was impeccable.  My only complaint was that a couple of our dishes were a bit bland (halibut itself had minimal flavor but sauce made up for it; chilaquiles we ordered for brunch were average).  However, the hummus we ordered as an appetizer was AMAZING. The pita bread was fresh and warm. The hummus itself, white bean, was perfect!  As the waitress said, "we made hummus sexy".  100% agree.  A must try.  Dessert was a pumpkin br√ªl√©e and as I described it, Thanksgiving in a ramekin. I literally felt like I was home eating all the home cooked-deliciousness of my grandmothers pumpkin pie. Bottomless mimosas for brunch were a nice add.  Definitely will stay on my list of places to eat in Vegas.

Although I still miss the Sugar Factory (the menu was better as far as I am concerned); this is still one of my 'go-to' restaurants when in Vegas. You can not beat the great view of the fountains (and the people watching - just wait for a patio table, it is worth it). Highly suggest this for brunch, but a late night bite is also great (their charcuterie plate is top notch). 
The ambience inside is also pretty good, but they could turn the music down a little so you can actually have conversations at your table without having to almost yell at each other. 
This time around there was a true shining star, which is why I am finally writing a review for this spot... Raphael. ASK FOR HIM; you will not be sorry! What an AWESOME waiter; fun, friendly, jovial, prompt, quality-driven and all-around just good at his job.

The pros: great location for people watching, friendly enough staff, best breakfast potatoes EVER

The cons: the music was INSANELY loud both inside and outside. It was ridiculous. The eggs and omelettes were flat and tasteless. My server and his bussers spent their time dancing to the music, rather than attending to tableS.

This was a very disappointing experience, to say the least.

In one word, PHENOMENAL! We were served by Teddy who was very kind and funny. He gave us  the ideal Vegas dining experience. Very fast service & food came out fast. We had the pork rinds as an appetizer, then the spaghetti & meatballs and the short rib plates. The short rib was nice and tender atop fluffy & tasty mashed potatoes and the spaghetti was a nice portion. I was appreciative of the reasonably priced Prosecco on the menu. I really liked the chocolate fortune and the view is great for people watching and taking in the Vegas vibes. Will recommend to everyone back home!
Stopped here for dinner and drinks one night. Our meals weren't spectacular and the drinks were of course, overpriced. Not bad but not great. Great location in the middle of the strip.

My experience here was wonderful. Our server Tracee was great! She recommend us the chilaquiles and it was delicious. And she was very friendly and helpful, good dance moves too. I enjoyed the restaurant thank you for the service Tracee!

La terrazza sulla strip vale il prezzo della cena, peraltro buona! Personale simpatico ed accogliente. Il filetto mignon √® buono ed i contorni sono assolutamente all'altezza. Prezzi non proprio popolari ma ci stanno visto che, tra l'altro si gode un'ottima vista sugli spettacoli d'acqua delle fontane del Bellagio.

I was very intimidated to go in since it was very empty on saturday night,so i was very surprised of how good it was.
Crab cakes omg just delicious 
Cesar salad tipical nothing espectacular about it but good
The sea bass absolutly delicious licked the plate
Great service,nice atmosphere,the only reason i do not go higher  is because the music is really loud besides that i recommended a lot will come back again

I haven't been to Hexx in like 4 months and I come back and I forgot how amazing the food is and how amazing the service is! Sean made sure we were always happy and had everything we needed! He was my server once before and I've always had a great experience with him! I will definitely be going back soon!

Stopped by Hexx kitchen and bar for breakfast. It is located in the middle of the strip and seemed like a good option as it was busy. We were seated right away outside when we arrived. Our waiter was very friendly and gave us refills often. I had the vegetarian omelette and it wasn't the best. It was certainly overdone and missing the fluff that most have. My husband did enjoy his selection however and shared his with me. I probably wouldn't come here again because it is over priced for what you get (what isn't overpriced on the strip though?).

We dined at Hexx, before a show, at Paris. We had the dinner/show package, so they only offer you two-three choices of an appetizer and entree. Very limiting. The other choices, came with surcharges. The place is decorated nicely, with indoor and outdoor space. The staff is dressed in blue jeans and a denim top. Toni was our server. Very friendly and explained the menu adequately. It took a very long time to have our empty dishes removed and get our check, which made the experience more annoying. The food was good, but not what I expected. I ordered the salmon, which was a tad overcooked. It also comes on top of soup (yep, weird) and has a salad on top of that. The salad falls into the soup, which is weird. Not a wise presentation in my book.

Do not have breakfast here. Have it at your Hotel. Not worth the trip
Thea almost $ 5:00 Brrrrrr for hot water.
Good food at Hexx make sure you go check it out inside of Paris las vegas next to chateau nightclub !

OK I might be biased because I came here off of a Foodie Tour (do it!) and we had an exclusive experience. We were ushered in like royalty into the back kitchen where they proceeded to show us the entire process of how they make chocolate! We got to ask questions and film everything and taste the differences. It was incredible! Then were were escorted out to their balcony outside which is under the Eiffel Tower with a view of the Bellagio Fountains to try a few AMAZING desserts. 

We had the chef bring out the following:

E S P R E SS O TO R T E
tanzania chocolate, espresso foam, cookie crumble
C H O CO L AT E P U D D I N G
tanzania chocolate, cocoa nib infused cream, banana bread crumble

There was one fore that i'm forgetting... but i don't think you can go wrong!

Had breakfast here on 9/1/2015. We were seated immediately. The food was excellent and the service perfect. The view on Las Vegas Boulevard was very nice. I could not have asked for a more tasty and enjoyable meal.

Happy hour was on our minds,  so we stepped into the bar and enjoyed the good food and drink.   Started with blueberry rickey cocktails which were refreshing and effervescent.  $7 so a good deal and worth it!   Appetizers and pizza are 20% off during happy hour.  We shared a crab cake and a pizza margherita, and both were well made.  

Nice ambiance and good service, so recommend coming here for happy hour.

Came here for breakfast on my own... to be honest I wasn't expecting much. But... I was greeted with hands down the best waitress I have ever had. Taylor is the best! She was super positive and attentive despite the crowds. The food was also great it's hard to make noteworthy breakfast potatoes but this place certainly does it right!
Food and drink is good. Great service n Its right in front of the strip at paris hotel and casino.

OMG BEST LAS VEGAS EXPERIENCE!!!! Naomi and Steven walked me through the menu so I understood the concept perfectly! The recommendations was exactly what I was looking for. Thanking the manager Christian for the wonderful experience was the cherry on top ! What an amazing team. I will definitely be back!!

Excellent breakfast at the heart of the strip! I had the eggs Benedict, which came over scalloped potatoes instead of English muffin and was really nice!  And hubby and I split the surf and turf sliders...Really yum. Bottomless mimosas are available until like 2pm but we stuck with coffee. Doesn't hurt that Paris is a great casino and under the total rewards program.

Tracee is the bomb. She kept our mimosas comin and like Oprah one for you, one for you, one for you.  All 6 of us got the bottomless mimosas! Also, the food was sooooo good. French toast has a magic ingredient and the potatoes..... mmmmmm!
Bar menu hasn't changed for years, same boring items but they carry good cocktail menu.

We really enjoyed having lunch at Hexx. The chicken and waffles were amazing. Chicken was lightly breaded and the waffles golden brown perfect. The wait staff were very attentive and helped guiding us through the menu. Even had no problem taking pics of our party. All in all a great experience. We are looking forward to heading back to Hexx this September.

I had a great experience in Hexx. The unlimited mimosas were amazing. Our waitress Jan was very attentive and hospitable. The food was great. The Hexx burger was amazing. My friends had the chilaquiles and the veggie burger. They were both very satisfied with their food. We all highly recommended Hexx and if you come ask for Jan. She's the best waitress, our mimosas glasses were always full!

Great food and great service! Our host Flor was amazing. A really sweet lady who really made us feel welcome. Her service along with the food really made our experience. Our server allexia was also more than exceptional. I highly recommend coming to this place and if you have a chance request them !
Good food, horrible services. Ordered an app, salad and dinner, all came in same time. Asked for the the manager and complained. Nothing was offered for inconvenience. Will never return.

I went here twice while in Vegas. Both times the customer service was great! The first time I went for lunch and had the sausage pizza. I wasn't really feeling the sausage, but the crust was great. The crust is usually how I judge a pizza cause it's my favorite part. :) The next occasion I went as part of a package for a bachelorette party dinner. We had 8 people in our group. My friends loved the salad! I had the burger and fries and the burger was good, but the fries were just okay. Atmosphere itself is great. They also have outdoor dining area and on those hot summer days a mist that gently spays you (not good for the hair though) :) I would return here the next time I come to town.

Came here for brunch while in Vegas for my friend's 21st birthday. Food was amazing -- one of my friends and I got the Hexx Benedict while my other two friends got the Veggie Omelet, and bottomless mimosas all around. Music was on point; my friends and I were jamming out the entire time! 

Huge shoutout to Tracee and Patrick for making our brunch experience amazing!! Tracee was super fun, never let our mimosas go empty, and brought out a cake for my friend! 10/10 would come back again

My friend and I bought a Groupon deal, $30 for $50 worth of food, and it was well worth it! I was immediately impressed by the classy ambiance of HEXX kitchen. My friend and I came for dinner and the view of the Belagio fountains and glowing lights made it a wonderful place to celebrate the end of the quarter. We started off with the Chipotle Guacamole, ordered the Jambalaya for our main course, and then finished with an Aztec Chocolate cake. The food was excellent, but my only critique is that he Jambalaya was a bit spicy and could have had more flavor. Overall, it was a wonderful experience!

Huge portions and Excellent Food
We have been to Hexx multiple times, due to there amazing breakfast/Brunch menu. The first time I went I ordered the Chilaquiles not knowing what I was going to get they bring out this massive plate of chips and cheese and eggs, it was so amazing I knew it was not the small portion. 

The second time we went I ordered a break sandwich and it was also very large and amazing. So much flavor and very great portion sizes for the value you get.

Very cool atmosphere with the restaurant sitting right on the Strip at Paris. The fancy goblet type drinks are tasty but pricey. Even for the Strip. Our server was friendly and attentive as well. For an appetizer we got the Meats and Cheeses plate which was nice. The grilled country bread was fresh and very tasty. 

The Pan Seared Salmon was very nice. It was cooked expertly and the nice lemon vinaigrette complimented it nicely. The mushrooms and peas in it were good, I wasn't wild about black quinoa though. 

We also tried the pizza which was just meh. Nothing to write home about. I wouldn't order that again but I wouldn't definitely try Hexx again.

AMAZING BREAKFAST MENU!!!! It was an awesome experience and we had a great server named Sean. Very quick service and Sean was on top of it! Got our meal quick and had a great time. The food tasted great and we will definitely be back because of the service!

Great food and great service! Sean was awesome!
We had the chilaquiles, carrot pancakes,  French toast and bottomless mimosas!  All delicious!

Our first experience here was for lunch and it was good so we returned for breakfast. Service was very slow which I can attribute to the fact that the restaurant was busier. They pride themselves on serving Peet's coffee which is great but do need to do a better job of brewing it. As a coffee lover, I was disappointed by the strongly bitter coffee, which I had to add more cream to just to dilute the bitterness.

Had a date night last Saturday the 25th.It started a bit rocky with our first stop at Paris Cafe(awful). Didn't order anything so we left.  We then walked over what I thought was still Sugar restaurant. Turns out it was replaced with a new restaurant called Hexx. They renovated the inside nicely. We were seated outside by the patio area. At night, we had a nice view of the Bellagio fountains.  Our waiter, Chris was excellent. Attentive,not slow and knowledgeable. The food was superb. The sangrias was a awesome.My company was the best.

I always like to come to this place with me and my girlfriends but on the May 1 2016 I went in and say on the patio .TRACEE was my waitress and she was so nice and upbeat ...I'm all about positive energy and she joke with us and came and checked on us frequently something that I had not experience any other time I been there she even got me to try the dessert  that she personally said was delish! Honestly the next time I got in their which will be soon because I love the margherita pizza here I hope TRACEE is there !!! I hope I spelled her name right and if she reads this  Hiiiiii TRACEE !! Thanks for the good time and fast service

We happened to be walking past this amazing place on our recent trip to Vegas. Needless to say I'm happy we decided to come in. Brunch was fantastic! If the rest of their menu is anything like what we experienced then you can't go wrong.

We stopped in for lunch and had a great time! Food was delicious! The burger was cooked a perfect medium and fries super yummy. Our server, Sean, was excellent! He was super attentive and made sure we were taken care of. Overall excellent ... 5 stars and will definitely go back again.

Loved the patio. I come here for business every July, and I didn't feel weird at a patio table for one. Pizza was good. Pear naked lady drink was yummy. Sean was nice, attentive though not overbearing, and efficient.

Pretty pricey, but overall pretty good food and views. It's right across the street from the bellagio so it's a great view of the water show.

I got the short rib with mashed potatoes and Brussels sprouts $30. The short rib was really tender and the Brussels sprouts had a great coating of flavor!

We also got the magik dragon hex potion, which again was very pricey but yolo when in Vegas. Decently strong and not as sweet as I thought it would be, which was good! Plus they give you a huge piece of dragon fruit to eat which I love!

Hexx was next door to our hotel and we decided to try breakfast here one morning we were up early.  As soon as we walked up to the restaurant, I could smell a strong paint/varnish smell.  I noticed they were getting ready to open Beer Park on the roof and it looked like someone was working on the area.  We got a seat inside and I hoped the varnish smell would subside.  I ordered orange juice because I saw it was served in a carafe and assumed it was fresh squeezed.  I should have asked because it tasted like it came from a carton at the grocery store.  Unfortunately, the varnish smell started making me queasy and we left before eating.

We tried Hexx again another evening for dinner, and this time the varnish smell was gone.  We were seated at a table farthest from the windows.  It still had a great view of the Bellagio fountains just across the street.  I ordered the spinach artichoke dip as an appetizer.  It's served in a mini skillet with tortilla chips and pita bread.  It was creamy and did not disappoint.  It was HOT though, and I burned my tongue - so maybe let it cool a minute before you dig in.  We also ordered one of their signature Hexx potions on the special drink menu that appeared to have smoke or mist coming from it.  We had to ask about it though, because $36 seemed pretty steep.  We learned it was actually a pitcher and not a single serving (you cannot tell from the photo) and we ordered the purple haze pitcher, which was a berry flavored drink.  The server brought out the pitcher and another cup and then proceeded to pour the contents of the cup into the pitcher and it immediately began smoking.  We figured there must be dry ice in the bottom.  We were given two straws and told to go to town!  The drink fizzed for a long time, at least 10 minutes!  It was tasty but not super strong, alcohol-wise.

My bf wasn't very hungry, so I was the only one who ended up ordering an entree.  I chose the Pappardelle, which was described as a pasta with wild mushroom, baby spinach, portabella cream and parmesan.  It was an average pasta dish and not very flavorful.  As a lover of all things pasta, I ate only about half and did not take the rest home.  I wouldn't order it again, either.  We skipped dessert and left once we'd finished our drink.  Service was satisfactory and nothing to complain about.  We did not get any chocolate with our check as another reviewer mentioned!  Tip:  If you have a Total Rewards card, they give 20% off the check!

Had a Groupon for $50 worth of food that I paid $30 for. Made a reservation and was seated immediately after arriving on a busy Saturday morning. Our waitress was quick and we had no issues. The food was amazing! I had the HEXX Benedict (no asparagus) and my husband had the fresh eggs (scrambled with bacon.) Both our dishes tasted amazing. Would highly recommend this place as a breakfast spot!
Great coffee and the pizza is delish!

The location is across the road from the Bellagio fountains but you can't see them completely or hear the music. Sitting outside is quieter than inside but it's relative. Outside has street and car and motorcycle noise. Inside the music is on too loud and the chatter echoes. The food I thought was fine. Burgers were good. Crab cake was good. Caesar salad was ok. Servers were nice. If it was quieter and at night, I'd go back.

Went for dinner and sat outside with view of the Bellagio fountains, the heaters kept us plenty warm.  The food was incredible. Everything we ordered was so full of great flavors and perfectly cooked. The halibut with the tomato risotto and curry broth was insane. My friend ordered the short rib which looked like something from the Flintstones and was incredibly tender.   I would totally go again

First time to Hex Great place for a Sunday lunch. They only have the brunch menu on weekends. But still lots of options. No kid options. But that didn't matter. A lot of us tried different things. Chicken and waffles was not as good as Yardbird inside the Venetian. But the cheeseburger, cheese pizza, and club sandwich was really good. No nickeling diming for refills on drinks. Service was good. Not your typical strip eatery. Not cheap. But nothing is anymore in Vegas. Looking forward to going back.

The brunch here was quite delicious! We were looking for a classy low key spot on the Vegas strip and this place hit the spot. We had the hash and it was absolutely delicious take on a fairly common recipe.

While in town we were looking for a fun but delicious brunch spot (preferably with mimosas). We were not disappointed by our choice Hexx! First the food was top notch and the mimosas were great. But what really stood out was the service! Sean and his assistant Myrna were TOP NOTCH, sweet, accommodating and genuinely fun to be around! I cannot rave enough about these two rockstars!

So there we were , sitting at our lovely table when Julia  (the server) walked up and asked "how we were". Let me tell you ! Julia was the highlight of our day . She made us feel welcome and she even listened to our fabulous stories. She was so sweet and excited to serve us . She made our experience great we forsure will be back.
Sean was our server and he was the best!! He made my girlfriends bachelorette brunch so special!

Tracee and CeCe are the best servers ever ! They were so attentive and sweet, on our last day the best choice was to come to hexx and have them as our servers ! When I come back to Vegas they will the first people I visit!!
10 out of 10 recommend the potato balls. ask for tracee and get the unlimited mimosas. u will not be disappointed. give tracee a big hug for me

Bottomless mimosas for $23 with brunch. I had the colossal Bloody Mary which looked awesome. The mix could use a little more spice, it was a tad bland. The sticky bun was soooo yummy. Would def come here again. 
Ask for Stephen! He was the best waiter ever. They sat 5 tables back to back in his section while we were there and he rocked it

Such a great time being served by Rafael. Awesome service. Such a great environment! So much personality. Always attentive to our table. Never asked for anything because he was always extremely professional.
Very nice location and nice looking restaurant. Burger and fries were awesome. Also got a pepperoni pizza which was also delicious. Service was good.
Came here for breakfast. Service not very attentive. I had to wait until the servers were done horsing around and chatting before I could ask for a salt shaker.

Don't have much to say unfortunately. My girlfriend and I came here because it was 5:30 am and we saw this was open 24/7.  The first night we stayed we went to bed early due to jet lag and such.  It literally states on their restaurant, "breakfast/lunch/dinner 24/7."  We go in and they are vacuuming, no one to seat us for awhile, the bartender had to go in the back to get someone who told us, we had to only choose from a shortened menu as they are "out" of several items on the menu.  Needless to say, we walked out.

This is the best place to eat in Vegas. Fresh environment, light and happy vibe with FRESH AIR and natural light and views of the Bellagio water show. The prices are affordable! Yes, I said affordable. The servers are fresh, friendly, happy, energetic, fun, informative, helpful and kind! Sit in Tracee and Jordans section! The food....fresh, beautiful, nutritious, exciting, flavorful, elegant to look at. From the front desk to the servers to the kitchen they pay attention to detail. Did I mention the flavor of the food? AWESOME! Visiting for Moms 70th with my sister and we were not diappointed. From hangovers to batchelorette parties or a 70th bash, you want to eat and drink here. Great memories! Thanks Tracee and Jordan!
Outside seating great for watching Strip at night. Music loud but not overly so.   Candied bacon a great appetizer. Service really decent.
-The Meat Omelette ..... OMG Delicious . love The Vibe And Atmosphere Of This Place .....

Me and my gf came here to try the Jungle Juice and we weren't disappointed. some appetizers here and there, so i cant really judge the food but from the reviews it all looks great!
the reason why i'm giving this place 5 stars was because overall our experience was wonderful to the moment we sat down our waitress was super friendly and asking us frequently how we were doing. Great job. i don't remember her name but she has short hair and a butterfly tattoo on back of her neck, you cant miss it.

First time here. I ordered the buttermilk pancakes which were very good. It's four full pancakes and I only ate two before getting stuffed. Also had some home fried which were just as exceptional! My wife ordered the french toast and scrambled eggs and she enjoyed both. She said this has become a new favorite breakfast spot for her! We sat on the outside patio which has a great view of the strip and you can get some good people watching views lol.

Went in June and had awesome experience. Today we went and it changed.....not in a good way. This time I got 3 eggs and 3 pieces of bacon. Had to leave off the potatos because they are fried with breaded items and leave the toast. I told the server why I couldn't have the potatoes and toast. The server said unable to substitute but I can have a banana for $2. I spent nearly $15 for 3 eggs and 3 strips of bacon. Not happy or pleased. I won't go back. Total rip off. I should have stuck with the $5 coffee.

Love Hexx Restaurant.
Great food,
Awesome specialty drinks,
Tasty deserts,
Delicious in-house made Chocolate,
One of the absolute best patios for dinning with a Amazing view of the Las Vegas Strip.
Hexx is definitely a must stop for every Vegas trip.
Must try the smothered fries, AMAZING!!!!!!!!

Outstanding. Went in Saturday morning. Only about a five minute wait. The twenty-something sons were called in by the bottom-less mimosas, which got high reviews. They also shared the colossal Bloody Mary which was amazing.  The food was great as was the service (thanks Mark and Shawn).  The home fries were fantastic. Our group had the cinnamon roll waffle, protein omelet, chicken and waffle, brioche French toast, veggie omelet, and farm fresh eggs. Everything was unbelievably good. To top it off they brought out cake balls to celebrate 24 year-old's birthday. And they were the best ever.

This review is only for their happy hour (daily 2pm-6pm, nightly 11pm-3am; 20% off starters and pizza on brunch and dinner menus). I didn't think the happy hour menu was that great because even during happy hour the prices were still a little on the steeper side, even for Vegas. They have a seating section just for happy hour so make sure you ask where to sit and the employees will direct you. 

We ordered the spinach artichoke dip and the carbonara pizza. The spinach artichoke dip came with bagel chips which I've never seen before. The dip was delicious but I'm not sure how I felt about the bagel chips. I think I would've preferred just regular tortilla chips instead, but the best thing was by far the dip. Just be careful as it's really hot when it comes out! The carbonara pizza was good as well. I liked the bacon on top and the crust was nice and light. It was a good happy hour shareable. 

For four people, these two dishes filled us up (granted we weren't that hungry) and it was a nice place to have a drink and chat.

Went to HEXX for breakfast on a Tuesday morning with my boyfriend. The wait was only about 10 minutes long for a seat inside, which we preferred anyway. The staff was welcoming and very nice! 

My boyfriend and I ordered coffee, which was only $2.75 each with free refills. The service for drinks was quick and they frequently came around with the coffee pot refilling our drinks. 

I ordered the eggs benedict. It was absolutely DELICIOUS. I definitely recommend ordering the eggs benedict. PLUS its served over scallop potatoes. It was also filling! My boyfriend ordered the steak and eggs. The portion was nicely sized for the price. It came with steak, home fries, two eggs, and a piece of toast. We really enjoyed everything

Fantastic addition to the strip. It has a large menu with something for everyone. 

We were there with a large group (10) and had a great time. The best part of the large group was that we had almost every appetizer to share. The best were the overcooked bacon, plus the baked cheese was awesome, real quality crab cakes and especially the fried broccolini. Holy crap, the fried broccolini. Words don't do it justice. 

All the entrees were great. I had the pasta with short rib bolognese. Huge portion and perfectly done. 

Finally dessert came and it was a mix of fresh chocolate creations and a huge banana split sundae. 
They take their desserts seriously, so save room. 

Service was attentive without being annoying and our waiter was just a real cool dude. 

The prices were definitely reasonable for Vegas especially when you consider the quality of the meal. 

You can't go wrong here. I plan on going back next Vegas trip.

We came again a few months ago. This time for lunch. After having set the bar sooo high the first time we were hoping for a duplicate experience. The funny thing is we were really looking forward to breakfast here again and came at the exact same time as before but they were not serving breakfast anymore. we must of just missed it.

We had to get the purple haze drink again and at $38.00 it did not disappoint. Again this may seem like a lot of money but it is enough for 2-3 people so it is well worth it and gathers attention :)

I had the prime beef dip and my wife had the turkey club. Both were very good. Fries were excellent. You can also taste the quality of food. 

A little pricey for lunch but it's Las Vegas and has a beautiful view if you sit outside. We recommend you try this place at least once :)

Had a great time here. They were super busy and we couldn't find our server to order. Sean noticed we hadn't been served and dropped everything to pick up our table and rushed our order so we could make our flight. Great service! Thanks Sean and Hexx!

HEXX is located in the front of Paris Hotel and Casino. It's open 24 hours, and that includes the bar and alcohol! They have entrances both on the Strip, and from inside the Paris casino. We were staying at the Paris, so stumbled onto this place when we saw the entrance from inside the casino, and glad that we did. We sat inside at the bar, and our bartender (Scott) was great!! We picked a couple things off of the menu, and they were both great. We really liked the selections to choose from. We got the smothered fries (awesome!), shrimp cocktail, soft pretzels with an amazing cheese dip, beef tartare. Everything was excellent. Prices seemed reasonable (as Vegas goes anyway). We planned on going back a couple days later, but that never happened. But we would return here anytime. Oh, and they are making their own chocolate in their candy store (attached to the restaurant via the street entrance). Great exotic chocolates to try at their "chocolate bar" with samples so you know which one you like. Plus a ton of other candies. So whether you stay at Paris or Planet Hollywood, which is close next door, stop in for a drink and food.

3.75 stars

Popped in to HEXX for brunch, and it was enjoyable though nothing overwhelmingly special. We were fortunate to get a table pretty quickly on a Sunday afternoon, and we admittedly were in a bit of a rush because my sister-in-law had to catch a flight within a few hours. But they were willing to take us and we were staying in that very hotel, so it made for an easy and convenient option. 

The service was fine but could have been better; the staff clearly had a lot on their plates, and while they were friendly, they were probably a bit stretched. There was a bit of a miscommunication regarding my sister-in-law's meal that resulted in her missing out on an ingredient that was supposed to be included in her dish (chilaquiles) and that she had really wanted, but ended up not getting due to the mix-up. 

Otherwise, the food was definitely solid. I ordered the veggie omelette and it was quite enjoyable, with good depth of flavor. Sides included potatoes, which were fine, and an english muffin, which actually had an unusual but interesting texture. The meal certainly filled me up for a good chunk of the day, so that was appreciated. My husband ordered the veggie burger, and I was impressed to see that they made their own. While it did not hold up well in terms of composition (as in it fell apart easily and ended up being eaten with a fork), it was delicious in terms of flavor. 

Enjoyable and well worth the visit, particularly for a filling and simple brunch after a lot of perhaps other excessive Vegas meals. Solid option for folks looking for an easy place to dine along the Strip.

My boyfriend and I visited Hexx for my birthday brunch on a very busy Sunday afternoon. We hadn't researched this place at all but decided to go in anyways since it looked like a cool place. We were offered the option of immediate bar seating or to check in and wait for a table. Normally, we would've opted to go to another place since we don't like waiting or sitting at the bar, but since we were hungry and tired, we chose to be seated in the bar. The only negative of our whole experience here was that we waited for about 10 mins before we were brought menus by the bartender, who ended up being our waiter. The wait was understandable though as the bartender had 4 or 5 other tables in his areas plus a few people sitting at the actual bar. 

The menu had quite a few different things to choose from including sweet and savory brunch items, pizza, and salads, so I knew this would be a difficult decision for my boyfriend and I. In the end, I decided to go for the Veggie Burger and my boyfriend chose the Corned Beef Hash. Once we placed our order, the food came out fairly quickly considering how busy it was. My veggie burger was delicious! It had a great chipotle mayo with just the right amount of spice. Only thing I disliked about the sandwich was the huge slices of avocado, but that's just a personal preference. I am sure that someone who enjoys avocado would consider the avocado the be just the right amount. My boyfriend loved the corned beef hash too.

As for their drink menu, their brunch feature is $23 bottomless mimosas, which I feel like is a very fair price for unlimited mimosas in Vegas! There were a variety of other signature cocktails, bloody Mary's, beers, and wines to choose from as well. I opted for a simple Malibu and pineapple juice, while my boyfriend tried an IPA beer (Prairie Artisan, Phantasmagoria), which he enjoyed throughly.  

Overall, we had a great experience here and will definitely be back to enjoy more of their delicious food next time we're in Vegas! Next time we will be sure to book a table ahead of time!

Went to Vegas for the weekend with some friends. My friend from home always talked about this place called Hexx... just happened be right outside of our hotel. We went for drinks the first day and tried one of the potion drinks. It was super sweet. Great for the insta, not worth the money though. 

Two days later we needed food AND drinks. We sat down and waited for about 20 minutes. Our waiter kept walking past saying I'll be right back. Not gonna lie, we were thinking about leaving. THANK GOODNESS we didn't. Sean was triple sat right as we walked in, hence the long wait. Once he could get to us, he was the best! Him and his helper Josh never let our bottomless mimosas get even half empty. Very attentive and helpful with the menu. He was willing to take a picture of the group, followed by a selfie with him! One of the best waiters I've had in a while. Very personable.

The food was great too! The turkey club was amazing. 3 of the 4 of us had it. The 4th had the chicken and waffles with the bourbon syrup. As a KY girl, I enjoyed it! It was a perfect mixture of sweet and savory.
I came here for my birthday -  taylor and chance are the best!!! Best waitors/waitresses I've had!!

Sooo, I finally made it to Hexx Kitchen, after passing by dozens of times.  I was NOT disappointed!!
We were greeted by friendly hostesses, and seated promptly, even though our group was fairly large.
Ordered the smothered fries (huge portions), and they came out hot & delicious. 
The chicken & waffles were really good as well.  
The menu is very diverse, with something for everyone. One thing I would like to see -- better beverage options. No fresh lemonade, specialty teas etc....only coke (fountain) products.
Overall, the service, atmosphere, and food were great!
The eggs benidict was amazing! I reccomend trying the sangria flight and of course bottomless mimosas! Amazing service from Spencer. The atmosphere is very warm and welcoming!

Not bad... I stayed at the Paris Hotel & Casino while in Vegas and ate at HEXX the morning that I flew back to PHL. It's such a nice restaurant and I wanted a seat outside overlooking the fountains at the Bellagio, but there was a long wait and I had things that I wanted to do before I left Vegas. The bar had immediate seating so I sat there.  I ordered the Chilaquiles with coffee on the side. The coffee was nice and strong (the way I like it) but the meal itself was just ok. Chilaquiles were made with chicken and the chicken tasted like it was leftover and reheated. It wasn't horrible and it was certainly edible but it was  hardly what I expected from a $15 brunch dish. 

I would give this place another try (if I'm ever in Vegas again), but I would certainly order something else next time.
Our breakfast was delicious. They really mean unlimited mimosas. Our glasses were never left half empty. The outdoor dining has a great view of the stripe and the Bellagio Fountains.

Breakfast was okay nothing exceptional. Potatoes were very good but that's really all:( Waiter was very nice when we sat down but did not wait on our table. I had to basically wave him down to get a cup of coffee. Yet he could hang out and chat with the other staff. Was NOT happy with the HEXX and will not eat there again.  Expensive and it definitely lack character! We'll chose another restaurant.

The food was great the service was so slooooowwww unfortunately. When the staff was around they were really nice and helpful. Unfortunately it took about 10 mins to get our drink order, (the place was not full btw) once we got our drink order, it took 30 mins to get our food order in, another 30 mins to GET our food. We did get an apology for the wait with our food, that was nice :) we never got our water refilled. We arrived at 2:30 and it's 4:00 pm now. We are waiting for our cc back let's see how long that takes. I wish we had had a better experience because like I said the food was terrific!

This place has style!!!!! The ambience is upscale but chill. The service was great, my water glass was always filled and the busser's were attentive to the table plus they were not smothering. I ordered the prime burger with a side of brussel sprouts and I really loved the presentation of the food. Our server Denise was awesome! She was really nice and very helpful. Thank you, I'll definitely come again!

Had my first meal in Vegas here and it exceeded all expectations. My first impression was that it was loud and my party of 3 would be waiting forever but we ended up getting seated quickly and all the laughter around us just showed how much everyone enjoyed eating here. The bottomless mimosas were so nice and my food could not have been any better. I believe our servers name is Bryan and he made our experience here even more enjoyable.
Bottomless mimosas is what brought us here... brunch was fantastic! Food is good and service is great too! Definitely recommend.
Loved this place. Everything was great from the meal to meeting the chef. Will be back in Vegas in 2 weeks and we'll be stopping by again!!
Worst place ever overcharged me added 70$tip for themselves what the he'll fuck u guys worst service ever plz do me a favor don't go here
Went here for lunch. The food was amazing, and the drinks were great. I couldn't believe how good the fries are here. I would definitely return here.

I think this is our favorite place to eat and drink in Vegas.  We fell in live with the drinks with dry ice in them....presentation does count! And these are bad ass! And the food is excellent.  We love getting a bunch of tapas to share and we have never had one we didn't love.  Same with the entr√©es. And they have awesome little booths with couches on either side of the table for cozy little groups. Plus check out the shop connected, they have the most unique ice cream flavours!

We were very impressed with this place! We went to breakfast here based on recommendations.  The staff was attentive and friendly.  The wait was not long at all. (Maybe 10 minutes)  Their tables were clean despite being outside and they were very busy. (No dust or bird mess on them)  I ordered the Hexx Benedict and my husband had the Corned Beef Hash. Both dishes were prepared very very well. The eggs were not over cooked, and my husband's beef was not dry. We were served promptly and our waitress was friendly and knowledgeable.

We would highly recommend this place for a nice breakfast with a great view on the strip.
Definitely one of my favorite restaurants on the strip. Food is always delicious and I love the seating outside to watch the water show while eating !
We had a wonderful brunch at Hexx. Our server Tracee kept the mimosas flowing for us! We will definitely come back and ask for her. She made the experience worthwhile :)

This is a great pace to have dinner with a wonderful view of strip and Bellagio fountain. Recommend the salmon was wonderful and shrimp pasta. A bit pricey but location was worth it. Expect to spend about 30$- 40$ per dish for dinner! Service was ok waiter was friendly.
We ate here for breakfast one day and they had numerous items that could be made gluten free. I would definitely recommend; if you sit out on the patio you can even people watch while you eat!

I have never been a fan of the breakfast options that Vegas offers, but this was an absolute exception. A friend and I ordered bottomless mimosas, which they extended a whole hour for us so we could enjoy since it was originally supposed to end soon. Our server, Johanna, was constantly checking in to our table and making sure our drinks were always full. The food was beautifully prepared and wonderfully portioned for the price. Even after our check had been paid she still came and waited our table with no change in the quality of the service. This is a place I highly recommend, and one that I plan on coming back to in the near future.

At first I was sad to see sugar factory left, but now I don't mind that it's gone now that hexx took its place. My man and I went here for dinner on the Fourth of July and were not disappointed. The prices are a bit steep but it is Vegas and you're at a fancy restaurant on the strip so it is expected. Our waitress was Sheri. If you can request her, do it! She is the best waitress we've had in Vegas so far and this is our 4th trip here together. She is very polite, knowledgable, and intelligent about the menu, the ingredients used, and the Vegas strip in general. We asked her a good place to get sushi and she was knowledgable about locations on the strip as well! We shared the chips and dip to start. It was delicious! I love onion dip. You could tell the chips and the dip were homemade and not from a package! We then shared the pepperoni pizza. Also delicious! It's not your boring old pizza, it is thin crust with a sauce that has a slight kick. Onion, garlic and cheese. Mmmm. The pepperoni on it were huge. We at first were just looking for something small to split since we wanted sushi later but the food and service was so good we decided to get dessert too. Sheri recommended to Aztec cake so we tried that! We had it with some coffees. It was very good. The boyfriend liked it even though he isn't big on chocolate stuff. It's a light and soft cake that has an excellent chocolate flavor. We devoured the whole thing. The other desserts looked great too. Next time I'd probably go for the espresso torte, just because it sounds so good! I'd definitely order the Aztec cake again too though! The coffee was very strong so I had to doctor it up a little with sugar and cream. It's definitely a dark roast but the flavor is still good. If you like a strong, dark cup of coffee, I definitely recommend to get one here for breakfast or dessert! 
Hexx is a must try if you are someone who loves to try different restaurants in Vegas! If you can get Sheri for a waitress, it'll make your experience even better! I love sparkling water, I ordered that and every time I even thought about pouring more into my glass from the bottle at the table, she was already there pouring it for me! With dessert she brought us 2 complimentary pieces of chocolate that paired nicely with our cake and coffee. She was very knowledgable about the chocolate as well!!

Delicious fries!! Loaded with gravy, cheese curds, shredded protein.... Omg. Completely worth the indulgence and a conversation starter for patrons around us who were quite envious of our order. So. Good.

To counter the cheese and grease, we also had salads that were quite good! My friend had the chicken Caesar & I had the green salad with the vinaigrette. Both were wonderful! 

We closed our visit to Hexx with some amazing chocolates that came with our bill. Rich and satisfying, Hexx competes with top notch chocolatiers .

Service was wonderful. Cool environment.
Great job, Hexx!!

After a very slow beginning, the Hexx staff and menu won out! We walked up with no reservation and were seated promptly. Very busy night with a large private function going on. Waitress took our drink order and disappeared for while...drink wrong when it arrived but was quickly fixed. Guacamole was delicious! Pizza was great too! Staff very attentive and friendly! Maria was great! Full of energy!
Great view of the Bellagio fountains. Good vibe. Recommended!

Came here anticipating breakfast because it looks SOOO GOOD, (and it's open 24/7, so I didn't even think they had a cut off time). Got here around noon and was very disappointed when they said they stopped serving breakfast at 11 . Nothing looked special on the regular menu so I got a burger. I'm giving this place two stars for the burger because it was good, but the fries weren't even warm... I am going to try my best to get back here for breakfast and maybe I'll give an updated review...

Don't go!  Terrible service and awful food. 
Checked in and told it would be 15 min for outdoor table. Waited 30 min and went and asked them told their system lost our reservation. Then sat indoors waited over 10 min without being offered water or a menu. Finally complained to manager and got service. Ordered the club salad. It came overloaded with soft giant bland cubes of bread that were supposed to be croutons and missing the turkey. 
Awful food and bad service. Wish we would have walked out at the start and went to the much better Moni Mi Gabi

Our favorite place to have lunch in Las Vegas the mimosas delicious and food are so delightful and flavorful. The atmosphere is the best in Vegas. The music is fun and the service r amazing like I said it's our favorite place thank you see you soon

Came here excited to try the chicken and waffles. Service time and waitress were good. However the chicken and waffle plate came with huge disappointments. Chicken was seasoned very oddly- heavy hand on the seasoning and thus over powered the entire meal.
Came here for my 21st birthday. Love the ambience, food, and service. The restaurant is so big there is a seat for everyone!
Came all the way from LA for my birthday in September and this place was a MUST again... Ya'll need that apple pie back though. Still bomb.

Welcome to Las Vegas, and the outrageous prices. The place is cool and looks very modern and minimalist. The food, though it looked fun, as not good. My salad with supposedly avocado, had maybe the equivalent of a table spoon of avocado and the rest was filled with large pieces of croutons and kale. 
My guest had a burger and it was overlooked and dry, even though we asked for rare. 
This was actually the first place to offer green tea, but at $6.50 a cup without refill, it makes the $5.54 Starbucks look cheap. 
My friend had coffee and never had refills either, and the overall experience was a $65 bill for a salad and a burger. I get it it's Vegas, but come on people, if you want me to pay these prices, you better review what you're offering. A little courtesy and welcoming staff would really be appreciated and would go as long way.

My husband and I visited Hexx for a lighter, earlier dinner and we're happy to have ventured in! We had a later reservation and they accommodated us when we got to the area much earlier than expected but it wasn't too busy at 5pm. Our server Teddy was awesome!
