He made personal menu suggestions that didn't sound forced and was quick with refills and removing empty dishes. We ordered the hummus with pita chips and a margherita pizza and both were really delicious and didn't feel heavy- everything tasted fresh. Husband had a beer and I had the Hypnotizing Strawberry specialty drink, which was blended well. The server even acknowledged our anniversary, which was mentioned when we made our reservation weeks prior so that was a nice touch. Some of the best food and drinks we had in Vegas on this trip for sure. We will return again! 

**i did post this review on other sites as well

This place has THE best steak and eggs I've ever eaten! The mimosas don't taste the greatest and are a bit overpriced, but the food makes up for it. Inside is pretty loud and crowded but the outdoor seating is wonderful and has a great view of the bellagio fountain show.

Great area! People watching was on point. View of the bellagio fountains was second to none. Food was me. 

We just came from dinner so we came for a nice dessert. 

Service was incredible. Waitress was amazing. 

We opted for the cookie Sundae. It was piled high with whipped cream, strawberry sauce and a cherry of course. 

It was more of a cookie cake than an actual cookie. Consistency was fluffy. 

The cookies and cream ice cream was good. 

I'd probably pick something else off the menu next time but I'd definitely come back.

No words can describe how amazing my experience was. The orange juice tasted freshly squeeze and salad was simple with a pinch of salt and pepper but it was extremely fresh and tasted like someone picked it right from the garden. The lobster roll was amazing and very fulfilling. Complimentary chocolate at the end of the meal tasted very different incompairson with other chocolate I had before. The dark bitter chocolate is my absolute favorite.

I came here Friday right after me and my friends got off the plane and were dying for breakfast and mimosas!!! First of all our waitress Theresa (praying that's her name, hard to remember after 5th mimosa), she was AMAZINNG! So sweet and hilarious, we always had a full glass and a smile. Also brought me a birthday treat and made everyone sing to me! We absolutely adored her and the food was really good as well! Next time I'm in Vegas I hope to return and pray she's still there!

Came here for brunch before heading to dayclub, and wow. Their food was amazing. 
I got the ham and cheese croissant, which was sooo delicious and HUGE! I wanna say the whole croissant sandwich itself was about the size of my face (but I guess that's not saying much since my face isn't really big but still...). The croissant also came with a side of potatoes which was mouth watering. The potatoes had the perfect amount of garlic and crispiness to them. I lowkey wish they gave me more.The whole meal itself was really filling, and I was already full before I even made it halfway through.  I guess the only sad part about the meal was I couldn't finish it.. wayyy too filling for this tiny body. But I couldn't take it to-go with me either cause we didn't have time to go back to our hotel room, and you can't really bring food in with you to dayclub ya know? Actually, I'm pretty sure that's not even allowed. 

Service was also good. We were seated immediately, and our waitress was very friendly and attentive.

My boyfriend and I made a brunch reservation at Mon Ami Gabi but as we walked past Hexx Kitchen, the outdoor patio space looked so inviting that we stopped in to ask if there was a wait. Inside there was a nice row of couches available and we hung out for a few minutes until our table was ready.

To start, we shared an order of the twisted sticky bun. We had been debating between starting with that or an order of the carrot cake pancakes and the server helped us decide. I think we made the right decision. It's a large bun similar to "monkey bread" where small pieces can be easily pulled apart and it's perfect to share.

For our main dishes, we got an order of the chicken & waffles, and also the Hexx Benedict. Both dishes are staples for us when we go out to brunch, and Hexx delivers these classics in true Vegas "indulgence" style. We were not disappointed.

The atmosphere at Hexx is low-key and open. It's perfect for a nice sunny day and is great people watching out on the strip.
This place was amazing.  We had lobster rolls and unlimited mimosas, which I must say were absolutely amazing.  Nice relaxing atmosphere.

My husband and I stopped in around their happy hour half price appetizer time and had a seat at the bar. We ordered one of the fun potion drinks and it was so good! We ordered a few small plates and apps with the bartender, a short girl. About 30 minutes later I noticed how busy it had gotten. I also noticed how all these other people had food when they came in way after us. Our bartender disappeared. We asked another bartender if he could check on the food. Turns out the girl didn't actually put our order in ): They quickly took care of it and got our food. The other girl, not sure of her name but had on black glasses was AWESOME! In the end we got our food, they handled it well and the food was good. We'll likely go back.

Food and service were good, but was really offended that they charged a concession fee as though it was a tax without telling us about it until we queried. It's not my problem that type not affiliated with the Paris - bake the fee into your costs and don't be underhanded.

Beautiful setting tucked outside of the Paris hotel. Great for people watching and for enjoying some fantastic farm to table food. Everything was delicious and I left wanting more. Check out the chocolate and candy store for a post dinner sweet

Amazing! What is not to love? The atmosphere is great, service was top notch, and the food was delicious. We shared a pitcher of red sangria (ask your server) and we each ordered the Hexx Benedict. It was one of the best egg benedicts I've had. The complimentary chocolate taster at the end of our meal was a nice touch. Can't wait to come back during our next visit.
I went to HEXX for Sunday brunch and got the bottomless mimosas and the carrot cake pancakes. My glass was always topped off and the pancakes were amazing. I highly recommend going!

Service: 5 stars. Food: 5 stars. Location: 5 stars. 

Our server Sean was very attentive, he was very polite and patient as we chit chat while looking through all the delicious sounding items on the menu.

We split a spinach artichoke dip, it was on point. 

The lobster roll was flavorful and plentiful. 

We were debating whether to sit outside to enjoy the view or inside, the person who seated us picked a table by the window on the inside so we got a little of both, AC plus a view of the Eiffel tower ;)
Tracee was amazing, sweet, and made our day! Affordable for Vegas!! Bottomless mimosas for 20 dollars. Great brunch day atmosphere on the strip.

Ordered the brioche French toast. We were seated and served quickly, but we did wait a little for the food. It took about half an hour after we ordered until the food came out. The french toast was delicious, though I think the serving size was a little small... it has that classic sweet taste you look for in a French toast, you can add fruits, but I didn't do that. Service was nice, food was alright.

Cleanly-designed open dining area: a tastefully-subdued change from the buzzy tourism of the strip. The decor was a pleasant combination of retro seventies-esque fixtures and modern use of space.

We had the broccolini (awesome), split the spaghetti carbonara (very good), and tried one of the potions for dessert. The potion - a pitcher-sized concoction of liquor and juice over dry ice - was amazing. Google-image "hexx potion las vegas" and you'll see the appeal.

Service was fast and professional. Our server was clearly having a rough morning, but he never let that show while at the table; I only noticed because I was watching and because I used to be a server. He had good recommendations and brought us complimentary chocolate with our "dessert."

Taylor and Ivan were the best duo ever in the history of service! They are an essential piece to Hexx and Emjay and I appreciate them especially since it was our birthdays. Promote them!!! They deserve it!!

A great view eating and people watching on the famous Las Vegas Strip across the water fountains of the Beautiful Bellagio Hotel Resort. 

Had the vegetable pizza which hit the spot. 

Just a wonderful place to drink and people watch. Very affordable also.

My husband and I were recently in Las Vegas for 4 days and had dinner here one night. The food was wonderful... I had the margherrita pizza and my husband had the salmon and quinoa. Both were delicious. Our waiter, Sean, was wonderful! He was so personable and nice. He was very helpful in answering menu questions and provided outstanding service!! Would definitely go back!

If I could leave a less star I would! This was the WORST service I have ever had by far.. I ordered a glass of wine from LISA she had the manager come over and card me as well NEVER got the wine, then my family ordered their appetizers and Lisa never cared to ask for my order she just walked away.. we asked the manager for a new server but he did not allow so my friend had went and asked another server to tell ours i needed to put in my app, food comes and we never seen our server again for at least 30 min and when she finally comes back she ask if we wanted a dessert.... well Lisa we would of liked to of had dinner since that was the whole point of coming here but no we declined because at this point we just wanted to leave. Get the check and we wait another 15 min for her to come back and when she does she said "do you need change" I have always found that disrespectful and greedy you should just bring the money back and let the customer leave what they want. I loved the calamari I had but that's all I ordered so not much else I can say great about this place. I could see this place being great just DO NOT LET ***LISA**BE YOUR SERVER!!!

We came here for dessert and drinks only, they have a very nice patio with a beautiful view. The prices are decent for the spot. The desserts and drinks were all really good. The service was one of the best..

I've always been a fan of the drinks that come smoking to your table and Hexx definitely has some fun flavors to offer. Their chicken and waffles have been the best to me, even after living in LA and having Roscoe's, I'd still say Hexx is better! Service is good, location is really nice especially with the view of Bellagio's fountain!

Great people watching spot, no doubt.  

But I can get a BETTER omelet from IHOP for half the price.  No one at breakfast was impressed with the meal.  Service was good and nothing was gross, but there are better options on the Strip.
Best Place in Vegas. Sean and Steven were great. Best bottomless mimosas were the Best, and we had so much fun.
Weird smell as soon as you walk in, it Threw my wife off. The wait was 15 mins for a table on the patio outside. So we went next door to the French Restaurant. Much better
Best brunch spot in Vegas ! We have bottomless mimosas and amazing breakfast food! Great view  Happy Valentine's Day!
Great brunch. Sean and Abram were awesome! Great deal on Bottomless Mimosas and some of the best Bloody Mary's you will find in Vegas. PS get the HEXX Benedict

Gals weekend and we were doing a Bloody Mary club crawl on a Saturday morning. This bar was on the top ten but at #3 or #4. We started at number 2 on the list and they had the worst service and a sad representation of the advertised drink. We made our way to Hexx and then never left to go any further. We split a Colossal, it was gorgeous!  A pitcher of spicy Bloody Mary w a meal perched on top. They infuse their vodka there with basil and spices, it tasted sooooo good. Don't forget to tell then to make it spicy so they can use this special blend. We sat on the patio and watched people go by, it was a good time. 
We had to come back later that night and received the same great service and drinks during happy hour. Thank you Hexx.

The atmosphere of the restaurant is very cool. Right next to the Paris hotel (it's connected) and the patio was great to people watch. We had French toast (nothing special) and the eggs Benedict. The EB was placed on a bed of au gratin potatoes which was so so and the sauce was a bit bland. We rated it overall a 3 as the coffee was good and most would say the French toast was better than I am rating it cause I have had some amazing FT over the years. :)

This place has good food. People really seemed to like the Hexx burger. I got a pizza and it was good. A bit pricey but most things on the strip are. Didn't order alcohol so I can't comment on the drinks. Service was great. It's a good place to go. Not sure I'll go back just because there are so many other places to eat at on the Strip. But I was certainly not disappointed in the meal.

If you are looking for amazing chicken and waffles look no further! Went here for lunch and the food here was great! We had the fruit plate to start and then chicken and waffles! So flavorful, perfectly cooked and lots of it! The best part though was our server Tracee!!! Tracee was so sweet happy and excited! She was super attentive without being overwhelming and always near by when I needed a refill on my endless mimosa! If you get the chance to go here do and ask for Tracee, yo won't regret it!!

Good food. WORST service ever. We won't be back. Had to call other servers over to get drinks and didn't see our server after our order. Extremely disappointed. 
I gave this 2 stars for the food but after reflection I'm giving it 1 because that is the lowest I can go. I've never left a restaurant in tears but I did here. They made us feel like we didn't exist. No one should leave a restaurant feeling this way. Food should make you feel good, not like you'd just been bullied.

My friends and I had such a great time at brunch. Sean was our waiter and he worked his tail off serving us. We never had an empty mimosa. We loved the experience so much we ate here twice. Sean is the best.
Delicious! Drinks were great, apps amazing and dinner was all perfect..all 6 of us lived it! Deff recommend!

Girlfriends and I were in Vegas for the iHeart Daytime Festival and wanted to have a good meal for our last night in town. My weekend roomie found a few good places on the Strip including Hexx! They take reservations, and our party of 5 in the late evening was no big deal. My roomie and I arrived first, and they seated us promptly. Our waiter greeted us the second we sat down and offered us water options while waiting for our other friends to arrive. He provided amazing service the entire evening.

I made sure to order one of the house drinks-the Hypnotizing Strawberry- and do not regret it! Great blend of alcohol and flavors. All 5 of us ordered different entrees and loved them all! I got the Short Rib meal that includes horseradish mashed potatoes and roasted Brussels sprouts. It was almost too beautiful to eat, but I ended up devouring my meal. One of my most-favorite meals I've ever eaten. All of the flavors blended together beautifully.

I really enjoyed my experience here . We had Rafael as our server who was hilarious and funny, the whole time making me and my girl laugh . Then Christian, who is the manager, was also just as cool. Made my birthday feel special ! ;) we had the brunch menu and it was all delicious ! Recommend this place !

My new bride and I had mimosas and the Eggs Benedict on 7/6/2015.  The best Eggs Benedict we've ever had and we're kinda foodies.  Expensive, but incredible.  It's the only meal we've eaten there.  Service and atmosphere were also fantastic.

Taking advantage of two visitors and a pair of holiday weekends to revisit several of 2017's best meals it was as a party of five that Brunch was enjoyed at HEXX Kitchen + Bar inside Paris Las Vegas, the city's best 24/7 Restaurant now a three-year tradition at Christmas and this year doubling as a 21st Birthday celebration for one guest at the table. 

Always a Restaurant testing the limitations of its space and clientele, the appointment of Due Forni's Carlos Buscaglia to top Toque earlier this year ushering in the complete overhaul of a Dinner menu that now holds its own against any Restaurant of its ilk while surpassing many 'fine dining' spaces in terms of creativity, it was just past 11:00am on Sunday morning that hostesses led patrons to a lengthy indoor banquet reserved earlier that week, a pleasant young woman stopping by within moments to take drink orders of Coffee for most, plus one Potion for the guest of honor. 

Once again featuring shockingly efficient service for a place that does so much volume, Mr. Stotland keeping a watchful eye over the expansive space and coordination of servers with bussers seamlessly filling drinks and clearing plates without ever feeling late or intrusive, it was in three courses that Brunch was consumed beginning with HEXX's famous Fruit Plate, the collection this time highlighted by Papaya and Pineapple best dipped in Coconut Whip while the Dragon Fruit was far sweeter than usual, both on the plate and as incorporated into the "Magick Dragon" that billowed smoke upon service with a flavor not dissimilar to the Red Icee's served at the movie theater.

Investing in both old and new favorites throughout a two-hour meal, the portions seemingly larger than past visits as relates to both sweets and savories, it was with many focused on the fluffy Brioche Sticky Bun that regulars reveled in the return of Chef Matt Piekarski's Carrot Cake Pancakes, the item now back on the Brunch Menu every bit as good as memory serves with lightly spiced Batter fluffy and moist beneath a mound of Cream Cheese Frosting.

Sharing all plates family-style, the carbohydrate-heavy first course taking its toll on lighter appetites despite several plates to follow, it was to wide eyes that servers next delivered HEXX's Benny replacing English Muffins with cheesy Potatoes alongside a stacked Breakfast Croissant and Chilaquiles with a lot of spice and several still-crisp Tortilla Chips, plus an oversized order of the typically Dinner-only fried Broccolini.

Admittedly a lot of Food, the Parmesan Potatoes particularly dangerous when accounting for portion and likelihood of going back for seconds, it was after a brief respite with one guest already waving the white flag that four all-new Desserts were delivered, Pastry Chef Mirada proving a worthy successor to Carol Garcia with thick Pumpkin Brulee that eats like Pot de Cr√®me with a caramelized top plus a boozy Shake served next creamy confetti Cheesecake and equally rich Marshmallow Semifreddo beneath crumbled Graham Crackers and Fudge made from HEXX's bean-to-bar Chocolate.

Not quite finished yet, a tableside Tiramisu still in-process as the last drops of Amaretto trickled through Coffee Beans to Almond Cake below, it was by way of advanced order that Brunch finished with a custom White Cake filled with Strawberries and Cream, @cakegirl702 living up to her name in terms of both design and taste even though most were too full to enjoy it until later.

We went for a birthday brunch and has a wonderful experience. The food was fantastic, menu had a good variety, and served good sized portions. I had the chilaquiles and it was delicious. Sean was our server and made our birthday girl feel extra special and took excellent care of the table. So many great restaurants in Las Vegas, but will definitely be coming back to Hexx.
Not only was the food bomb but Tracey was amazing great customer service she's great !!!! Now that raiders are moving out here I'm visiting vegas more often you are great Tracey !!!!!!

HEXX kitchen is so awesome !!! Open air indoor tables, super good mimosas that are bottomless for $24, and our server Taylor is a SAVAGE !!!! Such an awesome experience, def gonna come back and ask for her our next go around in Vegas.

Great customer service! We had an incident with the high winds and an umbrella that broke the lamp above us. Long story short they moved us to a new table right away and comped our entire ticket. Throughout the whole experience they were just so great. The food was delicious; the flamingle punch drink is a great deal when you have a few people drinking and the vegetable pizza was bomb.com. Definitely will be back!

Me and my brother went to Hexx for Saturday brunch. Mostly, we wanted the bottomless mimosas for $23, served until 2 pm. The brunch looked good though, so we thought we would give it a try. 

The place was crazy packed. We were super happy we made a reservation, but still had to wait a bit to be seated. The restaurant was really loud from the DJ music. We were sitting pretty far, and could still barely hear each other. Not a bad thing at a bar, but not my favourite for brunch when I want to talk. 

The bottomless mimosas were a good deal. They bring around a pitcher to fill up your glass, and we had about 4 by the time we left. The prosecco was a bit flat and the OJ was cheap, but I expected that. The food was pretty awesome too. I had the chicken and waffles, served with house made pickles and syrup. So yum. The chicken was crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside. The waffle was a bit dry, but the syrup helped. I liked the touch of the pickles, which cuts the heavy meal. I really enjoyed it. My brother had a chicken Sandwich and he really enjoyed his meal too. 

I would give the place 4 stars, but something just felt off about the atmosphere. Could have been the loud music and cold server, but I can't quite put my finger on it.

The location is cute because it is located across the bellagio fountains but the quality of food isn't that great. The servers were really nice but the two hostess in the front were rude. We stood right in front of them and no one acknowledged us for a few minutes. They were too busy talking to each other. Then when they did acknowledge us they asked how many people and said nothing else other than walk us to our table. Don't bother!

Went here for brunch on our last day in Vegas for a bachelorette party and we were so glad we did. It was a short walk from our room at the Cosmo and every single bit of food we had was delicious. Cece was an amazing server and made sure our mimosa glass did not run dry! Check this place out!
Food was good fast and flavorful! We grabbed a late snack. They had a $10 all day breakfast deal was good

Even if the food wasn't excellent, which it was, Hexx was a fun place to dine. Sitting on the outside patio is a great people watching experience. We also had a fantastic view of the Bellagio fountains.
Chris, our server, made perfect suggestions for appetizers as well as an amazing Roasted Bass entree. In a city where everything is overpriced, this was a hidden gem.

My boyfriend and I came here for Tuesday brunch because of the great reviews I was reading. However, I do not agree as I did not have the 5 star experience that it is getting. It was mostly due to lack of service, our waitress did not seem to be too attentive to our table. In fact, multiple times I had to track her down to either order something, get a refill and ask for additional condiments. I'm addition, after we ordered a dessert, the waitress came out 10 min later to tell us the dessert was not available. This happened twice... It would be better if the waitress was able to inform us earlier that certain desserts were not available at that time instead of waiting after we ordered. We were definitely at the restaurant for much longer than what we intended. I mean, I didn't want to spend most of time in Vegas at a restaurant...

Regarding the food, I was not too fond of the corn beef hash. I was expecting it to be more fried but it had a very soft texture. However, I also tried the carrot pancakes and I actually really like the flavor of the pancake. It is topped with a nice cream cheese frosting which is delicious as I did not need additional syrup. The frosting was sweet enough with the pancakes and I would definitely recommend that if you are in the mood for a sweeter side. The dessert we got was the smores which had ice cream in between Graham crackers topped with heated marshmallows and chocolate. Definitely try if you like the mix of warm and cold desserts!
Bottomless mimosas for brunch, a good people watching view & competent menu top off this kinda tepid hotel/casino restaurant. It & the bar above have good views of the fountains @ the Bellagio.

Server was fantastic. Menu was.....ok. Good food but just limited options and fairly pricey. Breakfast menu looked good though.


Update:
Went in for the brunch menu. Fantastic!
Service was great!!! Food was good, but wasn't anything to write home about. I would go again, if anything just to hit up the bar that was tucked away from the rest of the restaurant.

Just finished brunch here. The food was excellent but the service was second to none. Our server Sean had the best personality and was on top of all of our needs without being overbearing. I personally recommend asking for Sean if he's available.

Stumbled across this place while walking on the strip on Valentine's day. Checked out the menu outside and was impressed by the options so my bf and I decided why not- let's give it a try! 

Menu was great and he decided on the 14 oz. ribeye while I had something smaller- meatballs, cause I wanted to save some room for their desserts.

14 oz ribeye was SALTY- too much peppercorn.
Meatballs came out COLD and DRY- returned it and rejected a second order, because we had already waited more than 20 minutes for our food to come out.

Disappointed but was also looking forward to desserts because BANANA ICE CREAM caught my eyes and I had to have it ;)

HOLY CRAP- banana ice cream was bomb! It was the Chocolate Budino!!! I'd def come back for deserts but not too happy with the food.

Amazing food, BEST view of the Bellagio Fountains, gorgeous decor and great ambiance. Also incredibly nice staff, very responsive, well managed. Shout-out to Juan the manager who took very good care of us and all the management team and staff members contributed to a beautiful artistic culinary experience. I especially enjoyed the Bloody Mary, crispy broccolini appetizer, and Jambalaya.
Great brunch w/ bottomless mimosas and Sean was an excellent server.  Perfect place to round out our Vegas trip.

Fun atmosphere, not too crowded, bottomless mimosas!! Right across from bellagio fountains!! Taylor is the BEST server, I will be back here next time I'm in Vegas because of her! We never found the bottoms of our mimosas, and felt welcome all 3 hours we were here!!

We came across Hexx on accident and we were not disappointed!  The food was amazing.  The candied bacon was phenomenal.  My husband had the club sandwich and I had the the prime beef dip - both were excellent!  Out waiter, Shawn, was the absolute best.  He was attentive and made sure we were happy.  Hexx is a must try!

Revisited Hexx for brunch. Business is located at Paris Las Vegas. 

Easy to get seated at 1030am mid-week. We scored a table on the patio overlooking Las Vegas Boulevard. 

Quickly was met by our server assistant to get introductions and waters. Server arrived a few minutes later to gather drink orders.

Ordered a twisted sticky bun for the table and meat omelet as my dish.

Bun arrived soon after and was piping hot! A twited cinnamon bun rolled into a circle and baked. Then, topped with brown sugar, cream cheese frosting and toasted pecans. The warm frosting oozed over crevices and intothe bun as we cut into the dish. Highly recommended for those with a sweet tooth. 

Dishes arrived soon after. Meat omelet was bountiful. Musthave included 3 eggs, stuffed with bacon, chicken, pork and sausage, with cheddar cheese. Dish is served with an English muffin and home fries. Home fries are smashed and seasoned new potatoes flash fried. A hearty addition to the dish.

Servers were friendly and attentive to our needs. 

Would definitely return to explore this brunch menu again.

Me and my friend had an amazing breakfast before we headed home.  I had the eggs Benedict which I loved! Instead of English muffins, the used these creamy cheesy potatoes and added asparagus. It was amazing. And my friend had chilaquiles that looked like a huge plate of breakfast nachos and she loved it too. I can't wait to come back and try the desserts and dinners!
And the coffee was perfect! 

Service was "eh!"  Our waiter could of been nicer. Luckily the food was fantastic. 

Ambience was modern and sleek. Beautiful opened Windows. View of the strip and weather was gorgeous this morning. Really refreshing

Prices were not bad at all for what it was. Definitely coming back

Had a reservation for a group of 6. We were seated almost 20 minutes late. This could have been a 3 star review but after delivering 3 free starters, the excellent entrees and constantly refilling our bottomless mimosas they earned a 5 star rating. We will definitely return. Between the group we had the Hexx Benedict, pancakes, French toast, omelet and veggie burger. Everyone was happy and the service was great.

Loved it!  Stopped by for Saturday breakfast and only waited about five minutes. The space is so bright and airy, and the food was delicious. I loved the little arugula salad that came with my quiche, and my friend really enjoyed her cinnamon roll waffle as well. It was also super fun watching other tables get some of the zanier items on the menu. There's a Bloody Mary that comes in a little pitcher with a giant snow crab leg sticking out of it! Also saw someone get a drink with dry ice. Would definitely return.
Terrible service. Took 20 min for someone to come up and take our breakfast order and the place was really slow at the time

This place is so amazing.  The food (Jambalaya ) is really good.  Our server Julie is amazing with a great attitude and awesome recommendation.  As a Vegas nut, I've been to over 75 restaurants, and this is hands down a great late night restaurant with exceptional drinks and service.  Thanks Hexx!

This is one of the best places to go for a great lunch. I'm sure dinner to! I was there for 2 nights and ate here twice it was so good. Everything I had was good from the crispy broccoli, asparagus and the crab cakes. Not to mention the view from the patio is awesome day or night.  I doubled back bcuz I had to try the Margherita pizza which was as good as it looks! 

I recommend this place hands down. Esp after the rude service and extremely pricey dishes at some of the other restaurants. Although I don't mind spending for great quality food, I was happy with both the prices, taste, and quality and this restaurant.
was a little confusing on which door was the main entrance.  We wanted to sit at the bar, but was too hot. It was a heated bar that felt more like a sauna...really gross.

We have been going there for breakfast!  Their breakfast is excellent.  The service fantastic.  We were recently there on Saturday and Enrique took care of us.  His attention to detail was great!  A very personable courteous guy who cares about his customers.  He asked us not once but three times if our order was ok and if we needed anything.  We are locals so lucky for us we get to go back!  Try Hexx!  You won't be disappointed
Great breakfast.  Gourmet meets comfort.  Carned beef hash was amazing.  Sean and Matt did a great job taking care of us. Thank you

My husband and I stumbled upon this place on accident trying to grab a quick meal before our concert.  We were so impressed with the service here!  We encountered at least five people during the time we were there, and every single one of them showed exemplary customer service.  It was so refreshing after having so many recent experiences with the opposite here in LA.  The food was fantastic too.  The bun on the burger was amazing, and the meatballs were great.  Next time we're in Vegas we will for sure be coming back!

Um, seriously?  This is the 24 hour choice for Paris?  What happened to the all night steak and egg diners of Vegas past? 

Woke up hungry after midnight and this or pizza were the only choices.  I had wanted to try this place anyway, so why not -- but no, never again.

Pulled pork French fries sounded great.  Well, if you like a big nasty lump of goo all glued together with cheese curds and swamped in some kind of nasty almost barbecue almost mayo/gravy.  Repulsive.  Literally tasted like something a small child would make by mixing every leftover in the refrigerator. 

Clam chowder that came with the dry nasty salmon tasted like a dirty fish tank.  The salmon tasted old and way too fishy.  Gross.  

The burger turned out to be almost decent, hence the 2 stars instead of negative 5 stars I would have given it for EVERYTHING else.  If you're starving to death in the middle of the night and have ABSOLUTELY no other choice than this place, at least don't waste your time on the other swill --have the $20 burger that is almost as good as Wendy's or Burger King. Almost.  

Way overpriced for this crap. -- There actually is not a price low enough for this place. I would pass it up if they were giving away food actually -- Even though one expects overpriced on the strip.  Next time we will uber to the all night taco place or the Peppermill.

Food and drink quality was excellent! we had a group of 4 - We got the carnitas hash, steak and eggs, mandarin orange mule. The potatos are roasted which was amazing. Steak was perfectly seasoned and perfectly cooked. 4 stars because their service was extremely slow and it wasn't even that busy.  Great spot if your not pressed for time.

My friend and her fiance came to Vegas for her birthday. Her fiance and I originally wanted to go to Sugar Factory but since Hexx took over and that option wasn't available we decided to try this place out. We ordered the Jungle Juice drink. It tastes similar to Malibu/Pineapple. It was really good. About 10 or so shots inside. We had the spinach artichoke dip, Loaded fries, Pepperoni pizza and calamari. The food was great. I personally loved the dip and fries. I would have given 5 stars but was disappointed to hear that they don't do anything for birthdays. I was offered a dessert menu and told they'd provide me with candles but I'd still have to pay full menu price. Considering how much $ we spent here I would have assumed they would at the very least speak to management and try to make some sort of gesture even at 1/2 price. Most places do something small for celebratory events. I really hope they consider this in the near future. We sat out on the patio and we got to see the Bellagio fountain show during our meal which made the atmosphere a lot more enjoyable. If you go here, be sure you're ready to spend $ as they are on the pricier side but overall good service and good food. Thanks

I took a recent vacation to Vegas and wanted to do brunch for the first time. I did a lot of Yelp research on brunch places with bottomless mimosas and Hexx stood out above the rest. They did not disappoint we sat outside in which it was a gorgeous day to eat brunch outside people watching on the strip. The service was incredible and the staff was amazing. We loved the mimosas, they're parfait and both breakfast entrees we ordered. The eggs Benedict and farm fresh eggs were amazing. Highly recommend Hexx if you're looking for brunch place.
Great for breakfast. I came here two days in a row. The carrot cake pancakes are amazing with a delicious cream cheese topping. They also have bottomless mimosas to get your morning started right.

We came here after deciding not to wait for Mon Ami Gabi. We decided to sit in the bar and immediately we're served by a nice young man named Andrew. He went through his favourite items on the menu and recommended the pancakes and eggs Benedict. Both were great. The eggs Benedict is served on a bed of scalloped potatoes. 

We opted for the $23 unlimited mimosas and had a blast. The restaurant is clean and has a great vibe. After breakfast we sampled a variety of chocolate and then pick up a few bars to go. 

Great alternative to waiting next store with friendly staff and excellent food.

We had breakfast here which was very delicious! Beautiful decor and a fun environment. The food was amazing and the potatoes wedges/fries were my favorite! I can't not wait to go back and try lunch and dinner! It was a but pricey though

Place is nice. Right outside Paris hotel & casino with a spacious area to sit inside or outside. It's literally right across the street from the fountains at the Bellagio which is a plus. We came here for breakfast on a Monday. It wasn't busy so we were seated right away. Had our drink orders taken shortly after being seated and our food shortly after that. I orders the banana nut French toast and she ordered the regular buttermilk pancakes. Both were cooked to perfection and delicious!! The prices are high on the strip (duh!) but the food we had here was at least worth it and I would come here again!

Chinese chicken salad was cold and fresh and huge- chicken would be better if it was chunks and not shredded. Hummus was served with thin and crunchy pita crisps, candied double fried bacon sounds amazing, but it wasn't living up to the hype, vegas mule was decent. This place has a nice interior- clean and modern. The menu features a lot for every mood. Right off the strip.
Excellent food, well presented and great service. Was a bit pricey for brunch, but I guess this is to be expected given this location.
Awesome food and drinks. Great service. Would recommend to any of my friends visiting Vegas. Will definitely go back.

A nice little place right on the Strip with pretty decent food. We got to the restaurant at dinner time on a Saturday night and were seated immediately, despite not having a reservation. Once we got to our table, though, I think that we were a bit disappointed; the restaurant forgot to swap out their lunch menu outside with their dinner menu, so the meals we were looking at weren't really an option. I ordered a margherita pizza, which was fantastic, though it was pretty pricy for a 10" pizza. The actual entrees were even pricier. The establishment itself was really clean and appealing, with outdoor seating available as well. I'd recommend this as a treat or special occasion!

Hexx is a bit of a Vegas tradition for me, I always go there the day I leave. Well, mostly for one specific menu item: the chicken and waffles, available for breakfast and dinner (!), are very probably the best I have ever had. The waffle is.golden and perfect, the chicken is fried but not so heavily breaded that it's more greasy skin than chicken. It all goes together perfectly into my favorite food for any time of day. 

Well, that's the upside. The chicken and waffles are perfect. Get them. Now for the downside: like most strip restaurants, Hexx is definitely too expensive for what it is. It is a pretty nicely decorated and kept restaurant right off the Paris and with Las Vegas Blvd frontage, but for the price I'd expect good service, but the service at Hexx always seems a little scattered and disorganized. I mean the classic two people trying to take your drink order and then the waiter not being sure they put in your food order right.

Good chilaquiles and chicken and waffles and affordable bottomless mimosas in a chill  atmosphere. Service was great - -JJ took great care of our 10 top even during a very busy Saturday brunch. Our glasses were never empty. Will definitely be back.

I love dinner at this restaurant but brunch is a whole other story. We went for brunch today and were sorely disappointed. The menu is limited and the food wasn't all that impressive. I ordered the veggie omelette which came with an English muffin and potatoes. The veggie omelette was grossly under seasoned and the English muffin was soft and not toasted properly. My friend ordered the meat omelette and she was just as unimpressed as I was with mine. The coffee was not very good which surprised both of us. The total for both was $50 which we felt was way too expensive as the food just was not that good. We will definitely not be coming back for brunch. I gave it two stars for brunch and this is why the average comes out to three stars because dinner is about 4 to 5 stars and so the average comes out to three stars for both experiences.
Evening/ dinner: Some of the dinner items were really good and others were average, yet overall, I would come back here and that gives it four to five stars for. Let me start by saying that it is a beautiful restaurant. Cool decor and relaxed atmosphere. As soon as we walked into the restaurant, from the inside of the Paris Hotel, we saw an area where you could sit four people with pillows all around you and two small but still good sized tables. It was comfortable and I totally wanted to chill there. The waiter told us that if we are having dinner, we really should pick a dinner table as there is not enough room in this area. I wish I had listened to my gut feeling because he sat us at a table with chairs that were higher than your average chairs, which most of the tables have, and it was very uncomfortable for me at 5 foot 4" and I could actually feel my legs falling asleep! I did not want to be rude so I did not say anything but as soon as we were done with the entr√©es, I asked to move back to the lounge area which was so relaxing and everyone agreed we should've stayed there from the beginning. That is just a clue for anyone that is not as tall and there are tables with normal chairs, and by that I mean they are closer to the ground.
THE FOOD: we started out by ordering two appetizers which were the hummus with pita chips and the meatballs. The hummus was just okay. I would not order it again. The meatballs were really good: there are two medium-sized meatballs that come out and the sauce made of tomatoes and cheese around them is delicious.
The entr√©es were as follows: one of my friends got the classic burger and liked it. He said it was not the best burger he's ever had, but it was really good. My friend got the salmon which was amongst clams and a rich broth. She said it was delicious. I got the Seabass, which I was told was one of the chef's favorite dishes. I have to say it was good but not amazing. The roasted Seabass was good, but I have had way way better Seabass. It was on top of a couscous and that was delicious.
One of my friends and I got a drink called the desert smash which consisted of gin with several fresh fruits in it and I loved it. This drink that we got was crisp and clean and it was delicious. 
The asparagus, which was a side, was absolutely delicious. One of my friends got the crushed Yukon potatoes as a side. It was good. I'm not the biggest potato fan so I would not be the best person to judge it but it was good.
We had some very nice people providing the service. We were offered free dessert and two items came out: one was a warm apple pie in the shape of a small round pie with a large scoop of vanilla ice cream over it and the other was a brownie with a large scoop of ice cream over it that was really good. We are not big dessert people, yet I will say for people that like sugar, either item was delicious. I am not a big brownie fan, but the ice cream on top of the brownie was outstanding.
We will definitely be coming back here for dinner. It was a lovely experience with a very nice staff.
There are a lot of items on the menu and it's all about what you like. 
Make sure to ask for a table that you know you'll be comfortable at and if all you're going for is either appetizers and drinks or just dessert, the small areas where you can sit amongst pillows with two tables side-by-side, where four people can fit in comfortably, is really cool.
Great service, great ambience, great location, good food.
We came here because we won a gift certificate at a charity event. I am glad I won it because this was a really nice experience and it exposed us to a very cool restaurant that we are definitely coming back to.
Therefore, in summary, brunch is not worth it and we would never go back and there are way better places in Las Vegas, even in that same hotel, for way better brunch. Dinner is very good and I do recommend it.
TRACEE IS THE BEST. Bottomless mimosas are the bomb. Great atmosphere. Great food. Great service. Go.
The food was plentiful and high quality, every single one of the staff was friendly. Definitely a strong recommendation, just watch out for that Saturday brunch rush.
Jody and Mike provided incredible service! Ask for them if you come to Hexx. We will definitely be back to see them soon!

Bloody mary was bloody awesome. Hangover cure for the win. A bit pricey but its vegas, way better than rainforest cafe. So good, so worth it. Need to fill in more space to post this soooo.... Nom nom nom nom nom nom nom nom mom non nom

Just ate brunch at Hexx (located in Paris) and it was deeeelish!! Bottomless mimosas and had the protein omelette- egg whites, chicken, spinach and an avocado sauce. Served with smashed fried potatoes and an English muffin with fresh raspberry jam! Our waiter was one of the nicest waiters I've ever had! It is a great view to the bellagio from our outdoor table. Beautiful and delicious!!

This place is the perfect place for your Vegas meal. Amazing wait staff and even better food. The view of the strip and Bellagio on the patio is the icing on the cake. Definitely a highlight in my Las Vegas trip! Will be a life time customer.

Of all of the sit down restaurants in Vegas, this is the best I've found so far (there's not much competition though). I've been here two years in a row for brunch now and I really enjoy it. 

This year we got the carrot cake pancakes and the chicken and waffles. The chicken and waffles were a little dry and definitely needed the syrup but pretty good once you added the syrup. The carrot cake pancakes were amazing. They were like eating a dessert. I would definitely get them again. I tried a bit of what my sister got - the chilaquiles which was very good. 

It can be a little pricey depending on what you get at brunch but not too bad. 

All in all this is one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas. There's always a line if you aren't a diamond rewards member though so get there early or be ready to wait.

Great place! Food was great waiter and staff were great and View while sitting on the patio was awesome for people watching.
Sean and Ivan service team were the best in Vegas they were all over it!!! 
I highly recommend this place 
Great job!!

Sometimes the strip has good finds that also include amazing views and food! 

Ambiance: Hexx / Alexxas has a great modern contemporary vibe. There are tables to choose from and also comfy couches to lounge on. In the bar area you can sit in quaint nooks for privacy. The natural lighting from the strip is perfect on a sunny day.

Food: Alexxas has a small bites and tapas menu and the Hexx menu has delicious entree and brunch options depending on the time of day and day of the week. We tried the ceviche, chicken sausage flatbread, and calamari. The calamari was my favorite! It had a light drizzle of buffalo and ranch and was like having buffalo wings but in the form of light and fresh calamari. We decided to try desert with the churro bites - oh man! The caramel dipping sauce has an alcoholic surprise we weren't ready for! The Hexx chocolate dip was Rich and dark and a perfect
Compliment. 

Drinks: We tried cocktails including the key lime martini and the pinky swear sangria. Everything was fresh and light and crafted perfectly. 

Service: our server was prompt and friendly. The churro bites took a very long time but were worth the wait. 

Overall: I am excited to come back and enjoy more of what Hexx has to offer! There's tons of items on the menu to come back for and it's great having a local hangout on the strip that's not too far from
Home!

Had lunch here during a trip to Las Vegas. Overall a great experience and would definitely recommend going there for breakfast/lunch. 

Location: ideally situated right across from some of the major resorts like The Cosmopolitan. Easy walkability.

Service: we were told that there would be a 20min wait and we got seated in 10min! Excellent service as well!

Food impressions: we tried 2 lunch items, both excellent and the portions were definitely on the larger side. 

Breakfast Croissant: amazing croissant filled to the brim with Black Forest ham and aged cheddar. Croissant was crispy and melted in your mouth. Came with a side of grilled fingerling potatoes drizzled with sea salt and some ketchup. Easily one of the better breakfast croissant I've had in a long time!

Veggie Omelet: was very tasteful and filling. Came with peppers, onion, spinach and mushrooms. In addition to the English muffin included they added some baked fingerling potatoes. The croissant is still a better lunch item depending on your preference. 

Service was efficient and courteous. No complaints!

The food? Excellent 
The service? IMPECCABLE!
The mimosas? Amazing

I work in a food restaurant as well but this place impressed even me.  They have great service, they make a personal experience for you even when you are one of 100 checks in the place. Sean was our main server and Myrna was our secondary and both paid so much attention to us it was incredible. So nice and attentive. The food was absolutely delicious but even if it was subpar I would come back surely for the service. Management  here is trusty blessed with great workers

First time dine @this place. Ordered 2 prime rib, but only one available. So, we changed 1 order to rib eye. But the prime rib came out too thick & doesn't taste right. We asked the waiter& he said that's how  prime rib suppose to be. The beef was too thick that was hard for to cut with the knife. For sure we not return to this place, not worth of $

Bottomless Mimosas for $20...need I say more?  Okay very well then, went there on a Saturday morning, Halloween morning...thought it would be early enough (11'ish) to sit on the deck and watch people walk by in their costumes on the Strip.  Got a table outside and ordered our mimosas.  It was a little slow coming, but once it came it didn't stop.  Yippee.  For food, we ordered the overcooked bacon, or something like that as an appetizer but also as a side with our breakfast.  I had the baked french toast.  It was good, almost bread pudding like in texture, a little firmer.  Couldn't finish it - took it to the room ate it later for dessert.  My husband had the Frittata, he wasn't in love with it but he ate all of it.   We'll be back- maybe try it for dinner next time we're in Vegas!

I made this reservation when it was still Sugar Factory, but ended up changing over to Hexx.  It was still a great restaurant and nice to sit outside and watch the people walk by on the strip.  Dessert was still delicious!

This place was disappointing!!! With all the great places to eat in LV you need to do it better not cheaper my wife had the quiche the mere appearance of it screamed Price Club it looked processed and tasted the same.  Good coffee cold bacon and the Carnitas Hash was mostly potatoes!! The service was good our server Amanda was great. But do yourself a favor and walk 100 ft further and go to Mon Ami. Oh plus it's too expensive for the quality.

We went to Hexx twice for breakfast. Banana Bread French Toast was very good and very filling (ate it for breakfast and lunch) my husband got the best Bloody Mary he's ever had there (Farmers Market Bloody Mary) this could be a meal itself if you eat all the stuff that comes with it! Corned beef hash was just average. The second time I went I got the Protein omelet which was average tasting and price was about $16 (average price here for a breakfast for one entree). Chocolate store has good treats as well while you wait (short wait) for a table. Good atmosphere.

The Prime Rib Beef Dip was just okay.  Nice size and they don't short you on the meat all though it is shaved into crumbles.  It had an odd taste to it, a spice or herb was used that's not normal.  Cheese wasn't melted...  Fries were great.

The meal I was dreaming of since we booked trip. Great brunch and we got the best seat on patio on a beautiful weather day. Great for people watching. The service was very friendly and my bottomless mimosa glass was never empty. The sticky bun was to die for. And my husbands chicken and waffles were amazing. Waffles just melted in your mouth. My eggs Benedict was incredible and served over potatoes versus an English muffin. I will def eat here every visit to Vegas.

Best service on the strip and everything tasted as amazing as it sounded!  And the food quality was equivalent to restaurants that are much more expensive- wonderful delicious food at a value price!  And we sat outside on the patio with an awesome view of the Bellagio fountains, great ambience.

The drinks are delicious and the bartender can even fashion and xquisite virgin cocktail. 

However the food leaves much to be desired.... the ingredients are not the best and the huevos rancheros is an abysmal affront to Mexican Cuisine. Fries are good. Sandwich meat and bread are subpar. 

Service is outstanding. I believe with better ingredients and a revamped menu this place would be a gem.

A casual eatery, open 24/7, and we went for a yummy brunch. If it's super busy, just take a seat at the bar and dine there. Lots of classic breakfast/brunch dishes. The bartender was super friendly! Loved the potatoes that came with the egg dishes and the chicken sausage was super yummy!

Stumbled across this place while on the strip one night! I think it used to be the old sugar factory? Anyways Lupita was our server and she was excellent! I have a few allergies and she was able to direct me on a pleasant culinary adventure! I don't go to the strip very often anymore but this was the best meal I've had in a while.

My wife and I have walked past this place several time, but thought it was just a snack place with lots of sweets and ice cream.

We tried their restaurant.  The prices were fair for Vegas.  I had the rib eye, which was made to my liking and my wife had the jambalaya.  Her plate was spicy with a great taste.  The waiter asked if we would like some garlic bread.  The bread was also good, but it was charged separately, which we didn't know.  

For dessert, we shared a brownie and ice cream, which wasn't on the menu.  The brownie was delicious and it was complemented nicely with the coffee ice cream.

We use a groupon we found without any hassle.

Great service from our waiter and staff.  It was a place I would try again.

We rolled up on a Friday afternoon and there was a small wait for brunch. About 10 mins later we were seating on the patio and handed menus. They do bottomless mimosas until 2 pm so it was a no brainer! 1 mimosa for $12 or bottomless for $23. The menu had a great variety of vegetarian and non vegetarian items. My husband decided on the eggs Benedict and I had the veggie burger. This is where one of the stars got docked. My husbands meal was a little bland and had something lacking. My veggie burger with fries was ok the other hand amazing! The patty was thick and not dry at all! The fries were some of the best I've had. Perfectly crispy and flavored with some sort of spice. The portion of my burger was huge where as my husbands wasn't as large. The inconsistency was a little weird. We checked in on the yelp app which allowed us one dessert on the house. I highly recommend the tiramisu! The presentation and flavor together made it so enjoyable. You get to pour the espresso over the cake.  The cream was perfectly sweetened and not over the top. I would suggest this place to anyone visiting Vegas! Wait for the patio seating for prime people watching while you enjoy a great meal.

So happy we decided to try this place. Originally, we were supposed to go to Mon Ami Gabi but they had some kind of emergency going on and they weren't serving anyone, so the bf and I decided to go to Hexx instead. Started off with the shrimp cocktail and crab cakes. OMG... best shrimp cocktail I've ever had. 4 Huge, prawn-sized shrimp that required the use of a with a knife and fork. Accompanying cocktail sauce had a nice kick to it. Crab cakes were delish. I'm always hesitant to try crab cakes on the west coast because I'm partial to the ones I've had on the East Coast. These crab cakes did not disappoint. Slight crunch on the exterior and nice ratio of lump crab and filling on he inside. We decided to share the prime-rib sandwich that came with fries. Big portion, tender meat, perfect for sharing. Comes with an au jus to dip and the horseradish to slather on your sandwich. We left stuffed and happy. Best lunch I've had in Vegas by far. We sat outside so we were also able to people watch their outside patio. Next time, we'll come in the evening so we can watch the water show at the Bellagio while dining. Definitely a memorable spot and can't wait for our next trip back to Vegas to try other items on their menu. Thank you to our server, David for the top notch service that made our day so much better.

Extremely slow, inattentive service. Took an hour to handle a simple brunch order on a weekday despite the place being only half full.  Our server didn't stop by to explain the slow service, and I suspect it was because several of the members of my party were non-English speakers.  Food was decent but overpriced, and not worth the wait.

Great little place for a casual meal with a view.  Our waiter was a delight as well.  The broccolini was sheer heaven.  Wow...I could have made a meal on that.  I had the grilled king salmon with arugula salad and clam chowder and ordered the broccolini to share.  The description of the salmon dish is misleading.  The chowder is not thick but merely a broth that the salmon is placed in with some arugula sprigs floating in it.  You will not be getting a salad or a chowder.  They need to rename this dish.  Thankfully, our waiter explained it to me at the time I ordered it.  The dish was very, very good.  I wanted more of it.  My husband opted for the crab cake and a salad and he was also very satisfied.  Upon receiving our bill, the waiter gave us each a piece of their dark chocolate.  I LOVE dark chocolate but this was inedible.  I had to spit it out.  Bitter beyond words.  I did try some chocolate at their candy shop and it was very good so don't let this discourage you.  If they want to encourage folks to buy their candy, they should rethink those samples.  This will be a stop the next time we visit Vegas.  I do agree with the poster that said the patio seating was uncomfortable.  The view is great but they do need to improve the seating.

Sitting outside on a relatively cool August night in Las Vegas watching the Bellagio Fountains while enjoying some good whiskey, some great appetizers and some fantastic jambalaya, well it doesn't get much better.
Considering it's probably one of the most touristy spots on Earth, the prices aren't that crazy. Of course you're going to spend more than norm, however it is well worth it with Bocelli playing in the background watching the magical fountains shoot a couple of hundred feet up in the air. Great people watching. Excellent service. I didn't have to ask to have my water refilled once.
Highly recommended.

Mother's Day is always a challenge at restaurants but a surprisingly positive experience. Portions a little small. The noise level, however, is out of control and the background music makes it even worse!  Bathrooms are in the casino like so many casino restaurants.  Service terrific - Natalie!  Quite frankly,  it would have been a near perfect experience if not for the noise!

I can only base this review off the appetizer section as we stopped in for a quick bite. The pulled pork fries were so tasty and not a skimpy portion either. The ambiance was beautiful. The staff were all very nice. I would highly recommend coming here. The only down side is anything beyond the appetizer menu is quite pricey. I'm sure it's worth it.

After a rough check-in late at night on 3/22/18, we drifted into HEXX and sat indoors at the bar.  Tom Tom greeted us and he was FANTASTIC.  So friendly, warm and welcoming.  His mixology was superb.  He gave us a ton of recommendations for the local area and we are on task to visit them.  

The following Saturday, we headed in based on a recommendation from another bar to try their New York strip with B√©arnaise Sauce on the side.  We were not disappointed.  We ordered the NY strip which my wife and I split, added their delicious roasted brussel sprouts in a balsalmic sauce, and asparagus wrapped in ham.  WOW!  No huge portions but just right.  HEXX wins for the best restaurant and bar experience during this trip!  Thanks Tom Tom and the restaurant wait staff!

Amazing food. Amazing view. Open 24 Hours. What more could you ask for? 

Get the chicken and waffles. Trust me. 

Went for brunch on my last day in Vegas. We sat outside because the weather was perfect. We were able to look directly at the Bellagio fountain. The most amazing view, it really is gorgeous. Our server walked us through the menu and provided us his recommendations. 

Of course because it was brunch we had to get the bottomless mimosas. They were divine and just enough kick for that last day in Vegas buzz. 

All in all one of the best places we ate it while in Vegas. I highly suggest you put this on your list even if it's 3 AM and you're just leaving the club. Shoot, I'm sure it's even better then.

My husband and I came in yesterday and was pleasantly surprised by the level of service provided 

Not only was everyone helpful , everyone was accommodating. Our waiter was a gentleman by the name of Sean , Sean was very kind , personable and made us feel as if we were at home. Promote him :) 

The food was delicious also!! We came in too late for breakfast so we left but came back and tried the chicken and waffles delectable! Will be back

The food here was incredible! Our drinks were spot on as well as our food. My boyfriend got the jambalaya and there was PLENTY of shrimp, sausage and chicken. It was so full of flavor it was crazy! I had the lobster roll, and in the past I haven't really been a fan of lobster at all but I decided to give this a go. It was soft, juicy, and absolutely perfect. Now I know why people love lobster! And the panna cotta dessert? Forget about it! It's a must have! Everything they did, they did RIGHT! The food is 100% worth the price. You can taste the quality! Our waitress Stephanie was such a delight as well. So sweet and nice. Can't wait to come back!

we came here because a co-worker recommended this place, so we thought we would try it out, and wow!!! amazing!!! from the front desk to the server all the way to the manager matt we had an amazing time! thank u mikhail for taking good care of us!!!

Came here twice with small groups both times. To be honest the staff here is hit of miss. The first time we had an awesome server who was knowledgeable, on top of everything and we really enjoyed him. The second time we had a different guy and he was awful. He barely greeted us, messed up my friends order and took  forever to get us our drinks, our food, our check, you name it. Too bad because I do like the ambiance here, it is trendy and touristy but also casual. Nice place to go on a date or bring your friends after a night out on the strip.

My favorite things to eat here are the smothered fries, which are normal fries but with cheese, pulled pork and BBQ sauce on top. They were amazing both times I had them. There are more then large enough for one person, or good for multiple people to share. I have also had the hummus here which is different. The chickpeas are not smashed, they are whole and so the hummus us not smooth as one might expect. Still good thought I thought.

Their drinks and chocolates are for sure their top items around here. Their chocolate tastes very different from the normal ones we know in the food store but if you love chocolate or are adventurous then why not try it out? The chocolate reminds me of strong dark chocolate, supposedly with no chemicals or preservatives and man can you taste the difference! I personally didn't like it, but my friends did. Worth a try for sure since they bring some samples around at the end of your meal. Their alcoholic drinks are also worth a try- if you come during the day make sure to look out for their happy hour or drink specials and save yourself a few bucks.
Worst coffee ever.! There is no coffee in the cappuccino, they charged 5$ more for an extra espresso shot.

Very good but bring your wallet! Had the jungle juice potion drink at $36... About 2.5 drinks which is run of the mill Vegas pricing. Smothered fries... think poutine but elevated... Delicious! Side caesar salad was one of the best I've ever had. We also had jambalaya and the Hexx burger... Both great but burger overcooked. Lastly good carrot cake. Overall great food and service at a price.

Since we stayed at Paris Hotel, this restaurant is very convenient for us, there is an entrance inside the lobby. Great place for people watching if you sit on the patio. Great view of Bellagio's fountain too however, the menu is limited and the price was too high in our opinion. We spent $90 for 2 sharing an appetizer, a salad and a pizza, a beer and a glass of wine. Good experience, however since there are so many choice of restaurants in LV, we won't be back.

Good food, very noisy so if you're looking for an escape from the constant Las Vegas noise it's not here. Extremely expensive beer and it's not like it was a rare beer find. Service was very good.  I think the food was over priced but good. I wouldn't make it a point to go back.

First timer here! Impressive place and great food. Good thing they're just few blocks away from our hotel. Def going back and try some of their food. Place is amaaaaaziing the servers are very attentive.

My boyfriend and I made reservations on open table to dine here one of the nights on our recent Vegas trip. We called ahead and asked to be seated outside so we could watch the Bellagio fountains. At first the host said that the outdoor seating was first come, first serve, but we told him that our entire goal was to be seated outside, so if they wouldn't be able to accommodate that, then we would just find another spot - he quickly changed his tune and confirmed that we'd be able to sit outside at the time of our reservation. 

The view outside was definitely what we were looking for. The patio also had heat lamps there which would be great for colder evenings. Our server was very energetic, made a few wine suggestions, and brought out some water and our wine. He was mostly scarce through the remainder of our dining experience (but not absent...just gave us space).

We ordered the spinach artichoke dip to start. While the dip itself was delicious, the chips seemed like they were just store bought. Would have been nice to have had something more fresh and/or authentic. Also the chips are too thin for this hearty dip - they kept breaking when we tried to scoop up some of the dip. We then shared the mushroom risotto and the bone-in ribeye. The risotto, while it was tasty, was mostly just OK, nothing incredible. The steak was ordered medium rare, and was served slightly more cooked than I typically prefer, but it was still yummy. Our total bill (which included a bottle of wine, an appetizer, one side, and one steak) for about 160$ after tip. We also had a 5% off coupon from Tix4Tonight. A bit overpriced, as neither of us were blown away by any of the food, but all in all it was an enjoyable experience.
Perfect for a date night or with friends. Brussel sprouts were killer, chopped salad was delicious. Scallops and flat iron were cooked to perfection. You cant go wrong.

Our party of 4 were there this past weekend (May 2017). We had made a reservation and were seated immediately, even though we had requested a table in its busiest area, the patio. Our waiter greeted us with a friendly, warm smile, and got to filling our water glasses and drink orders on the spot.

We enjoyed the Traditional Caesar and Simple Salads to start. The Caesar was large enough for two of us to share, while the Simple Salad was just about the prettiest salad that I'd ever seen! Time and care from the kitchen was obviously present. 

One of us ordered the Cheese and Charcuterie appetizer as a meal, and was not disappointed! Again, the presentation was inspired! Two of us shared the Pappardelle, and were still unable to finish everything! If you love mushrooms, these wild mushrooms will not disappoint! However, the person who ordered the Hexx burger went back and forth between bites of the burger and oohs and aahs! After having a burger the other day at Gordon Ramsay's Burger, he stated that the two were incomparable! 

Finally, watching the Bellagio Fountains as we people-watched, our experience couldn't be matched! Next time we'll have to save room for that Butterscotch Creme Brulee!

Nice spot across from the Bellagio Hotel.. I recommend the patio seating if you like to people watch and get some fresh air.. they have a bottomless mimosa special for $25 and a pretty extensive menu selection of soups, salads, sandwiches and small plates.. I had the Swiss Chicken BLT sandwich and it was pretty tasty.. if you don't like a "peppered" taste to your meal I would pass on this one as the chicken breast was doused in pepper.. I'd do brunch/lunch here again but I'd personally look elsewhere for a better dinner selection..

Being locals we don't hang out on the strip much, but I'm glad we did! We went to Hexx for brunch this last weekend and we were pleasantly surprised. The view and atmosphere were great, as well as the food. My niece is vegan and although the menu didn't have vegan options,our server went above and beyond to explain the vegan options that were available. The service was fantastic, Raphael was funny and knowledgeable in regards to the menu.. top notch service! Management had a strong presence on the floor, being in the service industry myself I really appreciated that. Allison and Andrew were very helpful and attentive. Overall, we had an awesome time and we will be back.

Sean our server was amazing and extremely attentive! The food was amazing, I had the steak and eggs and it was cooked perfect! My friend had a traditional eggs bacon potatoes and the potatoes were next level! Will def be back next trip to Vegas

My family and I had the most amazing experience at Hexx large in part to our server Taylor. She was knowledgeable, friendly, and went above and beyond to make my fiance's 30th birthday amazing! I will be telling all our friends about the amazing customer service taylor provided and her co server Bobby was amazing as well!! The food was amazing - but the best part of our dining  experience was because of our amazing servers. What a wonderful experience - thank you Taylor & Bobby!!!!!
Very good to try all their foods and dessert as well. You're here already anyway why not try it, there won't be any other place to see them or go to with this kind of food and especially the ambience

Hexx is a large beautiful restaurant with plenty of outdoor seating facing the famous Belaggio fountains. They are open early and relatively late. 

I bet Hexx does a lot of awesome food. But their chilaquiles is not one of those things. My friends loved their chicken with waffles and chicken salad. I just made a bad choice. They have a pretty diverse menu I will just have try something else. 

The servers were really nice although the hostesses were a but abrasive even though when we showed up it wasnt packed.

This place was loud. I could barely hear the server. The service was OK. The food was OK. We tried it out because we were going to a show at Bally's and it was close. I'm sorry that I don't remember what I had because it was forgettable. My friends had a special bloody mary and thought that it was overpriced and wasn't anything special. It wasn't a bad experience, but just not my kind of place.

I came here on a Saturday afternoon for brunch. It was around 12pm and we luckily only had to wait about 10 minutes before we were seated. We were able to snag outdoor seating too! The waitress brought water out to us immediately and took our drink orders. I ordered a hot green tea, it comes out with its own little pot which was very convenient so I could refill my own teacup. 

For my entree, I ordered the Gravlax Benedict, which comes with house made gravlax (raw salmon in salt, sugar and dill seasoning), english muffin, hollandaise, red onion and potatoes. The salmon was well seasoned, the egg was perfectly poached and the side of potatoes were amazing. The potatoes had a nice crispy burn to the skin, but not overdone where the potatoes were dried out. I was very happy with my order and I left very full. It was just the right amount of food, I didn't feel disgustingly stuffed. At $17, it was a little pricey, but it was a nice brunch with great service so I would say worth the price.

The restaurant is walking distance from the Planet Hollywood Hotel. They have a bottomless mimosas special for $23 that would be a great pregame before going out to party in Vegas :) HEXX was always packed every time I walked by it and I can understand why, I would definitely recommend this spot, especially for brunch :)
Ask for Tracee! She has the best energy and made the bachelorette party so much fun. We had a group of 20 and she was attentive to each of us! You HAVE to get the bottomless mimosas!
Great outside seating with views of the Bellagio Fountains. A friend of mine who is local to Las Vegas and I grabbed dinner here on a Saturday night. Great food and service.

What a great way to start your day in Vegas!  Go for the Collosal Bloody Mary.  Just looking at it on your table is worth the price...and they're great!  Ask for Rachel for your waitress she's a blast.  We've heard her bottomless Mimosas are the best but we're still trying to finish the Collosal.

We had a wonderful experience here! They quickly sat us and the entire staff was very friendly. Unfortunately, happy hour is bar only (why I'm not giving it 5 stars) but the bartenders and food are top notch. Try the spinach artichoke dip and the brocollini while you're here!
Taylor is amazing! Best waitress and best brunch  Bottomless mimosa and delicious food!

A group of my friends and I stayed at the Paris Hotel for Labor Day weekend and spent that Monday holiday morning gambling in the casino. Eventually, when we got hungry, we debated on where we should go to eat. Somewhere close by and somewhere with great reviews. Then I realized, I have had HEXX kitchen bookmarked for a while now and it is located inside of the hotel, so we decided why not! 

We arrived around 11:30am and it was brunch time. There was a 25 minute wait, so we spent our waiting time drooling over all the desserts they had in the HEXX chocolate bar next door. Everything looked so good, especially the ice cream sandwiches!! (I ended up getting one and omg, amazing!)

Once we got seated, we were overwhelmed by the amount of items they had on their brunch menu. We STRUGGLED to decide. Ultimately, we ordered an array of delicious brunch specialties and it was awesome!

Chilaquiles (3.5/5)
I must say, these weren't bad. But they were not amazing. Plus, you will always get a dish of chilaquiles anywhere that will eventually become soggy. Not my thing really.

Corned beef hash (5/5)
Now, this dish was so freaking good! Probably the best corned beef hash I have ever had! Highly recommend!

Breakfast croissant (5/5)
The croissant was perfectly flaky and so buttery. Let me say that ALL croissant breakfast sandwiches should taste like this one! Nailed it for sure!

Meat omelet (5/5)
This is what I call an omelet. No complaints. BOMB.

Carrot cake pancakes (5/5)
Okay, okay. Now this right here had me craving pancakes for the rest of the week and I am not the pancake type. Waffles are my go-to, but oh my goodness, these were heaven!!

The four stars is because our service was not that great. We had to ask for water re-fills and it seemed like our food took a little longer than it should have. I don't know if it's because we didn't order alcohol, but the service was just alright. Part of the time I really wondered if we were forgotten about. But from my experience working in a restaurant, it seemed like they were transitioning and new servers were coming onto the floor because we really couldn't tell who our server was. 

Anyway, I would still come back! The food was great and it would have been a great pair with their bottomless mimosas! Until next time!
Fantastic food and even better service! Sean was one of the best servers we have ever had. Very attentive and personable. We will be back next time we are in Vegas!

The service was good. Our waiter was nice. View was good. It was the food that was not so great.

I ordered the "spicy jambalaya." I tried jambalaya in Louisiana and really liked it so I thought it would be a safe choice. The spicy jambalaya at Hexx kitchen was easily 4x saltier than what I had at other authentic restaurants. I thought there was some kind of mistake and the chef accidentally poured a lot of pepper and salt onto the dish. The waiter was nice and tried to bring us extra rice, but the rice unfortunately was also almost just as salty. 

This is the first time I have ever complained about a dish because I just could not stomach it down. I drank 4 cups of water and still was not able to finish the meal. 

If you do decide Hexx Kitchen, I would stay away from Spicy Jambalaya unless you like super salty food.
SEAN , SEAN , SEAN ... is he best server . Hands down . This is the kind of customer service I am talking about. Love it !!!!!! Come here and ask for SEAN to be your server !

My new favorite restaurant in Las Vegas & the best bloody mary I've ever had! The food is fresh and flavorful. Our server was super friendly and attentive. The atmosphere is bright and light and homey (I wanted it to be my living room/dining room) Although almost directly on the strip, indoor area with open air patio (we sat right next to the window)-you kinda feel more like you're in California by the ocean-its a refreshing change from a lot of the other establishments in Vegas that tend to
be darker, louder and more elaborate. Definitely will be going back whenever we're in Vegas & I highly recommend you give it a try. (they also have a bar that looked cozy-I told my husband if he couldn't find me later, that thats where I'd be, sadly I never made it-but definitely will on the next trip)
Love this place! Great brunch spot after a long weekend in Vegas! Great prices and bottomless mimosas. Our server Joshua was fantastic!!!!! Love him!

This location used to be another 24 hour food joint called Sugar Factory. Was expecting a better experience. I had the garlic cheese bread for apps.  It's was not your average cheese bread you would expect. It was cut in mini squares and had a little cheese in the center of the tray. Definitely wasn't cheesy enough for me. My wife made reservations in hopes in getting our table immediately upon arrival, keep in mind we have our 9 month son with us so time is valuable.
