We came on time and had to wait 25 mins for our table. They didn't give us a reason why we had to wait. I didn't find the menu very appealing so I ordered a Pepperoni Pizza. Why? Because it's hard to be disappointed with a Pepperoni Pizza! I was playing is safe. My wife had the Crab Cake and didn't finish it. Note to management, if a customer just takes a bite and doesn't eat the rest, I recommend asking if the customer would like to order something else or take the item off their check, especially if you know it wasn't liked. Our waitress was busy with other diners. She didn't even take our drink order. Had to flag her down and let her know we want to order drinks. Back to the pizza, it was good. Cheesy and greasy just the way a pizza should be. Our other 2 guest has some pasta and steak, they didn't complain so I'm assuming it was good. We payed around $250 for 3 drinks, one app, and four entrees. Not bad for Vegas. The place definitely needs to improve on their guest experience.

Such a disaster. Came here on a week night for dessert. It was past 11 pm so the whole restaurant was empty. We asked the server if we were able to sit outside after making such a hassle and throwing a fit she finally said yes. Then she took our order. Like I said we just came for dessert. Got a couple of shakes which literally took an hour to come. 8 don't understand what could of possibly took that long. It's not like we ordered steak. Where were they getting the ice cream from?... Alaska? Didn't even taste good.

Disclaimer: I have worked as a server/bartender for 2 years with over 7 years of restaurant experience. 

I came to Vegas on a birthday surprise trip and I had TRACEE as a server for my final day here. I could not have had a better experience. From beginning to end I felt as if I was embraced and celebrated for being here. She made our party feel overly joyous for choosing this place to end our trip on a great note. 

When the bottomless mimosas were ordered for our whole table and they ran out of champagne for a busy day, she turned to ros√© and embraced it as if I had just upgraded to a premium package. 

Overall, restaurant has upbeat vibes with beautiful touches of class from their silverware, glasses, seating, and decor posted all around: classy and aged-framed tapestries, artwork, grand windows viewing the strip, and well set light fixtures with hundreds of wine bottles displayed on both the ceilings and walls in the bar area.

Food came out with class with no surprise.
10/10 would recommend for anyone looking to celebrate with class and joy. Cheers.

We arrived to Las Vegas around a awkward time so we decided to do a quick happy hour to get some food in our system. 
I stayed at Planet Hollywood so it was a quick walk next door to get to Hexx.
Their happy hour deals are great and the food is yummy! 
I ordered a crab cake and a spinach dip!

Crab cake:
Delicious and they did not skimp out on the crab meat! Every bite was satisfying!

Spinach dip:
The dip was LOADED was spinach and artichoke. The cheese pull was mesmerizing ! 

Service is remarkably awesome, the staffs are so friendly and nice! I definitely will be back! 
Thank you Hexx!
Great place. Great mushroom pizza. Great drinks. Hope you get Julie as your waitress and you'll have a great experience.

This place is overly priced and the food was horrible. Everything was bland and small proportioned. The spaghetti and meatballs tasted worse than the frozen ones at the market. The margarita pizza was bland and had no sauce on it. The "crispy" French fries were thick cut and soggy, not crispy at all. The chip and artichoke dip was decent but so very small for the price. Don't go here, go across the street and go to the Cabo restaurant; it's so much cheaper, tastes better, and bigger portioned.

What's telling about any business is not how it acts when things go as planned; but how it responds when it drops the ball.  Hexx gets a F in this regard.

When I made my reservation that same morning, Hexx said it offered complimentary valet parking for its guests.  When I arrived, the valet said Hexx hadn't updated its website and I would owe $13. After placing my order, I showed the manager on my phone his restaurant's offer and he incorrectly told me that was between me and the hotel.  

As a courtesy to him, I called the hotel.  The hotel's response was, appropriately, that the offer was between the restaurant and me. Again, I asked to speak to the manager and told him that the hotel was correct when it said the restaurant was responsible for honoring its contract, and I would deduct the $13 from payment.

He said he would review the listing to see if had any outs such as "subject to change without notice." Seriously!? I couldn't make this up.   Is that really intended for a situation where the restaurant changes its parking policy 45-minutes after someone makes a reservation because of its parking policy? 

Sure, if the website had adequate disclaimers, it may have the right to respond "screw you," or similar, to its guests if it would like to.  However, disclaimers are not intended for when less than hour passes between a quoted price and someone accepting it (the stock market excluded).  The waiter returned with a $13 credit on my check since the manager wasn't able to find "subject to change without notice." 

***Note to all restaurateurs: if 45 minutes earlier your website stated a cheaper price for anything (corkage, parking, menu items), and someone makes a decision to dine at your restaurant based on that and comes directly to your restaurant, honor the information on your website.***

An appropriate response would be, "Thank for letting us know.  We'll update our website and, of course, honor that price this time." Any other response serves as litmus test for anyone "serving" at your restaurant.

The food was good but the music was too loud for casual conversation.  Fortunately, I was dining solo.  If I had a guest, I would have found it challenging to converse.  For that reason, and my not needing to assume the risk for any restaurant's mistakes, I would not return.

I have to give 1-star for value because paying for valet parking almost doubles the cost of breakfast for a regular, solo diner.  I suspect using the free parking may make going there take too much time for the everyday diner on his lunch break.

My server, Julio, was great.  The service score reflects my overall experience which, even a truly service-oriented server like Julio, can't overcome significant mishaps from management.

Great place for bottomless mimosas! Showed up fairly early around 730am and received excellent service from our waiter Raphael. Protein omelet and the home fries were amazing! I also ordered a farmers market (I can't recall the exact name) Bloody Mary and it was perfect. Great view of the water show if you sit outside!

My husband really wanted desert last night and it was after midnight- everything else was closed but so glad we were walking by the Paris hotel and found Hexxx! They sat us at great seats on their patio overlooking the strip with he best people watching. Everything sounded so good! Thankfully Denise our wonderful server told us all about her favorite deserts and explained that they specialize in chocolate which they make in house- they have so many different types too! We ordered the chocolate peanut butter cheesecake which was amazing and coupled it with the Aztec cake and a scoop of ice cream per Denise's suggestion! 
 Juan who is one of the managers came over half way through our meal to check on us and we ended up chatting and he told us more about the restaurant and how they're trying to offer a 5 star restaurant experience and quality, while keeping it casual - that is exactly how I would describe it!! Juan was so fun and we can't wait to bring our friends and family back to try Hexxx and possibly go to Chateau which he so kindly offered to take us to. Service was awesome, fantastic atmosphere, our desert was amazing! Looking forward to going back to try all the food and drinks we saw everyone around us enjoying! So happy there is finally a late night (better yet 24 hr) restaurant in Vegas that has this quality!!
Tracee kept the mimosas coming! Loved this place! Great food great price. Can't beat bottomless mimosas for $20. We each had 4-5 glasses. Thank you so much for a great afternoon!

Really wanted to love it but just wasn't what I had hoped for my first dinner in town. Chocolate martini was the only thing I loved! My husband's steak was rubbery taste of pasta was bland and just not what I expected for the price point.I know Vegas is expensive but it just felt cheap. Our chopped salad we ordered as an appetizer was wayyy over dressed and took a long time to hit the table after ordering. Server seemed angry but she did her job, none of the staff seemed very happy to be there. Took awhile to get the check....honestly just not the best experience I had while visiting.

Very busy so we ate at the bar.  Had bottomless mimosas that were good.  My husband had the hash and loved it.  I had the hexx Benedict.  It was good.  However when they say smoked meat that's  what they mean.   Good food there is enough to leave you feeling full.

They say first impressions matter... well then I should only give 1 star.  How dare we assume that one of the 3 hostesses would greet us upon entering! I'm so sorry to inconvenience you by wanting a table. 

There was a glimmer of hope... food was not bad.  Good luck getting the check. Did we have a waiter? Apparently not...

Last but not least, thanks for giving us dirty looks when we were finally leaving your sight. Maybe EVERYONE who works here was having a bad Monday? I heard a waiter being rude to a customer and the table next to us was trying to pay their bill for at least 10 mins, but they also had no waiter.

Went here for a late night dinner since we where close by, and happen to be the only restaurant open so late. Got the spicy jambalaya it was fresh, great kick to it and one of the best jambalaya I've had. Their menu isn't the greatest for late night hours, but my choice was a winner !
Great atmosphere & service! Try the Steak & eggs

Spectacular restaurant in the heart of Vegas. I couldn't be more impressed with the food. The eggs Benedict was amazing, as well as this cheese bread we ordered to start as an appetizer. Our waiter was really nice, but took around 30-45 minutes to charge our cards for the bill. This was extremely disappointing. We had thought our waiter maybe forgot about us and went on break with the bill in his apron, maybe he was in the bathroom taking care of business, or maybe he was stealing all of our credit card info! The amount of time to charge 3 cards (split bill) was outrageous. Nonetheless, our cards were eventually charged and we were on our way. I would have loved to give this restaurant a 5 star rating, but due to this major issue it must fall under a 4, which is the utmost generous.

Wow...really enjoyed breakfast.  There were 3 of us and we wanted everything on the menu.  Settled for the French Toast, Omelette, and Eggs Benedict.  Plus we ordered 2 Croissants to share.  The table was full of plates after they delivered and we said no way we could eat everything.  Well...long story short the plates were clean when we left!  We ended sharing or at least tasting everything.  The Eggs Benedict was the best I ever had!  They served it on French Style potatoes layered with gruyere cheese.  SIMPLY AMAZING!!!  Order Croissants for the table but do yourself a favor...order with a side of house made cream cheese sauce. PS...service was the best!!!!

We were accommodated right away because we explained we needed to catch a flight back home and couldn't wait the current wait time of 30 minutes. We had a very nice brunch. The veggie omlettes was good with fresh ingredients and the coffee hit the spot. Although they originally brought out the wrong omlettes they quickly rectified it.

Chocolate sampling? Yes please!

Hexx Kitchen + Bar has taken over the previous business Sugar Factory which I believe moved to the Towne Center location in Las Vegas. They offer a variety of sweet confections as well as savory dishes. However, all that I sampled was some of their vanilla gelato which satisfied my sweet tooth for the moment. We sat along the patio bar which offered a great view of the strip, people watching and the Bellagio fountains.

After finishing my scoop of gelato, we wandered inside to browse their novelty items and came across their Chocolate Bar which was the highlight of my visit here. The offerings were pure chopped chocolate from Peru, Tanzania, Venezuela, Ecuador and Madagascar that had hints of fruit, caramel, almond and marzipan.  It was interesting how the Madagascar's fruity acidity didn't hit the tongue until after it melted. My favorite was chocolate from Ecuador which had notes of sweet marzipan, almond and floral flavors. For those that are chocolate fans, be sure to stop by Hexx for a sample of chocolate from around the world.

4 stars!

Great place with great view.  Food was wonderful from the white bean hummus, to the chopped salad, braised ribs and divine sides.  Must try the roasted cauliflower... has a kick and is so good. But the two best things about this restaurant was the service and their specialty blackberry infused gin cocktail The Desert Storm!

Such a great brunch spot! Sean was our server and made our experience exceptional. Very attentive and great personality. Would ask for him again! The food was amazing and the bottomless mimosas did not disappoint. Will be returning next trip.

We arrived at our reservation for 7:45pm thinking that we had plenty of time before our theatre show at 9:30pm.  We were seated promptly and offered water.  We then had to remind someone to get our waiter so we could order after we had been waiting 15 minutes.  Another 10 minutes we get our drinks - glass of wine and a beer.  Another 25 minutes still no food.  We had ordered the Wagyu steaks ($60 steaks) - one fillet and one ribeye - both cooked medium rare with some side veggies.  We got the waiter's attention asked him about the food and told him we had a theatre show to make.  He said he would check.  Still no food.

Finally the steaks arrive at 9pm - 75 minutes after we arrived at the restaurant - all that for medium rare steaks.  

The food was good - steaks were decent and veggies were tasty.  We didn't have enough time to finish the food and had to leave some of the meal - also no hope of dessert, we never even finished our meal.  We had to track down the waiter to get the check.  We finally got out of the restaurant but missed the first 10 minutes of our theatre show.  We complained to the manager while we waited on the check but he didn't do anything.

This was really poor performance and I will probably never go back to this restaurant again.  Also the fact that they did nothing to correct the problem makes me feel obligated to write this review and warn others - when things go wrong, restaurants need to fix it.

We came here since they offered a Groupon for a discount on dinner. Be sure to check Groupon before you go!
From the name of the restaurant you dont expect such a fine dining experience but we were pleasantly impressed. We came for a late dinner and there weren't many diners inside. The wait for a table was short, but at the table the wait for service was a bit slow but we weren't in any hurry so it was fine. Also being a 24/7 steakhouse I understand how there can be a lull in service at late night. Also there were great views of the Bellagio fountains.
We decided to order the wet aged steaks. No joke, it was one of the best steaks I've had in my life. And I think even more amazing than the steak was mushroom risotto side dish. It was the best risotto I've ever had, tasted like melted butter fused into the rice. If you ever come here, get the risotto. We talked with the waiter how they were able to get that texture and richness in the risotto. The waiter said he used to be a chef (at another kitchen, not at Hexx), and that they made sure to coat each grain of rice in oil while sauteing to achieve that effect. That risotto is how I judge all other risottos. Its that good.
Anyways the service was a bit slow but great, food was excellent, price was decent using the Groupon. We had a great experience eating here.

Overall,  this place was okay.  Not great & not bad.  Same feeling as others... great yelp reviews, but felt over hyped.

Food: great portion sizes, food looks better than they taste (or ...at least the cinnamon waffle). My hubs enjoyed the lobster roll. I enjoyed the french fries. Chicken & waffles were decent.

Pricing:  3 plates & an iced tea cake out to $90ish with tip. Not surprising bc its right off the strip & looks bougie.  

Service: Ehh, our waitress wasn't the most attentive person to us. The servers were great, nice & were more helpful than her.  Took me to be almost finished eating before i could ask for an iced tea. 

Would i come here again? Nope.

Stopped in here because we were looking for a quick brunch before watching football games, and it was attached to our hotel. We decided to sit at the bar, and ordered some appetizers because we weren't too hungry and everything was expensive. Got Mac and cheese (delicious) and the overcooked bacon (great). May try it again on a weekend if I feel like going for bottomless mimosas (only served during weekend brunch).

We got the travelzoo deal and enjoyed every second of our meal! Lovely calamari, yummy salads, short ribs and filet mignon were cooked to perfection. The portions were just right too. We were helped by Maria and Coty - they were super nice and accommodating! My partner and I appreciated their quick service and friendly attitudes! DEFINITELY COMING BACK!
This place is amazing for breakfast, lunch and dinner.  Went to Vegas for 6 Days and ate here 3 times.

Love this place for the bottomless mimosas Sean was our server and he was great.  He was calm cool and collected the whole time. The restaurant was busy but Sean stayed attentive and pleasant the whole time. His sidekick Brandon runs food like a champ. Come to hexx and let Sean put his spell on you.

Really amazing breakfast. I got the meatty omelette, and it was a lot of food and really tasty. The bottomless mimosa deal is 23 dollars and very champagny!
Our waitress Cece was awesome and super helpful.

Would definitely go again!
Standard breakfast food EXCEPT the chocolate pancakes. That was pretty good. With some kind of caramel sauce.
Melissa was wonderful. Such a great experience with my family. They brought a special grilled cheese off the menu request for my little niece. We can't to come back! Thanks Melissa!

Absolutely wonderful experience.My Fianc√©e &I just enjoyed our Pre Wedding meal.We almost over did it. Everything thing we ordered was just Perfect.He had an omelet full of all kinds of meat.I had a delicious waffle with the best Bourbon syrup in the World.We had a Total Grand Experience!!!

Tracee was AMAZING! I just came in from a long flight after my other getting cancelled and when i walked in to greet my friends....she made my day so much better. Couldn't ask for better customer service! Made my day that much better.
Fantastic brunch spot. Bottomless mimosas on point!!! DJ on fire. Food was all delicious. Huuuuuge thanks and props to the best server, Sean, for taking great care of us.

Came here for a birthday with a large group. Patrick and Sean were so accommodating and  awesome, especially with a big group! Our food was delicious and our servers were always on the ball refilling out bottomless mimosas when we needed them! They were so nice and fun, really made our experience in Vegas so fun!! Will definitely come back next time we are in town!

Love this place!
Bottomless mimosas....yes please!
Cadillac Margaritas...yes please!
Delicious breakfast dishes...hell yes!
People watching... oh yes!
Go there

Our server, Maria, was amazing. She was this sweet little edgy girl that was really fun to talk to. Our water was always filled and our table was always cleared of dirty dishes. I would honestly go back to this place just to have her as our server. She was laid back and real, which is a nice difference from the servers that always try to sell you the highest price stuff. The outdoor patio has misters that keep you nice and cool and you can see the fountain show at the Bellagio across the street. We had the broccolini for an appetizer that was amazing. It was fried just perfect and had a nice citrus taste to it. The bolognese was to die for. It was different than your run of the mill pasta because was savory and almost had a little sweetness to it. The Marguerita pizza was super fresh and delicious.

Perfect brunch spot for any occasion! They have $24 all you can drink mimosas until 2! Sitting outside offers the view of the Belagio water fountain shows every 15 minutes as well as fans and misters to keep you cool! The drinks were amazing! If you have a group, I highly recommend the disco ball punch or the $36 Bloody Mary! I love the chicken blt but the spinach and artichoke dip was delicious as well as the salads!!

I love this place! I had the chicken and waffles, with the pickles being the perfect addition to the dish, and hubby had protein omelette. We were both very happy with our food, although it was a LOT and we probably should have shared one dish. Next time I want to try the loaded bloody mary.  I love love LOVE the d√©cor of the place and was impressed at how they made a single large room feel cozy. The back of the restaurant leads directly into Paris Hotel.

Food, drinks and atmosphere were excellent!! Service was horrible! Everyone was friendly, but the restaurant was slow, there were a ton of employees, but it was hard to get a waiter to your table when you needed anything.

We had breakfast and bottomless mimosas.  It was excellent!  I had the lox waffles which were an excellent choice if you want a savory breakfast.  My companion had the cinnamon bun waffles....yummy but very sweet!   We also had the over cooked bacon and it was super good.  View was great and service was decent.  I would definitely go back!

Tried to go there Wednesday afternoon the 25th but was a fail. We put our name in and received a text that our table was ready. We went to the host stand and which she said it would be just a moment. Then watch 3 other parties walk in and get seated right away. Not sure if the hosts need to be re trained on how to seat people or they are not able to handle the volume of guests coming into the restaurant.

Excellent!!  Came in for happy hour.  The waiter suggested the fried broccolini and it did not disappoint!!  We shared the charcuterie tray and there was way more food than we could finish.  Will definitely be back when we visit again!

Came for dinner. Service was 4 stars, food was overpriced and was disappointed 2 stars.  Had their fried Mac-n-cheese app and Caesar salad. Too expensive for the mini portions. My friend got a soup and really?  $10 for a minuscule bowl. Save your dough and eat at Pink's.

Just landed in Vegas. Perfect spot to brunch. Bottomless mimosas filled to the brim. Was given VIP treatment. Felt like a gluten free Celine Dion. Our waitress Clare was amazing. We tried to get her to come out with us, but she professionally declined.

Love love it. The food was definitely top notch, but what was better was the hospitality. Sean looked after our table & he was the best host there can be. The lady at the entrance clearly doesn't smile so you go in wondering what to expect. But he got us a table of our choice, adjusted the pizza to our choice & looked after us really well! Thanks Sean.

Okay so they have a 36 dollar silly cocktail on the menu!  I guess it smokes. Anyway, we went there about 3 in the afternoon and they had several tables on the patio overlooking the strip.  We went in and the hostess said they had an hour wait.  We insisted we be seated and were at a dirty table.  Then it took a long time for the waiter to come and he was kind of rude.  I looked at the menu and they gave me a crappy brunch menu at 3.30 in the afternoon.  We got up and left.  The place was a mess and the staff was unprofessional and rude.  The food is very expensive so I expected better.
Great location. Food was good but I didn't like the chicken in the protein omelet. Other than that id be back to try more menu items
Lots of covered outdoor seating right on the strip. Went at noon on a Wednesday and sat right now. Food came fast. Very fresh.

I will give this restaurant a two for the service and the feng shui. Unfortunately, the food tastes worse than most of the buffets around Vegas. The Eggs tasted like they had been cooked a 8am and served to us at 11:30am. We got the "over cooked bacon" at it was cold and probably cooked along with the eggs at 8am. The French toast and pancakes where okay. Nothing special! Only way we come back is for the bottomless mimosas.
Hexx which is the rebranded Sugar Factory is a great find. Super delicious food and bottomless mimosas.

For those visiting Las Vegas, you'll be pleasantly surprised dining here. I went up for the weekend for a bachelorette party and realized that it's not as cheap to eat here as I thought. It wasn't until our last day in the city that we stumbled upon Hexx. 

What a modern, open, and spacious place! You'll love eating here and being able to watch the fountain show across the street at the Bellagio. 

As this was the last day in Vegas, the thought of endless mimosas almost did me in. I chose iced tea instead. As for brunch entrees, collectively we had: the classic burger, French toast, omelette, and the prime rib sandwich. 

Not one person had a complaint. We gobbled up just about everything. These portions are HUGE so don't be turned off by the price. The fries are deliciously seasoned and fresh out the frier. 

I inhaled my burger -- it was absolutely delicious. Warning: it appears to have a thousand island dressing (or mayo /kethcup). Make sure to clarify which sauce(s) you want on your burger. 

After the meal, make sure to take your receipt to the chocolate store next door and get yourself something half off!

Favorite brunch place in Vegas thus far!  Let's start with the service, I thought our Waiter looked a little bit stressed out while serving our table, since we had a party of 7, I forgot his name, but he did his very best to keep it professional, he was friendly and came by once in a while to ask us how we are doing while attending other customers. Since we had 7 people we had the opportunity to try a lot of the amazing food as a family style. But I especially think they did well with their carrot pancakes and the chicken waffle, they made the chicken so well!! Very crispy on the outside and very tender inside! very flavorful! The drinks were also amazing, we got the flamingo and the Elixir. I much much prefer the taste of the flamingo it is so fruity, I can really taste the guava I love guava!!! The Elixir was very fun to look at and great for pictures and videos, but after that flamingo drink nothing else can taste better! I would say the only item that I was not a super huge fan of was the pizza carbonara, I thought it was slightly dry but not the crispy kind of dry. Other than that everything else was fantastic! And it was a great touch when the waiter bought a small red velvet pastry for our friend who is getting married to congratulate her, it was nice that we didn't even ask for it! He was still very sweet even tho we can tell he was a bit overwhelmed.
I ordered a takeout and waited for over 40 min to get my food. The waitress is not helpful at all and the management is confusing...

We got a sampler of chocolate at HEXX instead of committing to a large $6 bar

Chocolate: 2/5
- 71% Dominican Republic dark chocolate  - Bitter escalates to a sour taste
- 73% ecuador dark chocolate  - Dirt plastic taste
- 47% ecuador milk chocolate - this was the last one and best of the bunch but not the best milk chocolate I've had

Of the small sample size of HEXX chocolate I tried, I would not recommend paying a premium here.

What honestly makes this restaurant great is how it isnt named after some douche bag celebrity chef like "Gordon Ramsey" "Emeril" or "Micheal Mina" -clearly an exploitative way to make money off your name without actually doing anything. The food was glorious(white chocolate burger bun) and the bartender Craig was a solid professional who truly understands the science of mixology without being a know it all. The "all you can drink mimosas" is a miraculous way of being inebriated in Vegas. HEXX's clientele radiates CLASS with the type of gentleman who takes a girl on a date and covers the bill without expecting a blowjob. I would recommend this place to anyone and not just for dinner but for hosting weddings, funerals and even bat mitzvah's.

ALEX AND ELAINA ARE THE BEST!!! 
So grateful for the amazing service. Not to mention the incredible food. But they are what made it over the top exceptional service.

When you work in the restaurant industry you are unable to enjoy yourself sitting down for a brunch because you pay attention to everything behind the scenes. But Elaina and Alex made me forget I ever worked in a restaurant before. And that is the highest compliment I could ever give. 
Thank you Hexx// bar side Alexxa (where we went) for giving us the best birthday celebration we could imagine

Horrible customer service. The waiter took 20 minutes to take our drink order and by that time we ordered dinner as well...45 minutes later, no drinks and no food. The only thing that came was my sons milk. We were seated at 9:15 came to us at 9:35 and at 10:10pm we still had no dinner. Since I asked for our check for the milk because I was ready to go, all of a sudden (after another 10 min wait) the manager and food came out. I refused and wanted my check since I still hadn't even received my drink yet.  The manager didn't even apologize for being late or anything just asked if we wanted our food or not. I'm like can I at least get my beer? Needless to say they suck! Unless your cool with waiting 1 hour for your food then this place might be for you.

This review is based on two separate visits. The first time we had an amazing waitress. My meal the pizza margarita and chocolate budino was not amazing. Since the waitress was we went back. Our second time the waitress could not be anymore less engaged. She did not get our drink order. We had to call her over to place the order. My pepperoni pizza arrived and crab cakes and she never showed up again. After we finished our meal we were ready to order dessert but after 30 minutes of waiting and had to ask someone else to find our waitress we decided not to spend another dime there. They at least comped my drink. The manager was nice and apologetic and did her best to smooth the situation.

I came with my four girlfriends and I cannot complain about one aspect. The open wall/windows were a wonderful addition. The decor is simple and beautiful. The brunch offered anything you could want. The bottomless mimosas offered to us by our server JOSH!!!! were the.best.part. He was so friendly and accommodating and attended to us with a to-die-for smile. The fact that his family was from South Boston (we're from Boston!) was an added bonus. 

Basically everyone in my group concluded that the mimosas and JOSH's baby blue eyes, freckles and butt were the best part. We would recommend this restaurant to anyone. Thank you!

Got into Vegas around 9:00 AM...went to Caesar's, nobody open until at least 11 AM. Wandered the strip looking for brunch menu. Happened upon HEXX. OMG. without a doubt, the best food and service I had in Vegas. Wonderful waiter, decent wait time, great seats across from dancing Bellagio fountains. And the FOOD...brunch: perfect omelet, crisp but not greasy potatoes, UNBELIEVABLE carrot cake pancakes. Those are a must-try!

Hexx Kitchen made us feel welcome. Our server, a kind and generous Nigerian man named Tulo (or something close!) could not have been more accomodating. Best dining experience in our entire trip!
Adorable patio with a great view and delicious food! Went with my family and was very well taken care of by Alex and Sean. Will definitely go back next time I'm in Vegas.

The food was very good. We came for brunch the hex burger was amazing. Couldn't really taste the white chocolate but the burger with their pickles had a great flavor combination. The turkey club was very good as well. The cranberry is in the bread which gave a slight hint of sweet flavor. The server was also so nice, someone got something they weren't really a fan of and the server offered to get him something different and wanted to be sure we were happy with everything.

Went here for brunch on Saturday and were told it would be a wait of 20 to 30 minutes. We decided to try bar section to avoid waiting and found two spots at the bar end. We were greeted with friendly and fast service that lasted throughout our dining experience. No service complaints whatsoever. 

Onto the menu, they had a wide variety of options available. Something for even the pickiest of eaters. While scanning the options, we came across a unique eggs benedict offering. Instead of the usual bread or biscuit offering as a base, HEXX Benedict used scalloped potatoes. I never considered this as a possibility, but don't think I can go back to normal benedict now. It was the best version of eggs benedict I have ever had. Egg cooked perfectly, potatoes were just crispy enough, and the sauce had so much flavor. Must have for fans of eggs benedict We couldn't pass up the offering of bottomless mimosas for $23. Signage out front claims this offering is available daily until 2 pm. As we got close to empty an employee will fill back up. Make sure to ask for an extra in a to-go cup for your trip around the casino or down the strip. The prices are what you'd expect from the location. Hexx has a chocolate store located next door for a variety of sweets available after a meal. Overall I would recommend this place for those visiting the strip. Can't go wrong with great food and bottemless mimosas for brunch.

Hexx was great! The kinky drink was magical, and seriously yummy. I ordered the short rib and absolutely loved it. My friend ordered the New York strip; it was slightly under cooked for our liking but our waitress Chelsea took care of us. Completely satisfied, would recommend to anyone. Ask for Chelsea, she made our experience tonight spectacular!

This place was so good! I'm usually daring when it comes to trying new foods, so I tried the Johnny Cakes. So delicious! It tasted similar to cornbread pancakes and topped off with a maple jalape√±o syrup... not to mention bacon! I highly recommend. Tracy was our server and she was downright awesome. As a server myself in the past, I always pay attention to certain aspects that go with being a server, and she for sure was at the top of her game. She made the experience even better, which is highly valuable in wait staff. Thank you! Keep being awesome.

Our server was friendly & knowledgeable, but the wait was painfully long!  My husband & I came here on a late Monday morning thinking we'd have a relatively quick meal before moving on with the rest of our day...we ended up spending over 2:30 hours here!  My husband enjoyed his burger, but my chicken sausage benedict lacked flavor.  In the end, the manager took 30% off our bill, to make up for it.  I probably would not bother going here again...there's so many other great options that won't hold up your day.

I ate at Hexx for the first time, my friend and I were wanting places we can't eat at home. We split a pizza and cheeseburger, kind of what you would expect of a cheeseburger and pizza. We had made our reservation on the open table app and we were seated right away, the staff was super friendly and nice. Our food came out pretty quick too. Both meals were really good, they even gave you a little chocolate sample at the end (wasn't my favorite, but it was still cool since they make their own).

We had breakfast here, my BF had the traditional eggs & bacon breakfast, I had the wonderful tasty blueberry pancake. It's only one very large pancake, but so filling one is all u need. The coffee was really good here too! Nice place to eat & watch people walk on the Vegas strip. Lots to see & talk about that's for sure!

Came here to eat with a group of friends since we were told the food would be taken take of since there was a power outage just three weeks ago. We end up finding out that they charged us full price and a broken promise. The other manager that told us about the free meals wasn't around but that's honestly not our problem. It's your establishment, when a worker fucks up it's on you. Other then that the food took forever, my steak was overcooked so I had to wait another 15 mins. The server was very sweet, but it was overall a bad experience.

Hexx has such a fantastic atmosphere with the patio being right across from the Bellagio water show and underneath the Paris' Eiffel Tower but the food quality is two stars at best. I reserved a table for 8 for a friend's birthday party and the experience was disappointing. The drinks were probably the second best part of the visit next to the sights, the drinks were shareable and had 8-10 shots and a pretty presentation. I wasn't able to try one so I opted for a virgin strawberry mojito which was pretty good. We ordered a variety of food from the guacamole to pizza and everything was pretty bland. The burgers had stale buns, the pizza was way too greasy, the pasta was bland. I ordered the mushroom pappardelle and I shouldn't have let our server talk me into adding shrimp because I couldn't stomach any of it and even though I literally didn't take one bite of the shrimp, she didn't ask what the problem was or even apologize for talking me into something I knew I didn't want. Adding garlic bread to your pasta costs extra and wasn't worth it. At the end of our dinner they came out with a tiny piece of cake for our friend and had the candle sitting on the plate all by itself so naturally the candle blew out and fell over before reaching my friend and the server just said I'm sorry, worst presentation ever and ran off. It was lame to say the least. Then two tables over we see a beautiful birthday treat come out with three well lit candles so that was even more upsetting. We ordered another dessert, the warm cookie Sunday and it was awfully dry and too thick to be considered a cookie. More like a dry chocolate chip cake. Just awful. For a place known for sweets, the desserts couldn't have let me down more. I won't return to Hexx and I will not recommend it. Also, the cherry on top, I came home and food positioning commenced. The papardelle DID NOT sit well.
Craig, Romo, Tom! Awesome servers I'm definitely coming back for them! It's my 21st Birthday and they definitely made it memorable ! Great service and awesome people !

If you're hungry dont go here unless youre willing to wait! We came on a tuesday brunch and waited 40 minutes till our orders came in . We were just drinking our coffee and tea so by the time our food came we lost our appetite. Not worth for a pricey brunch

Ate brunch here and maaaannnnnnn this place is incredible.  Took the colossal Bloody Mary down solo.  It's incredible!  Service was amazing, Tracee was on point!  Food was great, ambiance is incredible, such a perfect way to kick off our Vegas trip!  Definitely recommend checking it out.    Thanks for an amazing meal!!!!!!
I just want to say the view was amazing, Josh our server gave is exceptional service he made our experience even more wonderful! Thank you Josh!!
Great patio spot overlooking the Bellagio fountains. Their bottomless mimosas were a decent price and the food was great. Check out their store next door for cute boutique souvenirs and candy.

The restaurant was only 1/4 full but it took us 40 minutes to get our food.
The Wagyu steak came out well done. We asked for medium. This is not acceptable. If I'm paying for Wagyu steak, don't serve me jerky and expect me to pay for it. The burger came out entirely wrong-as in the wrong burger. My child had to wait an extra 20 minutes for the burger to be remade. By the time the burger came out, half our party had already finished their entrees. As a result, we were late for our next exciting Vegas excursion.

Good fresh food. Generous portions. Pity no light meal options (half portions for sandwiches). Great, attentive service. Got offered coffee to go as part of bottomless coffee offer - which impressed the living daylights out of me because most establishments try to squeeze every penny out of you. Winner!

We had a great dinner we ordered short ribs, scallops and salmon which is very good and we even ordered the artichoke palm salad and we got to share our food and tastes every single one of their food it was very good. excellent place to go. I highly recommend. very classy have a great atmosphere and they are very customer service.
Best lunch I ever had! Lobster roll was unbelievable! Thanks to Tracee, our photobombing waitress!

The food here is absolutely delicious but it does take awhile to actually get the food to the table after ordering? Not sure why tables that were seated after us got food before us ?  We ordered a meat omelette and an extra order of potatoes not a lot of food to take 25 minutes?  Anyway besides the wait everything was great- food -service and atmosphere.

We stopped for breakfast. Food was great! Perfect location for people watching. Nice selection on menu for either breakfast or lunch items. We both had omelets and left satisfied. Didn't disappoint considering it's a bit touristy.
Best corned beef hash that I've ever had in my life & bottomless mimosas $23.. I'm in love.

So I've eaten here before, after 12 AM. This time it's a bit earlier. We waited maybe 5-8 minutes to be seated inside. Our waiter was just okay. He was semi attentive in the beginning and then once our dinner came out, he disappeared. Never came back except maybe once to ask how things were.  I did notice that he was always at the table next to ours, but never at ours. That was irritating. He came back at the end to delicer our check, and that was it. Expecting a tip for what? That I don't even remember his name isn't surprising. 

It also was a nagging comment in my head that maybe he didn't want to wait on a group that looked like they wouldn't tip as much as the table next to ours. I get that all the time when I go out, I'm 30 and I tip based on service. If my service is terrible, do I think you deserve 15% or more. No. If you did amazing maybe you'll get tipped 20%. I guess it was the attitude that out waiter put off was not very pleasant. I want to say his name started with an M? Older gentleman, I think he wears glasses.  

On the other hand, the gentleman replenishing our waters and getting us boxes for our leftovers was great. Spencer, good friggin job. We joked throughout the meal about leaving a pitcher of water at our table, because he was frequently back refilling all of our waters. As soon as our cups were either half full or empty, he was there.  I'm hoping he got some of the tip we left and it didn't just go to our lazy waiter. He took away our dishes right away. 

Okay now onto the food.  So the menu is alright. We ordered the Caesar salad, seafood on ice, braised short rib, wagyu burger, brussel sprouts, broccolini, and the mushroom risotto.

The Caesar salad was not bad. The seafood on ice was okay. The crab legs were super cold and tough to eat without a small fork. The prawns were slightly overcooked. The tuna poke, shrimp ceviche, and lobster salad missed their mark. The garnishes on the plate were mostly inedible. Not a good choice.  

We ended up asking for clarified butter for the crab. The lobster was not bad, it wasn't over cooked and was tender.  

Hands down, the braised short rib was the best thing I've ever had there. It was the size of my forearm and the meat was just fall off the bone. There could have been more sauce that they braised it in on the plate.  The mashed potatoes were tasty, but a bit gummy. The acidity of the Brussel sprouts on as garnish was a bit much. 

I ended up eating the nicely charred brocoolini. That with short ribs and mash was delicious. I would definitely order this again. 

The wagyu burger was like an burger. The taste was alright, and the texture good. But it came out rare when we asked for medium. The pepper bacon was thick cut, good flavor. The fries were forgotten among all the food we had. Not sure if it was $23 amazing. 

The mushroom risotto needed to be cooked a little longer. When the rice still has a bite to it, and it wasn't creamy like risotto should be. The starches did not release. Risotto is a timely dish. You rush it, it doesn't come out right. Mom said flavor was good, but texture and execution were not. 

Overall I would come back. The view was great. Got to see the Bellagio fountain show.
Good food. Decent Bloody Mary. Sat us on the bar side where there were loud speakers. Hard to talk. Ask for left side.

I gave this place 4 stars and had the food not been delicious I would of given less. When we got there there was a wait but the hostess said we could eat at the bar no wait. Ok as soon as we sat down a server was over to give menus and get drink orders. Than the wait started. When he came back to take our order he didn't bring drinks and acknowledged that.   I'm ok waiting for food to come because I want it fresh. It water and soda shouldn't be a long wait.  The food was filling and delicious.

First time experience and will definitely be returning again on our next trip to Vegas! Food was delish and service was great!! Carrot cake pancakes were the best I've ever had!!! So glad we made a quick stop before heading home.. prices are a tad high but I definitely don't mind paying for good quality food and service!!!

I bought a dinner n show ticket n this place was the restaurant to go to....hostess was going to seat me in sunny area but asked for a diff seat away from sun..got a nice better seat ..i ordered a cocktail..tried the hypnotizing strawberry..deelish! Dinner was a prix fixe menu..several items to choose from..i chose the maryland crab cakes w/lemon aioli..big portions n delicious! My entree i tried the fried chicken n apple cheddar waffles wit bourbon maple syrup topped with sliced, chopped pickles..chicken very tasty..waffles nice n fluffy inside n crispy outside..big portion i could only eat half! But it was yummy! dessert was a single serving box of dark chocolate to take home..i guess they want us to make it in time to the show..which i did..awesome food n service..i will be back!

Really cute restaurant atmosphere and super fun little candy and thugs store!!
The food was different but we enjoyed it! The atmosphere is very bright and friendly...great waitress!! Sad I can't recall her name, because my Sangria was awesome and delicious, along with the pita style chips and yum hummus...we all required another batch of the chips in order to finish the hummus..lol!! The store was great fun, especially for my kids and my coffee was superb!! We are coming back to sit outside and enjoy it more!! Great place!

Had the chilaquiles corn beef hash and roasted beets. 
Chilaquiles good 
Corn beef hash hubby liked it very much but slightly too salty which sometimes happen with corn beef
Roasted beets good . Have had better versions with goat cheese and not worth 18 dollars for a salad
All items are expensive considering it's not a mind blowing experience 
I would hope for more chocolate in the menu items considering their brand but they r normal American cuisine 
 Cannot beat location for the tourist. We r locals though. Nice decor
Service is average . Bit of a wait time
I had a groupon. I am not bothered to return .i wasn't that impressed.

The breakfast food was excellent, service was amazing, and you couldn't ask for a better view of the strip. It is right across the street from Bellagio. I definitely recommend the outdoor seating. Sean and Crystal were both top notch!
Went there for brunch and had bottomless mimosas with the ham and cheese croissant. The mimosas were amazing but not as amazing as our service! Jody, hands down best server we've ever had in Vegas!

Absolute favorite location. Great view of bellagio fountains. But what makes a place is the service. Tracee our server was the best waitress of any restaurant we dined at while here in Vegas. She was friendly and prompt.  A great smile and genuinely cares about customer service. 5 stars for Tracee.
The wine took forever, the food was terrible and the check was overpriced.  We were both disappointed.  Not worth trying.

Love this place. Bloody Mary is amazing, food is great! 

Always on the itinerary when I come to Vegas. 

Our server Sean (007) was fantastic!!! Friendly, attentive and on it even with like 6 tables!!!

This place was great in so many levels!
1) Location: right in front of the Bellagio fountain if you sit in the patio, at night the atmosphere is alive because of the club atop the restaurant.

2) Food: although my ribeye was overcooked, i still enjoyed it, had enough flavor to compensate for the slight toughness. My girlfriends' Filet was on point. Pricing is reseaonable. 1 thing i didnt like was our server didnt let my girlfriend substitute her asparagus for something else. Im a server & i know it isnt really a problem at all to do that..

3) Drinks: they upgraded from the Sugar Factory's goblets to these even bigger POTIONS! pretty exotic looking drinks with the dry ice. Tried the Jungle Juice & Purple Haze, JJ was excellent!

4) Service: other than the asparagus i cant really complain! The bald busser there is really kept an eye on us & took every plate away asap without us having to ask. Shoutout to him!

5) Time: its pretty packed during the day, but they still open a little later than most restaurants. Went in around 12:30 & they were open a whl
Ile longer after that

Overall, this place is definately worth coming!

Looking for a place to eat where my boyfriend could have his typical breakfast food but I could have a meal that didn't consist of eggs, cheese, or meat. Harder to find then we expected but Hexx turned out to be perfect. He got a standard breakfast of pancakes, eggs, and bacon and I was able to get a veggie burger with some breakfast potatoes and coffee to make a burger qualify as breakfast. The food was awesome and the portions were big. Our server was Sean. Sean was friendly, professional, funny, and very attentive. We made quite a few modifications to our order and he brought out exactly what we wanted. They also had a bottomless mimosas deal that we didn't take advantage of because we were heading home after breakfast but I will definitely be going back for the mimosas, the yummy food, the pretty atmosphere, and the great service.

Fresh? Not so much at Breakfast.

$5.95 Minute Maid OJ from concentrate, cold coffee (read: been sitting in a coffee pot for a while) and a moderately cold French toast dish.

Maybe they were just waking up - everything was corrected but still missed the mark on their first attempt.
Tracee was THE BEST! She had a bachelorette party of 18 and made it so much fun!!!! Food was amazing, and my mimosa glass was always full!!!

After having been to Vegas over a dozen times and noticing that this restaurant is always packed, I finally decided to put myself on their busy waiting list for a table on their patio overlooking the strip and it was worth it. We waited about 45 mins for a table on a Saturday morning around 10:30 which I didn't think was bad considering the day and time. It honestly went quick because we wandered close by until we received a text that our table was ready. I had their breakfast croissant served with aged cheddar, ham (which they don't skimp out on) and a scrambled egg. The croissant was so good, flaky and layered with butter! It was a giant breakfast sandwich but worth every bite and calorie. Loved it here and will be back for sure.
AMAAAAAZING food!! & our server was awesome and patient! This place is a must!! All the sandwiches are amazing!

The food is amazing! Also big portion too. Sean I want to personally thank you for the amazing customer service you provided my friends and I! Your energy and vibes was on point! Will come back for sure on my next Vegas trip! Thank you Sean and Hexx team!

Stopped in for a light lunch yesterday. Menu is fairly simple but has plenty of choices to please a group with a variety of tastes/dietary requirements. 

We started with bloody mary's - one was "bacon infused" and the other was spicy. Both of them were tasty but seemingly light on the alcohol (which was fine...we weren't looking to get loaded). They have several special bloody mary choices - one of which looks like a meal (and it's $38...)!

We ordered one of the appetizers: candied bacon - which was just OK. Tasted like bacon; was expecting maybe a bit more sweet based on the description (maple glazed and cacao nibs). Also, a piece of wax paper got cooked up and delivered with the bacon...so that was a little weird. Kitchen dropped the ball on that one.

I had shrimp cocktail for my lunch and it was 6 pieces of very nice, jumbo shrimp. My companion had a burger and enjoyed it. 

Service was very good - efficient and friendly.

After reading some of the reviews, it seems that this might be a better choice for a decadent breakfast/brunch.

I was finally able to eat here! I have had their candy and chocolate but not food. We sat outside looking at Bellagio. Great for the water show. It was late night and they had a 10.00 breakfast special. We got that and it was great. A huge portion of food for a great deal. Staff was friendly. They even had no problem moving people to the outside heaters if asked. All around great service. I can't wait to go back.

Loved this place, from the excellent service to the great food. I had the chicken and waffles and boy it was instant hangover cure (the bottomless mimosas might have helped too). The chicken was well spiced, nice and crusty but not oily. At first trying to finish my plate seemed daunting but I knew leftovers just wouldn't be as good and couldn't let this goodness go to waste. But our waitress (Tracy?) was very friendly and lively so we stayed long enough that I was able to catch a second wind and finish enjoying. Outside patio is perfect for people watching, which is half the reason to go to Las Vegas anyway.

HORRIBLE customer service. The greeters were extremely rude and unwelcoming, giving me dirty looks when I asked a question. I decided to still try this place out despite them, due to the simple fact that I LOVE the sugar factory. Well, I was disappointed because this place does not compare to the sugar factory in any aspects.  After being seated my waitress set menus on the table and walked away before greeting us. She then grabbed our wine glasses (before asking if we wanted any wine) and replaced them with small water glasses. At this point she still did not say anything to us. Serval minutes later she finally approached us and asked if we were ready to order and never offered us drinks. Throughout the entire meal she wanted very little to do with us. She would set down our food while turning her head and leaving before we could talk. 
The menu is much smaller, less variety, and their dessert menu is very poor. The food is overpriced, I could barely get anyone to give me service, talk to me, or even look at me for that matter. The view of the water show is gorgeous, but not worth it. The interior is also a failed attempt to look classy; mismatched furniture and decor. I also sat in a wicker chair, more proof that this place is a failed 5-star attempt. I do not plan on returning.

Overpriced for food that was a glorified of Chili's if that. It did not take me long to get seated to the Ambiance is great you can see the Bellagio water show from outside which is nice however the service really does suck the taste of food including salad was Bland and all items were highly inflated most likely due to the area in which it was the seating was elegant and stood out to me very modernistic but as far as food very poor

I can't even just explain it. You gotta eat the sh**. You take the 1st bite and gotta sit it down, stare at it, get nervous because it's gotta be some crack or somethin in this sh**. Bite it again to see if u were trippin. Too good to be true. Oh I'm speaking of the banana pudding ice cream. The mango chile sorbet is f**king awesome too.

Recently went to Vegas and needed a place to have good brunch. I have to say, This place is a must! We got the bottomless mimosas that happen to be real mimosas (aka champagne w/ a splash of OJ), the carrot cake pancakes which I 100% recommend if you like carrot cake, and I got a made to order omelets. I got a spinach, mushroom, bacon, and light cheese omelette that came with a side of garlic country potatoes and a biscuit. The garlic potatoes tasted like the garlic fries at AT&T park in SF.
Waited forever for drinks to come and waited nearly an hour for the food to arrive. Wasn't even busy at all. Don't think I'd come back here to eat but I would go back to the candy store.
Best brunch spot on the Vegas strip. Food was excellent and the boozy brunch was reasonably priced. Would definitely come back !

Came here for brunch after my sisters bachelorette party. I had made a reservation for the 10 of us and we were sat promptly outside on the patio as it was a beautiful day. I ordered the lobster roll which was delicious and the unlimited mimosas which were probably the best mimosas I've ever had.

We had lunch at Hexx today and it was delightful! It was crowded and we had a large group, but our waiter Sean crushed it. He was on top of our mimosas the whole time and was able to split our checks efficiently despite moving tables and more people showing up. Couldn't ask for a better experience!

I was very impressed with this place.  The seafood sampler was unbelievably delicious.  Highly recommend that for the table to share as an appetizer.  Braised Short ribs - my mouth is watering just thinking about them.  The meat just fell off the bone.  Pairing of the potatoes and Brussels sprouts were perfect.  AND the Prime Rib......oh the prime rib.  Cooked to perfection, lots of red (the way we asked), didn't have to send it back like you do most places because most places over cook.  The meat just melted in our mouths.
There's a lot more I need to go back and try.  I saw drunk that was served out of a large swan.  It's on my to do list.

We came to this restaurant on a Monday. It was a 45 min wait and eventually we got seated at 11:05am, which 11am is apparently the cut off for weekday breakfast/brunch. 

I asked the server if we can still have the breakfast menu, since I heard HEXX is known for their breakfast. The server unfortunately couldn't give us the breakfast menu and we were forced to order from the lunch menu. 

The lunch menu is definitely pricier than the breakfast menu, but we felt optimistic about this place. 
I ordered the chicken BLT burger and it came with fries. I had one bite of the burger was it was BLAND all the way! Nothing too special about this $18 burger! The fries were average. I asked our server for a side of ranch dressing. The service was SLOW. It took a good 20 min just for ranch. And by the way, the restaurant wasn't that busy around that time. The ranch tasted like Hidden Valley ranch from the bottle. Ehhhh..

To summarize my review: slow service, overpriced & bland food (at least for lunch) & I wish we had the option to order breakfast instead! Definitely disappointed.

2 stars rating though because we had a view of the Strip. 
But honestly I would rate this place 1.5 stars.

Stopped in for Saturday brunch this morning. We were advised it would be about a 35 minute wait for the first available table, the place was busy, so we waited. 35 minutes turned to 45 which turned to an hour... the hostess explained they were "cleaning tables" but there were lots and lots of open tables. After inquiring about our wait time twice, we were finally called in. We were brought out to the patio but our table was in direct sun without cover, I asked if we could sit in one of the other five tables for two outside that were in the shade. We were told that those tables were already "called for" - you can't swap my table with another open table that is five feet away? Hostess gave no effort to accommodate. Why would they? There is a long wait list so who cares about two unhappy people. So, we walked out - no effort from anyone to have us stay. 

If you are the type of person who likes hospitality and quality over quantity, this isn't the place for you. They've got a lot to work on in terms of managing the seating of guests and giving accurate wait times. Save yourself the headache and go somewhere else.

Considering this place was open late, we decided to eat here after walking around the strip. We ordered a couple apps and a burger to share. The guacamole was a little bland but I enjoyed the pork rinds that came with it. The charcuterie board was amazing. Fresh baked pretzel, with meats and cheeses alongside stone ground mustard was awesome. The bun served with our burger was made with white chocolate. Which sounds weird but it was really really good as well. The only thing that offset all this was the service. It was a little busy on the patio, and the server forgot about us a couple times.

Came here Sunday morning for some breakfest. Techinically during lunch time but they were serving breakfest until 2 P.M. I got the french toast which was good but nothing amazing! It did fill me up. We also got one of the drinks that are made with dry ice which makes "smoke" come out of the cup which is very very cool but once again nothing amazing. The service was good for being the day after new years when everyone should be groggy and not wanting to work. I guess for there not being any wait to get in its good for a quick bite but other then that I would probably try something else next time for a quick lunch. Nothing too special for me here.

I was so disappointed we were intending on going to The sugar factory but ended up here. I got the bottomless mimosas which were disgusting because they were pre-made "all orange juice" but the food was great.  There was a water leak from the roof and we asked to be moved while in the middle of moving 2 waiters came up basically screaming at us that we couldn't sit where we were moved to. I was embarrassed but the manager came over and offered us 2 glasses of champagne "alcohol doesn't make up for bad service " not to mention the prices are too high let's just say we won't be returning
We had a lovely breakfast at this place outside. The food was delicious and the staff was even better! Marife was the sweetest! Would 10/10 reccomend

We went here to celebrate a birthday and our food was absolutely delicious!!! There was not a single dish that we were not gushing over. The number 1 word tossed around throughout our meal was FLAVOR. The flavors were just spectacular and we noticed after our meal that the tables lacked seasoning and condiments, which we know means you don't need them! I mean even down to the French fries! They were truffle or garlic and came with this incredible mayo. Delicious. My friends dad, who has a degree in culinary, was raving about the veal he ordered. The buffalo calamari was delicious as well. I wish I could've tried more! 

The only downside I had was that menu was limited. The sandwiches and burgers were only offered at lunch and I was hoping to order the veggie burger. So for somebody who doesn't eat meat and can't have too much dairy I felt somewhat limited which is why I chose calamari and French fries. But it tasted delicious and filled me up so it wasn't a complete let down. 

Thank you so much for your service HEXX!

Stopped by here for a drink and maybe a an appetizer. Our server alexia sold us on an entire meal and I'm so happy she did! The crispy broccolini was amazing! It was light crisp and full of flavor. Me and my boyfriend shared the burger and finished off with the bake sell, which was my personal favorite. All of her recommendations were excellent. She was very informed on the menu and genuinely excited to serve us. Can't wait to come back, hopefully we can get alexia as our server again.

On our last day in Vegas, we came here for brunch. Sat near the patio because we couldn't sit on the patio with the stroller.. it wouldn't fit. (Lame!) 
My husband ordered the Chilaquiles and I got their French toast. My husbands food was almost too spicy for HIM to eat, which is saying a lot & my French toast tasted a little funky and we're super soggy. I was too starved to say anything though, just wanted to eat and go before the baby starts crying again haha. Overall, it was an average brunch. I've had better in San Jose & at way cheaper prices!!

This trip to Vegas was nothing short or awesome. There were a few bumps in the road with all of the persistent street marketing teams, but that's all part of Vegas. Luckily, it didn't stop us from experiencing this great dining experience at HEXX kitchen + bar. The modern atmosphere made the whole experience cool. All the furnishings, lighting and decor tied into the theme. The food presentation was very neat and fun. The drinks were smoking, from the dry ice, and the food was hot and fresh.

From the extensive menu, I decided on the pancakes and bacon. The order came with 3 large and fluffy pancakes. Topped with powdered sugar and parted with whipped butter and a nutty maple syrup. They were great and syrup was an awesome pairing with the pancakes. My wife enjoyed the pepperoni pizza that was large enough for two people to enjoy. The pepperoni on the pizza were larger than normal and they covered the pizza, we couldn't see any of the cheese because there were so many pepperoni. The pizza was topped off with toasted shaved garlic. The garlic looked like large Rice Krispies, but the flavor make the pizza even more savory. We both enjoyed the bottomless mimosas that were a great kick start to our day.

I really enjoyed the restaurant and will definitely go back to visit, on my next trip to Vegas.
